story:
Overview

Most of my readers know me as a horror novelist. Over the past seven years -- seven years, I type, only to realize just how astounding it's been so long -- I've published three novels in the Damnation Saga: Teddy, Wake, and In the House of Wolves.  

I was born in East Tennessee in 1985 and currently live in Florida. I possess degrees in psychology and English, and I live with my significant other Christine and our two dogs, Bandit and Rory, both of whom provide a constant distraction from my writing.

While my first forays into the world of writing were prose, my earliest publications were poetry. One of my poems was selected for inclusion in an anthology when I was in middle school, and I kept writing poetry throughout the years. While I honed my craft in regard to prose, I churned out a ton of poetry in my early twenties. I ultimately published five books of poetry [three of which are no longer readily available] before I published my first novel Teddy.

And then... well, seven years passed. I was still writing poetry, but my output in that arena slowed. I started talking about this title with friends as early as four, even five years ago, thinking, Oh, it'll be out next year. I'm sure it'll be ready.

It wasn't. It needed longer to gestate. I needed more time for my poetic focus to evolve past where it was when I released the last poetry book, Wasted Days, in 2013.

But here we are, nearly eight years later, with Black Tie, White Noose.

Welcome to my black tie affair.
Please ensure your white noose is firmly secure.

So what can you expect from Black Tie, White Noose? The poetry in this particular outing marks an evolution in the way I think. The topics here are just as diverse as they always have been, but I've grown a little older, gotten a little wiser (I hope), and the poetry reflects this... but I also like to tell a story, and there are a few lurking in these poems as well -- tales in which I may be the storyteller, but I'm certainly not the narrator if you dig it. Dare I say, there might even be some controversial material.

The time has come to share this little trove of poetic secrets with you. Just be careful not to catch the sickness lurking within... a sickness Ravenshaw Art captured in freaking gorgeous detail on the cover. This, my friends, is one of the coolest covers in my bibliography yet, if I may say so myself.

What I Need, What You Get

So, why have I turned to crowdfunding for the release of Black Tie, White Noose? As an independent author, it is a difficult proposition to launch a book without resources. The funding from this endeavor allows me to launch Black Tie, White Noose ​properly while forging a direct relationship with my readership. I want you to feel like you're as much a part of this release as I am. I want it to mean as much to you as it does to me. Without you, dear readers, I'd still be writing stories only for myself. You make these endeavors all the more fulfilling.

In the past, I "ninja released" my poetry, told friends, and moved on with my day. Now that I'm established with my fiction, the motivating factor in establishing this campaign was that I wanted to give readers the chance to acquire signed copies of the new work as well as give them a chance to collect signed copies of titles they haven't collected... and that I don't normally keep on hand in my personal stock, namely the older poetry books that are still in circulation: Tennessee Refugee and Wasted Days.

I'm looking to raise a minimum of $500. While these funds will allow me to order copies of the novel and ship them to backers, it also allows me to prepare for additional marketing. As an author, I'm looking to expand my readership. Ultimately, my goal is to write full-time. I, like many other independent authors, have a day job, and therefore I write on the side. If I'm able to write full-time, you'll see releases more often, which means you'll get material from me faster. That's always a good thing in my book! (I'm hoping my next work of fiction will be ready for publication in either 2022, early 2023 at the latest.)

By contributing a minimum of $1, you'll see your name in the finished work in the acknowledgments.

Ravenshaw Art is also providing art prints of the Jack card as well as the front and back covers as add-on perks!

This will be my fourth campaign. The first two successful campaigns for the Teddy Dormer novels Teddy and Wake were hosted by Pubslush, which is no longer active. With my third successful campaign for In the House of Wolves, I transitioned to Indiegogo.

My goal is to release Black Tie, White Noose in July 2021.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, for some people, it's impossible to help the campaign right now. I understand. Life happens, and perhaps the timing isn't the best. If you still want to help, you can help me tremendously simply by sharing the hell out of this campaign. You can share it directly from Indiegogo to your social media pages!

Thank you for stopping by! I do hope to see your name in my book!

story:
The Bikeraft Guide - What Is It? A Book and...

This community multi-media storytelling project will ultimately result in a comprehensive book on bikerafting (history of, stories from the most well-known bikerafters from around the world, and a how-to section). But, along the way we'll share audio interviews through our new The Bikeraft Guide Podcast, plus photos and stories on @TheBikeraftGuide Instagram page and on the Four Corners Guides website & blog. Our goal with the IndieGoGo Campaign is to raise $22K through pre-sales of the book and "Perks" donated by our sponsors. This will pay for printing, distribution, contributors and editing. We're really relying on you – aspiring bikerafters and people who love great adventure stories – to help us make this dream a reality.

What We Need: $22,000

The funds will be used to pay the 20+ contributors, the editor (Eben Weiss of "Bike Snob"), and to get the book printed and distributed.

What You Get

  • A signed copy of the book!
  • All kinds of awesome, discounted "perks" in the form of bikerafting gear. Scroll down and check out all we have on offer!
  • The first 80 people to order the Special Featured Package get a signed copy of The Bikeraft Guide signed by Steve "Doom" Fassbinder, a couple 30" Industrial Titan straps, the limited edition Roman Dial T-shirt and matching sticker, the limited edition Roman Dial, Doom & Kim McNett Stickers, your name listed at the end of the book as a supporter, plus access to an hour+-long Zoom slide show presentation and Q&A with the author, Steve "Doom" Fassbinder on Friday, January 29th, 6p.m. MST, all for $99!

Why This Book?!

  • Because Steve "Doom" Fassbinder is co-authoring it. An early adopter of bikerafting and owner of the only North American bikerafting guide service, Doom is one of the most knowledgeable bikerafters in the world.
  • Because Roman Dial is writing the foreword, contributing an adventure story, and has been interviewed extensively for the history section.
  • Because it's full of inspiring stories by the most experienced and renown bikerafters in the world: Doom, Huw Oliver, Kim McNett, Bjorn Olson, Brett Davis, Roman Dial, Annie Lloyd-Evans, Deane Parker, and Liz Sampey, Eric Parsons, Roman Dial, Jonathan Kennett, Jason Magness, and more!
  • Because it includes a deep dive into some serious adventure history. We chronicle bikerafting's oldest missions with photos & interviews, from Roman's 1st "Hellbiking" missions in the '80s to the Lost Coast Tours in the '90s to Doom's dastardly desert adventures of the '00s, & beyond.

  • Because this book will help you reimagine your bikerafting adventures! Use this How-To Guide & accompanying videos to learn the skills you need for utilizing bikes & boats to discover less-traveled waterways in your own backyard or the wildest, most remote landscapes of the world. Check out our How-To videos on Vimeo and YouTube.

Why We Hope You Will Support the Book!

We don't have enough cash to publish this book yet. More than a dozen outdoor industry sponsors/advertisers helped us get started, paying for some contributors, marketing help and a down payment for the book's editor, among other things (Click here to see all our amazing sponsors!). But we still need cash to pay for printing, distribution, taxes and fees, plus to pay more of the contributors. BUT, we are confident pre-sales of our book and the amazing bikerafting-specific "perks" offered by our sponsors will get us to where we need to be.

Why We're Uniquely Positioned to Write This Book

  • Steve "Doom" Fassbinder and Lizzy Scully own the only bikerafting guide service in North America, and Doom is a master bikerafter and storyteller.
  • Lizzy Scully, the other co-author, has been in the outdoor industry writing and editing for 20 years.
  • Eben Weiss, the author of "Bike Snob" and various other books, is also a long-time editor in the bike industry. He has the chops to edit a book like this, but also the wit to bring out the funny bits of our unusual, irreverent sport.
  • Elizabeth "Liz" Sampey is not only a badass multi-sport adventurer, but also a marketing whiz. She is both contributing to the book and is helping with the marketing of the giveaway we've been running since November and the IndieGoGo Campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but you can help in other ways!

  • Please tell all your adventurer-minded friends about @thebikeraftguide on Instagram, directing them to this IndieGoGo Campaign, or sending them to The Bikeraft Guide website to learn more. THANKS!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! It's easy!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello everyone! My name is Jonathan Fesmire. I'm a full-time writer and proud steampunk.

Last year, I published my novel, Bodacious Creed: a Steampunk Zombie Western which started out as a Kickstarter. It more than met my funding goal and gave backers the opportunity to help create characters that shaped the story. Readers love the novel, which has more than 70 great reviews and is selling well.

Yes, crowdfunding works for novels!

Now, I'm working on the sequel, Bodacious Creed and the Frisco Syndicate. This campaign will help fund it, allowing me to pay for professional editing, cover art, and a portion of my reader's fee for the Audible edition.

Like its predecessor, Bodacious Creed and the Frisco Syndicate will be full of steampunk technology, gunfights, mystery, and well-rounded characters. These include the hero, the resurrected U.S. Marshal, James Creed, and the brothel madam and inventor, Anna Lynn Boyd. It will also include a full cast of supporting characters.

While the first novel took place in an alternate version of my home town of Santa Cruz, California, in 1876, the second will happen mostly in San Francisco.

What was San Francisco like at the time? Wild, rowdy, and dangerous. I've been doing extensive research on the city and its most notorious criminal district, The Barbary Coast, where much of the tale will take place. In addition to historical crime, add a syndicate raising the dead with steam-based technology, and we have a formula for the sort of danger Creed was born to confront. His greatest challenges lie ahead.

Check out the video and any updates. Once we reach the goal, I'll add stretch goals. Also, have a look at the rewards and become a backer! Everyone backer gets something. Even at $1, you will get a large, high quality jpeg of the wrap-around trade paperback cover. I invite you to become part of James "Bodacious" Creed's next adventure!

Why $1,500 for the Initial Goal?

I have a helpful spreadsheet that allows me to calculate the least amount of backing I need to ask for in order to fund a project. It assumes that every backer selects the reward that will cost the most to fulfill compared to the pledge amount, and takes into account the various expenses associated with the project.

Yes, this shows $3,500 rather than $1,500. I'm going to write this book regardless of how much backing the project gets. The $1,500 will help a lot toward paying for the services I'll need. However, $3,500 will cover everything, so that's what I'm hoping for.

Risks & Challenges

Time. It took me four years to write the first book in this series. I was going through some serious financial and work difficulties for the first couple of years. Also, I spent much of that time developing the characters and the world of Bodacious Creed.

The book turned out longer than I expected! That's good, but it did add to the time it took to finish it. I figured it would be average novel length, at about 80,000 words. The first draft came out to 140,000, and the final draft, 120,000.

Now that I have a good, full-time writing job, meaning a lot more stability, and I have deep knowledge of my fictional world and its inhabitants, I can realistically extrapolate that it will take about two years to write, revise, edit, and publish.

It will take a lot of research to bring 1876 San Francisco to life, but I've already done most of that.

My track record of finishing books speaks for itself as far as my ability to complete this project goes. You, my backers, will get an exciting adventure you helped bring to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can back a given project. Even so, consider the lower backer levels. I always make sure that even those who can only back a project for $1 get something.

If you can't even back at a low level, I understand, and I've been there myself.

Share the project on social media, or tell your friends about it! Word of mouth is critical in getting a project like this the funding it needs.

Indigogo has share tools to help, so use those!

story:
Summary

Hi! I'm Nora Kayserian, an Armenian-American mother and lover of books. After my eldest niece was born, I came across many picture books about influential women like Frida Kahlo, Amelia Earhart, Rosa Parks, etc. Sadly, no such books could be found in Armenian about Armenian women. However, Armenian history is full of incredible women who were trailblazers and leaders of their time. And those were the stories I wanted to tell my niece about. So, I decided to create my own!

About the Book

"Անպարտելի Զապէլը" is a picture book biography about Armenian writer and activist Zabel Yesayan. It is an inspirational story (in Western Armenian) about a girl who loved books and made history by pursuing her childhood dreams. From the moment she could read, she surrounded herself with words. Zabel discovered the magic between the pages of books and when she was seventeen, she began publishing her first piece of literature.

Zabel witnessed many injustices growing up and decided that she would fight for what's right with the most powerful weapon of all: words. Little did she know that, one day, she would be considered one of the most important writers of Western Armenian literature.

 

What We Need & What You Get 

Funding Goal 

My goal is to raise $4,900. These funds will be used to pay for the illustrations and to print 1,000 copies of "Անպարտելի Զապէլը". The text, illustrations, and page set-up are all complete - the only thing left is to print the book!

If I do not reach my goal, "Անպարտելի Զապէլը" will still be printed. However, I may not be able to print as many copies, so fewer families will have access to the book. If I significantly exceed my goal I will consider translations into English, Turkish and/or converting it into Eastern Armenian. Everyone who has contributed to this project will still get their perks.

Book Details

The illustrations are done by Yerevan-based artist Lusine Ghukasyan.

The book is hardcover, measures 200 x 248 mm and contains 32 pages of full-colored illustrations. Printing will be done in Armenia by Zangak Publishing House and shipment of the books will take approximately 12 weeks. 

Perks

If you are interested in helping out with this campaign, there are some very exciting perks! You can support my campaign by pre-ordering a copy of the book for only $20. If you are interested in contributing more, there are perks available at various tiers. 

The Impact

The project will connect hundreds of school-aged children with a female hero who shares a similar ethnic background. The hero’s ethnicity and gender is connected to larger personal and social themes like facing challenges, overcoming obstacles and making a difference in your community. This can impact a child by helping them better understand society and concepts such as equality, fairness, and justice.

The project will also encourage parents and teachers to read to children in Western Armenian. By producing content that is engaging and fun, we can help foster a new generation of Western Armenian speakers. 

Risks & Challenges

I have been working on this project for over a year and have researched printing, illustrating, publication, and writing in depth. The only possible risks I see at this point would be related to printing errors and shipping delays from the manufacturer. However, I have chosen a very reputable printing and publishing company in Armenia called Zangak Publishing House who has printed many high-quality books for self-publishers.

Distributing the book to my target audience, which are primarily Armenophone families and those trying to learn Armenian, is the next big step after the book is printed. I am working on creating a website and reaching out to Armenians and Armenian speakers through social media in order to raise awareness about this book and potential future projects. I have also been in touch with Armenian bookstores who have expressed strong interest in having this book available at their shops and helping with distribution once the book is published.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out by posting on your own social media accounts
  • Share the campaign with your friends and family via email
  • Write an article about the project

However, Armenian history is full of incredible women who were trailblazers and leaders of their time. And those were the stories I wanted to tell my niece about. So, I decided to create my own!
About the Book
"Անպարտելի Զապէլը" is a picture book biography about Armenian writer and activist Zabel Yesayan. It is an inspirational story (in Western Armenian) about a girl who loved books and made history by pursuing her childhood dreams. From the moment she could read, she surrounded herself with words. Zabel discovered the magic between the pages of books and when she was seventeen, she began publishing her first piece of literature.
Zabel witnessed many injustices growing up and decided that she would fight for what's right with the most powerful weapon of all: words. Little did she know that, one day, she would be considered one of the most important writers of Western Armenian literature.
 

What We Need & What You Get 
Funding Goal 
My goal is to raise $4,900. These funds will be used to pay for the illustrations and to print 1,000 copies of "Անպարտելի Զապէլը". The text, illustrations, and page set-up are all complete - the only thing left is to print the book!
If I do not reach my goal, "Անպարտելի Զապէլը" will still be printed. However, I may not be able to print as many copies, so fewer families will have access to the book. If I significantly exceed my goal I will consider translations into English, Turkish and/or converting it into Eastern Armenian. Everyone who has contributed to this project will still get their perks.
Book Details
The illustrations are done by Yerevan-based artist Lusine Ghukasyan.
The book is hardcover, measures 200 x 248 mm and contains 32 pages of full-colored illustrations. Printing will be done in Armenia by Zangak Publishing House and shipment of the books will take approximately 12 weeks. 

Perks
If you are interested in helping out with this campaign, there are some very exciting perks! You can support my campaign by pre-ordering a copy of the book for only $20. If you are interested in contributing more, there are perks available at various tiers. 

The Impact
The project will connect hundreds of school-aged children with a female hero who shares a similar ethnic background. The hero’s ethnicity and gender is connected to larger personal and social themes like facing challenges, overcoming obstacles and making a difference in your community. This can impact a child by helping them better understand society and concepts such as equality, fairness, and justice.
The project will also encourage parents and teachers to read to children in Western Armenian. By producing content that is engaging and fun, we can help foster a new generation of Western Armenian speakers. 

Risks & Challenges
I have been working on this project for over a year and have researched printing, illustrating, publication, and writing in depth. The only possible risks I see at this point would be related to printing errors and shipping delays from the manufacturer. However, I have chosen a very reputable printing and publishing company in Armenia called Zangak Publishing House who has printed many high-quality books for self-publishers.
Distributing the book to my target audience, which are primarily Armenophone families and those trying to learn Armenian, is the next big step after the book is printed. I am working on creating a website and reaching out to Armenians and Armenian speakers through social media in order to raise awareness about this book and potential future projects. I have also been in touch with Armenian bookstores who have expressed strong interest in having this book available at their shops and helping with distribution once the book is published.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out by posting on your own social media accounts
Share the campaign with your friends and family via email
Write an article about the project

story:
SUPPORT THIS SPECIAL LAUNCH OF IML PUBLICATIONS, DEDICATED TO BOOKS BY FEMALE THINKERS AND ARTISTS.
 

IML Publications LLC is a new-financial-model press dedicated to amplifying the important and often under-represented voices of women.  

Our authors receive a minimum of 50% of book sales and as a gift, 10% of the proceeds raised by IML Publications through the targeted Indiegogo campaign for them.

Our flagship collection, Venus as She Ages, is the collectible works of author Jacqueline Gay Walley. For this project we have set a fundraising goal which will cover publishing six novels in print (in English and French), digitally as ebooks, and recording them as audiobooks. You may also donate toward the design, podcasting, and public relations for the collection.

Any additional "dream" funds raised will go into the development of the next collection. In May 2021, we plan to launch a contest for fiction, non-fiction, and poetry. 

Learn more at www.imlpublications.com

Follow on Social Media:  Facebook  •  Twitter  •  Instagram  •  LinkedIn 

Listen to the "Venus As She Ages” podcast on Apple Podcasts

 

 

LEARN MORE ABOUT THE SIX BOOKS IN THE VENUS AS SHE AGES COLLECTION


STRINGS ATTACHED (BOOK 1)
A girl raised solely by her British renegade father grows to find marriage difficult, knowing nothing of normalcy. Awards: Finalist for the Pirate’s Alley/Faulkner Award, the Capricorn Award, and the Paris Book Festival Award. Originally printed in 1999 by University Press of Mississippi.

TO ANY LENGTHS (BOOK 2)
A woman frightened of losing her freedom in marriage visits a friend in prison who awakens her to nuances of freedom.  

PRISON SEX (BOOK 3)
This is a book about longing and how three people have to break free of their prisons, whether literal or metaphoric.

THE BED YOU LIE IN (BOOK 4)
Two adult children of holocaust survivors work out their family pain when one seemingly betrays the other Awards: Pirate’s Alley/Faulkner Finalist, 2020.

WRITE, SHE SAID (BOOK 5)
Marguerite Duras and Jean Rhys come back to life to help a hapless modern day writer rewrite herself in love and work.

MAGNETISM (BOOK 6)
An older woman on a quest to find her eros and to be desired. Awards: Leapfrog Press Finalist

 

Listen in on our podcast as we discuss each book with author Jacqueline Gay Walley!

 

LEARN MORE ABOUT THE AUTHOR


Jacqueline Gay Walley was born in London, grew up in Montreal, Canada, and moved to the US when she was 18.  She has been publishing short stories since 1988 and published her first novel, Strings Attached, with U Press of Mississippi (1999), which was a Finalist for the Pirates Alley/Faulkner Award and earned a Writer’s Voice Capricorn Award and the Paris Book Festival Award. The erotic fire of the unattainable: aphorisms on love, art and the vicissitudes of life was published by IML Publications, in 2007 and was reissued by Skyhorse Publishing 2015. This book, the erotic fire of the unattainable was a finalist for the Paris Book Festival Award and from this, she wrote a screenplay for the film, The Unattainable Story (2016) with actor, Harry Hamlin, which premiered at the Mostra Film Festival in Sao Paolo, Brazil. Walley also wrote a screenplay for director Frank Vitale’s docufiction feature film, Erotic Fire of the Unattainable: Longing to be Found (2020), which was featured in Brooklyn Film Festival, Sarasota Film Festival, Cinequest Film & Creativity Festival in San Jose, ReadingFilmFest, American Fringe in Paris (2020). Her novel, Lost in Montreal (2013) was published by Incanto Press, along with the novel, Duet, which was written with Kurt Haber. In 2013, her play Love, Genius and a Walk opened in the Midtown Festival, New York, and was nominated for 6 awards including best playwright, in 2018, it also played in London at The Etcetera Theatre above The Oxford Arms pub as well as at three other pub theatres. It is scheduled to open in 2021 in Theatro Techni in London.  She currently lives in NYC.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Earl A. Birkett. I am a resident of Jersey City, N.J. My background is as a real estate broker for the past 23 years. I have had positions in a multitude of fields, including teaching, business and journalism.

My plan is to publish BAVUAL, The African Heritage Magazine, a quarterly (4 issues per year) publication that is designed to explore the Afrocentric experience in world history, from the beginning of recorded time to the present.

Financiers will provide the seed money that will enable me to sustain the magazine's operations from pre-launch through the first few months of publication after the premiere issue, slated for Winter 2022 (December 2021 release).

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking an initial capitalization of $100,000, which will enable me to do the following:

  1. Pay for development costs
  2. Pay a staff
  3. Fund a direct mail subscription campaign
  4. Publish the premiere issue

In return for your minimum $60 contribution, you will receive a 2-year subscription to BAVUAL, valued at $120. The 2nd year will be FREE.

The Impact

MEANING OF THE TITLE AND SYMBOL

"Bavual" is a male baby name with roots in Swahili that means "power, strength, or force." The name is quite popular among the Swahili-speaking people of East and Southern Africa, including Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya. "Adisa" is Yoruba for "one who is clear, or lucid." 

Bavual Adisa is a fictional person. He is 25 years old (born June 19th - Juneteenth - 1996), a native Tanzanian, but his residence is the world. He is from any country you wish him to be. His lineage dates back 680 centuries. He is the name of the magazine and the personification of its spirit and purpose: to document the African experience from the beginning of recorded history to today.

BAVUAL will publish features and regular departments on the key people, places and events that shaped black people and as a consequence, all peoples. It is not a black magazine produced solely by black people; it is for all people who are interested in understanding cause and effect in history from the perspective of a key race of people and produced by a multi-ethnic international staff. We are not advocates for a cause, a pedantic academic journal or a celebrity magazine; we are historic storytellers, placing the reader back in time and explaining how the present world came about as a result. Through its pages you will come away learning more than you did before about black history and primed to learn more.

SOME FUTURE ARTICLES

history of persecution of the black farmer

wokeness, or the new reaction to insults based on historical stereotypes

VP Kamala Harris and the rise of the black female pol since Shirley Chisholm in 1968

11 black athletes who made Winter Olympics history

white snobbery and vestiges of social discrimination toward blacks

who was the best President for American blacks?

the black boxer through history

101 years of Negro League Baseball

 

Risks & Challenges

Any magazine publishing venture is risky, due to the nature of the business, the relatively high production cost, competition from the Web and shortened reader attention in the Twitter Age. Even so, we believe that BAVUAL is a magazine for this particular moment in history, when knowledge to counteract misinformation and preconceptions is the best antidote to confusion. We have assembled the staff and organized operations to take maximum advantage of this need while at the same time keeping operating costs low enough to weather the critical first 1-2 years of existence.

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost, we need your funds. However, if you cannot contribute at this time, spread the word on our new venture to friends, colleagues and family. We want them to be subscribers, readers and, if they so desire, advertisers. Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Who I am...

My name is Sarah Granato! I've been teaching Yoga and Mindfulness for 14 years, am a doula, and a mama to two little girls. Inspired by our experiences in strengths and struggles, play and practice, I have self published two Children's Books. My Little Light: my first postures is a board book of yoga postures, poetry, and paintings by Nova Stanley. I Am Light: postures and affirmations, illustrated by Valerie Willis Tower is also a board book narrative with yoga postures and positive affirmations. Both books sold out at a 1000 print inventory and now live in homes, libraries, schools, children's hospitals and more! I teach Kid's Yoga in the classroom and have many more books in my brain with movement, mindfulness, and growth mindset themes!

Where the funds go and what you get!

Funds go towards self publishing My Magical Toolbox, a book for children and families filled with Mindfulness and Mindset tools to help practice presence and manage big emotions.

Funds go directly towards:

Illustrations,

Editing

Copyright and ISBN purchase

Printing 

Shipping

Indiegogo Fees and withholdings 

Outreach and Marketing

Business Advisor/Consultant

Book donations to Libraries, Schools and Children's Hospitals

You GET this awesome book for yourself/kiddos/family! 

The Impact

This book is an important interactive practice for children, families, and teachers to help with physical, mental, and emotional health and wellbeing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, please spread the word! I would be so grateful if you could share with any families, schools, book shops, boutiques, yoga studios,  and schools.

story:
That sound you hear upstairs... the chill running up your spine... the creature coming straight for you...

Welcome to FRIGHTLAND, a scary new middle-grade series inspired by the classic books we grew up on, featuring covers by artists like genre poster creator Flavio Greco Paglia and original 90's Goosebumps artist Tim Jacobus.  

What happens when regular kids meet living skeletons, mutant chickens, interdimensional monsters—and Bigfoot? Get ready for some scary fun with FRIGHTLAND—guaranteed to keep you reading with a flashlight under the covers.

 

 

 

#1 The Wildman of Shaggy Creek

 

 

Something lives in the woods behind Scott's new house. It's big, it's hairy, and it smells worse than a dead skunk in the rain. When Scott accepts a dare to camp in the woods all night, Hailey is the only friend who will help him. But Scott doesn't really believe in the creature lurking along Shaggy Creek—it's just a story, right?

  • Cover Art by Tim Jacobus / Illustrations by David Romero
  • Approx. 120 pages

 

 

#2 Why I Don't Sleep On Feather Beds

 

 

Gavin and his sister Torrie aren't thrilled to be staying at Great Aunt Ethel's farm. It's in the middle of nowhere, Aunt Ethel is a little weird, and Gavin is forced to sleep on an old, lumpy feather bed.  Then Gavin discovers something worse: the lumps are moving. Torrie thinks he's just crazy—there's no way something's alive inside the mattress—until the lumps begin to hatch...

  • Cover Art by Flavio Greco Paglia / Illustrations by Daniel Brown
  •  Approx. 125 pages

 

 

#3 The Bones at the Bottom of the Lake

 

 

Fiery lights at night and a ghostly figure at the end of the dock are making Jacie's stay at a summer cabin on the lake eerie enough. But when her younger brother Cal pulls bones from the water with his fishing pole and a strange girl named Chloe warns them to put it all back, Jacie starts to wonder what's really hidden at the bottom of the lake.

  • Cover Art by Flavio Greco Paglia / Illustrations by Daniel Brown
  •  Approx. 125 pages
     

#4 Donut Shop of Doom

 

 

Something about the new donut shop and its seriously weird baker doesn't sit right with Bridger.  When people start disappearing and a mysterious green light is seen in the back of the shop at night, it's up to Bridger and his friend Sage to figure out what's really going on before everyone is consumed by the deadly donut craze!

  • Cover Art by Steven Hake / Illustrations by David Romero
  •  Approx. 125 pages

 

What Grown-Ups Are Saying About Frightland Books "Wildman"

"Loved this book! Fun story with just the right amount of creepy—I couldn't put it down!"
 —Ashley Craft, USA TODAY bestselling author of The Unofficial Disney Parks Cookbook

 

"Not only did the novel evoke a sense of nostalgia, but it had a good deal of suspense to keep me—an adult reader—glued to the page."  
—Robert Zangari, AMAZON bestselling author of Tales of the Amulet

 

"I couldn't put it down! A chilling, totally gripping adventure through the woods."
—Mary Probst, Educator and Parent, Kentucky, USA 

 

 

What Kids Are Saying About Frightland Books "Wildman"

"I really liked this book! There were lots of twists and turns, and every time I finished a chapter, I just wanted to keep reading. I burned midnight oil to finish this book. Two Thumbs up!" 
—Simeon C. age 11, Utah, USA

"Very scary and exciting! I think anyone who likes terror stories should read this."
—Grace P. age 10, Utah, USA

"Remember that time we got so scared by The Wildman of Shaggy Creek you had to sleep over in my room all night?"
—Hazel B. age 7 (to her 9-year-old brother), Idaho, USA 

"I really enjoyed this book—I especially liked the suspenseful parts and how funny Scott is."
—Joseph D. age 9, Texas, USA

 

 

FRIGHTLAND books 1-4 are only the beginning. FRIGHTLAND is a planned 12-book anthology series. Each book is a self-contained novel, but the stories exist in a shared universe and there will be easter-eggs and details that tie everything together throughout. After the 12-book series run, the author has plans for a Frightland Literary Universe (FLLU) "Avengers Assembled" style 13th novel that brings the whole thing definitively together. 

Here you pre-order the first 4 terrifying novels. Additional novels will be released regularly after that.  

 

 

R.H. Grimly was born with a fortunately sinister name. He grew up on Goosebumps, Wait Till Helen Comes, and Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark and has one goal: to get kids excited to read, and scare them silly while doing it (okay, that's two goals).

  • twitter | facebook

 

 

Tim Jacobus is the mastermind behind every book cover you loved as a kid. If you've read Goosebumps, Spine Tinglers, Bone Chillers, or a plethora of other spooky titles, you know Tim's work.  Tim currently resides in New Jersey. 

  • instagram

 

Flavio Greco Paglia is a pop-culture influenced genre illustrator and poster artist, who does awesome images for movies and film festivals (specifically horror, fantasy, and sci-fi). He hails from Buenos Aires.

  • instagram

 

Steven Hake is a 2D Game Artist and Illustrator based out of New York that specializes in the genres of science-fiction and fantasy. He also enjoys training in the art of of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

  • instagram

 

David Romero draws stuff that nightmares are made of. Like really scary stuff.  Like don't-send-your-kids-over-there-'cause-they-will-have-nightmares stuff.  He's doing illustrations for The Wildman of Shaggy Creek.  Please don't hate us, parents.

  • tumblr

 

Daniel Brown is a fantastic artist who draws on good old-fashioned paper with real ink. His subject matter is varied, but we of course love his spooky stuff the best.  He's doing illustrations for Why I Don't Sleep On Feather Beds. 

  • instagram

 

 

Illustrations

  • Each book will have 3 interior illustrations.

Formats

  • Ebooks will be in both Kindle and ePub formats for reading on any device.
  • Paperback copies will be fulfilled through Amazon POD

 

 

Become a Founding Member of the FRIGHTLAND Books Fan Club! Join the scary fun and get cool stuff, including a letter from R.H. Grimly, Stickers, Bookmark, and Bi-Monthly FRIGHTLAND newsletters with activities, contests, exclusive spooky short stories and more! Founding members get their name listed on the Founders Page and Club Lifetime membership!  

FRIGHTLAND Books Fan Club Membership is available as an Add-On after selecting your reward tier. 

 

ABOUT BARDE PRESS

BARDE PRESS is a small team of independent artists who love fantastic stories! Helmed by fanboys Scott Baird and Rob York, we have one goal: To find, publish, and create the best new stories for fellow fans and geeks...the things that we love and want to read! It's fantasy and sci-fi (and now with Frighland books, kids horror) for fans by fans.

Risks and challenges

Print copies will be fulfilled by Amazon POD, which makes it pretty straightforward. The people behind Barde Press have brought many creative projects to life. We just need help covering the art, paying the author so he can write more, and launching it well. Cover art this good isn't cheap!

Fiery lights at night and a ghostly figure at the end of the dock are making Jacie's stay at a summer cabin on the lake eerie enough. But when her younger brother Cal pulls bones from the water with his fishing pole and a strange girl named Chloe warns them to put it all back, Jacie starts to wonder what's really hidden at the bottom of the lake.

Cover Art by Flavio Greco Paglia / Illustrations by Daniel Brown
 Approx. 125 pages 


#4 Donut Shop of Doom
 

 
Something about the new donut shop and its seriously weird baker doesn't sit right with Bridger.  When people start disappearing and a mysterious green light is seen in the back of the shop at night, it's up to Bridger and his friend Sage to figure out what's really going on before everyone is consumed by the deadly donut craze!

Cover Art by Steven Hake / Illustrations by David Romero
 Approx. 125 pages

 
What Grown-Ups Are Saying About Frightland Books "Wildman"
"Loved this book! Fun story with just the right amount of creepy—I couldn't put it down!" —Ashley Craft, USA TODAY bestselling author of The Unofficial Disney Parks Cookbook "Not only did the novel evoke a sense of nostalgia, but it had a good deal of suspense to keep me—an adult reader—glued to the page."  —Robert Zangari, AMAZON bestselling author of Tales of the Amulet "I couldn't put it down! A chilling, totally gripping adventure through the woods."—Mary Probst, Educator and Parent, Kentucky, USA 
 

 
What Kids Are Saying About Frightland Books "Wildman"
"I really liked this book! There were lots of twists and turns, and every time I finished a chapter, I just wanted to keep reading. I burned midnight oil to finish this book. Two Thumbs up!" —Simeon C. age 11, Utah, USA
"Very scary and exciting! I think anyone who likes terror stories should read this."—Grace P. age 10, Utah, USA
"Remember that time we got so scared by The Wildman of Shaggy Creek you had to sleep over in my room all night?"—Hazel B. age 7 (to her 9-year-old brother), Idaho, USA 
"I really enjoyed this book—I especially liked the suspenseful parts and how funny Scott is."—Joseph D. age 9, Texas, USA
 

 
FRIGHTLAND books 1-4 are only the beginning. FRIGHTLAND is a planned 12-book anthology series. Each book is a self-contained novel, but the stories exist in a shared universe and there will be easter-eggs and details that tie everything together throughout. After the 12-book series run, the author has plans for a Frightland Literary Universe (FLLU) "Avengers Assembled" style 13th novel that brings the whole thing definitively together. 
Here you pre-order the first 4 terrifying novels. Additional novels will be released regularly after that.  
 

 

R.H. Grimly was born with a fortunately sinister name. He grew up on Goosebumps, Wait Till Helen Comes, and Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark and has one goal: to get kids excited to read, and scare them silly while doing it (okay, that's two goals).

twitter | facebook


 

 

Tim Jacobus is the mastermind behind every book cover you loved as a kid. If you've read Goosebumps, Spine Tinglers, Bone Chillers, or a plethora of other spooky titles, you know Tim's work.  Tim currently resides in New Jersey. 
instagram
 

Flavio Greco Paglia is a pop-culture influenced genre illustrator and poster artist, who does awesome images for movies and film festivals (specifically horror, fantasy, and sci-fi). He hails from Buenos Aires.
instagram
 

Steven Hake is a 2D Game Artist and Illustrator based out of New York that specializes in the genres of science-fiction and fantasy. He also enjoys training in the art of of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.
instagram
 

David Romero draws stuff that nightmares are made of. Like really scary stuff.  Like don't-send-your-kids-over-there-'cause-they-will-have-nightmares stuff.  He's doing illustrations for The Wildman of Shaggy Creek.  Please don't hate us, parents.
tumblr
 

Daniel Brown is a fantastic artist who draws on good old-fashioned paper with real ink. His subject matter is varied, but we of course love his spooky stuff the best.  He's doing illustrations for Why I Don't Sleep On Feather Beds. 
instagram
 

 
Illustrations
Each book will have 3 interior illustrations.
Formats

Ebooks will be in both Kindle and ePub formats for reading on any device.
Paperback copies will be fulfilled through Amazon POD

 

 
Become a Founding Member of the FRIGHTLAND Books Fan Club! Join the scary fun and get cool stuff, including a letter from R.H. Grimly, Stickers, Bookmark, and Bi-Monthly FRIGHTLAND newsletters with activities, contests, exclusive spooky short stories and more! Founding members get their name listed on the Founders Page and Club Lifetime membership!  
FRIGHTLAND Books Fan Club Membership is available as an Add-On after selecting your reward tier. 
 
ABOUT BARDE PRESS
BARDE PRESS is a small team of independent artists who love fantastic stories! Helmed by fanboys Scott Baird and Rob York, we have one goal: To find, publish, and create the best new stories for fellow fans and geeks...the things that we love and want to read! It's fantasy and sci-fi (and now with Frighland books, kids horror) for fans by fans.
Risks and challenges
Print copies will be fulfilled by Amazon POD, which makes it pretty straightforward. The people behind Barde Press have brought many creative projects to life. We just need help covering the art, paying the author so he can write more, and launching it well. Cover art this good isn't cheap!

story:
What if the past became your future?

My name is Graham Whitlock and I’m the author of The Crystal Palace Chronicles.

I believe there’s appetite for a rollercoaster fantasy adventure bringing this neighbourhood’s incredible history to life for the young and the young at heart.

Help prove me right, please support my self publishing costs and raise £4,000.

 

“Graham Whitlock takes readers on a clever and hilarious adventure.  It’s quirky and dark.  And so much fun.”                                                                                                         Carrie Jones, New York Times best-selling young adult author

 

 

Cross the boundaries between time and worlds

Star of Nimrod is the first of the Crystal Palace Chronicles trilogy.  Here’s what’s in store…

Joe is thirteen, lonely, and bored. His best friend moved away, he’s stuck looking after his annoying little sister and Dad spends every hour in their struggling restaurant, Paradise.  

But Joe's world is turned upside down when he discovers a shattered compass among the brambles where the Crystal Palace once stood and time travels through the maze back to 1888.

With help from the teenage H. G. Wells and Samuel Coleridge Taylor, daredevil Iris Blondin, the creator of Sherlock Holmes and the Queen of the Gypsies, Joe must foil dangerous diamond thieves to uncover dark secrets about the ‘People’s Palace'. Standing on boundaries between worlds, it's secrets are tied to the fate of his family.

Will Joe be trapped in the past with his new friends, find a way to return to his family or can he somehow have both?

Explore a world waiting behind the one you thought you knew, haunted by spirits that roamed the untamed Great North Wood, where the secrets of the past can make the ordinary extraordinary. 

 

Bringing the past to life

Here’s feedback from some of the brilliantly critical crew of 10 to 14 year olds who’ve helped me shape the story;

“It’s a story about realising what true friendships are.  What I found really good was the way Joe met up with famous people that were to become successful like Samuel Coleridge Taylor and Bertie who becomes H. G. Wells. It taught me much more about Crystal Palace and it’s a really entertaining book.”                                     Abdurehaman aged 13

“Even when you feel you don’t love your family you love them deep inside especially if you’re away from them.”  Maia aged 12

“I would recommend it to all my friends because it’s good to know more about where you live.”  Spike aged 10

 

Try before you Buy ...

See if you like the book by downloading the first 10 chapters and following Joe into the past… 

https://www.keepandshare.com/doc6/36965/star-of-nimrod-opening-chapters-pdf-2-0-meg?da=y

I really value reader feedback so tell me what you think by messaging me on facebook at @grahamwhitlockwriter or emailing graham@grahamwhitlock.com  

Crystal Palace, a Magical Inspiration

It’s easy to take where you live for granted, even when it’s as magical as Crystal Palace.    

Growing up in the Norwoods I was aware the area is named after the Great North Wood that once spread across London’s hinterland.  My granddad sold programmes at the Crystal Palace and I love the mystical feel of Crystal Palace Park, the crumbling terraces of the ‘People’s Palace,’ the dinosaurs and sphinxes like phantoms from the past.  

I knew I wanted to capture this in a tale for the young and the young at heart. 

What I didn’t know until I began my own adventure making this tale a reality, is the areas incredible history and the extraordinary people drawn to live in the palace’s shadow. 

Everyone hears about the palace when it stood for six months in Hyde Park housing the Great Exhibition displaying artefacts looted from around the world which then ended up in London’s new museums. 

But the palace itself relocated and dominated the Norwood Heights for eight decades until the mysterious fire destroyed it in 1936.  It became the world’s first theme park, offering education by recreating from scratch civilisations of the past alongside sell-out entertainment drawing in millions.

Overnight this area changed.  Navvies who constructed the Palace settled in Norwood New Town which had a wall built around it separating them from grand villas built by industrialists yearning for power.  Pioneers of science came searching for hidden truths, bored socialites came seeking fresh air, amusement and mischief.  The new Crystal Palace changed life here forever.

The Crystal Palace Chronicles weave this fascinating history into a tale that can enthral kids today, capturing the goose-bumps I still get walking with my kids through the palace maze or beneath fragments of the Great North Wood. 

About Me

Star of Nimrod is my debut novel completed during lockdown.  I edited the Dev and Olli children’s books by Shweta Aggarwal and professional writing credits include a stage adaptation of the Shane Meadows film 24/7 and the UKs first immersive musical based on the classic Ealing Studio comedy Passport to Pimlico.  I know the audience I’m writing for because I’m lucky to experience young people’s imagination running award-winning charity DreamArts which fuses arts and therapy to transform young lives. 

I enjoy helping bring our diverse communities together to share, create and celebrate; I’m Chair of Crystal Palace Festival and I’m on the board of the beautifully bonkers Stanley Halls (now Stanley Arts).  I help out on the events subgroup for the Crystal Palace Park Trust which will soon be taking over the park, and I’d love The Crystal Palace Chronicles to help put our unique area on the map.

   

What is the funding for?

You will be helping me realise the ambition of self-publishing this book.  I’m looking to raise £4,000 to cover the following costs;

So for example, if you’re choosing a £30 perk that contributes £25 after printing costs of your book and Indiegogo fees (fee 5% + 2.9% processing fee + 30p per pledge), and £50 contributes £41.

I’ve got a stretch target of £1,350 to employ a publicist to promote the book, and any additional funds raised will go towards delivering Palace of Shadows, the second book in The Crystal Palace Chronicles trilogy. 

 

Risks

Generally, the most significant risks with novel projects are whether the author will finish the book and can they write.  The good news is Star of Nimrod is written and awaiting publication in November to coincide with the 85th anniversary of the Crystal Palace burning down.  And as for my ability as a storyteller you can read the first 10 chapters and see the feedback from readers and professionals. 

The second and third books in the trilogy are plotted and underway.  And if I don’t meet my full target I still intend to make this happen and will offset any costs I don’t raise against future income when the book is released. 

With regards to physical distribution of your perks, I’ve been lucky to get sage advise from experienced crowd-funders and look forward to getting your rewards to you.     

 

Why self-publish?

Star of Nimrod is aimed at 11-14 year olds (although it’s brilliant that much older readers have also loved it!) 

It’s a readership group commercial publishing doesn’t cater for because their marketing constrictions are children’s books up to age 11 and young adult fiction targeting ages 13+.

As someone with an 11 and 13 year old I know the challenge of finding books that bridge David Walliams and The Hunger Games.

I’d love The Crystal Palace Chronicles to help fill that gap and keep growing readers entertained, educated and enthralled.   

When will Star of Nimrod be delivered?

Your exclusive preview copies will be ready for October, in advance of the book’s official launch in November 2021, the 85th anniversary of the Crystal Palace burning down. 

If you live in the Crystal Palace area I’d happily hand deliver your rewards and meet you in person!

 

Perks, Rewards, Helping a Luddite 

There's a range of rewards for being part of making this happen and thank you for considering contributing, it helps so much. 

If you're unable to contribute you can still help and share this project with your friends and family – I’ve spent my life living off the grid without a Facebook profile so if you can help spread the good word across social media that would be amazing! 

 

Thanks for your time and consideration!

story:
---> OVERVIEW

The Naraka Cycle ​aims to introduce a new generation of young adults to the Indian epics 

The epics of India are more than mere stories. Stories from the epics supported the ancient's lives, inspired civilizations, informed religions over the millennia. All of us, especially young adults, face challenges evolving in a fast-paced, information-overwhelmed, technology-driven, modern age.  The Indian epics contain sacred tales that explain the universe and our experience. They answer timeless questions and serve as North Star to each generation.

The Ramayana, for example, describes the journey of the heroine and hero, a golden era that can give our modern culture hope that each of us has the potential to change the world. The eternal quest of the heroine or hero is a model for young women and men to follow, as they accept adult obligations. 

My passion is to help young adults learn the values of self-awareness, curiosity, courage, empathy, resilience, collaboration, intuition, and adaptability. I bring Indian spirituality, art, architecture, flors/fauna, Ayurveda, Yoga, the ancient sciences of politics, organization, weapons and battle strategy to the modern reader's attention. 

As a reader, you can expect to walk away with a sense of wonder and awe at the challenges that were overcome by the archetypal characters!

Excerpt - https://www.sundarnathan.com/s/S_Nathan_Demons_...

---> WHY THIS NOVEL IS UNIQUE

This is not an ordinary novel.  I have explored an alternative mythology of the Ramayana with strong female characters, told from the unique perspectives of teenagers and young adults in the epics.  My goal with this unique alternative mythology is to help young adults strengthen human capacities that matter, by learning from the successes and failures of the epic characters that walked the earth before us.

 

---> WHY I WRITE

My maternal grandmother, Namagiri Ammal ('Pati') lives on in my heart. She embodied generosity, candor, feminism, and a fierce love of family, especially her grandchildren!

I grew up entranced by her magical stories interwoven with Gods, Goddesses, Demons, Mythical Creatures, Celestial Weapons, and Epic Battles. Her depiction of the Ramayana - the story of Rama and Sita - was especially enthralling. 

Pati's memory inspired me to work with great love and passion for the past 7 years on these novels.  I spent 3 years on research and outlining and the next 4 on writing and editing.  Many, many drafts!

 

---> A SPIRITUAL JOURNEY

While on this spiritual journey, I'm learning Sanskrit, and have read the Ramayana, parts of the glorious Vedas, and the ancient Puranas in great depth. 

My obsessive research and attention to detail have led to a unique, exciting mythological thriller. 

 

---> ABOUT ME

I grew up in India in a family of story-tellers. My passion for mythology and the Indian epics started when I was 5.

Armed with an M.S. in Engineering, I've been a technologist, sales & marketing leader and entrepreneur in Silicon Valley for about 20 years. I'm fluent in 3 languages, learning a 4th (Sanskrit) and have traveled to 25+ countries.

 

---> MY "WHY"

With all the changes in the publishing industry, I decided to take the gutsy route of self-publishing my book. There's not a single publisher that can get my message out as well as my team and I can. 

We are running this crowdfunding campaign to raise money from our community in order to self-publish my book. 

     

    ---> WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

    We are targeting $30,000 USD.

    We will market the novel on various channels including social, email, print, and influencer marketing. 

    The book will be published in English in digital, paperback, and hardcover editions. Your contributions would support developmental editing, copy editing, proofreading, typesetting, illustration, and marketing. We’ll also produce an audiobook. We plan on executing an international book tour  With your support, we’ll be able to amplify our message globally and have a successful book launch.  

     

    ---> HOW YOU CAN HELP

    You can show your support by backing this campaign, contributing what you can. Please share the campaign with your friends, family and network.  Feel free to go to my website to sign up for email updates and blog at sundarnathan.com.  Feel free to tag me @sundarwrites on all social media platforms.  You can follow me on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok and sign up for email updates on my website.

    You can share it with anyone who you think would enjoy it. Direct messaging on social media, text messaging, Signal and WhatsApp tend to work best. 

    Thank you for all your support and for being part of this incredibly exciting journey.

story:
Press about the Campaign!

Euronews - This-book-of-love-stories-is-funding-crucial-environmental-work-in-morocco

Yahoo - Project Fiasco Helping the Environment One Love Story at a Time

The Project

Hello, my name is Cynthia Weeks. I am a teacher, children’s book author and founder of the social enterprise Project Fiasco, which has the goal of helping the environment.

We are crowdfunding to add another book to our collection. Our latest project is to collate and publish a book of love-themed short stories from around the world.

Our aim is to produce an uplifting and fun book. We also want to give our backers the opportunity to express themselves and tell their stories of love. We are offering the perk of having your story published in the book. At the same time, as Project Fiasco is a social enterprise focused on the environment, we will use part of the proceeds to fund pollution solutions. Doubly uplifting!

 

What We Need

To proceed with this book, we need at least $2000 AUD. We will use this money to pay for the editing, formatting, cover design, and printing of the book. The funds will also go towards crowdfunding costs such as Indiegogo fees, transaction costs, promotion and, of course the best part: perk fulfilment. We also need your stories! We have been collecting stories from around the globe and we would love more.

 

The Perks

Through this book you will not only have the opportunity to read interesting stories from around the world, but you will also have the option to get your own story published in the book! 

The perk options include:

  • A Love Note sent to you or someone else by postcard
  • Your story being published in the book*
  • An Ebook copy of the book
  • A paperback edition of the collection
  • Certificate of Contribution for sharing your story (a great gift idea until the book arrives!)

 

*Love story guidelines:

  • 10-1000 words
  • You can use your first name, nickname, or alias
  • Please tell us the location your story. (City or town, and country)
  • The deadline for submissions is April 15th so you have plenty of time to complete it or time to fall in love and write about it. Good luck either way.
  • We will have an editor go over the story so do not be too worried about typos

 

The Impact

Project Fiasco uses profits to fund pollution solutions so you are helping the environment. We are currently funding a local women’s NGO in Morocco to plant trees and clean beaches.

And let's be honest, we all could use an elevating book right now. Whether you read the book or contribute to the book, we hope it will be an enriching experience. 

 

Risks & Challenges

If we reach our goal, we will be able to go ahead and produce the book. A challenge that we face is since the many of the stories will be written by backers we cannot fully work on the editing, layout and design of the book until after the campaign is over and the story submission deadline of April 15th has passed. To avoid these timing issues we have given ourselves a generous fulfilment schedule.  

Another challenge that we could have is if stories are not submitted. We anticipated this, and started collecting love stories in advance. We have collected a book's worth of stories, but we want our book to be interactive with our backers so we are excited to offer a place for your stories too. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Interested in our initiative but do not need a perk? 

Crowdfunding needs a crowd! Please share, share, share this project on social media to help us make this campaign a success. 

We will forever be indebted to you. Thank you for reading!

story:
Lisa Sterne is a master’s level therapist with a background of 20 years in child development and parent-child relationships.

After having worked with traumatized children for 20 years, Lisa believes that empathizing with children and earning their trust is the key to their healthy development, in spite of trauma. 

"These children hold space in my heart and communicating with them through humor and love is my passion." - Lisa 

This book and those that will follow in the series focus on resilience building and communication, both of which develop children with a strong sense of self.

Funding will allow us to continue with the Onyx Says series and develop three other Onyx Says books that have already been written and are ready for production when funding has been secured. These touch on the healthy expression of sadness, overwhelm, and uncertainty.

 

Quick Ways To Help...

Share, Share, Share! Send the Indiegogo link to anyone who might be interested!

Be sure to share on social media and tag us @onyxsays for a shoutout! 

If you have any additional questions or ideas of how to get more eyes on the campaign please reach out to us through the comments. Be sure to subscribe at www.OnyxSays.com

story:
Ooga Booga: Music Monster is an early childhood music and movement book for ages 2-7. The building blocks of music are cleverly disguised as the tale of a monster that is learning how to share. I have seen firsthand how children pick up the beat from these stories, and I consulted with psychologist and researcher, Dr. Brian Harward, to find out if my casual findings could be backed by science. (They can! Scroll to see the research on the benefits of early exposure to music.) I believe all children should have access to these early music concepts, so I am putting all of these story-songs on YouTube FOR FREE, and including them with every backer level. 

Check out the lyric videos below. Both of these stories are included in the book, so these videos can accompany the book, or teach you and your child how to read them in the appropriate time! YouTube: BrittPowitzKids

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=mqE6kmValJ8

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=MrErkKq0TlQ

Ooga Booga: Music Monster was created by preschool teacher, drum teacher, and musician Britt Powitz to assist in the development of young children's musical aptitude, as well as to engage children in a fun story with accompanying movements. The book, music, and videos are a culmination of many hours of experimentation, tinkering, and playtesting with children in the target age group to maximize engagement and participation. The stories are kid tested, and reading the stories in the appropriate cadence can be a fun challenge for parents and older children as well. 

More than a storybook!  

Features & Benefits:

Exposes young children to different musical meter (time signatures): reading or singing in different times (4/4, 6/8, 7/8), which can enhance musical ability later in life

Teaches Musical Tempo & Dynamics: some of the songs are fast, some are slow; some are loud, and some are quieter. Exposure to different tempos and dynamics can help children become more aware of these differences in other music

Participation in Musical intervals - minor 3rd: the sing-along chorus introduces children to the easiest-to-learn musical interval, the minor third, a head start toward tuning their ear for music, later helping with singing or musical instruments 

Encourages imaginative movements: each story has accompanying movement for participation, light exercise, and learning to move to music

Develops Rhythm skills: tap and clap to the beat with your child; available audio and video tracks, with and without vocals, allow for the child, parent, or Britt (on audio track) to read along rhythmically

Challenging fun for all ages: a fun challenge for parents and older children to read in time with different musical meters. Younger children can start to memorize the songs (and the words are a lot more complex and interesting than everyone's favorite young shark song!)

Dyslexic-friendly font: for easy reading, inclusive of more readers

Promotes discussion about sharing: stories demonstrate the problem of wanting to take others' toys, providing an opportunity for parents to discuss appropriate sharing of toys

Models resourcefulness: the children cleverly outsmart Ooga Booga with nonviolent tactics, serving as an example of appropriate responding to others' bad behavior

Broadens language skills: children can learn rhyming words and new vocabulary

Presents opportunities for social awareness: identifying the meaning and emotion behind facial expressions of Ooga Booga and the children of the book in various situations

 

Meet Ooga Booga:

Original Concept Art for Ooga Booga

 

Ooga Booga came to life when 5 artists across the globe were paid to create a character concept from only a brief description. Letting artists work with minimal direction allowed them to display their insane skills! The winning concept (sketch above) from Renata Christine captured our hearts. Adorable, mischievous, and built for stealing! Bendy arms for stealing and a toy pouch, all from the brilliant mind of the artist. 

A few months later, the music and movement stories were transformed into a beautiful set of illustrations. 

Sample Final Art Spread (2 pages) 

What had started as a storyboard and sketches was soon to be a book ready to print!

Rough Story Board

 

Rough Sketch

 

 Color and words were added before finalizing each 2-page spread. 

Improved sketch with Color Palette

 

The vibrantly illustrated final versions portray the fun and fantastical world of Ooga Booga!

Final Version

 

Maps introduce each story and show Ooga Booga's movement throughout the land. His home and the scenes of the book are depicted here, as well as several undiscovered locations (for a second book). 

Follow Ooga Booga on his Adventure with a Map Introducing Each Story

 

Tell Everyone!!!

 

Collaborators

    •    Author, Composer: Britt Powitz (Long Island, New York)

    •    Illustrator: Renata Christine (Jakarta, Indonesia)

    •    Layout Designer: Nicolò Venturi (Italy)

    •    Consulting Psychologist: Brian Harward, PhD (San Diego, California)

    •    Music Notation Preparation: Esin Aydingoz (Istanbul, Turkey)

    •    Recording, Mixing, Audio Production: Roy Silverstein (San Diego, California)

    •    Keyboard, Recording, Mixing: Ben Krueger (San Diego, California)

 

Research: Benefits of early exposure to music

Early exposure to music of different meters has been shown to improve later musical learning, and in particular musical meters of other cultures. Ooga Booga: Music Monster exposes young children (or even infants) to non-isochronous musical meter that is not common to Western culture, preparing them for a wider array of musical expression (Hannon & Trehub, 2005). Even infants can learn about music in some ways. In fact, infants learn some aspects of music faster than adults!

"Implicit learning [from mere exposure] underpins the long-term acquisition of stylistic knowledge, musical enculturation, and acquisition, in both children and adults, nonmusicians and musicians" (Rohrmeier & Rebuschat, 2011)

"Musical skills such as hearing and expressing beat and meter or matching pitch with the voice are developmental. That is, nearly all children will develop these skills readily with adequate exposure and opportunity to experiment. [...]children benefit most from modeling, plenty of opportunities to engage in music-making without correction or evaluation, and an understanding on the part of the teacher that they will arrive at a developmental milestone when their age and experiences coalesce. Thus, children need repeated exposures to musical experiences and multiple opportunities to listen, move their bodies to the music, and play with their voices. Therefore, the hallmarks of developmentally appropriate music instruction include structured, informal instruction that is play-based and encourages experimentation." (Karen Salvador & Keith Corbett, 2016)

References

Hannon, Erin E. & Trehub, Sandra E. (2005). Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences , 102 (35) 12639-12643; DOI: 10.1073/pnas.0504254102 https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.0504254102

Rohrmeier, M. &Rebuschat, P. (2012), Implicit Learning and Acquisition of Music. Topics in Cognitive Science, 4: 525-553. doi:10.1111/j.1756-8765.2012.01223.x

Salvador, K., & Corbett, K. (2016). “But I Never Thought I’d Teach the Little Kids”: Secondary Teachers and Early-Grades Music Instruction. Music Educators Journal, 103(1), 55–63. https://doi.org/10.1177/0027432116655199

story:
Storyline

Hello, and thanks for stopping by my site. Do you love books about historical fiction? Are you captivated by stories from another era? There's a good chance your are, so don’t go anywhere.

Let me set the scene. It's 1944, the height of the European war. American bomber pilot, Jack Swaggart, finds himself stranded behind enemy lines and teams up with an unlikely ally, Hilde Augsberg, a plucky young German. The pair barely manage to stay one step ahead of Horst Kloster, a relentless Gestapo agent. Jack needs to get back to London and convince the Allies of the looming threat –the Horten bomber.

My book, entitled Stealth, weaves true historical events, about a WWII warplane, the Ho-229, designed and built by two German innovators, Walter and Reimar Horten, with larger-than-life swash-buckling characters in a fictional plot that will leave you clinging to your ripcord.  All of which is sure to make for an exciting read.

Stealth has it all: adventure, romance, deception, and twists and turns that will surely keep you strapped in the pilot’s seat, wanting to check out the “logbook” for more. 

Jenn Lundy, a talented local artist adept with water colours and acrylics, is creating a cover design. Jenn will come up several sketches, and you will have an opportunity to view and comment on the preliminary drawings.

Do you want to hear more? I’m also setting up a rewards program for those wishing to participate in this venture. Would you like your name listed in the acknowledgements? Do you want a limited edition print of the cover? Would you like one of the characters to be named after you? Check back often for updates.

What You Will Get & What We Need

In partnership with Siretona Creative, a Canadian boutique publisher, and me - a local author - you can play an important role in publishing my WWII novel. Choose your reward (perk) and you will enable the project to move forward. Here are the ways your financial investment will move us closer to the goal:

  • Substantive and Copy-editing of the manuscript. This is an integral part.
  • The cover design. (The mockups currently on display are temporary). I will update the cover to reflect progress on the design.
  • Layout and formatting of the paperback and ebook version.
  • Printing and shipping.
  • Launch and promotional efforts associated with the campaign.
  • Production of a limited edition print of the cover.
  • Once I pre-sell 100 copies of  my book, I will publish the paperback and ebook.
  • Once I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.
  • I will also be offering some exclusive rewards for those who pre-order the novel.
  • A personally signed paperback copy.
  • Your name will appear in the acknowledgements.
  • Early access to the introduction (beta reading) and select excerpts.
  • An opportunity to be involved in the selection process of the cover design.

About the Author

Robert Stermscheg, born in Europe in 1956, was exposed to many wonderful writers – Edgar Rice Burroughs, Alexandre Dumas, Karl May, Agatha Christie, just to name a few. He appreciated how they opened up a whole new world to our imaginations through their portrayal of life.

When Robert retired in 2006, he had the opportunity to devote himself to a new career path – writing fiction; but fiction with a twist. Robert embarked on translating the works of a well-known European author, Karl May, from German into English. No easy feat.

Robert chose one of Karl May’s historical fiction novels, set in 1814 which loosely featured Napoleon Bonaparte, coined The Prussian Lieutenant. It was well received, encouraging him to continue with further translation work. He quickly followed up with the sequel in The Hussar’s Love series, The Marabout’s Secret. Both titles have been published by Word Alive Press.

It was while Robert was immersed in his translation series that he came up with the idea of collaborating with his father, a WWII veteran and a prisoner of war, by writing his memoir. The result was a two year effort that culminated with the finished product, POW #74324. Robert presented the first copy to his father for his 90th birthday.

Robert joined a local writers group, giving him the exposure and opportunity to learn from other, established writers and expand his own repertoire. Positive feedback on his writing encouraged him to venture into the devotional and short story realm. To date, several of Robert’s submissions have been featured in the hugely popular Chicken-Soup-for-the-Soul series as well as in David C. Cook’s Power for Living magazine.

Robert resides in Winnipeg, Manitoba. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges in delivering a finished product, including distribution.  I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of shipping the paperback copies and limited edition prints into each pre-order perk.

The risk of delivering pre-sale copies is contingent on the publisher, the printing service, as well as the delivery method (courier). My publisher, Siretona Creative, is based in Calgary, Alberta and has a good reputation for meeting deadlines and fulfilling their obligations to authors.

Pre-sale backers will be kept up-to-date on a regular basis.

International Preorders are doable. Please contact the author via private message.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just aren't in a position to contribute financially. The pandemic has affected many, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Spread the word with family, friends and co-workers.
  • Tag my Indiegogo site, my publisher, Siretona Creative, and my website.
  • Spread the word with a local book club or writer group.

Thank you so much for your interest and support.

Robert Stermscheg

www.robertstermscheg.com
