The result was a two year effort that culminated with the finished product, POW #74324. Robert presented the first copy to his father for his 90th birthday.
Robert joined a local writers group, giving him the exposure and opportunity to learn from other, established writers and expand his own repertoire. Positive feedback on his writing encouraged him to venture into the devotional and short story realm. To date, several of Robert’s submissions have been featured in the hugely popular Chicken-Soup-for-the-Soul series as well as in David C. Cook’s Power for Living magazine.
Robert resides in Winnipeg, Manitoba. 
Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges in delivering a finished product, including distribution.  I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of shipping the paperback copies and limited edition prints into each pre-order perk.
The risk of delivering pre-sale copies is contingent on the publisher, the printing service, as well as the delivery method (courier). My publisher, Siretona Creative, is based in Calgary, Alberta and has a good reputation for meeting deadlines and fulfilling their obligations to authors.
Pre-sale backers will be kept up-to-date on a regular basis.
International Preorders are doable. Please contact the author via private message.

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some people just aren't in a position to contribute financially. The pandemic has affected many, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Spread the word with family, friends and co-workers.
Tag my Indiegogo site, my publisher, Siretona Creative, and my website.
Spread the word with a local book club or writer group.

Thank you so much for your interest and support.Robert Stermschegwww.robertstermscheg.com

story:
Help your kids DREAM of learning an instrument!

As a musician, music educator, and arts administrator, I've seen the transformational power an instrument can bring to a child's life.  Learning an instrument benefits kids' minds and bodies with positive habit building, development of fine motor skills, and literacy and math skills, too!

But signing up isn't enough!

Finding the right instrument can be just as important as committing to music education, and that begins years before you step into a music room.  All of the books published by Musically Ever After Publications will include curated music scores, unforgettable characters, and music education subtly inserted into the story. 

Discover what happens when Goldilocks is finally brave enough to visit the Bears' musical home.

Unlike the original Goldilocks and the Three Bears, The Goldilocks Quartet ends with Goldilocks becoming friends with the Bears through their mutual love of music.

Enter: Musically Ever After Publications!

Every member of the team is a seasoned musician dedicated to making music fun and accessible to children. Our first book, The Goldilocks Quartet, introduces your children to the string family, but it's so much more. When you purchase The Goldilocks Quartet, you receive:

  • A customized soundtrack curated by professional musicians with decades of experience and a passion for cultivating a love of music
  • A full musical soundtrack performed by professional musicians
  • Narration by illustrator and professional actress Candace Neal
  • Educational materials to help you continue learning

Sounds great- When do I get my book?

To ensure our book is high quality we're not cutting corners. That means that we need to raise funds to offset (bulk) print The Goldilocks Quartet. To secure this funding, we are offering our first customers (you!) the opportunity to pre-order our book.

Plus, we'll be offering some exclusive perks that will only be available during this campaign:

  1. Our illustrator Candace is creating a limited edition poster of our favorite scene in the book.
  2. My husband Drew will create a custom 30-second music video of you, your child, your dog, whatever you want to commemorate!  We'll put it on our YouTube in any permission level you wish. Here's a sample created for Candace & Oliver
     
  3. If we reach $5K or higher, we'll donate 50 books to Harmony Project KC, a nonprofit in Kansas City that provides free music lessons and coaching.
 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges when an author self-publishes. Currently, the book is done (and it looks terrific!) so the main risk is that pledge fulfillment might be a little late. Rest assured, however, we will do everything in our power to ensure that doesn't happen. If it does, we will let you know immediately.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you will consider pledging to our project. Even $1 helps! If you can't, we would deeply appreciate that you share on your social media about this campaign; Indiegogo makes it easy! If you're not sure how, message me and I'll do my best to help you through the process. 

Thank you for your time; we look forward to working together on this project!

story:
Looking for your next home?

Afraid you might pick the wrong one?

Want to get it right the first time?

 

 

How to Find a Good Feng Shui House is a practical step-by-step guidebook to help you find a house that brings an abundance of chi energy for good health and a fulfilled life.  This book will help those who are thinking about moving, or have already started house-hunting. and want to pick the perfect house the first time.

What is feng shui?  Feng shui is a 3,000 year old Chinese practice of how to detect and understand the inner energy of the land and house.  It's the knowledge of how this energy affects and nourishes human life. It's the 3,000 old practice that Asians all over the world rely on to find a home that matches their lifestyle so they can live a fulfilled life.

Why do you need a good feng shui house?  If your current house feels cramped, old, tired or simply gets in the way of what you want to do in life, then you need good feng shui. A good feng shui house makes you feel safe and secure.  It supports your lifestyle and family.  And it teaches us to live in tune with nature.  By doing so, we can live without stress and worry so we can reach our full potential.

What kind of questions will this book answer?

  • What landscape features should I look for? What should I avoid?
  • What constitutes a good feng shui house? And why is that important?
  • Why is one house better for my family than the other?
  • Are there any special rules I should follow to guarantee I find a great fengshui house?
  • Is there any hidden consequences of having a house on the top of a mountain with a view?
  • Is it bad to live at a T-junction?
  • Do I need to buy Asian ornaments for better feng shui?
  • And many more...

Who Am I?

My name is Jenny Nakao Hones and I wrote this book because I believe the ancient knowledge of feng shui  can help you on the biggest purchase of your life. I've seen dozens and dozens of families regret their first home purchase and I thought, "Enough."  After working as both a professional interior designer and a feng shui consultant for over 10 years and raising 3 boys in 4 different countries, I thought it was time to share what I've learned so you can find your next home, and buy it with confidence. 

Now it gets a little frustating because...

Feng shui today gets a bad rap.  And that’s very understandable.  There are many charlatans and marketers who use feng shui to sell their trinkets, ornaments, and good luck charms without any proof of concept.  I too have been fooled and bought knick knacks in hopes of a better life for my family.  

How It All Started:

I first became interested in feng shui because it overlapped with all my interests in homes, spirituality, energy and Asian culture, .  Many books promise good fortune, prosperity, and money.  I wanted that for my family too.  When I heard it had a 3,000 year history of accumulated knowledge, I wanted to know more and wondered how it worked.  

Like most, I first began learning by reading books and searching the internet for more information.  But, the more I read, the more confused I became.  It seemed like one book said one thing, and the next book said something completely different.  I didn’t know how to decipher the information.

On a fateful day, twelve years ago, I met Dr. Shantung Hsu and began my studies of Form School Feng Shui.  There were no trinkets or ornaments.  There was no astrology.  Instead, he taught me how to tap into 3,000 years of ancient Chinese wisdom to live a fulfilled life. Dr. Hsu’s teachings made total sense and I was no longer confused.  I thought, “Why don’t more people have access to this information!!" The knowledge was practical and actionable. It made a lot of sense, even to my husband. To top it off, it was obvious how much money friends and family would've saved on their homes if they knew these simple feng shui principles.

 

In this book, you will learn

  • The origins of feng shui
  • The core principles of Form School Feng Shui
  • Why we don’t incorporate astrology and the bagua in our practice 
  • What to look for and avoid in the landscape for good energy
  • What to look for and avoid for the actual site and house when searching for a house
 

You will love this book if you find other feng shui books confusing or contradicting.  

Maybe you’re moving to a bigger house because your family is growing.  Or maybe you have a new job and are moving to a new city.  Some of you may be downsizing after your children have left home.  In all these situations, the book will be a wonderful guide to help you find a good house with a peace of mind.

 

The book is written into two parts.

  • Part I is about the origins and history of feng shui, addressing why there is much confusion on the subject.  It also discusses why we need this ancient wisdom to find a good feng shui house in our high tech society of today.
  • Part II is broken into a step-by-step approach to finding a good feng shui house.  With only four steps, it is clear and easy to follow.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published as an e-book and physical book.  I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Cover Design of my Book 
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • Editing and Proofreading
  • Images
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish 
  • Printing  
  • Shipping and Handling 

 

About the Author

 

Jenny Nakao Hones is an interior designer and a certified feng shui consultant. Her designs include new construction, remodels, commercial businesses and an award winning green design community.  

She has taught feng shui at the Bellevue College Continuing Education Program, Blue Mountain Institute in Bellevue and at the Feng Shui Certification Retreat in Ukraine.

Jenny was born in Hawaii and raised in Tokyo.  She and her husband Robin have lived in Tokyo, Singapore, Kuwait, and now, as empty-nesters, they moved from the suburbs of Seattle and live in Enumclaw, Washington where her husband is a farmer.  This has given her a unique perspective and understanding of many different climates, cultures, and experiences.  

 

You can find Jenny on Social Media:

 
  • Website:  www.threefrogsdesign.com
  • Blog:  www.AsianLifestyleDesign.com
  • Facebook Group:  Feng Shui for New Home Owners
  • YouTube:  Asian Lifestyle Design
 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, signed thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help me get the word out and  share this campaign with your friends, colleagues, and family.   Thanks so much!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello everyone! My name is Melissa Jennewein, and I am the author of Shadowed Soul, the story of my seven-year quest through inner and outer worlds. This solo expedition into truth and understanding would take me through 23 countries and 46 territories; coincidentally, just as many chromosomes in the human genome! It was a fantastic adventure exploring and mapping my human condition and experiencing radical new possibilities here on Earth, and I am excited to share with you the medicine that I am bringing back! 

This journey is for explorers who want to choose a different path and those who have already chosen it. It is for seekers who wish to transcend their struggles and learn how to trust their divine guidance system. Shadowed Soul is a tribute to the struggle of defining oneself, cultivating personal power, and connecting to the worlds in which we live. The reader will have the possibility to explore the depths of their truth as they journey with me across the continents and meet many healers, shamans, visionaries, and of course, shadows. 

My deepest desire is that this story inspires the reader to be the change they wish to see in the world and do it with all of the incredible potential that they possess.

Why should you fund this campaign? 

Do you know someone who needs a little adventure? Perhaps a journey around the world but without all the baggage? Are you curious about what it's like to dance with your subconscious shadows? Are you interested in a bold, courageous, daring experience that will make you laugh, cry, and scream, "look out!" Would you like to support a story that is inspiring, honest, authentic, and raw? Then you should fund this campaign! You can support the project in many ways, and they are all appreciated! Pick a perk to the right, make a donation, or scroll to the bottom to see how to become an author influencer! 

I invite you to join in and contribute to this project! Let's make things happen! Are you ready to take the leap and go resistance diving? Then jump in! And invite those other visionary friends of yours that belong in this new story to invest in this project! 

By contributing, you will be giving not only to the publication of a book but to a vision.

The more fantastic idea beyond the book is to create spaces where we can:

  • Playfully teach the concepts and ideas found throughout this story. 
  • Grow stronger within ourselves and our community.  
  • Care newly for the planet and all of its diversity.
  • Connect with our inner child, who is always full of wonder and curiosity. 

Are you ready? Then it's go time! 

 

Shadowed Soul Book 

I can hardly remember when I was a child between the ages of eight and twelve years old, and what I had chosen to decorate my bedroom with. There were many posters of world maps and fast cars like Ferraris and Lamborghinis hanging on the walls. A spinning globe stood on the desk and plenty of stuffed animals that I would create stories with hung weightlessly in the netted corners of the room. But I could only remember those things from the photographs left behind. On August 17th, 1995, when I was sixteen years old, I was in a car accident that would take those memories and many more from "the good years" of my life away from me for almost two decades. 

Up until my eighth birthday, we moved quite often. It seemed that I had become quite adaptable to the changing of schools, friends, and countries and eagerly anticipated the appearance of large cardboard boxes. Through this moving around, I would become fascinated with the world and curious about every inch of it that I had not yet explored. Then, around the age of twelve, I remember some real drama that began to happen in my childhood. By the time I was almost fifteen, I would have already moved out, got a job to pay my rent and feed myself, and forgotten all about those childish daydreams of world maps, fast cars, and storytelling. I would instead enter the working world in America. The one that was not my dream but helped me survive to be out on my own at such a young age.

That is until the year 2012, or better known as the end of the world as I knew it. Death and heartbreak would begin to shatter -with heavy, broad, and deliberate strokes, the illusions of my reality. And while experiencing this deterioration of the old, I felt confused, vulnerable, and completely lost. I began to understand depression as it was introduced as my new companion and took up a lot of my space and energy. Is this a spiritual awakening or just a bout of psychosis I wondered?

The journey into understanding would take me around the world and deep into the folds of my unconscious mind. I decided to turn my compass inward and upward and sought out guides to teach me along the way. What I learned was game-changing and went against most of my knowledge up until the point of those experiences.  

Little did I know that at the end of those seven years that COVID would thwart my plans to continue traveling, and that is when friends would begin to ask, "Will you share your story with the world?" The thought of it terrified me. I had already compiled my diaries into a first draft in 2019 while I sat in the silence of the Sahara Desert. And yet, I really wasn't sure why I had done it. 

And then, as the book started to take form, I realized that I was becoming very apprehensive about sharing it. Sometimes I felt quite confident that it could inspire others. At other times, I felt that exposing these honest and unfiltered experiences would open my heart to unwanted emotional vulnerability. 

This divide brought up a whole new set of shadows that I would need to dance with and took me deep into some genuine (to me) fear. The process took weeks, but we made it through, and now here we are :) 

I feel that we are all here to learn, grow, and figure out how to be the best versions of ourselves, and I would like to support that growth. I now know that it starts with me and cannot seem to forget a quote from Gandhi that has reappeared throughout the years: "You must be the change you wish to see in the world." And what I wish to see is a world where we uplift one another versus tearing each other down—a world where we celebrate our achievements and learning steps. A world where learning to be one's most aware and authentic self is our aim and sharing our love, compassion, and support for one another while on that journey is our priority—a world in which we teach our children how to nurture and guard our home's diversity. Not to destroy it in the ways that we as a species unconsciously have. 

This non-fiction memoir is my most authentic attempt to share what that journey into understanding how to be the change I wanted to see in the world looked like for me. Everything in this book is true, to the best of my knowledge, memory, conversations with characters within the story, and notes from my diaries.

What I Need & What You'll Get.

Shadowed Soul will start as an eBook, followed by a print edition and an audiobook. Feel free to join in at any level and share this campaign with your tribe. Let's create some magic! We need the funds raised through the preorders to support:

  • The editor! To assist with the revision and publishing in 2021!
  • The artist! The cover artist has already earned it!
  • The layout! The interior of the book and the formatting need work!
  • The proofreader! He is the final touch on this project!
  • The launch! Blasting it out into the world! December 21st, 2021!

There are exclusive rewards available for those who preorder, including: 

  • You can receive a personally signed copy of the book when it's published. 
  • Your name could appear in the Acknowledgements section of Shadow Dancer.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from this book, with the opportunity to review them and offer early feedback.
  • We will invite you to join the Author Community and receive invitations to upcoming events and opportunities. 
  • My undying and infinite gratitude and a huge hug when we meet. 
  • And other perks that surprise! 

For more information, you can connect with Melissa at soulcuriosity@gmail.com and on the Soul Curiosity Press Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/ShadowedSoulBook

Risks & Challenges

We face only one challenge, and that is if we do not reach the fundraising goal. This campaign has a fixed goal of $7,777.00 and reaching it is the only way to guarantee the perks to its contributors!  The total cost to publish is $12,000, and that is the extended goal! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help! You can quickly become an author influencer and assist in getting the word out! 

You are welcome and encouraged to…

  1. Share this pre-sale campaign on any of the social media platforms you prefer. Please use the hashtag #shadowedsoulbook and be sure to tag me (@MelissaJennewein) in your posts so that we can assist with and recognize you for your efforts!
  2. You can also easily share the pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  3. Please share this book with your friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct social media message.

Thank you for all of your love, encouragement, and continued support! I appreciate every single one of you. Together we can create the most spectacular waves and make magnificent movements. I love this adventure with all of you.

Pick a perk to the right, make a donation, or scroll to the bottom to see how to become an author influencer! I invite you to join in and contribute to this project! Let's make things happen! Are you ready to take the leap and go resistance diving? Then jump in! And invite those other visionary friends of yours that belong in this new story to invest in this project! By contributing, you will be giving not only to the publication of a book but to a vision.The more fantastic idea beyond the book is to create spaces where we can:
Playfully teach the concepts and ideas found throughout this story. 
Grow stronger within ourselves and our community.  
Care newly for the planet and all of its diversity.
Connect with our inner child, who is always full of wonder and curiosity. 
Are you ready? Then it's go time!  Shadowed Soul Book I can hardly remember when I was a child between the ages of eight and twelve years old, and what I had chosen to decorate my bedroom with. There were many posters of world maps and fast cars like Ferraris and Lamborghinis hanging on the walls. A spinning globe stood on the desk and plenty of stuffed animals that I would create stories with hung weightlessly in the netted corners of the room. But I could only remember those things from the photographs left behind. On August 17th, 1995, when I was sixteen years old, I was in a car accident that would take those memories and many more from "the good years" of my life away from me for almost two decades. Up until my eighth birthday, we moved quite often. It seemed that I had become quite adaptable to the changing of schools, friends, and countries and eagerly anticipated the appearance of large cardboard boxes. Through this moving around, I would become fascinated with the world and curious about every inch of it that I had not yet explored. Then, around the age of twelve, I remember some real drama that began to happen in my childhood. By the time I was almost fifteen, I would have already moved out, got a job to pay my rent and feed myself, and forgotten all about those childish daydreams of world maps, fast cars, and storytelling. I would instead enter the working world in America. The one that was not my dream but helped me survive to be out on my own at such a young age.That is until the year 2012, or better known as the end of the world as I knew it. Death and heartbreak would begin to shatter -with heavy, broad, and deliberate strokes, the illusions of my reality. And while experiencing this deterioration of the old, I felt confused, vulnerable, and completely lost. I began to understand depression as it was introduced as my new companion and took up a lot of my space and energy. Is this a spiritual awakening or just a bout of psychosis I wondered?The journey into understanding would take me around the world and deep into the folds of my unconscious mind. I decided to turn my compass inward and upward and sought out guides to teach me along the way. What I learned was game-changing and went against most of my knowledge up until the point of those experiences.  Little did I know that at the end of those seven years that COVID would thwart my plans to continue traveling, and that is when friends would begin to ask, "Will you share your story with the world?" The thought of it terrified me. I had already compiled my diaries into a first draft in 2019 while I sat in the silence of the Sahara Desert. And yet, I really wasn't sure why I had done it. And then, as the book started to take form, I realized that I was becoming very apprehensive about sharing it. Sometimes I felt quite confident that it could inspire others. At other times, I felt that exposing these honest and unfiltered experiences would open my heart to unwanted emotional vulnerability. This divide brought up a whole new set of shadows that I would need to dance with and took me deep into some genuine (to me) fear. The process took weeks, but we made it through, and now here we are :) I feel that we are all here to learn, grow, and figure out how to be the best versions of ourselves, and I would like to support that growth. I now know that it starts with me and cannot seem to forget a quote from Gandhi that has reappeared throughout the years: "You must be the change you wish to see in the world." And what I wish to see is a world where we uplift one another versus tearing each other down—a world where we celebrate our achievements and learning steps. A world where learning to be one's most aware and authentic self is our aim and sharing our love, compassion, and support for one another while on that journey is our priority—a world in which we teach our children how to nurture and guard our home's diversity. Not to destroy it in the ways that we as a species unconsciously have. This non-fiction memoir is my most authentic attempt to share what that journey into understanding how to be the change I wanted to see in the world looked like for me. Everything in this book is true, to the best of my knowledge, memory, conversations with characters within the story, and notes from my diaries.What I Need & What You'll Get.Shadowed Soul will start as an eBook, followed by a print edition and an audiobook. Feel free to join in at any level and share this campaign with your tribe. Let's create some magic! We need the funds raised through the preorders to support:
The editor! To assist with the revision and publishing in 2021!
The artist! The cover artist has already earned it!
The layout! The interior of the book and the formatting need work!
The proofreader! He is the final touch on this project!
The launch! Blasting it out into the world! December 21st, 2021!
There are exclusive rewards available for those who preorder, including: 
You can receive a personally signed copy of the book when it's published. 
Your name could appear in the Acknowledgements section of Shadow Dancer.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from this book, with the opportunity to review them and offer early feedback.
We will invite you to join the Author Community and receive invitations to upcoming events and opportunities. 
My undying and infinite gratitude and a huge hug when we meet. 
And other perks that surprise! 
For more information, you can connect with Melissa at soulcuriosity@gmail.com and on the Soul Curiosity Press Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/ShadowedSoulBookRisks & ChallengesWe face only one challenge, and that is if we do not reach the fundraising goal. This campaign has a fixed goal of $7,777.00 and reaching it is the only way to guarantee the perks to its contributors!  The total cost to publish is $12,000, and that is the extended goal! Other Ways You Can HelpSome people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help! You can quickly become an author influencer and assist in getting the word out! You are welcome and encouraged to…
Share this pre-sale campaign on any of the social media platforms you prefer. Please use the hashtag #shadowedsoulbook and be sure to tag me (@MelissaJennewein) in your posts so that we can assist with and recognize you for your efforts!
You can also easily share the pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share this book with your friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct social media message.
Thank you for all of your love, encouragement, and continued support! I appreciate every single one of you. Together we can create the most spectacular waves and make magnificent movements. I love this adventure with all of you.

story:
ALUMINUM BASEBALL BATS ARE DANGEROUS!

Metal baseball bats have been used for more than three decades and have been banned by thousands of little and youth leagues around the world.


Metal bats have been used for more than 35 years and, in an irresponsible way, more and more metal alloys have been developed with lighter and harder materials. This has resulted in serious accidents, mainly in little and youth leagues, however, adult categories have not been exempt.

THE RETURN OF BASEBALL TO ITS ORIGINS: THE WOOD BAT

The return of the wood baseball bat was not only necessary, but it also turned into pressing need due to its dangerous background and the possibility of getting worse sincethe ball may become a missile when it contacts a metal bat.


LOOKING FOR SOLUTIONS

During the last months, at RHINO BAT CO. we have devoted our time to find a solution to this serious problem that affects thousands of players of all ages and who are limited to the use of wood and have been victims of the after-effects of having used metal bats.



RHINO INDESTRUCTIBLE

With the help of material experts and our experience, we designed a structure made of 16 pieces of wood assembled with ecological glue. Such structure was transformed in a beautiful solid bat piece called THE INDESTRUCTIBLE and which can resist up to three to four times the impact of a baseball in comparison with traditional bats. Its craftsmanship (unique in the industry) with MLB specifications in its finish certainly solve the damage caused by the use of metal bats.


WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF THE INDESTRUCTIBLE?

·  It promotes discipline which is necessary to bat as a professional.

·  It offers the possibility to be a better player.

·  It introduces players to real baseball.

·  The after-effects caused by the use of metal bats disappear.

·  It helps increase self-esteem.

·  It gives players confidence and SECURITY.



RHINO BAT CO. AND ITS SOCIAL COMMITMENT

Like finding the cure for a disease, we have faced the challenge of offering a solution by designing and building THE INDESTRUCTIBLE. We intend to place it in the hands of professional baseball players of all categories and solve, at the same time, the problem of cost. Definitely, the cost-benefit of THE INDESTRUCTIBLE is EXTRAORDINARY.

RHINOBAT CO. AND ITS CONTRIBUTION

·  We donate 5% of our profit in the USA to:

  Tracy Baynes, President.

SPANISH

EL BATE DE ALUMINIO ES PELIGROSO!

El Bate de beisbol metálico, ha sido utilizado por más de tres décadas y ha sido prohibido por miles de ligas infantiles y juveniles de todo el mundo.


Hace más de 35 años, se está utilizando el bate metálico y de manera irresponsable cada vez se han creado aleaciones con materiales más ligeros y más duros, esto ha traído como consecuencia graves accidentes, sobre todo en las ligas infantiles y juveniles, no quedando exentos de estos problemas, las categorías mayores.

EL REGRESO DEL BEISBOL A SU ORIGEN: EL BATE DE MADERA

El regreso de la madera al beisbol, no solo se hizo necesario, sino que se convirtió en una urgencia por los antecedentes peligrosos y la tendencia a agravarse, al salir la pelota como un misil, al contacto con un bate metálico.


BUSCANDO SOLUCIONES

En RHINO BAT CO. nos hemos dedicado los últimos meses a buscar y encontrar una solución, para este grave problema que azota a cientos de miles de jugadores de todas las edades, al ser limitados a solo la utilización de la madera y ser víctimas de las secuelas que ha dejado el bate metálico.


RHINO INDESTRUCTIBLE

Nuestra experiencia y los especialistas en materiales diseñaron una estructura, compuesta de 16 piezas de madera unidas con un pegamento ecológico, la cual fue transformada en una bella pieza de batear sólida, misma que soporta hasta  tres y cuatro veces los impactos de una pelota con EL INDESTRUCTIBLE  en comparación con los bates convencionales, su fabricación artesanal, (única en la industria), con especificaciones de MLB en sus acabados,
resuelven sin duda los daños provocados por el uso del bate metálico.


QUE APORTA EL INDESTRUCTIBLE?

·  Genera hábito de disciplina, necesaria para batear como un profesional

·  Ofrece la posibilidad de ser un mejor jugador

·  Te introduce a jugar el beisbol real

·  Desaparecen las secuelas que provoca la utilización del bate metálico

·  Aumenta el autoestima

·  Te da confianza y SEGURIDAD



RHINO BAT CO. Y SU COMPROMISO SOCIAL

Como encontrar la cura para una enfermedad, hemos enfrentado el reto de ofrecer una solución, hemos diseñado y construido EL INDESTRUCTIBLE, y nos proponemos ponerlo en las manos de los jugadores serios del beisbol de todas las categorías, paralelamente, se resuelve el tema de costos y definitivamente el costo beneficio del INDESTRUCTIBLE, ES EXTRAORDINARIO.

RHINOBAT CO. Y SU APORTACION

·  Donamos el 5% de nuestra utilidad en USA a:

  Tracy Baynes Presidenta de la organización.

En la compra de un INDESTRUCTIBLE, le obsequiamos

story:
Project 6: The Next Frontier.

Because no one has yet to ask me why I started these on number 4 instead of 1 or 0.

That aside, this is it.  Y'know that moment in that movie "In The Mouth of Madness," that point before everyone reads that guy's book and turns into monsters?  Yeah, this is that moment right before that.

As of this fundraiser, I have gotten Taboos 0-3 done and more, the crowning achievement (for me) for 2014.

The Omnibus Generalis, with the fifth book inside, three short stories, and a whole full-color gallery.

It took me three months to rock that, and now?

Now it's time to get the word out!  I've found a great publicist, and the funds will be split amongst several ventures, all available through Massive Entertainment Publishing:

-Taboos 4 and 5 (namely the final edits of Taboo 4 and the beginning of Taboo 5)
-Killer 13 Volume 1
-The Publicist Herself

This is it.  This is the next frontier, the last iota needed to propel The Generalist into the fanbase it deserves.

My team and I thank you for all your help, O Faceless And Omnipresent Reader, and we hope you help us with this current endeavor.

If you can't pay even a buck, surely you can invite a friend!

Let's do this.

Because we both still believe in a world of books.

~Thomas Duder, Author of the Things

The Pen Is My Sword - http://www.thepenismysword.com
Duder's Army (under construction) - http://www.dudersarmy.com
Facebook Author Page - http://www.facebook.com/AuthorOfTheThings

story:
1992 to 2015 in under 5 minutes: 

In the spring of 1992, after a jury in Los Angeles acquitted police officers in the beating of Rodney King, I was sitting on my sister's couch in Atlanta, next to a good friend of mine who is black. I am white. As we watched neighborhoods in south central LA burn to the ground, both of us were upset, angry, confused, but for completely different reasons. In fact, although we were both watching the same images play out in front of us, it was as if we were watching two entirely different stories. Shocked and confused by what we were witnessing, I said some things, she said some things, and every word we spoke only widened the divide that was developing between us. The complexity of that afternoon sparked me to write a one-act play about race and friendship called Maggie & Drey, which went on the have multiple productions across the country, including being featured in an off-Broadway theater festival in 2002. Audiences were rocked by the play. In fact, some people, both black and white, claimed that the story of Maggie and Drey changed their lives.

One year ago, I decided it was time to develop Maggie & Drey from a one-act to a two-act, full-length play and to self produce a legitimate run of it in New York City. I knew I wanted to say something about racism that hadn't been said before, so I dove head first into a deep and fearless exploration of race in America. The result of these past twelve months is a bold yet intimate play that exposes, not the overt expressions of racial conflict that we see in the headlines, but rather the little ones, the almost imperceptible ones that seem to occur every day.

Maggie & Drey explores the tangled web of racism through the simple story of two women, one black, one white, who grew up as best friends and reunite after ten years for their high school reunion. Set inside Drey's Harlem apartment, Maggie & Drey goes directly to the heart, which, after all, is where racism resides.  

Where We Are & What We Need

In the true spirit of independent theater, I have used my own resources (aka grocery money) to bring Maggie & Drey to this point. Now I need your help. I have put down a deposit on the PERFECT theater space for a 5-week world premier run of Maggie & Drey from May 1-31, 2015. The Kraine Theater is situated in Manhattan's East Village, between New York Theatre Workshop and La Mama Theater, two of the most legendary spaces for brave and experimental independent theater in America. This two-act version of Maggie and Drey could not have a better place to be born.

Funding breakdown: 

  • $13,100 Rental Fees for 5-week run at Kraine Theater, NYC. 
  • $13,600 Compensation for Actors, Director, Crew (stage manager, assistant director) Designers (light, sound, set, wardrobe). 
  • $5000 Rehearsal and Storage Space. 
  • $2000 Equipment/Prop Rental. 
  • $3200 Transportation/Lodging. 
  • $2500 Advertising/Promotional Materials.
  •  $2000 Unforeseen Expenses. 

Why This Play Matters 

That moment on the couch was 23 years ago, but it might as well have been today.

We are standing at a pivotal moment in the life of America. We truly are a great nation, but until we understand racism, what it is and how it operates in our everyday lives, that greatness will never fully flourish. Only art can take us to places that our minds don't know how to reach, and what art form other than theater for exploring places our hearts are afraid to go. If you have ever experienced or witnessed racial conflict asked yourself "what can I do?," supporting this brave production of Maggie & Drey is one thing you CAN do.

Real Talk

There are still many pieces to pull together before our May 1st Opening Night and you might feel a bit hesitant to commit to a project that does not have its entire team in place. If this is the case, please consider contributing a small amount now and then adding another contribution later when you see the momentum build. I will be actively updating this campaign with new developments and milestones reached. From the moment I arrived back in Brooklyn last year and started working on this play, innumerable doors have flown open and I have made deep and lasting connections within the New York theater world. That is not to say that it has been easy. I have given my life over to this project and most of the hard work is behind me. Now all I need are the funds to get Maggie & Drey to the finish line and beyond. 

Share the Love! 

I know you want to help, I can just feel it! Money is not the only way to help. If you would prefer to express your support in other ways, here are a few suggestions: 

  • Love Big! Smile More! 
  • Tell others about this campaign!
  • Help us fill every seat for every show! Tell your NY friends and family to come see the show in May. 
  • Send prayers and good vibrations our way. 

Thank you for your kind attention! Peace and Love to you all!!
story_txt:
1992 to 2015 in under 5 minutes: 

In the spring of 1992,
after a jury in Los Angeles acquitted police officers in the beating of Rodney
King, I was sitting on my sister's couch in Atlanta, next to a good friend of
mine who is black. I am white. As we watched neighborhoods in south central LA burn to the
ground, both of us were upset, angry, confused, but for completely different
reasons. In fact, although we were both watching the same images play out in
front of us, it was as if we were watching two entirely different stories. Shocked
and confused by what we were witnessing, I said some things, she said some things, and every word we spoke only widened the divide that was developing between us. The complexity of that
afternoon sparked me to write a one-act play about race and friendship called
Maggie & Drey, which went on the have multiple productions across the
country, including being featured in an off-Broadway theater festival in 2002.
Audiences were rocked by the play. In fact, some people, both black and white,
claimed that the story of Maggie and Drey changed their lives.
One year ago, I decided it was time to develop
Maggie & Drey from a one-act to a two-act, full-length play and to
self produce a legitimate run of it in New York City. I knew I wanted to say
something about racism that hadn't been said before, so I dove head first into
a deep and fearless exploration of race in America. The result of these past

racism resides.

story:
Raccoons at summer camp?

You betcha! Summer camp was my favorite place to be as a kid and then it became my favorite place to work as an adult. But, not as many children have the chance to go to camp as they used to. To inspire children and parents to rekindle their love of summer camping (and use their imaginations), I began this series about Roger McPaw and the nocturnal world of raccoon camp. Most people think of swimming, hiking, and campfires when they think of summer camp, but the real action is what goes on after dark. 

In Book One, Roger McPaw, a timid first-year camper spends his first week at Camp WannaTippaTrashCan. He gets a little homesick, makes a lot of friends, and learns about how summer camp can change his life. Book Two in is in the works and three more will follow to complete a five-book series.


Help keep the summer camp dream alive

  • Funding for this project will go directly to have the book illustrated and self-published. 
  • Funds will also be used for travel to schools and bookstores to read Roger's story to children and to camp-obsessed adults.
  • Supporting this project comes with all kinds of perks like stickers, t-shirts, signed books, and even a character in future books based on YOU!
  • If the goal is not reached, funds will still be used to self-publish as many books in the series as possible.

Supporting books ALL kinds of kids want to read

The Camp WannaTippaTrashCan series is for all those readers, of all ages, who want tales of adventure and a chance to use their imaginations. Each book will charm and delight girls, boys, and all adults who are children at heart.


Ahoowee! means Hooray! for raccoons

  • If you love outdoor adventure, please share this campaign to your friends and family.
  • Think your child would love this book? Donate and get a signed copy along with a cool sticker too.
  • Stay up to date on Roger's adventures on Camp WannaTippa's Facebook page too!

story:
Hello! I'm Angelika (Angie) Hofmann and I was formally a personal chef/health food caterer as well as a wellness coach and have helped many people, including myself, heal ailments through food. I have recently put together my favorite recipes that I created during my career into a wonderful book called "Simple, Healthy Delights." It took a lot of hard work and investment, hiring designers and editors to create a product that I could feel proud of.

Now that I have this beautiful book ready to share I would like to ask your help in getting these delicious, nutritious recipes out to the world! The funds would go to putting out advertisements in national magazines and after researching prices, I have found that I'm going to need about $2000 dollars per magazine so I'm asking for $4000 since I have 2 magazines in mind.

Each contributor over $25 will get a copy of the book "Simple, Healthy Delights" as well as extra goodies such as the PDF of the useful shopping list that's available in the book and the chart of what's good to eat organic otherwise known as "The dirty dozen" and The  clean Fifteen"

I'm so excited about getting these healthy recipes out to the world and I am so appreciative of your support.

I believe food has the potential to heal people on a body, mind and spirit level and that's why I'm so determined to get people back in the kitchen creating easy things that can help them thrive. I believe learning to eat well is taking your life back into your hands. Although I'm not a doctor, I believe in preventive lifestyle and these foods are a cornerstone of that lifestyle.
I hope that you would like to help me on my mission! Even if you can't fund the campaign with money right now, I would love if you would share it with your network of contacts. Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart.

story:
HEART MEDICINE: A True Love Story was successfully produced! The official public relations launch begins May 15th, 2016. Review copies are now available on Amazon or by request at your local book retailer!

THANK YOU to everyone who donated and shared the word about our campaign! The greatest blessing has been connecting with such a dynamic community of caring plant allies. All perks have been mailed and delivered.

Subscribe to our email list HERE if you would like updates about our upcoming book & art tour and other events.

____________________________________________________________________________


Help to publish the 1st run of this intimate memoir. Author Elizabeth Bast and world renowned artist Chor Boogie bare all about their healing journey with iboga, an obscure sacred plant medicine from Africa known for it's spiritual healing and powerful addiction-breaking effects.

 

 

Perks include Chor Boogie's fine art prints, cards, & original paintings at special prices available ONLY in this campaign.
 

 

 

*To learn more about iboga and the related medical studies, please explore:
this book
this article
EBAST.NET
MAPS
GITA

 

Praise for Heart Medicine:


"I stayed up and read 200 pages in one sitting! Elizabeth Bast's writing is so compelling, so present! What a gift she is giving the world with her experience and her exquisite writing. It’s the best kind of modern love story: passionate lovers, spiritual awakening, urban addictions, and the rising power of shamanism and plant medicine to help individuals, couples and families step into a new, more enlivened and powerful paradigm of relating.

It’s not only a fascinating read, it has the power to be a vehicle of healing for so many. There are so many folks right now on prescription medication or addicted to drugs (or hey, even playing Sudoku) who are seeking relief from suffering. This is the perfect story to get through to them. And also for those who are already more aware, what an amazing reminder of what is possible and how to realign with what we know to be true. I’m so heartened to know that her story offers true solutions to modern ailments and is now available to the world at large. It’s going to grab people and give them a healing just as they read it."


- Bella Shing
Award-Winning Writer, Director, & Founder of SweeterMedia.com

 

 

 

Two lovers. One shocking drug relapse - after more than a decade clean.

Then the disheartening discovery: 90% of narcotics addicts relapse in the first year in our Western Medical system.

The lovers navigate the treacherous labyrinth of addiction and ultimately chose to pursue treatment with an obscure indigenous African sacred plant medicine called iboga, used since ancient times for spiritual healing and proven to have powerful addiction breaking effects. It sounds too good to be true, but it's seems to be worth the try, considering the alternatives.

This medicine is only available well beyond the borders of the United States. There is hope for healing, if they can both make it to the shaman in time.

•

Explore E. Bast's blog post about their experience.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Read about HEART MEDICINE: A True Love Story in...
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

"...That night of his confession I realized; this heroin demon, stealthy and devious, had stayed hidden and sleeping inside him for 13 years, whispering to his unconscious all the while, biding it’s time, waiting for a weak moment and the right company, waiting for it’s friend alcohol to wear him down and leave him on it’s dark doorstep. "

The complete 1st chapter is freely offered on the author's website HERE.

 

 

 
Elizabeth Bast serves as a writer, poet, yoga teacher, yogic life-style coach, visual & performance artist, fusion temple dancer, and musician. She studied at New College of San Francisco with an emphasis on Art and Social Change. ebast.net


Chor Boogie a.k.a. Joaquin Lamar Hailey is an internationally acclaimed spray-paint artist. His visionary murals and art exhibitions have graced many countries across the globe. He was recently honored by Societe Perrier as being number three among the the TOP TEN U.S. Street Artists of 2014. He approaches his use of color as a form of therapy and visual medicine, and has been dubbed “the color shaman” by comrades and fans. chorboogie.com

Elizabeth & Chor now also serve as educators and advocates for the iboga medicine by sharing their healing journey.




 

 

 

 

This professional quality book will help to educate people about iboga as a viable option for holistic addiction treatment as well as for spiritual healing, and how to approach this sacred medicine with care and respect for safety and efficacy. 

Though Iboga is regarded as a national treasure in Gabon, it is currently illegal in United States. We are not advocating for illegal use. We are simply sharing our story, as is protected by free speech, and we are advocating for it's legal use in countries where this medicine is protected by qualified traditional providers. 

In addition, this is true love story reveals how a couple can survive incredible obstacles with the aid of love, intuition, and the greater force of Grace… while falling ever deeper in love.
 

These alarming statistics show the need for new treatment options:

In 2012, 183,000 drug related deaths occurred globally, mostly overdoses, with opioid overdose being the largest category.  (The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime [UNODC] 2012 World Drug Report) 

Drug overdose death rates in the U.S. have been steadily rising since 1992 with a 118% increase from 1999 to 2011 alone. (Center for Disease Control & Prevention)

Methadone treatment and other kinds of "drug replacement therapies" can last between 1 year to 20 years or more. These legal drugs are known to be as toxic and addictive as street heroin, Though they are more stable than street drugs and can sometimes alleviate dangers associated with the black market.

Iboga research has been increasing in recent years. For instance, MAPS-sponsored researchers are collecting observational data for the first prospective ibogaine outcome studies in order to contribute to the growing scientific literature about ibogaine as a treatment for drug addiction.

 

 

 

Traditional publishing can be unduly challenging, time consuming, and creatively compromising for newer authors, and this uncensored story needs to be shared with as many people as possible as soon as possible. We don't want this story to be sitting on desks indefinitely.

 

Traditional publishing rarely offers substantial advances or promotional budgets to newer authors. We would like to take the helm of the book's production, promotions, and distribution, and give it the attention and resources it needs to thrive.

We are forming a new independent press complete with a professional team that will properly support this book, in addition to other conscious media projects.

Here is an excellent article detailing the rise in success for "indie" publishers.

 

 

 

 

BOOK PRODUCTION & BOOK PROMOTION:

• Copy-Editor:  Stephanie Pascal
• Book Designer:  Mark Weiman of Regent Press
• Publicity & Marketing:  Green Galactic
• Publishing Services:  Ingram Spark
• Distribution to Reviewers
• Book Tour & Promotional Events
• Advertising
• Video
• Graphic Design
• Hard Cost of Campaign Perks & Shipping
• Establishing our Independent Publishing House: Medicinal Media


TAXES & FEES:

 

4-9% of final funding goes directly to crowd-funding platform.
Taxes will be paid on all proceeds.

 

 

 
Heart Medicine - the book! Be the first to read it in E-Book format or enjoy the first-run limited edition signed hardcover - or both!
 



Enjoy "The Love Dance," Chor's first iboga inspired work of fine art, as postcards and also as signed high quality Giclée prints on archival canvas - at special prices only available through this campaign. 3 different sizes are available. Certificate of authenticity is included. *The original piece is not available through this campaign. Please inquire for details.
 


 
"Light Orange" is an original post-iboga painting by Chor Boogie:
30" x 40" spray-paint on archival canvas.
 


 

Experience a 6 hour private spray-paint fine art mentoring session for TWO GUESTS with Chor Boogie, one of the top spray-paint artists in the U.S., according to critics. This option comes a healthy catered vegan lunch + 2 Deluxe Perk Packages! (San Francisco Bay Area)
 




Experience a 6 hour personalized YOGA + MEDITATION day retreat for TWO GUESTS with Elizabeth Bast. This option comes a healthy catered vegan lunch + 2 Deluxe Perk Packages! (San Francisco Bay Area)
 

 
 


Receive special rewards JUST for referring donors to our cause!

*These perks can ONLY be acquired through generating referrals!
Read this page to learn how you can set up your IndieGogo account to participate in our Referral Rewards. Start sharing our campaign from your dashboard to begin accumulating referral points. Accounting will be automatic.

•

Refer friends to donate a total of $100 to our campaign (can be from multiple people) and receive a pack of 10 greeting cards featuring this "Boogie Bird" design by Chor Boogie + a personalized note of thanks + the E-BOOK!

Inside you will find the ONE PRAYER of our Africa Bwiti tribe:
"THANK YOU FOR THIS DAY!"
 



 

 


Check for new videos in our video gallery. Send us your questions about our healing experience with iboga to heart medicine.info@gmail.com.
 

•
 

...Stay tuned! As the campaign gets rolling, we may be able to add more perks, and prizes! SEE the UPDATES tab on our campaign above!
 

•
 

Yes! We made it to Africa! At the time of shooting our video in early winter 2014, it was still just a dream. We were blessed to experience the sacred iboga medicine in vibrant traditional Bwiti ceremonies with Moughenda's tribe. We were also blessed with a traditional wedding ceremony. See more pics from our Africa adventure HERE.
 

 

 

 
Special thanks goes out to our amazing community & media partners!
 

 


Special thanks goes out to Elizabeth's awesome Mother who is the most soulful and meticulous literary critic ever. Many thanks to the families of both Elizabeth & Chor (especially Doug & Esther!) who have been a profound support throughout this intense journey. 


Special thanks also goes out to Mopunga, Julia, Michael, Ann-Mari, Bella Shing, Anandha Ray, Mara Altman, Kat PK, Polly "Superstar" Whittaker, Marco, Shamana Ma & Patrick Riley of holylove.tv alistcalendar.com, Jeff Cook, Gary Cook, Laura Cirolia, Gina Marie, Ewa Dauter, Shamani, Ton Ton, Lizzie Easton-Montes, Oscar "Trek6" Montes, Justin Hamel, Beth Johnson, Julian Reyes of keyframe-entertainment.com, Philip Milic of oldcrowtattoo.com, Debra Giusti of DebraRecommends.com, Magenta Ceiba of evolver.net, Amber Lyon & April at Reset.me, Syd Gris, Jonathan Dickinson, Brad Burge, & the good people at Focus@Will, a music program that helped the author focus beyond what she could have imagined, & the many amazing friends and angels along the way!

We would like to take the helm of the book's production, promotions, and distribution, and give it the attention and resources it needs to thrive.We are forming a new independent press complete with a professional team that will properly support this book, in addition to other conscious media projects.Here is an excellent article detailing the rise in success for "indie" publishers.  

 
 
BOOK PRODUCTION & BOOK PROMOTION:
• Copy-Editor:  Stephanie Pascal• Book Designer:  Mark Weiman of Regent Press• Publicity & Marketing:  Green Galactic • Publishing Services:  Ingram Spark• Distribution to Reviewers• Book Tour & Promotional Events• Advertising• Video• Graphic Design• Hard Cost of Campaign Perks & Shipping• Establishing our Independent Publishing House: Medicinal Media
TAXES & FEES:
 
4-9% of final funding goes directly to crowd-funding platform.Taxes will be paid on all proceeds.  

 
Heart Medicine - the book! Be the first to read it in E-Book format or enjoy the first-run limited edition signed hardcover - or both! 


Enjoy "The Love Dance," Chor's first iboga inspired work of fine art, as postcards and also as signed high quality Giclée prints on archival canvas - at special prices only available through this campaign. 3 different sizes are available. Certificate of authenticity is included. *The original piece is not available through this campaign. Please inquire for details.
 


 

"Light Orange" is an original post-iboga painting by Chor Boogie:30" x 40" spray-paint on archival canvas.  


 


Experience a 6 hour private spray-paint fine art mentoring session for TWO GUESTS with Chor Boogie, one of the top spray-paint artists in the U.S., according to critics. This option comes a healthy catered vegan lunch + 2 Deluxe Perk Packages! (San Francisco Bay Area) 
Experience a 6 hour personalized YOGA + MEDITATION day retreat for TWO GUESTS with Elizabeth Bast. This option comes a healthy catered vegan lunch + 2 Deluxe Perk Packages! (San Francisco Bay Area) 

 
 


Receive special rewards JUST for referring donors to our cause! *These perks can ONLY be acquired through generating referrals! Read this page to learn how you can set up your IndieGogo account to participate in our Referral Rewards. Start sharing our campaign from your dashboard to begin accumulating referral points. Accounting will be automatic.

•Refer friends to donate a total of $100 to our campaign (can be from multiple people) and receive a pack of 10 greeting cards featuring this "Boogie Bird" design by Chor Boogie + a personalized note of thanks + the E-BOOK!Inside you will find the ONE PRAYER of our Africa Bwiti tribe:"THANK YOU FOR THIS DAY!" 
 
 Check for new videos in our video gallery. Send us your questions about our healing experience with iboga to heart medicine.info@gmail.com. 
• 
...Stay tuned! As the campaign gets rolling, we may be able to add more perks, and prizes! SEE the UPDATES tab on our campaign above! 
• 

Yes! We made it to Africa! At the time of shooting our video in early winter 2014, it was still just a dream. We were blessed to experience the sacred iboga medicine in vibrant traditional Bwiti ceremonies with Moughenda's tribe. We were also blessed with a traditional wedding ceremony. See more pics from our Africa adventure HERE.
 

 


 


 
Special thanks goes out to our amazing community & media partners! 
 

Special thanks goes out to Elizabeth's awesome Mother who is the most soulful and meticulous literary critic ever. Many thanks to the families of both Elizabeth & Chor (especially Doug & Esther!) who have been a profound support throughout this intense journey. 

Special thanks also goes out to Mopunga, Julia, Michael, Ann-Mari, Bella Shing, Anandha Ray, Mara Altman, Kat PK, Polly "Superstar" Whittaker, Marco, Shamana Ma & Patrick Riley of holylove.tv alistcalendar.com, Jeff Cook, Gary Cook, Laura Cirolia, Gina Marie, Ewa Dauter, Shamani, Ton Ton, Lizzie Easton-Montes, Oscar "Trek6" Montes, Justin Hamel, Beth Johnson, Julian Reyes of keyframe-entertainment.com, Philip Milic of oldcrowtattoo.com, Debra Giusti of DebraRecommends.com, Magenta Ceiba of evolver.net, Amber Lyon & April at Reset.me, Syd Gris, Jonathan Dickinson, Brad Burge, & the good people at Focus@Will, a music program that helped the author focus beyond what she could have imagined, & the many amazing friends and angels along the way!

story:
How I Got Here . . .

My name is Connie Flynn. I write fiction, mostly novels, and teach others how to  write it. I have been busy at it for over twenty years and have written sixteen novels, twelve of them published. I've also written three published short stories. This campaign is about turning a book of mine into a runaway bestseller. Sounds cool, huh? But let's go the beginning . . . if you have time.

My earliest writing memory was of a series of mysteries I wrote for Mr. Ryan's fourth grade class at Isaac Elementary School. The stories followed the adventures of a brother/sister team who solved mysteries, particularly around Halloween, where they spent way too much time counting white hairs on black cats who'd applied to be on their witch/wizard team. My classmates loved these stories and so did I. Somehow, at that early age, I'd connected with my true calling.

But life got in the way. I grew up, I got married. I had children (who are the joy of my life). I gave up my calling. After all, it took years to get a novel published, if it ever even happened, and I needed a real job.

Several decades later I published my first novel with Harlequin and wrote five more for them. I then went on to write four supernatural romantic thrillers for Penguin/Putnam. (See my book list further down.) Then life got in the way again. A disruptive injury, a divorce, a move to a new house and a need to earn a regular paycheck. I needed a day job.

Another decade later, I was ready to go back to full time writing. In an entirely

different publishing world. When I left there were over thirty independent publishing houses. By the time I returned to writing, there were no more than seven. By this time my calling to write was howling. No matter what, I was going to get and stay published. I joined the growing ranks of independent authors. I got back rights to my previous books and reissued four of them. I wrote two new books (See Know When to Run above) and have four unfinished manuscripts to complete.

The demands of this calling are staggering. Although I published the two new books, and converted four earlier books, I still have six left to prep for reissue. There are three million books listed on Amazon and thousands being sold through smaller distributors and independent websites. I have to promote at least two hours a day or lose sales and advertising continues to get more expensive. Generating enough income to pay my bills has become a struggle. But to stay on top, much less get ahead, I need to outsource some of the work I'm now doing.

There's a business axiom that says that whatever you did to get to your current level of success won't take you to the next level. I've found that axiom to be true. My time and income is limited, my competition fierce. My team consists of family members, who have their own lives to live. I can't do what needs to be done, not alone. Which is why I'm asking for help.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Connie and her team are aiming for $4000 in contributions to cover the following publishing expenses:
  • $2000 for advertising
  • $1200 to prepare remaining backlist for publishing
  • $500 to cover cost of delivering perks and pay taxes
  • $300 for upgraded software
  • REALLY NEAT PERKS 
  • The 400 Club Built on the premise that if 400 people each contribute $10, our campaign will be fully funded. Plus,contributors will get a fantastic 6-inch foam finger that declares our book is a #1 runaway bestseller. Imagine . . . not only do you get the satisfaction of helping a great book go runaway, you also get the finger, which is available only to 400 Club members.
  • Books and Swag Other perks include digital, paperback or audiobook copies of Know Where to Run. Bookmarks, cover art, t-shirts. The higher the contribution, the greater the perks.
  • Recognition and Collaboration - Acknowledgement of your contribution through  Connie's website, Facebook author page, and tweets on Twitter. Be a character in Connie's next book. Collaborate with Connie on a short story. Have Connie's next book dedicated to you.
  • Ongoing Perks - New and exciting perks will be randomly added to campaign. A replica of heroine Ky Taylor's little pink derringer. Have dinner with Connie at a posh Scottsdale resort. 
    • WHAT IF THE GOAL ISN'T MET?
    • When Connie and team stop crying they will immediately set to delivering the perks and sending out thank you notes.
    • The next priority will be advertising, which is vital to spurring a runaway bestseller. Since getting the backlist books in print will generate higher income, thus buying more advertising, so depending on the funds available, book prep  will be preserved, at least some of it.
    • After that . . . well, the team is getting the mother of all headaches just thinking about it. Can denial be far behind. One thing is clear. The new software is dead, kaput. Unless . .
    • WHAT IF THE GOAL IS MET?
    • All systems go. Advertising project is set up. Books are prepared for publication. Software is purchased and installed and, of course, all perks are fulfilled.
    • Connie and team will issue a public thanks to all supporters and contributors and sponsor a virtual celebration party of sorts.
    • WHAT IF THE GOAL IS EXCEEDED? 
    • When Connie and team stop cheering and doing their silly happy dance, they'll develop a first-class advertising program.
    • Backlist books will be prepped and published.
    • Connie will hire a part-time virtual assistant so she can spend most of her time writing.
    • Connie and team will publicly and eagerly thank everyone who supported and/or contributed to the success of the campaign. Delivery of contributors' perks will include some unexpected classy swag.

    The Impact

    Novels and the world of fiction and storytelling are often underestimated in the digital society. Reading fiction requires skills of concentration and abstract imagination that are fading away in this world of constant distracting interruptions. Moreover, much like what happened to musicians in the twentieth century, a growing perception that books should be free is pushing writers to the edge.
    And just like musicians have to make music, fiction writers have to tell their tales. And, what's more, like all human beings they still need shelter and food. They deserve the right to be paid for their work.

    Your contributions to support this one writer—Connie—in her attempt to get out of the basement of book marketing and help others do the same, could leave a greater mark than you imagine. Reading is a salve to the mind and develops these valuable abilities, among others.

    • Slows and sometimes eliminates the constant mind chatter many of us have.
    • Stirs active participation from the reader which is missing from television and motion pictures.
    • Improves memory.
    • Gives us access to the history of the universe that widens our perspective.

    Connie is a professional award-winning and bestselling novelist. Know When to Run was a #1 bestseller on the Amazon Financial Thriller list for over two weeks and remained on the top 100 list for several months. This wasn't her first bestseller, she has several to her name. Moreover, as a creative writing teacher she is committed to helping other writers reach their full potential. She wants to make sure that world is still there for them and feels the best way is to help them learn learn to market their books so they can support themselves.

    While this goal is certainly not on a par with eliminating world hunger or a hideous  rare disease, it is important. Besides, according to Connie, "Damn,I do love books." She bets you do too or you wouldn't have read this far.

      Risks & Challenges

      This objective—not the money but the bestseller list—has its challenges. KNOW WHEN TO RUN has done well, but it's a simple classic romantic suspense. While human values are explored, it's not a shockingly violent or highly sexual story. It's just well-written and solidly edited. The kind of book that seldom reaches the top of the New York Times list.

      That was the bad news. The good news is that it is the kind of book that has wide public acceptance leading to healthy sales and a following for sequels. Connie is developing a sequel right now, and plans for a third. This could get it to the top of some higher Amazon lists and even move it into USA Today, possibly Publisher's Weekly. That depends on how much buzz we can generate, but it helps that Connie . . .
      • . . . is a relentless tweeter. While her direct followers number just over 3000, she has a reach into hundreds of thousands of followers due to her active re-tweeting.
      • . . . has an enthusiastic campaign team that's eager to spread the word.
      • . . . constantly creates new ways to spice up thing, including a readiness to give you the finger.
      So, brave contributor, feel confident that a perk from Connie Flynn will at worst make you smile and that, well that, will simply make your life better.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you want to contribute, but can't, don't hide behind the canned peas if you run into Connie at the supermarket. She's not keeping score and won't be mad. You can help more than you think by simply using the Facebook or Twitter share buttons (or both, nothing wrong with both) and telling others about the campaign. If you aren't participating because your scruples won't let you, don't let it stop you from shopping on  Connie's website. You might see something you like.  For instance, you can find the Kindle version of KNOW WHEN TO RUN for only $2.99 and if you prefer paperback it's also available.

        And if you email Connie that you clicked 'liked' on her Facebook Author page and  followed her on Twitter, she'll send out a big thank you on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
The Kitten Calendar: How I Found My Inner Bettie Page (And So Much More)

In 2012, married to a lady, recently polyamorous, and utterly befuddled by men, I sent myself on a series of body adventures. My goal was to find confidence, but I found something so much deeper: life-altering healing and self-acceptance. I shed my inhibitions (and often my clothes) and went deep into the overlapping worlds of polyamory, BDSM, and nudism and discovered what it’s really like there—the characters, the struggles, the ecstasies and joys. Though I went looking for (and sometimes found) a magical land of liberated acceptance, I also wrestled with rape culture and eroding definitions of responsibility and consent. (And sometimes I won!)

In this time of Fifty Shades of Grey, I think it’s important to tell this sex-positive, empowering story of what it really means to transgress and transcend sexual boundaries, to experience the thrills of objectification while at the same time expressing and celebrating personhood.

Writer and activist Jaclyn Friedman said “The cure for sexualization is sex,” and as right and happy as that idea is, I think that the cure for sexualization is connection. By opening up and bringing my specific point of view to a mainstream audience, I would like to humanize and give voice to the submissive female, break down stereotypes, and form a real connection. The more we can all be perceived as individual and real, the better chance we have of truly liberating ourselves.

I blogged my adventures at kittencalendar.blogspot.com, but I need the time to comb through the content, convert it into book form, and find a publisher. That’s where you come in. I am asking for $6,000 to help cover four months’ living expenses so that I can devote myself to the book full time.

If this project seems like something you can get behind, please pass this link along and/or donate. I promise to do my darndest to make it worth your while.

story:
Our Story

Easter Seals Southwest Human Development is a nonprofit organization in Arizona dedicated to serving young children ages birth to 5 years old. One of the ways we do this is the distribution of more than 100,000 children's books through our 40 early childhood programs.

We distribute these books in low-income communities where there is only 1 book per 300 kids, compared to 13 books per child in middle and upper income neighborhoods! We know that by developing early literacy skills, we can ensure young children will be ready to succeed in school when they reach kindergarten.

Finding high-quality children's books at reasonable prices is a challenge, so we are going to publish our own book using the resources of a wide range of early childhood professionals. To find the right book to publish we are holding a manuscript contest. You can find contest details at the First Edition Children's Book Writing Contest website. We'll be selling this book in local and online book sellers, and for every book we sell, we will give one to a child in need, similar to the Tom's shoes model. We will distribute at least 2,000 of the books we publish to the children we serve. This social venture needs your help!  Since we are a nonprofit, this $10,000 campaign will help fund our initial costs of making the next great children's book a reality!

                

What We Need & Why

This is a social venture and we need your help to raise $10,000 in order to hire an illustrator, copy editor and layout expert for our book. As a nonprofit, we cannot spend money until we make money!

The Impact

By publishing our own book, we will be able to keep our costs low, engage with people who love literature and create a new revenue stream to fund early literacy initiatives in the future. But most importantly, we are going to be putting the books into the hands of children who live in low-income neighborhoods. 

So, how do we do it?

  • We distribute books through our Reach Out and Read program which is a partnership with pediatric clinics where a book is incorporated into the doctor's exam during each well child check-up. Plus, the child gets to keep the book to start his or her own home library!
  • We use books to support early literacy and language development through our Raising A Reader eight-week workshop series for young children and their parents at low-income apartment communities and community centers.
  • We WILL close the book gap between kids being raised in low-income neighborhoods and those in middle and upper income communities!

Are There Risks?

This is a social venture that incorporates a business approach, so yeah, there are risks. But we think there is a Dr. Seuss out there who just hasn’t been found yet! 

Why are we confident that we can make this happen?

  • We’ve got an amazing team of professionals to help us with the edit and layout process. 
  • Our selection committee includes many literacy experts and diverse experiences that will ensure that we find a great manuscript!
  • We’re not afraid to ask for help and - fortunately for us - our business community and entrepreneurs are eagerly stepping up to help!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us spread the word! Do you have a friend that likes to write? Maybe they’d like to submit a manuscript. Ask them to go to www.firsteditionproject.com for details. 
  • Like us on social media and share our Indiegogo campaign! You can find us by clicking here.

                                       Thank you so much for your support!
