Are There Risks?

This is a social venture that
incorporates a business approach, so yeah, there are risks. But we think there is a Dr. Seuss out there
who just hasn’t been found yet!  Why are we
confident that we can make this happen?

We’ve got an amazing team of professionals to help us with the edit and
     layout process.  

Our selection committee includes many literacy experts and
     diverse experiences that will ensure that we find a great manuscript!
We’re not afraid to ask for help and - fortunately for
     us - our business community and entrepreneurs are eagerly stepping up to help!

Other
Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people just
can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Help us spread the word! Do you have a friend that
     likes to write? Maybe they’d like
     to submit a manuscript. Ask them to
     go to www.firsteditionproject.com for details.  

Like us on social media and share our Indiegogo
     campaign! You can find us by clicking here.

                                       Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Welcome

My name is Dante Coats and I am on here to raise money to self publish my romance novel "Only If I".

Storyline...Kendrick Walker is a 21 year old African American dot com tycoon. Amanda Sheltmon is a 20 year old Caucasian in school for Interior Design. Kendrick proposes...Amanda accepts, but what happens when the world doesn't?

This book honestly has the potential to be an overnight success and I'm not just saying that because I wrote it. But the subject matter and my style of writing is an amazing blend. Email me CoatsDante@Gmail.com and I'll reply with a short story so you have a taste of my writing ability. I am very confident in what I do.

I'm just a regular guy working a 9-5 trying to make ends meet. The cost associated with self publishing and in order to market it the way I would like to is what brings me to this site.

If I had an investor I'd much rather go that route because I'm not too fond of panhandling it's against my male pride, that's why I set up the perks to make this like a little store so that your getting something in return for your money.

While your on here check out the gallery (above) I've got photos up tracking my progress of this campaign. I just wish I had books in my hand instead of flyers. Your help is what's going to get me there and I promise I won't forget about you.

Since the launch of this campaign a few days ago, here's what I've been doing....

Friday May 15, 2015...Ft. Lauderdale Beach, FL

Tourist always come to South Florida and run straight to South Beach but Ft. Lauderdale also has an awesome beach. The people were friendly and real receptive of what I was doing. Myself, along with a few friends went out there and passed out maybe 6-700 flyers. I had a chance to take pics with a few people, sign a few autographs and even discuss race issues with some folks. Everyone, Black, White, Hispanic, Old, Young, Teens, all agree that racism is ignorant! Ammmmazing.


Saturday May 16, 2015...Kissimmee, Florida

So...we're walking through the Flea Market on 192, I'm holding a huge cardbdoard sign with my book cover, while my friends are passing out flyers. It took us all of ten minutes to get the boot, lol,. No discouragement, we kindly told the lady we were gone, loaded up and went and hit the mall down the road. Honestly, I think we did a lot better in Ft. Lauderdale, I really need to learn more Spanish lol. Thanks Kissimmee you guys were beautiful.

   

Sunday May 17, 2015...Coconut Grove, Florida
(Miami)

Had a chance to actually step foot into The Book Store In The Grove (The venue for my book signing). I spoke with the owners and manager several times on the phone but this was my first time actually seeing the store. It was amazingly beautiful. There's an Improv right next door and a Mayfair Hotel & Spa. At the Book Store, they even have an outdoor section tha's covered by the parking garage so it's shadeful and just a very relaxing environment. I can't wait to see you guys there at my book signing!!


Other Progress

So...I called around to a few Barnes and Nobles, explaining that I was a local author that whole spiel, and I asked if I could drop off flyers maybe by the cash register. Some stores said no flyers but I can leave bookmarks. Some stores told me no flat out. The bookmarks will be in my hands Wednesday May 20, 2015 and in the Barnes and Nobles location in Ft. Lauderdale on Sunrise Blvd by the Sawgrass Mall (I think), and the one in Coral Springs on University Drive. Free of charge of course. Well that's all folks, I'll be updating this website very often so make sure you keep coming back and refer your friends. Thanks for stopping by.

story:
¿Quiénes somos? ¿Cuál es nuestra trayectoria?

La Milana Bonita es un programa radiofónico de fomento de la lectura en el que cada semana se analiza de manera monográfica un clásico de la literatura universal. El proyecto nació el 18 de abril de 2010 de la mano de un grupo de estudiantes de Periodismo de la Universidad de Valladolid (Víctor Gutiérrez, Samuel Regueira, Ignacio Pillonetto y Sergio Pascual). Programas después, se incorporaron al equipo Eduardo Martín y Eduardo R. Salgado. En la actualidad, La Milana Bonita es realizada por:

  • Víctor Gutiérrez Sanz, como presentador y coordinador.
  • Nacho Pillonetto, en la redacción.
  • Eduardo Martín, en la redacción.
Hemos ofrecido más de 120 programas, hemos cosechados más de 700.000 descargas en nuestro podcast, pero no nos es suficiente. Pensamos que ya ha llegado el momento de dar un paso más. Queremos crear la revista literaria de La Milana para seguir luchando por nuestro objetivo: quitar la caspa que han impuesto algunos a la literatura. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nuestro objetivo es conseguir hacer una primera tirada de 300 ejemplares. Seguimos siendo un proyecto sin ánimo de lucro, solo necesitamos el dinero justo para financiar el coste de cada revista. Estas tendrán un precio de 3 euros (gastos de envío no incluidos). Así pues:

  • 300 revistas x 3 euros = 900 euros.
  • Licencia InDesign durante 3 meses = 108 euros.
Y si decides colaborar, ¿qué obtienes? 
  • En primer lugar, da igual lo que aportes (10 céntimos o 100 euros) aparecerás en la contraportada como colaborador directo del proyecto. Es una tontería, pero te lo queremos agradecer. 
  • En segundo lugar, si pones más de 3 euros (dejamos que cada cual calcule los gastos de envío y los sume a estos tres eurillos) te mandaremos una revista a tu casa firmada por todos nosotros.
  • En tercer lugar, si decides dar más de 15 euros (además de todo lo anterior) te ofrecemos la posibilidad de seguir semana a semana el proceso de creación. Te informaremos de los avances y pediremos tu opinión en cada nueva decisión importante que tengamos que tomar. 

El impacto

¿Usted puede imaginar un mundo sin literatura? Seguramente, sí. ¿Le gustaría vivir en él? Piénselo. Si su respuesta es no, entonces entenderá por qué consideramos que esta revista es importante. Nuestra labor de fomento de la lectura lleva cinco años en marcha y hemos conseguido llegar a más de medio millón de personas. Pero no nos queremos anquilosar, queremos seguir creciendo para demostrar que la revolución no ha hecho más que comenzar. 

Riesgos y desafíos

Nuestro mayor desafío será mantener la periodicidad. Por supuesto, que nos comprometemos con este primer número para el que pedimos financiación; ahora bien, ¿cuánto más podremos estar dedicándonos a esto de manera voluntaria? Ahora mismo, los tres queremos dejarnos la piel, pero el tiempo dirá. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • Pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  • Colabora con textos para la revista.
¡Muchas gracias por su atención!

story:
About this project

“When they started getting letters from the governor’s office, former governors, prominent individuals, they realized that they had messed with the wrong black family.” -- Adam P. Kennedy, on the Arlington district attorney’s office after he was beaten by police

I’m Canaan Kennedy, 17 years old. I’ve written a book about racism in America and my family’s history of not only overcoming great adversity, but of cutting a path forward. I’m asking for your help with self-publication so that I can add my story—and my family’s story—to the canon of African American literature.

Who am I, and where am I going?

I’m the son of Adam P. Kennedy and Renee Kennedy. I am the grandson of Dr. Joseph Kennedy and Adrienne Kennedy. I’m also at a crossroads in my life, in the process of moving from teenager to man, in particular, a man of color in 21st century America. Having grown up mixed-race in an all-white community, I’m coming to grips with continued racism in this country and the events in Ferguson, Missouri and New York. Above all else, I’m understanding, appreciating, and integrating the power of my family’s history.

What happened to Michael Brown and Eric Garner are not isolated incidents. They’re all part of a long history of struggles, several steps forward for every step back, and I’m finding one thing of great importance: for every story of struggle, there are more of victory. My family is full of such stories. What challenges did we face? How did we successfully beat the odds? How did we prevail? Why can’t these positive stories trump the media stereotypes? What does it mean to be middle class, educated, and black in America?

These are all things I explore and present in my book, through interviews conducted with my family members and my own observations of how this has informed and will inform who I am. It’s my hope that these stories will serve a larger narrative of struggles leading to victory.

These are stories of victory - of my family

My father

Adam P. Kennedy

In January of 1991, just two months before Rodney King was captured on camera being attacked by Los Angeles police, my father was brutally beaten by a policeman in the driveway of my grandparents’ home in Arlington, Virginia. To make matters worse, my father was then charged with assaulting a police officer. Not only did he survive this attack; he was acquitted of all charges, won a civil suit against Arlington County, forced the Arlington County Police Department to stop using racially biased teaching manuals, co-wrote a play about the incident with my grandmother, and won the 1996 Obie Award for Best New American Play, Sleep Deprivation Chamber. That’s what I call victory! He’s also a television producer; his company R.A.V.E. created shows that have aired nationally on network television and PBS includingAfrica/USA: The Connection, The World Connection, and Phat Tracks. He’s also an historian and publisher.

My grandmother

Edward Albee, Adrienne Kennedy, and Sam Shepard

Adrienne Kennedy has been a force in American theatre since the early 1960s, influencing generations of playwrights with her hauntingly fragmentary lyrical dramas. She was a key figure of the Black Arts Movement of the 1960s and 1970s, which included (among others) Amiri Baraka, Nikki Giovanni, Lorraine Hansberry, and Maya Angelou. She is a three-time Obie-award winning playwright, including Funnyhouse of a Negro in 1964, June and Jean in Concertin 1996, and Sleep Deprivation Chamber in 1996. Among Kennedy's many honors are the American Academy of Arts and Letters Award, the Guggenheim Fellowship, and the 2003 Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Lifetime Achievement. She was nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize by the Theatre for a New Audience. Kennedy was also honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award at the 2008 Obies. She has been commissioned to write works for the Public Theater, Jerome Robbins, the Royal Court Theatre, the Mark Taper Forum, and Juilliard. In 1995-1996, the Signature Theatre Company dedicated its entire season to presenting her works. She became an honorary member of the Modern Language Association in 2005, and her work appears in the Norton Anthology of American Literature.

As a young girl she voraciously read books. Despite facing racism during her undergraduate years at The Ohio State University, she went on to experience not only her plays winning awards, but also being taught in universities all over the world. Kennedy has been a visiting professor at Yale University, Stanford University, the University of California at Berkeley, and she ended her teaching career at Harvard University. Kennedy received an honorary doctorate from The Ohio State University in 2003 in recognition of the 50th anniversary of her graduation.

My grandfather

Dr. Joseph Kennedy and Nelson Mandela

Dr. Joseph Kennedy was only the second black American to get a PhD in social psychology from Columbia University when he graduated in 1958. He was a professor of psychology at Hunter College of CUNY and Prairie View A&M College in Texas.

One of six children growing up in a mostly white Ohio community, his mother and father encouraged him to dream. Because of his parents’ teachings on Africa he developed a deep interest, traveling there with his own family in the early 1960s. He was the first black American to be Peace Corps Director for the East Asia and Pacific Region.

In 1971, he co-founded Africare, a leading non-governmental organization (NGO) committed to improving the quality of life of the people in Africa and strengthening relations between American blacks and Africans. His writings on Africa and African development have appeared in the New York Times Magazine and Washington Post. He has traveled to 100 countries.

About me

Canaan Kennedy

I’m a senior in high school in Virginia. In the past year I’ve produced a short movie and conducted a survey on racial relationships at my school. I’ve also conducted several interviews with my family about their work and views on the world, which is what you’re now helping bring to life in the form of this book. I’m interested in media journalism, which I hope to pursue in college. One of my role models is Fareed Zakaria. I’m also a member of the Model UN and Forensics Club at my school, I enjoy lectures on literature, and I’m an avid football fan.

Help us continue to make history

We need funds to:

  • hire an editor

  • hire a graphic designer

  • pay for publicity and marketing

  • handle travel costs

  • manage taxes and accounting

  • cover everything else needed to successfully publish this book

Any funds over and above our goal amount will go toward college expenses. I’m well on my way to realizing my dream of not only becoming a published author, but also an established journalist.


Please donate whatever you can, and please spread the word. I’d also like to hear your stories of struggle that led to victory: whenever and wherever you get the word out, use the hashtag #StrugglesToVictory. Thank you so much!

story:
This crowdsource campaign ended before our interview on The Buzzsaw by Sean Stone was put live on TheLip.TV, and YouTube.  Please instead see the new live Part 2 of the campaign here: Indiegogo campaign: Murder of Time, Part 2

Intro


My name is Matthew Pauly.  I am Canadian.  I earned a B.A. in Sociology and Computer Studies and have been working in my field successfully for 26 years until recently.  My parents were American.  I was baptized an Anglican, and raised a Unitarian.  I became a Buddhist (and thus Vegetarian) in 2010 after a near death experience involving this true story.  My father was a Cultural Anthropologist and Sociologist; I was taught to non-violently fight for equality, social justice and especially for the rights of North American Indians.  I have no criminal record. 

I have been married to a wonderful woman from China for the past thirteen years.  Our son is in university.  My wife reports that what our family has been through in the past ten years with all the shock, raw fear, and illness far eclipses what she experienced growing up in a top targeted family in The Peoples Republic of China during Mao's Cultural Revolution. 

I am a non-consensual, MKULTRA Monarch mind-control “sleeper assassin” test subject, and non-consensual chemical weapons tester.  I was chosen in part because the US Joint Task Force (JTF,) and Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) knew I had suffered severe Psychological Trauma as a child which means under torture I dissociate quicker than most.  To dissociate means the dominant personality goes to sleep to protect itself.  In 1940 it was announced in The Ottawa Citizen that the RCMP were partnering with the OSS (CIA precursor) in a project to develop "better assassins." 

Once dissociated, resisting hypnosis is very difficult, and dissociative amnesia starts immediately after the event so the victim is handicapped in gathering evidence like seeking medical attention or calling the police.  After the dissociation event they have 'missing time' for from months to years.  The anonymous handler is never fingered for the crime.  My first non-consensual training event was a 2005 JTF-->JTF2 (Joint Task Force Two is Canadian) training exercise titled “Joint-Control, Unified Command 2005” (JC UC ’05), with RCMP support. In that event my X-handler Mitch (JTF) asked about of my childhood.  I told him of some of the traumas.  He responded, “Yes, I know.  We look far and wide for people like you Matthew.”

They also stopped the JTF officer from taking me off to Pearson International Airport where he had a jet waiting to take me to Guantanamo Bay.  They knew I was no terrorist as all I had admitted was that I would defend my country if invaded.

Martial Art study to direct blood, and oxygen to my heart, still partly in a
trance.  After about twenty to thirty minutes, my
heart started to return to normal, and I narrowly survived the indirect hit from a medium-length, Nicotine liquid laden, heart attack gun. 6. 2014 Q3-2015 Q1 - Coerced into acting in a faked, hate, snuff filmSometime in about the last nine months, Mitch (JTF) produced a faked, hate, snuff film with myself as the actor; I do not yet remember details of the initial snatch-and-grab part.  No one died, but it looks like they did in
the video.  This was his trump card, his
way of having the Israeli Special Operations and Intelligence, Mossad murder
his whistleblower for him. Probably the 1940 agreement between the RCMP and the OSS (and thus its modern-day agreement) does not allow actual assassinations of Canadian test subjects, only tests of lethal weapons which might not be successful.  So Mitch (JTF) needed a fail-safe way to take out his whistleblowers.He unequivocal words after the film were “Good, now
you are dead!”  This suggests he may
have had experience manipulating the Mossad in this way before, and in so being
manipulated, the Mossad would have been prolonging the professional life of an actual
Nazi Jew hater/killer. Mitch gleaned Jew targets to satisfy his Nazi urges in his intended last contact with his whistleblower test subjects before a lethal weapons test. Then he deceived the Mossad into killing his whistle blower test subjects for him by leaking a faked, hate, snuff film so his career could continue. Its the most diabolical, devious plot I have ever witnessed or heard of. 
7. 15-07-13 - Break in from the Isreali Special Operations and Intelligence, Mossad
Since
trauma-dissociation causes amnesia, it was not until early July that I recalled
the Nazi-revealing events of the May home invasion.  I did three things:
    a. 
Visited the Israeli consulate in Toronto, but I was not let in due to
heightened security during the Pan-Am games according to John the security
guard
    b. 
Visited the Holy Blossom Temple, the oldest Jewish congregation in Toronto and
informed the president of these facts
    c.  July  11 I sent a private message to the Mossad on Facebook, telling them of
these facts. I also posted it on my timeline. (I removed it from Facebook on July 15, 2015 at the request of a
Mossad officer.)

On
July 13, 2015 my house was broken into at 3:40 AM.  An alarm went off and
a person mounted an electric scooter in front of my house and drove away. While
the police were present they got a call that an electric scooter driver was being
held. They quickly left to interview him.  Fifteen minutes after the police left, at 4:45
AM three riders of the same electric scooters drove by the front of my house on
Montgomery Avenue twice, during the same time period another electric scooter
driver was being interviewed.  According to Victor Ostrovsky’s book “By
Way of Deception: Making and Unmasking a Mossad Officer” the Mossad operate in
teams of four, like JTF2.
8. 15-07-15 - Mossad Visit: Hypnosis Interrogation, House Search, Death Threat A bald man with a large cranium, long limbs and wearing dark sunglasses walked back and forth in front of my house every few minutes for twenty minutes.  On the fifth time I said "Good Morning".  He said "Good Morning, I know" and continued walking West past my front yard. He soon returned and said to me from the sidewalk through my front yard bushes, “We know about Mitch, JTF, thanks for telling us.” 
“Are you Mossad?” I asked. “Yes,” he admitted exasperatedly. He explained “your Facebook post naming Mossad and Mitch is making things difficult.......” “OK, I’ll take it down,” I said. “That big post before it, the one sent to all the newspapers, you should take us out of it.” “But that’s history, the email is sent, I can’t change it,” I replied. “Well, since you cannot even word spell our full name correctly (Israeli Special Operations and Intelligence, Mossad), please change it just to just Israeli Intelligence Services on the Facebook post,” he argued. “OK,” I replied.
As he turned and started to walk west he stopped behind the biggest bush and said “Did Mitch ever mention anything about a snuff movie to you?” “No, he did not,” I said truthfully.A little bit later he approached from the west and stopped in front of the large bush, which mostly concealed his figure. “Alpha... Beta...? Are you in there?” he called in a carefully chosen voice that was very animated and sing-song. Within five seconds I responded, “Yes”. “Are you in trance?” he asked. “Yes,” I said. “Good, so which are you right now? Alpha or Beta?” he asked.“Alpha” I replied, slowly, and with a deep voice. Immediately there was the “zzzzzzzip” sound of metal being pulled out of tight clothing, a “shhhh, snap, click” as a magazine was inserted and a “click” as a safety was turned off. The backlit human figure shadow on the other side of the bush in that moment went from front-facing, to side facing with body arching slightly away from the perceived threat, and an orange-red dot danced among the leaves between us.“Beta, Beta, Beta, I am Beta, I am Beta” I said rapidly. “Why did you say Alpha then?” he demanded. “Its the first alter that popped up, you are on my property” I replied. “I am on the sidewalk,” he replied. “But you are behind a bush talking to me and, I don’t know you and cannot see you,” I replied. I was in Beta alter (passive, compliant,) answering his questions truthfully. “You’re sure you are Beta?” he asked. “Yes, yes, Beta, I am Beta” I assured him. “Well you just about got yourself killed,” he said with exasperation. After a few clicks, and metallic sounds, he then silently slid his weapon into his clothing. [Thank you 'Marcus'.]He took a few steps in on the private sidewalk. “Can I approach?” he asked. “Yes” I replied. He got to the stairs and stopped. “That is a big screwdriver you have there.” “Yes it is,” I said as I placed by hands palm up above the 24 inch slot screwdriver laying across my Muskoka chair to lessen my threat. “Could you put it down please?” he asked. “Yes” I replied, and I tossed it to my right side, which was necessary to roll-it out of reach to comply with the spirit of his request. The heavy screwdriver made a loud bang as it bounced on the porch, and then rolled away, which he seemed to fixate on. A more heavy set Mossad officer with side burns approached and stood beside him. The first officer turned to him and said, "He is in a trance.  He is Beta now.  He switches very fast, so be aware of that." The side-burned officer gave an aggressive look and exhibited hostile body language suggesting he was about to take action. The bald, intellectual officer turned to him and said "not now, he doesn't remember anything."  The first officer came up on the porch. "You will know me as Marcus," he announced. He said, "It would look more natural if I was sitting when talking with you.  May I sit?"  "Yes, sure sit down," I said.  I was interrogated about what I had
reported about Mitch (JTF) being a Nazi Jew hater/killer, and related
questions.  He again asked
if I knew about a snuff film, and I truthfully reported no.  I asked, "If you appreciate my help turning over Mitch then what was the electric bikes and break-in about the other night?"  He smiled and said "That was to scare you” and he added “We wanted to let you know we were coming.”  He said "That's pretty good what you are doing as whistleblower, with weaving in related issues."  "Thanks," I said.  "We can't kill you because we'd be killing a whistleblower," he said.  I wondered why they would want to kill me, I just turned over a Nazi to them, and saved my friends' lives.  I realized within twenty-four hours his words were deception, to give me a false sense of security, as is clear but what happened next.
After asking permission to come inside, we moved inside and the side-burned officer went upstairs and I heard him walk into our South bedroom closet (90 year old wood floors creak.) He photographed the alarm system panel, the location of which I had posted on Facebook when documenting Mitch (JTF) having photographed it in January.  Upon his return Marcus asked
"Did you get it?"  The side burned officer
replied "Yes, got it." The side-burned officer inspected the label on my
bulletproof vest no doubt to later lookup the specifications and thus the firepower needed to penetrate it.   We moved outside after a bit of more mundane discussion.  Marcus sat beside me on the porch again. "You know how in
your Facebook postings you talk about 'missing time?' "Yes," I
responded. He leaned in close on my left and continued “I have news for you Matthew... You
have missing time.” "No!!", I said in panic as I held my head in my hands.  The side-burned officer was squatting to my right said, “You did a hate
crime.”  He added, “God’s anger must be avenged.”  They prompted me
to start remembering and left.

Thirty-six hours
later I fled my house seeking a safer place (my wife was out of town helping relatives with a new
baby.)  I have since recalled and posted
all the salient details of the ‘video event’ including that the person did not
die, and that in addition to be Scopolamine dosed, tortured repeatedly,
hypnotized I still would not participate. 
Finally Mitch (JTF) pulled out a black handgun and pointed it at me saying, “You’ll do
it or you’re dead”.  My dissociated Alpha
alter did an act of violence while coerced at gunpoint. The target stopped breathing, and after appearing on camera with a white mask Mitch pulled out a mirror and held it over their open mouth angled to the camera to show there was no fog.  Then he ran off camera and the video must have ended there.  He returned promptly without the mask but holding a hand-held respirator retrieved from an open gym bag about six feet left of the camera, the kind you squeeze a polymer bottle and it forces air through a nose-mouth mask.  Mitch resuscitated them.  I saw him pull off the respirator and they lifted their head. 
I posted on
Facebook, and privately to the Mossad instructions for conducting forensics on
the audio track that will prove the video does not depict an authentic event, i.e. no loss of life.  The Mossad have refused to respond, so I am left with an outstanding death threat from the most feared
assassins on the planet.  Reader Cool Down AreaIf desired the reader can read of other events during the ten years of my non-consensual MKULTRA weapons testing in an earlier false-start crowdsource campaign at The Murder of Time, but its a similarly intense, heavy read.In handling such a traumatic life, two books I have treasured more than most are: 1. Victor Frankl’s “Man’s Search for Meaning" which has been a great source of strength, guiding my purpose. I made it my
meaning in life to make the world a better place.  2. Viradhammo Bhikkhu's "The Stillness of Being" (free online) has been a great inspiration, and peace restoring read, many times over.  It never ceases to calm me down.
Why Donate to this Book Project
Ann Diamond and I are so close to completion of this watershed book, which we hope will be a game changer. The
security expert last year strongly advised a ‘Safe house.’  A burglar alarm, and
cameras are only part of the solution.  We need a security presence (guards) for the remaining two months while the
book is being finished, if not a ‘Safe House.’ 

We need your support to safely complete this landmark humanitarian book.  Your contribution will
make a huge difference to ending significant human rights abuse, human trafficking, violations of Geneva Conventions, and the corruption of our
democracies.
• 
I ask you to donate
if you or anyone you know has been drugged, or raped, or
tortured, or coerced at gunpoint, or had their pet mortally injured by another
• 
I ask you to donate
if you wish to stop non-consensual human experimentation that has its roots in the Nazi Concentration Camps of WW II
• 
I ask you to donate
if you wish to stop the removal of our civil rights by politicians in response
to 'false flag' terror events orchestrated by anonymous security apparatus
controllers using mind-controlled, non-consensual sleeper assassins
• 
I ask you to donate
if you wish to stop Nazism embedded in the US security establishment from the
1000 Nazi scientists resettled in America in 1945 in the CIA's 'Project
Paperclip'

Your contribution will make a difference:
a) 
To my family's safety to enable completing the book,
and by extension
b) 
To the lives of non-consensual test subjects everywhere
c) 
To innocents being queued as termination targets for MKULTRA tests (like me probably)
d) 
To democracies around the world"We live in an era where more and more people are stepping up to blow the whistle on illegal and suppressed information. Information they believe is in everyone’s interests to be made public. Unfortunately, despite the assurances of protection to whistleblowers from world leaders, we actually see the opposite—the suppression and persecution of such people." – Duncan Roads, Nexus MagazineIn summary, you will be helping stop human suffering, effectively human trafficking, and help reclaim our democracies now so abused by manufactured terror events.
Your Privacy
Indiegogo will not
share your name with me, or anyone if you do the following:- On panel 1 of the 3 simple donation panels, checkmark the box labelled 'Hide my name on the campaign page'- On panel 3, select the option 'Credited to another name:' and enter Anonymous in the text box, or whatever you preferIf you wish to select a Perk, then do not do the above.The
site uses HTTPS (S=Secure Sockets Layer), and as a computer professional I assure
you that its adequately secure.  Indiegogo is a professional online business that adequately secures their crowdsourcing site as it is the mission-critical core of their business.Other Ways You Can HelpPlease share this crowdsource campaign with others.  Please like my postings at the Facebook profile http://facebook.com/matthew.pauley99   Please buy the book when it comes out.  Please check back on this page as I will add a link to an online petition to demand a halt to non-consensual human experimentation.  Thank you for reading this long appeal.
Here is a powerful three-minute video that is guaranteed to touch and move you.

story:
Me and The Project

My name is Sigal Sharon and I was born in a Kibbutz in Israel. I am married and have 5 children , 4 boys and a girl.

For the last 19 years I worked in the medical devices field, with my husband Dr. Akiva Sharon - a physician and an inventor, and helped to materialize his ideas.  3 years ago Akiva suffered a medical event and had to step aside from running the business. I carried on the activity myself until recently.

Now that this time has come, I can go forward with my projects.

 Cetem (Splotch in Hebrew, and also Gold) was written 17 years ago when my 4th kid was born.

The story and illustrations are introduced in the video.

 Now we are in Publishing stage:  Printed and E-book

My Publishing House is Contento, partners for the book journey,  high quality people. The name of their production manager is Nati :)

I have the privilege and joy to collaborate with an excelent editor, who is also my dear childhood friend, Ms. Lilach Ron. She is not cutting me any slacks, in case you were wondering...  it's a great challange - and pleasure.

My talented and amazing doughter Shani, traveling in India now,  sent her Cover Illustration - first draft ; she agreed that I will publish and follow how the illustration is created. Here it is!


An Interactive digital book project is on the go, in paralell (not part of this funding campaign). Progress will be updated.


The Impact of the Story

  1. Pursue and explore your dreams, wherever they take you - the story is about a journey of a splotch who dared to step out of his destiny as set by the painter for an unknown one. Along the way he meets  Nati the Black Panther who dreams to be splotched, and Motek, who wanted to be a frame, and later to become a cloud... 
  2. The power of collaboration and sharing 
  3. Self-acceptance  - believe in yourself, whatever color or form you are...
  4. What to do with the bad guys? Punish? lock away? How can they reform?
  5. Implicit impact:  dealing with colors, forms and dimensions 


SO, help me to publish the book! 

 At this phase, the Hebrew version - this is my goal by the present CrowdFunding project. And the English version following; already translated. 


What We Need & What You Get


The money raised will finance:
* Final version editing
* Publishing of 150 full color printed books, primarily for marketing puposes 
* E-book
* Artist's set first batch, t includes picture frame, brushes, colors and palette; and of course the book. The Artist's set is to be channeled to gift and toy stores, 
* And, it will cover my perks shipments to the contributors- you:).
The perks : 
E-book with personal dedication,  hardcover book,  Artist's set with hardcover book; T shirt with a picture from Cetem; a full package with all items.

Risks & Challenges

I have already paid first installment to the publishing house. In case I will not be able to reach my funding  goal, I can adjust the process according to the available funds. 

But I plan to reach my goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everybody can contribute, but I will appreciate if you could spread the word about this campaign!

Or, if you are intersted in investing in the larger project (or knows somebody), that will be great!

You are welcome to use Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Greetings Good People!

   My name is George Lee Jr. I am a writer, poet, visual artist and spoken-word performer. I am in the midst of launching my 2nd self-published book entitled, "Lov(H)er". This is a book made up of "letters" addressed to my fellow men suggesting various ways in which to love our women more effectively. This project is very close to my heart as the concept of love within an intimate relationship is something I've always been very passionate about.  

   Some of the "letters" included in this book deal with areas such as Compromise, Communication, Foreplay, Honesty and Faithfulness. These are areas that I feel are crucial in building a functional, loving and effective intimate relationship. I was fortunate to have a living example in the form of my dad who was nothing but loving to my mother. I do realize that they are a lot of men who were not as blessed with a front row seat to a healthy display of love from a man to woman as a child. For that reason, I felt that it was my responsibility to communicate what I witnessed between my parents to my fellow men.        

   Assisting with the funding of this book will first and foremost allow me to get it in front of a wider audience. Most importantly, the audience who needs to read it. This will be done by way of book signings as I will be able to have product on hand to sell as well as to conduct forums, workshops and panel discussions that would circulate around the subject matter of "Lov(H)er".  

   In attempting to obtain assistance, I came up with $3000 as enough funding to jumpstart my movement. This would initially go towards printing copies of my book to have on hand. That will then enable me to schedule book signings with also enough funding (if needed) to book a space. Funding would also assist in promo materials such as business cards, videos, posters as well as banners which would be utilized during books signings. With this assistance, I would also be able to launch a website and purchase an ISBN number that would enable me to place my books in stores as well.

   Even during this time, feel free to place a presale order by way of my Facebook page, "Author George Lee Jr." If you are not able to contribute or place a presale order, you can simply support by either sharing this campaign of mine's or by getting the word out! Please check out my perks as well as any amount contributed will be greatly appreciated!

   Thank you for your time as I implore you to share this post whenever and wherever possible. Thank you!

Love and Light,

George Lee Jr.

story:
This book is the result of a very personal journey which started almost forty years ago at school when I was constantly called "stupid" by the teachers for being slow, struggling to read, keeping up with lessons and often falling asleep in class – now recognised as symptoms of dyslexia.  Of course dyslexia had no meaning in the 1970s and the "solution" was some form of physical punishment to somehow jolt "intelligence" into me! Thankfully society has moved on...

As the title suggests it’s an insight, a tour of my home city of Newcastle upon Tyne and its changing face over the years.

Although I failed in most subjects, somehow I still managed to excel in a local history project as a part of my final exams. Struggling for an idea I found a colour photograph taken in 1929 by my father of the North East Coast Exhibition for which I did not really know anything about, but this was the inspiration that quickly built up into a project comprising of 20 stories of events and significant buildings within the City of Newcastle. I divided it into two sections; before 1900 and afterwards, up to what was the present day of 1977, hence the original title of the book; "Newcastle Old and New", concluding with a "vision of the future" - quite ambitious for a 16 year old lad?

An unexpected pass mark was achieved which, not only shone against a bleak background but, I left school with something to be proud of. However for the next 35 years of dead end jobs, five redundancies and then going on to build two businesses, "The Book" laid buried like a time capsule until one day my wife Alison came across it.  Intrigued, she read it cover to cover with ease and loved it!  Soon after I was convinced by an ex-journalist friend to help me refresh it and put into print as he felt that, not only would it uncover many hidden stories but had the potential to appeal to others. Now three years on this ambition is almost complete.

If you want to hear a very personal insight to the journey so far check out Mike's story behind the book here 

Please help me get this life changing project launched by purchasing one of the perks I have on offer or by simply sharing it with anyone you know!

Your investment in this project will help me achieve two distinct aims

Firstly, I want to stand proud on the stage at the book launch and show to the world that I am not as stupid as I was told so many times all those years ago by my teachers - I may be dyslexic but I have a life and a book to be proud of!

Secondly, in my research for rewriting the 1929 North East Coast Exhibition chapter, I discovered that for every millionth visitor a gold watch was given, so there are at least four gold watches out there buried out of sight.  Wouldn’t it be great to track down the stories behind those watches? 

Incidentally as I write, I hear that the last remaining building is to be converted into a pub! This campaign will help keep those memories alive.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your time and interest in my campaign. I suspect that if you are reading this then you too have a dream - I think John Lennon’s infamous line sums it up…

“You may say I’m a dreamer, but I am not the only one,

I hope someday you’ll join us and the world will be a better one”


(Psst.. a sneak preview of the stunning front cover image)

Please note image supplied under copyright for use in promotion of the book

then you too have a dream - I think John Lennon’s infamous line sums it up…
“You may say I’m a dreamer, but I am not the
only one,I hope someday you’ll join us and the world
will be a better one”(Psst.. a sneak preview of the stunning front cover image)
Please note image supplied under copyright for use in promotion of the book

story:
Short Summary

Great Hymns of the Faith, Part III is a celebration of traditional hymnody put on by two great musicians, Mr. Winston Bailey and Dr. George Roberts.

All of the money raised from you donations to this event will go to HISTORIC CHURCHES FUND INC., a charity established to assist the renovation efforts of the St. John's Cathedral and Ebenezer Methodist Chapel; both of which have been declared Historic Structures by the Government of Antigua and Barbuda.

Please visit our website http://historicchurchesfund.com for more information on this cause.

What We Need & What You Get:

We are not appealing only on a religious basis, we are reaching out to people who are in love with architecture.  If you are interested in European and Colonial architecture, you will be enthralled by these two beautiful edifices. 
We need to raise US$ 200,000  to assist these two magnificent edifices that are desperately in need of money to complete their restoration and we reaching out yo you and your community for help.
You will have live access to the event, which will be streamed live via radio, with a delayed television broadcast.  Please tune in on Sunday 3rd May from 7:00-9:00pm.
  • ABS Radio: http://abstvradio.com/live-streaming/
  • Observer Radio: http://station.voscast.com/51891877d60b6
  • ABS Television: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/abs-television

The Impact

The St. John's Cathedral and the Ebenezer Methodist Chapels are at the core of Antigua & Barbuda's history.  These two superb edifices represent an era of change within our island's landscape.

The Ebenezer Methodist Chapel is the first Methodist Chapel built outside of England and represents the beginning of Methodism outside of the Caribbean.

These two congregations have molded some of the greatest minds on the island, in the Caribbean and across the world; they are filled with such rich history that our Gov't sought to declare them both historical structures. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially, you can assist by sharing this cause with your network and help us raise awareness and funding.

story:
SchwarzRund - die Autorin
Ich schreibe schon mein Leben lang, seit einem Jahr blogge
ich nun auf SchwarzRund zu Mehrfachdiskriminierung und Eis-Essen. Meine Novelle Quasi kam vor einigen Monaten raus und zwar eigenständig publiziert!

Ich liebe es, zu bloggen und Projekte so autark wie irgend möglich umzusetzen, weil ich so Geschichten erzählen kann, die auch 1:1 beim Lesenden ankommen. Jetzt schreibe ich einen Roman und genau darum geht es in dieser Kampagne.


Worum geht es bei Schwarzer Frost?

Es geht um Tue, eine Schwarze Berlinerin, dreißig, die zwischen Bandalltag und Neurodiversität ihr Leben aufgebaut hat. Tue's Erziehungspersonen sind beide weiß und eine der großen Fragen, die im Roman verhandelt werden ist:

Wie sieht eine Schwarze Identität eigentlich aus wenn es keinen Länderbezug gibt?

Außerdem geht es um Räume und wie diese sich anfühlen aus verschiedenen Positionierungen, Hairpolitics, Queerness, Gehirnmasse, die über Bagels läuft und Utopien.

Romane und Romanstrukturen schreibe ich schon seitdem ich schreiben kann, jetzt bin ich an dem Punkt, damit in die Welt zu wollen.

Jetzt ist es soweit:

Schwarzer Frost ist in Kapitel und Szenen aufgeteilt, die Geschichte will ausformuliert und geschrieben werden. Bisher ist Schwarzer Frost nur der Arbeitstitel.

Damit ich das umsetzen kann, brauche ich eure Unterstützung - denn zum Schreiben benötige ich ungefähr drei Monate, in denen ich mich ganz auf Tue und ihre Geschichte einlassen kann.
Außerdem muss der Druck der ersten Auflage finanziert werden, eine Rechtschreibkorrektur, die ich fair entlohnen will und Technik, die ich für die Hörbuchaufnahmen, Layout und den Schreibprozess brauche.


Was ist das Ziel dieser Kampagne?
Ganz klar: Schwarzer Frost zu verwirklichen und die erste Auflage zu drucken!  Dafür brauche ich Ressourcen, die ich nicht selber decken kann. Die Alternative wäre das Projekt großen Verlagen anzubieten, die dann durch Lektorat und Korrektur den Roman verflachen würden, um ihn kommerziell interessanter zu machen für den großen Buchmarkt. Meine Novelle Quasi wurde nur durch die Tatsache, dass ich ihn aus der eigenen Tasche finanziert habe und Freunde unbezahlt die Korrektur übernommen haben, zu dem was sie ist: eine queere Novelle, eine Geschichte, wie es sie leider zu selten zu lesen gibt.

Was ist das Besondere an Schwarzer Frost?
Auf dem deutschen Buchmarkt gibt es sehr sehr wenige afropolitane Bücher, queere afropolitane Bücher sind letztendlich nicht zu finden. Ich möchte Bücher lesen, die nicht nur die Lindenstraßen-Realität wiedergeben, sondern eine diverse Sicht auf das Leben in der Stadt darstellen. Schwarzer Frost erzählt genau so eine Geschichte, berichtet von Personen und Konflikten, die sonst in den Medien und Büchern der heutigen Zeit marginalisiert werden.

Wann wird Schwarzer Frost erscheinen?
Meine Zeitplanung für die Ausformulierung und Ausgestaltung von Tue's Geschichte sieht drei Monate vor. Im Anschluss benötige ich noch weitere Monate zur Nachbearbeitung, für das Layout und den Druck. Schwarzer Frost wird Anfang  2016  in Print erscheinen, das Hörbuch einige Zeit später.



Supportet Schwarzer Frost – eine literarische Intervention auf dem  Buchmarkt - eine Geschichte, die ihr garantiert nicht mal eben so im TV sehen werdet!
Teilt das Projekt, erzählt allen Menschen davon und nutzt eure Mailinglisten!

Falls die Bezahloptionen hier für euch nicht greifen :

Kontoinhaberin: SchwarzRund
IBAN: DE42430609671178975601 und BIC: GENODEM1GLS
Im Betreff dann bitte euren Namen und das Paket, das ihr gerne haben mögt. Via Mail an schwarzrund@posteo.de dann bitte eure Adresse!

story:
Born at the end of 2013, Fotomeraki is a project that aims to present and promote the best from Colombian photography. 

____________________________________________

Fotomeraki es un proyecto independiente que nace a finales del 2013 y busca promover y exhibir lo mejor de la fotografía en Colombia.


In Colombia, there are very few places for local photographers to stand out. Thus, Fotomeraki was born; it is the reason for its existence. 

Our purpose, besides exposing different work about a variety of topics, is to encourage discussions and reflections about the photographic image and the different creative processes that occur nowadays, in and outside of the country. We want to encourage new generations of photographers to create work with a worldwide impact. 

This is a very important stage for Colombian photography; therfore, we want to show the people the aesthetics and the conceptual framework Colombian photographers have these days. On this occasion the female point of view is this book's topic.

______________________________________

Tenemos el firme propósito que esta plataforma  además de exponer distintos proyectos con una amplia variedad de temas, fomente el estudio, la reflexión y el dialogo sobre la imagen fotográfica y los diferentes procesos de creación que se están llevando a cabo actualmente dentro y fuera del país. 

En Colombia han sido pocos los espacios que se han dedicado exclusivamente a resaltar el trabajo y el talento fotográfico nacional. Es por esto que Fotomeraki nace como una necesidad para hacer difusión de lo que esta pasando actualmente con la fotografía en el país.

La fotografía en Colombia esta pasando por un momento importante y es por esto que queremos dar a conocer la línea estética y conceptual que manejan los diferentes fotógrafos colombianos actualmente, en especial con este libro, la potente mirada femenina que existe en el país; para dar a conocer sus metodologías de trabajo y por medio de este proceso, inspirar a las nuevas generaciones de fotógrafos a crear proyectos que impacten al mundo.

-Fotografías por Melissa Cartagena durante el lanzamiento de nuestro primer libro-

The book " Colombian Female Photographers" will be our first book promoting the work of the female photographers living inside and outside Colombia. We want it to be positioned as the first research reference for this topic and we would like Fotomeraki to establish as the first research site for Colombian photography in general.  

The money we raise with this crowd funding will be used for the different processes involved in the making of this book (design, printing and distribution) and also for the release gala (which we want to be even better than the one from the opening book " Fotomeraki Vol. 1/ Colombian Contemporary Photography").

_________________________________________

El libro Fotógrafas Colombianas, será nuestro primer libro dedicado a exhibir y promover el trabajo que están realizando las fotógrafas colombianas a nivel nacional e internacional; y así, por medio de esta y nuestras diferentes publicaciones impresas, convertirnos en el referente principal a la hora de pensar en la fotografía en Colombia.

Fotomeraki es el primer proyecto en Colombia que busca darle mayor divulgación y eco a el trabajo de los fotógrafos contemporáneos en el país a nivel nacional e internacional; por eso, por medio de este primer libro de Fotógrafas Colombianas, estamos abriéndole una ventana a estos talentos que no muchas veces tienen la oportunidad de ser conocidos.

Todo el dinero recaudado será utilizado para realizar la producción del libro. Será destinado para el diseño del libro, impresión y distribución, ademas del evento del lanzamiento, que aspiramos sea aun mejor que el lanzamiento de nuestro primer Libro Fotomeraki Vol. 1 / Fotografía Contemporánea en Colombia".

Your collaboration will help this book happen. You will be able to get not only our books but also different products that are offered in our site such as printings and tote bags. You also will be able to be mentioned in the book as a sponsor of the project.

If we do not reach our goal, we will make this book anyway, trying to get help from other sponsors, foundations and private companies.

___________________________________________

Gracias a tu colaboración podrás recibir varios de nuestros incentivos como nuestra Tote Bag, el libro de Fotógrafas Colombianas, nuestra primera publicación impresa Fotomeraki Vol. 1 / Fotografía contemporánea en Colombia, impresos de nuestra tienda en línea y crédito de agradecimiento en el libro.

En caso de no recibir todos los fondos necesarios para la producción de igual manera se realizará el libro, buscando patrocinadores y apoyo de empresas privadas y fundaciones.

Queremos seguir enriqueciendo la memoria visual de Colombia, por eso es vital para Fotomeraki crear este tipo de publicaciones impresas para que sean conocidas en Colombia y el mundo.

Por medio del blog de Fotomeraki ya estamos mostrando al mundo las creaciones fotográficas de los colombianos y ahora llego el momento de crear memoria de estos increíbles proyectos. En junio de este año realizamos el lanzamiento de nuestro primer libro Fotomeraki Vol. 1 / Fotografía contemporánea en Colombia, con el empezamos este camino de crear memoria de los grandes trabajos que se están desarrollando en el país.

Thanks for reading and giving us the opportunity to introduce us to you. If you can not contribute to the crowd funding you can still spread the word sharing this campaign to your friends.

_______________________________________________

Muchas gracias por su atención y recuerden que si no pueden colaborarnos económicamente siempre pueden compartir con sus amigos esta campaña y comprar nuestras publicaciones impresas.

story:
I'm looking for a group of people who want to be a part of this community, a concept called THE TENTACLE ROOM. If you are interested in art, reading a good story, and enjoy artistic discourse,  I invite you to learn about the twists and turns in my life as an artist and the evolution of my artwork. I hope you will join me on this adventure!

A labor of love, I have been working on this manuscript for ten years. The money raised will be used to hire the professional people needed to complete the book, pay my editor, book designer, and for the cost of printing and production. I have offered some perks to get you involved, because without your help, I may not be able to realize this dream.

Additionally, I'm asking you to tell your friends about this project through email as well as your social media sources. I thank you in advance for being here and for helping to support me and my project, CAPTAIN SQUID & THE TENTACLE ROOM.

The money raised will be used to hire the professional people needed to complete the book, pay my editor, book designer, and for the cost of printing and production. Additionally, I'm asking you to tell your friends about this project through email as well as your social media sources. I thank you in advance for being here and for helping to support me and my project, CAPTAIN SQUID & THE TENTACLE ROOM.

story:
Historia corta

 

Saludos mi nombre es Jordan Díaz y soy el hijo de Carmen Vicenty Gómez. Carmen es una mujer trabajadora que luchó toda su vida por criar a mis hermanas Brenda Díaz Vicenty, Lorna Díaz Vicenty y a mi. No fue una vida fácil y en un momento se quedó sola con mi hermana menor y yo.

Después del divorcio, ella calló en una pequeña depresión pero aun así logró salir de ella y seguir hacia adelante.

Desafortunadamente en el 2001 sufré un fallo renal por lo que la lleva a coger diálisis. Desde el 2001 hasta el sol de hoy sigue cogiendo diálisis. Durante todos estos años se le hicieron varios procedimientos para dializarla a través de "Fistulas". Tristemente las "Fistulas" tienden a deteriorarse y se dañan. Ya a Carmen no le quedan más venas y lugares para realizarle una "Fistula" nueva. Esto nos lleva a buscar el trasplante de riñón.  

Qué necesitamos?

 Afortunadamente los planes de la Reforma y Medicare  le cubren todo el procedimiento del trasplante.  Aun así hay unos gastos post operatorios que necesitan ser cubiertos. El hospital le exige al paciente que pueda presentar pruebas de que puede suplir esos gastos post operatorios ya que si el paciente vive lejos del hospital (como es el caso de Carmen que vive en Mayagüez y el hospital es en San Juan) debe poder probar que tiene el dinero para los gastos que son por un minimo de 3 meses o hasta que el Dr. determine que puede ir menos tiempo a los chequeos. A principio de trasplante los chequeos son 3 veces por semana en el hospital Auxilio Mutuo.
Los gastos son para:
- Gasolina
- Peaje
- Hospedaje
- Medicinas
  

Riegos y Obstáculos

 El obstáculo  que tenemos ahora mismo es el dinero ya que es una cantidad sustancial para poder cubrir varios meses de citas y medicinas y el riesgo es que de no poder probar que podemos cubrir los gastos post operatorio ella puede ser que no sea elegible para el transplante.

Durante todos estos años se le hicieron varios procedimientos para dializarla a través de "Fistulas". Tristemente las "Fistulas" tienden a deteriorarse y se dañan. Ya a Carmen no le quedan más venas y lugares para realizarle una "Fistula" nueva. Esto nos lleva a buscar el trasplante de riñón.     Qué necesitamos? Afortunadamente los planes de la Reforma y Medicare  le cubren todo el procedimiento del trasplante.  Aun así hay unos gastos post operatorios que necesitan ser cubiertos. El hospital le exige al paciente que pueda presentar pruebas de que puede suplir esos gastos post operatorios ya que si el paciente vive lejos del hospital (como es el caso de Carmen que vive en Mayagüez y el hospital es en San Juan) debe poder probar que tiene el dinero para los gastos que son por un minimo de 3 meses o hasta que el Dr. determine que puede ir menos tiempo a los chequeos. A principio de trasplante los chequeos son 3 veces por semana en el hospital Auxilio Mutuo.Los gastos son para:- Gasolina- Peaje- Hospedaje- Medicinas      Riegos y Obstáculos  El obstáculo  que tenemos ahora mismo es el dinero ya que es una cantidad sustancial para poder cubrir varios meses de citas y medicinas y el riesgo es que de no poder probar que podemos cubrir los gastos post operatorio ella puede ser que no sea elegible para el transplante.

story:
UPDATE: 9/23/16: Due to funding limitations, we've proceeded with the novelization of 'Final Countdown' on an episode-by-episode basis and THE FIRST EPISODE IS NOW COMPLETE!!! The first episode ('The Trigger'), is available on Amazon (for Kindle readers) @ https://www.amazon.com/Final-Countdown-Episode-Trigger-ebook/dp/B01C4G8RGG

The first episode of 'Final Countdown' can also be read for free in a non-downloadable version on Scribd at https://www.scribd.com/document/324398852/Dark-Fiction-Comedy-Novel-about-the-New-America-FINAL-COUNTDOWN-Episode-1-The-Trigger

Thanks to all supporters as this unique and deadpan dark comedy novel winds its way along to its audience...!

UPDATE: 10/27/15: The Project Continues - A sample section of part 1 of 'Final Countdown' is now online (See / Hear Audio Book Below, Chapters 1-3)...if you like what you hear, please do spread the word and stay in touch on our website and Facebook page, or email camerado@camerado.com :)

 

UPDATE 10/6/15: Though our standard campaign here is just about wrapped, we've completed the first 15,000 words of 'Final Countdown' already - thanks to supporters who helped us make it to this first critical milestone!  You'll get copies of the eBook and any other perks as we continue to make progress. 

As mentioned below in our contingency section, we'll be making 'Final Countdown' available in a serialized format on Amazon, Smashwords, iBooks and other platforms as we complete each section, with a combined 'special version' and print edition available later.

*** Get Ongoing Information about the Project at the 'Final Countdown Book and Movie Page on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/FINALCOUNTDOWNUSA *** 

 

 

 

  

 

My name is Jason Rosette, I'm a writer-director and filmmaker with an established track record across a range of genres and media. My previous titles include the feature documentary 'BookWars' (TERRIFIC - LA Times), the multicultural road movie, 'Lost in New Mexico' (GREAT ROAD PIC - 'Angelika Entertainment, NYC), the supernatural Vietnam war themed drama 'Freedom Deal: Story of Lucky', and numerous other commissioned, independent and short form movies.

Today, I would like to ask for your support for a new project - the novelization of an original screenplay, 'FINAL COUNTDOWN',  into an ebook, as a first step in the process of developing the resulting content into feature and episodic movie version.

In a nutshell: this project aims to make a compelling and marketable ebook out of the completed screenplay for our upcoming movie project 'FINAL COUNTDOWN: The Tale of Pat and Lloyd', which will then also be used in the process of producing of the movie. 

If you have any questions regarding this project or fundraiser, feel free to drop me a line directly by email and I'll be happy to answer any questions you may have!

 

TAKE A  LOOK ->  Read a few sample pages of the original screenplay HERE, to get a sense of the style and tone, and a taste of the story and premise. The novelization will be based upon the screenplay as a story-framework, but will include added characterization and dimension that a novel format can offer.

 

Keep in mind, with this fundraiser you'll actually be assisting with two projects for ONLY ONE contribution: the novel based on the screenplay, PLUS the development of the actual movie itself!  

So, thanks in advance for your support - kindly click below to make a contribution of any level you like.

 

JOIN US in Making this Project Happen!

 

Our goal in this stage of production is to share this entertaining, offbeat and unique tale with readers around the globe in the near term, as a standalone eBook, since this is comparably a much quicker process than the development, financing, and production of a motion picture. We'll still continue to develop the movie version in the longer term, however - but writing an eBook from this hilarious and fabulous tale and publishing it as a book in its own right is a vital and useful step in that direction.

 

 

SUPPORT & Contribute - CLICK HERE to Be Join this One-of-a-Kind Project!

 

 

PROJECT BACKGROUND

I completed the screenplay and it's been long since registered with the WGA. The next step in getting this fabulous and unique story out to a global audience is to adapt it into an eBook - with your help - while continuing to develop it as a feature film.

 

CLICK HERE to Make a Contribution 

WHAT YOU GET

This is where YOU come in: you can be a crucial part of making this happen, and you'll be credited online and in print accordingly, besides receiving any special gifts and perks.

Instead of just pushing the script around in the normal (often long and drudgerous) development process, YOU can help bring this story to life in a more, immediate and fulfilling way - i.e., turn it into a standalone novel.

 

 

The movie version will still be developed - and the novelization, with your help will actually boost that process as well!

UPDATE 9/15/15: Supporters who contribute $50 or more will also get a digital fine art photo or DVD/VOD of one of our previous movies! See photo gallery @ http://fineartamerica.com/profiles/jason-rosette.html?tab=artwork and IMDB with list of movie titles @ http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0742891/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1... your choice (in addition to regular perks listed below)

COSTS

The costs for this stage involving the novelization process* (*adaptation from screenplay to an electronic novel format) are very targeted, efficient, and manageable.

A writer for this project with existing screenplay-to-novel credits, Mr. William Grabowski, has already been contracted and secured for this Stage of the project. He has agreed to work well below his normal scale on this project, as seen in the breakdown below:

 

  • Writer - $1800+ (*Depending on Bonus and Surplus Funds)
  • Editor/Proofreader - $750 (allow)
  • Administrative Costs (lump sum including any phone, internet, or miscellaneous costs) - $200 (allow)
  • Story Creator and Screenplay Writing - Deferred
  • eBook formatting (*text only) - $250
  • Marketing Costs - $500 (allow)
  • ATM, Indigogo and Other Fees - $250
About Mr. William J Grabowski (writer/novelist secured and contracted for the novelization of 'Final Countdown')

 

Writer/editor William Grabowski is the author of 7 books (ghost-writer of many more) and over 300 short stories, articles, interviews, and reviews. Grabowski published interviews with Ray Bradbury, Peter Straub, Robert Bloch, Clive Barker, Poppy Z. Brite, Dennis Etchison, John Skipp and Craig Spector, Dean R. Koontz, Bentley Little, Joe R. Lansdale, Robert R. McCammon, and Grabowski's friend and mentor, J.N. Williamson, as well as many others. 

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T REACH THE FULL GOAL?

 

This is a good question! - this does happen even with the best run campaigns and the most noteworthy projects.  

 

Our contingency plan is as follows, in the event we don't reach the complete goal. First, we'll slash anything absolutely immediately expendable - for instance, the marketing and PR component is highly desirable for a coordinated released of the completed book, but the actual writing of the text of the book is the highest priority. 

So, funds generated will go first to the writer.  In the event we don't reach the full writer's fee at once, we'll apply whatever funding is generated from this campaign through the flexible funding mechanism (*we will receive whatever funds are generated, even if we don't reach the total goal) towards segments of the novel.

That is, the book would be produced in a stage-by-stage, serialized way, per available funding and then unified later into the intended 'single' book.

As a final baseline approach, out of pocket funding would kick in, and the writing of the project would simply take place over a longer span of time - but would still be completed. That is, instead of having the entire writer's fee available all at once, the writing would occur in segments, supported through funds generated through sales of other media content that Camerado Media has coming in per monthly and quarterly royalties, and sales from previous projects.

 

But contributors will still receive their Perks and 'Thank You' gifts no matter what happens! You'll still get your copy of the eBook, for instance, if you've made a contribution on that level, or your Audio Book, Postcard from the Story creator, etc even if we don't meet the total goal.  

*You may choose opt to wait until the complete novelization is written, or to receive each segment of a serialized version as it is completed...up to you, and you can drop us an email with any questions.

 

CLICK HERE to Make a Contribution!

 

IN CLOSING

Thanks for your support of the novelization of the original screenplay, 'FINAL COUNTDOWN', a unique, edgy, original, and hilarious darkly comedic tale the American Southwest.

For a relatively very minor contribution (*compare the $ 3K budget for novelization with a hundred to a thousand times that amount or more to execute and deliver the movie version) you all can help breathe life into this fabulous and unique tale, while receiving some great gifts and perks along the way!

All the Best,

Jason 'Camerado' Rosette

story:
“‘Magic’ is the operative word for this moody novella. The magic of Harry Houdini serves as an overriding backdrop here, but another kind of magic permeates these pages—the magic of fine writing. ... Read THE BOX JUMPER and share the magic.”
— William F. Nolan, author of Logan’s Run and screenwriter of Burnt Offerings


A Side of Houdini Few Know

In this wonderfully disturbing novella, THE BOX JUMPER, written by Bram Stoker Award Winner Lisa Mannetti, we meet Leona Derwatt, Houdini's assistant on and off stage, and one of his mistresses. Houdini not only takes her into his confidence, teaching her the intricacies of his magic, but teams with her as they confront and expose fraudulent psychics and mediums of their day. The tension in the story (based on Mannetti's thorough research) involves Houdini's conflicts with fake mediums (who may have been complicit in his death) and Leona's continued confrontations with the same phony psychics later in her life.

“Lisa Mannetti has given us a look into the life of a fascinating historical character and cultural icon. Her novella brims over with dark suspense and a brilliant re-creation of a New York long gone. As always, she writes with passion and originality. A great story.” — Tom Monteleone, Bram Stoker and Locus Award-winning author of Night of Broken Souls and Eyes of the Virgin

This will be the 10th book published by Smart Rhino Publications, an indie publisher specializing in horror/suspense fiction. Our books have all been well reviewed; we strive for quality in our publications. We feel strongly about this novella and want to get it into as many hands as possible--and we need your help!

SEE AN EXCERPT FROM THE BOX JUMPER AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE!

Why We Need Your Help

The Kindle version of the book is scheduled for release on August 17, 2015, and the costs for that edition have already been covered. Our goal is to fund the paperback edition of THE BOX JUMPER.

Our goal is $1,000, which will cover the initial production, printing, and shipping costs. Anything beyond that will help us expand the reach to any and all fascinated with the life of Houdini, or those who just enjoy superb historical fiction (with a taste of horror and suspense). Any additional money donated will help fund future Smart Rhino Publications projects. Our mission has always been to provide a venue for new as well as veteran writers, with the ultimate goal of entertaining and informing our readers. Your support will help us continue to publish the quality fiction of many talented writers.

The nature of this fundraising event is to make the paperback edition of THE BOX JUMPER possible. But the perks offered can help us achieve much more if one is inclined or willing to help. Any and all help is appreciated!

With your generous support for THE BOX JUMPER, we can continue to provide a venue not only for Lisa Mannetti and other writers, but for all the cover artists, cover designers, proofreaders, and the many other people who work to make each book possible.


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, we realize that not everyone can donate money for this cause, but you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign. Tweet about the campaign. Mention us on your Facebook page, Google+, LinkedIn, or wherever you hang out online.

And, if you read and enjoy THE BOX JUMPER, you can also help us out by providing a review on Amazon, Goodreads, or any other review site that you frequent. We would greatly appreciate it!

An Excerpt from THE BOX JUMPER

(Copyright © 2015 by Lisa Mannetti)

...

The fake mediums maintained that strict linkage not only enhanced cosmic vibrations but, more important, proved that with their hands and feet accounted for, any manifestations had to come directly from spirit entities. I smiled thinking that even though Houdini had said he was going to demonstrate how every effect could be accomplished by purely physical means, and there was going to be absolutely nothing occult about this séance— because every bit was sheer conjuring—Sir Arthur was in for something of a shock.

Just like the phony trance artists, Houdini began with a prayer. His voice appropriately solemn even though, as I knew, he considered using prayer and hymns to connive believers the worst kind of blasphemy. Can you imagine anything uglier than manipulating people’s sincere belief in God to convince them you’re genuine—the real, honest-to-Jesus ticket—when you’re just about to scheme as many dollars as you can out of their pocketbooks? It’s disgusting.

The last “amen” intoned, the final strains of “Nearer My God to Thee” on the Victrola Houdini cranked up just before we’d taken seats faded, and there was a deep silence. I could feel Doyle’s pulse against my fingertips. Houdini cleared his throat and said, “Are there any spirits here?”

Nothing.

“We have to concentrate ... there can be no resistance, no skepticism ... we have to open the portal, open ourselves.”

Silence.

The merest dimming of the red lamp, but Sir Arthur’s gaze was riveted on the circle of pale hands on the tabletop, and I wasn’t sure he’d even noticed the growing darkness.

“If any spirits are here, we ask for a sign,” Houdini said.

A tremendous boom—loud and startling as the crack of thunder. At the same time, the table rose upward swiftly and the red lamp went out with a hiss. I heard Doyle’s sharp intake of breath, but his hand remained rooted in mine even when we all lifted our arms as the wooden table tipped twice drunkenly, then finally steadied itself, floating shoulder-high. Slowly, it rocked back and forth, finally settling down against the floor.

“Do you have a message for us?” Houdini breathed. A bell tinkled softly; in the dark it was impossible to tell where the sound came from. “Who is the message for? Show us—we beg you, please.”

Now there was a whispering sound—like the rustle of satin garments—and across the large room and out of the dark, the tiny faint outline of a dead white face swirled, then moved slowly toward us, becoming larger and clearer.

“Who are you?” Houdini said. “Who is your message for?”

The eerie voice from the wavering figure was as mottled as if the thing’s throat were choked with the dirt of the grave. “I ... have come ...” it rasped painfully, then trailed off. “So distant ... so hard ...”

“Spirit, we can help you. Who are you? What is your message?”

“So much sorrow ...” 

“Do either of you recognize her? Leona? Sir Arthur?” She had long wavy hair, dark glittering eyes; her mouth was a narrow slash. Doyle and I shook our heads.

“Give us a sign. Stroke the forehead of the one whose need to know brought you here. Make the sign of the cross.” At the same instant Doyle nearly jolted out of his seat, crying “Who are you?” A barely luminescent, distinct hand seemed to be already in the process of drawing away from the table and receding further into the darkness.

“That touch was ice cold,” Doyle said. “Damn near startled me into losing my grip on your hands, Harry.”

“You did well,” Houdini said. “Your experience at so many séances over the years kept you steady. But I think there’s more—let’s find out who this woman is and what she wants to tell you,” Houdini said. Then he addressed the spirit. “On the large desk near the standing globe, you’ll find a bowl with warm paraffin; place your hands in it—then dip them into the bowl of cool water alongside. If you understand me, tap three times for yes.”

Three sharp raps knocked against the wooden table.

“Excellent. Sir Arthur, did you wash the slates on all four sides as I told you before we started?”

“Yes, you gave me the damp sponge yourself, my dear boy.”

“And they were completely blank on all four sides?”

“Yes. “

“And you strung them from the cord we set up before we began?”

“Certainly. They’re right where I hung them—just over our heads.” A stream of cold air blasted around us and I felt Doyle’s hand quake.

“Spirit, there is a set of locked slates—the same type children use in schoolrooms—dangling in midair just above this table. Kindly write your name and tell us why you’re here. In particular, why you’ve come to see Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.”

There was a brief pause ... then, scratching, like chalk writing on a blackboard.

“Do you hear that?” Doyle breathed.

“Yes,” I said.

Houdini asked for quiet ... then a last prayerful invocation. “I’m going to use self-hypnosis to induce a trance state in myself, and I’m going to ask whatever spirits are present to rekindle the red lamp very, very slowly. And if they favor us, to give us a definite sign—the most definite sign possible from the other side. I’ll say the prayer and Leona and Sir Arthur, you must entreat the spirit of this woman—or any others nearby. I’ll say the prayer while you chant ‘Donnez.’ He took a deep breath. “Our Father who art in Heaven ...”

Doyle and I kept a steady rhythm. “Donnez, donnez ... donnez, donnez pour nous, donnez.”

By the gleam of the light we saw a tiny wisp—like spider web—slowly inch out from Houdini’s mouth. Gradually, it thickened and seemed to grow heavier, pulling at him. He lay his head down on the table and the ectoplasm twirled from between his lips and coiled over his chin until the large faintly glowing mass puddled on the table. His eyes were closed; his breathing was so shallow Houdini appeared to have fainted.

“It’s all right, Sir Arthur,” I said. “You’ve seen me on stage with him, and I know what to do.”

I called his name, we broke the circle, and I tapped his shoulder.

A few seconds later, his eyes fluttered open and he sat up.

“Are you dizzy? You look quite pale,” Sir Arthur said. He turned to me. “I’m speaking as a doctor now, he’s white as a sheet and I think he ought to have a sip of brandy.”

“He doesn’t drink—”

“Well, he needs something. Let me feel his pulse.”

“I’m all right ... really,” Houdini said, but his smile appeared pasted on, rather than genuine. “I must’ve been out of it. I was really under. Did something happen?”

...

About the Author, Lisa Mannetti

Lisa Mannetti’s debut novel, The Gentling Box, garnered a Bram Stoker Award and she was nominated in 2010 both for her novella, “Dissolution,” and a short story, “1925: A Fall River Halloween.” She has also authored The New Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn (now a Smart Rhino publication); Deathwatch, a compilation of novellas—including “Dissolution”; a macabre gag book, 51 Fiendish Ways to Leave Your Lover (2010); two nonfiction books; and numerous articles and short stories in newspapers, magazines, and anthologies.

Her story “Everybody Wins,” which was included in the Smart Rhino anthology Uncommon Assassins, was made into a short film by director Paul Leyden, starring Malin Akerman and released under the title Bye-Bye Sally; the film has been posted on YouTube. Her story “Almost Everybody Wins,” was also included in the sequel, Insidious Assassins.

Two of Lisa’s other stories have also been included in other Smart Rhino anthologies: “Paraphilia” in Zippered Flesh: Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad and “The Hunger Artist,” which was nominated for a Bram Stoker Award, in Zippered Flesh 2: More Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad.

Lisa lives in New York.


About Smart Rhino Publications

Smart Rhino Publications is a young publishing firm based in Delaware, with a current leaning toward (but not limited to) horror and suspense fiction. Our goal is to provide a venue for new as well as veteran writers, with the ultimate goal of entertaining and informing our readers. We work hard to highlight our superb writers and their work!
