historical character and cultural icon. Her novella brims over with dark
 suspense and a brilliant re-creation of a New York long gone. As 
always, she writes with passion and originality. A great story.” — Tom 
Monteleone, Bram Stoker and Locus Award-winning author of Night of Broken Souls and Eyes of the VirginThis will be the 10th book published by Smart Rhino Publications, an 
indie publisher specializing in horror/suspense fiction. Our books have all been well reviewed; we strive for quality in our publications. We feel 
strongly about this novella and want to get it
into as many hands as possible--and we need your help! 
SEE AN EXCERPT FROM THE BOX JUMPER AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE!

   Why We Need Your Help
 

The Kindle version of the book is scheduled for release on August 17, 2015, and the costs for that edition have already been covered. Our goal is to fund the paperback edition of THE BOX JUMPER. 
Our goal is $1,000, which will cover the initial production, printing, and shipping costs. Anything beyond that will help us expand the reach to any and all fascinated with the life of Houdini, or those who just enjoy superb historical fiction (with a taste of horror and suspense). Any
additional money donated will help fund future Smart Rhino Publications
projects. Our mission has always been to provide a venue for new as well as veteran writers, with the ultimate goal of entertaining and informing our readers. Your support will help us continue to publish the quality fiction of many talented writers.The nature of this
fundraising event is to make the paperback edition of THE BOX JUMPER possible. But the perks offered can
help us achieve much more if one is inclined or willing to help. Any and all
help is appreciated! With your generous support for THE BOX JUMPER, we can continue to provide a venue not only for Lisa Mannetti and other writers, but for all the cover artists, cover designers, proofreaders, and the many other people who work to make each book possible. Other Ways You Can Help
 
Of
course, we realize that not everyone can donate money for this cause, but you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign. Tweet about the campaign. Mention us on your Facebook page, Google+, LinkedIn, or wherever you hang out online. And, if you read and enjoy THE BOX JUMPER, you can also help us out by providing a review on Amazon, Goodreads, or any other review site that you frequent. We would greatly appreciate it!

An Excerpt from THE BOX JUMPER
(Copyright © 2015 by Lisa Mannetti)
...
The
fake mediums maintained that strict linkage not only enhanced cosmic vibrations
but, more important, proved that with their hands and feet accounted
for, any manifestations had to come directly from spirit entities. I smiled
thinking that even though Houdini had said he was going to demonstrate how
every effect could be accomplished by purely physical means, and there was
going to be absolutely nothing occult about this séance— because every
bit was sheer conjuring—Sir Arthur was in for something of a shock.


Just
like the phony trance artists, Houdini began with a prayer. His voice
appropriately solemn even though, as I knew, he considered using prayer and
hymns to connive believers the worst kind of blasphemy. Can you imagine
anything uglier than manipulating people’s sincere belief in God to convince
them you’re genuine—the real, honest-to-Jesus ticket—when you’re just about to
scheme as many dollars as you can out of their pocketbooks? It’s disgusting. 
The
last “amen” intoned, the final strains of “Nearer My God to Thee” on the
Victrola Houdini cranked up just before we’d taken seats faded, and there was a
deep silence. I could feel Doyle’s pulse against my fingertips. Houdini cleared
his throat and said, “Are there any spirits here?” 
Nothing.
“We
have to concentrate ... there
can be no resistance, no skepticism ...
we have to open the portal, open ourselves.” 
Silence.

The
merest dimming of the red lamp, but Sir Arthur’s gaze was riveted on the circle
of pale hands on the tabletop, and I wasn’t sure he’d even noticed the growing
darkness. 
“If
any spirits are here, we ask for a sign,” Houdini said. 
A
tremendous boom—loud and startling as the crack of thunder. At the same time,
the table rose upward swiftly and the red lamp went out with a hiss. I heard
Doyle’s sharp intake of breath, but his hand remained rooted in mine even when
we all lifted our arms as the wooden table tipped twice drunkenly, then finally
steadied itself, floating shoulder-high. Slowly, it rocked back and forth,
finally settling down against the floor.
“Do
you have a message for us?” Houdini breathed. A bell tinkled softly; in the
dark it was impossible to tell where the sound came from. “Who is the message
for? Show us—we beg you, please.”
Now
there was a whispering sound—like the rustle of satin garments—and across the
large room and out of the dark, the tiny faint outline of a dead white face
swirled, then moved slowly toward us, becoming larger and clearer. 
“Who
are you?” Houdini said. “Who is your message for?”
The
eerie voice from the wavering figure was as mottled as if the thing’s throat
were choked with the dirt of the grave. “I ... have come ...”
it rasped painfully, then trailed off. “So distant ... so hard ...”
“Spirit,
we can help you. Who are you? What is your message?” 
“So
much sorrow ...”  
“Do
either of you recognize her? Leona? Sir Arthur?” She had long wavy hair, dark
glittering eyes; her mouth was a narrow slash. Doyle and I shook our heads. 
“Give
us a sign. Stroke the forehead of the one whose need to know brought you here.
Make the sign of the cross.” At the same instant Doyle nearly jolted out of his
seat, crying “Who are you?” A barely
luminescent, distinct hand seemed to be already in the process of drawing away
from the table and receding further into the darkness.
“That
touch was ice cold,” Doyle said. “Damn near startled me into losing my grip on
your hands, Harry.”
“You
did well,” Houdini said. “Your experience at so many séances over the years kept
you steady. But I think there’s more—let’s find out who this woman is and what
she wants to tell you,” Houdini said. Then he addressed the spirit. “On the
large desk near the standing globe, you’ll find a bowl with warm paraffin;
place your hands in it—then dip them into the bowl of cool water alongside. If
you understand me, tap three times for yes.”
Three
sharp raps knocked against the wooden table.
“Excellent.
Sir Arthur, did you wash the slates on all four sides as I told you before we
started?”
“Yes,
you gave me the damp sponge yourself, my dear boy.”
“And
they were completely blank on all four sides?”
“Yes.
“
“And
you strung them from the cord we set up before we began?”
“Certainly.
They’re right where I hung them—just over our heads.” A stream of cold air
blasted around us and I felt Doyle’s hand quake.
“Spirit,
there is a set of locked slates—the same type children use in
schoolrooms—dangling in midair just above this table. Kindly write your name
and tell us why you’re here. In particular, why you’ve come to see Sir Arthur
Conan Doyle.”
There
was a brief pause ... then,
scratching, like chalk writing on a blackboard.
“Do
you hear that?” Doyle breathed.
“Yes,”
I said.
Houdini
asked for quiet ... then a last
prayerful invocation. “I’m going to use self-hypnosis to induce a trance state
in myself, and I’m going to ask whatever spirits are present to rekindle the
red lamp very, very slowly. And if they favor us, to give us a definite
sign—the most definite sign possible from the other side. I’ll say the prayer
and Leona and Sir Arthur, you must entreat the spirit of this woman—or any
others nearby. I’ll say the prayer while you chant ‘Donnez.’ He took a deep breath. “Our Father who art in Heaven ...”
Doyle
and I kept a steady rhythm. “Donnez, donnez ... donnez, donnez pour nous, donnez.”
By
the gleam of the light we saw a tiny wisp—like spider web—slowly inch out from
Houdini’s mouth. Gradually, it thickened and seemed to grow heavier, pulling at
him. He lay his head down on the table and the ectoplasm twirled from between
his lips and coiled over his chin until the large faintly glowing mass puddled
on the table. His eyes were closed; his breathing was so shallow Houdini
appeared to have fainted.
“It’s
all right, Sir Arthur,” I said. “You’ve seen me on stage with him, and I know
what to do.”
I
called his name, we broke the circle, and I tapped his shoulder.
A
few seconds later, his eyes fluttered open and he sat up.
“Are
you dizzy? You look quite pale,” Sir Arthur said. He turned to me. “I’m
speaking as a doctor now, he’s white as a sheet and I think he ought to have a
sip of brandy.”
“He
doesn’t drink—”
“Well,
he needs something. Let me feel his pulse.”
“I’m
all right ... really,” Houdini
said, but his smile appeared pasted on, rather than genuine. “I must’ve been
out of it. I was really under. Did something happen?” 
...

About the Author, Lisa Mannetti


Lisa
Mannetti’s debut novel, The Gentling Box,
garnered a Bram Stoker Award and she was nominated in 2010 both for her
novella, “Dissolution,” and a short story, “1925: A Fall River Halloween.” She
has also authored The New Adventures of
Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn (now a Smart Rhino publication); Deathwatch, a compilation of
novellas—including “Dissolution”; a macabre gag book, 51 Fiendish Ways to Leave Your Lover (2010); two nonfiction books;
and numerous articles and short stories in newspapers, magazines, and
anthologies.Her
story “Everybody Wins,” which was included in the Smart Rhino anthology Uncommon Assassins, was made into a
short film by director Paul Leyden, starring Malin Akerman and released under
the title Bye-Bye Sally; the film has been posted on YouTube. Her story “Almost Everybody Wins,” was
also included in the sequel, Insidious Assassins.

Two
of Lisa’s other stories have also been included in other Smart Rhino
anthologies: “Paraphilia” in Zippered
Flesh: Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad and “The Hunger Artist,” which
was nominated for a Bram Stoker Award, in Zippered
Flesh 2: More Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad.
Lisa
lives in New York. 

About Smart Rhino Publications
Smart
 Rhino Publications is a young publishing firm based in Delaware, with a
 current leaning toward (but not limited to) horror and suspense 
fiction. Our goal is to provide a venue for new as well as veteran 
writers, with the ultimate goal of entertaining and informing our readers. We work hard to highlight our superb writers and their work!

story:
Story Summary

Juventud explores the idealism of youth, the complexities of a ravaged country, and the stories we tell ourselves in order to survive. Growing up as the only daughter of a wealthy landowner in Santiago de Cali, Colombia, teenaged Mercedes Martinez knows a world of maids, armed guards, and private drivers. When she falls in love with Manuel, a fiery young activist with a passion for his faith and his country, she begins to understand the suffering of the desplazados who share her land. 

A startling discovery about her father forces Mercedes to doubt everything she thought she knew about her life, and she and Manuel make plans to run away together. But before they can, tragedy strikes in a single violent night. Mercedes flees Colombia for the United States and a life she never could have imagined. Fifteen years later, she returns to Colombia seeking the truth, but discovers that only more questions await.

   

My Journey  

This riveting story, part sociopolitical thriller and part love story, lyrically told, marks the culmination of the copious research and drafting which I began in 2009, and relied on the support of several writers’ colonies to complete, including Yaddo, Ragdale, the Virginia Center for the Creative Arts, and others. 

After so many years of working on the project, I am ecstatic that Juventud has found a home with the Chicago-based independent press, Curbside Splendor Publishing, and I am committed to bringing the novel to the widest audience possible upon its release this fall.  In the Northeast I am scheduled to present at the Burlington Book Festival, the Fall for the Book in Fairfax, VA, then will head to launch events in Chicago and Minneapolis, Boston and NYC. In November, the tour heads south and will include my home state of Florida, Savannah, Charleston, Charlotte, Nashville, and D.C. 


Why I Need Your Support

I need your help and support to cover travel expenses, lodging, and meals from when the launch starts at the end of September to early December, when I will be on leave from my part-time job at Bookmark It in Orlando, FL. While the publisher is arranging the tour, they are not funding it. My only source of income during the fall will be the online fiction workshop I’m teaching for UCF, which will allow me to maintain flexibility but will amount to a small paycheck that will just cover monthly essentials. 

I have a variety of donation levels and incentives to offer – but of course you may donate any amount you wish! I sincerely thank you for being a part of bringing this stunning and important novel—the first of many, I hope—into the world. Further information can be found on the press release and in my biography, provided here, as well as on my website, www.vanessablakeslee.com. 

                                


The Impact

Your support will make all the difference. Juventud  is a story I truly believe in, and I can't wait to embark on the exciting journey ahead. I've been fortunate enough to have my works published in a variety of journals, including The Southern Review, Green Mountain Review, The Paris Review Daily, The Globe and Mail, and Kenyon Review Online, among many others. My debut story collection, Train Shots, has taught me a lot about the publishing world, but my next endeavor will be the most challenging yet. Ultimately, with your help, it will be a valuable and unforgettable experience as I embark on a journey across the country to share my debut-novel with you.    


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word of my campaign and share this page with your friends, family, and colleagues. I appreciate whatever assistance you can provide in helping me realize the culmination of my years of research and writing, so that I can share my debut-novel with the world. Indiegogo has simple share tools, so don't forget to post this page to your Facebook, Twitter, or email. Thanks so much!

Pre-order “Juventud” here!

Follow my author page on Facebook. 900 followers and counting!

story:
About this project

In May 2015 the people of Ireland voted overwhelmingly in favour of same-sex marriage. It was a historic day, a real landmark for human rights and equality.

Now it’s Australia’s turn. We’ve already seen some politicians and parties starting to make positive noises. But that’s not enough and right now the worst thing we could do would be to leave it to them to bring about this much needed change. Those that are really committed to change are still in the minority. 

We’re going to create the biggest, most heartfelt and hardest-hitting campaign ever with the single aim of getting the Australian government to make marriage equality a reality. 

To do that, we need your help. We’re not going to let the politicians and law-makers kick this into the long grass anymore. So we’re going to produce hard-hitting TV campaign that will grab attention, get people talking and bring about the change that we all know has to happen. The more money we raise, the more impact our campaign can make and the further we can spread the word. 

So please give us your backing. Every financial contribution will bring us closer to being able to create the campaign that will send a signal to the Australian government … you can’t ignore this any longer, it’s time for a change, equality for all. 


Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise enough money, our campaign will have less impact, and we will all have missed a fantastic opportunity to send a strong, direct message to the politicians of Australia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Perhapse you can help us with film crew, or even offer us media placement for our campaign.

Ask your friends, family and colleagues to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign campaign.

Think you have something to offer us? Get in touch and let's see how we can work together.

story:
Hello,
I am a part time writer.  This is my 3rd book I have written, yet I do not write for profit or fame.  I write to help others. This book that I have just finished is about my life growing up in foster care and in a single family home. The proceeds of this book will go to our Foundation.  We are planning a soft launch for Dec. 10th 2015.  I ask your help in raising the funds to Edit, Print, and Build a Website for the sales of this book.

The Foundations name is Love Your Struggle.org 

Our mission statement is:

“With God our Struggles are just little bridges to a positive future.”

We at Love Your Struggle.org aim to offer hope in kids 12 to 18 years of age.  These kids will be from foster homes, broken homes, and abusive homes. We will offer guidance in the following subjects, and will be instructed by professionals in those fields. We will offer guidance in different types of business, finances, education, and health. We will be sponsoring kids into college that cannot afford to go but have the will to do so.  We will teach kids how to open a business and run that business.  We will teach these kids about financing, banking, and credit.  We will also teach them how important it is to be healthy in all spectrum's of their lives, Mind, Body, Heart, and Soul.  This Foundation will be helping kids that have lived in a struggle most of their lives.  We will teach them that their struggle can be their biggest strength.  By loving their struggle, each kid has the power to overcome anything.  So their struggles do not define them, they will inspire them.
Our goal is to print 500 copies of this book.  Anyone who donates $20.00 or more will receive a copy of this book.  It will be shipped to your home or office. 
If you cannot donate, we understand, but please share with family or friends.  We would be greatly appreciate it.

If you would like to talk to me, I would be honored to answer any of your questions. I am an open book. 949.566.5446


Thank YOU!
God Bless Everyone

story:
Campaign Summary

Hello! I'm Casey Tait, a traveling gal who absolutely loves people, justice, mentoring, good food, studying and teaching the Bible, and making a difference in this world. 

This campaign is all about reviving HOPE. I'm promoting my first book, "WAIT: Contending with Hope." This story is a candid glimpse into my life as a single lady as I learn to trust God through each season and live fully in the tension of hope deferred. This book is a bold stand against apathy, compromise, and discouragement that I believe everyone can relate to, regardless of their season of life. It is a powerful message of hope in a day and age when hope can seem distant or impossible.

I plan to dedicate all proceeds (after publishing/printing expenses) towards work among refugees in the Middle East and persecuted minorities. I currently volunteer in the Middle East with an organization called Derech Avraham that seeks to meet some of the pressing needs in the region as a result of terrorism, civil war and religious persecution. For further information about this organization and what we're doing to help, please see https://middleeastcrossroads.wordpress.com. 


What I Need & What You Get

The fine-print:

  • I need $6,000 to cover publishing and printing expenses. These costs can be fully covered if I sell just 400 books. 
  • Even if I don't meet my goal, I'll dedicate the first $2,000 of any funds received towards the cause of refugees and will personally cover any outstanding publishing costs at the end of this campaign. If I exceed my goal and am able to cover the publishing/printing expenses, everything else will go towards the cause of refugees.
  • All finances dedicated towards refugee work will be allocated based on the recommendations of the leadership team at Derech Avraham and financially accountable to my team of spiritual leaders.
  • PERKS: No bells and whistles ...I'm simply selling books, with the hopes that I can raise awareness about the current refugee crisis and in some small way make a difference as I generate finances to help. You get the satisfaction of knowing you helped too, and hopefully, an entertaining and valuable book to read or to give away.


The Impact

Nearly 60,000,000 people worldwide are considered "displaced" due to conflict, terrorism and religious persecution. About 20 million of these numbers are refugees, more than half of which are children. This is a global humanitarian crisis that is spiraling out of control and straining the resources of governments, humanitarian aid organizations and local economies. We cannot ignore the desperate needs of these people.

Civil war in Syria has claimed the lives of nearly ¼ million people over the past 4 years, and the rise of terror groups worldwide has led to an 80% increase in displaced people in the past year alone, contributing to the greatest refugee crisis the since WW2.

There are presently close to 4 million Syrian refugees in Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan and the surrounding nations. Most of these have lost homes, businesses, possessions and even family members as they were forced to flee for their very lives. Many of these people are victims of terrorism and have suffered in ways that I can never hope to comprehend. These precious people need basic life necessities that we so easily take for granted: food, clean water, shelter, clothing, medicine, education and much more. The need is far too great for humanitarian or government agencies to tackle on their own and the daily events of world news indicate that this humanitarian crisis will only increase over the coming years.

In many ways, the fight for hope for these people seems overwhelming and it can feel impossible to make any difference at all. I serve alongside a regional team of leaders from throughout the Middle East who also have a desire to make a difference in the current refugee crisis. We are directly working with local contacts in the center of these conflict zones who are daily feeding people at the refugee camps, bringing in supplies, mentoring young leaders and bringing hope in the midst of a dark time.

This campaign is my small drop in the bucket of need, and a way for others to come alongside and support some of the work on the front lines in this crisis. 


Book Details

This is an incredibly vulnerable book to share. The only reason I'm willing to let other people read this is for the possibility of helping revive hope and encouraging others. 

Book Summary (as seen on back cover):

Hope is part of the design of humanity. We were innately created to desire and to be fulfilled. The uncomfortable reality is that hope often hurts, especially when the journey requires waiting in faith and enduring untold disappointments or detours.

Living in the tension of hope deferred requires great courage. Life presents us all with numerous opportunities to pacify desire with temporary substitutes or to kill hope and embrace numbness or bitterness. The wise person will not give up on hope but rather contend for true fulfillment, no matter how long or arduous the wait.

Using the backdrop of her own narrative as a single woman trusting God’s plan, Casey wrestles with the concept of hope deferred in light of God’s goodness and his promises.

Chapter Titles

Introduction: A Siren Named Desire

Section 1: The Dilemma of Desire

     Chapter 1: Hope Deferred

     Chapter 2: Hunger

     Chapter 3: The Question of Free Will 

Section 2: The Enemies of Hope

     Chapter 4: Great Expectations

     Chapter 5: Disappointment

     Chapter 6: Divine Detours

     Chapter 7: Silence

     Chapter 8: Heart Issues

Section 3: Stewarding Hope

     Chapter 9: Conversations with God

     Chapter 10: Accountability

     Chapter 11: Health and Balance

     Chapter 12: Seasons

     Chapter 13: Vision

     Chapter 14: Joy is a Choice

Section 4: Anchored to Hope

     Chapter 15: Another Silent Saturday

     Chapter 16: The Valley of Achor

     Chapter 17: Eternal Hope

     Chapter 18: Perseverance


More About the Author (as seen on back cover)

Casey has served in full-time ministry for over ten years, investing in leadership‑training, mentoring, and global missions as well as teaching internationally. She served on staff at The City Church in Seattle, WA, and in Ventura, CA, with the Generation Intern Program. She obtained a master’s degree in Missiology from Regent University in Virginia Beach.

Casey has a heart to train this generation in biblical truth and practical wisdom and to see young leaders reach their full potential in Christ. She also has a passion for food and languages, intercultural discipleship, women’s ministry, humanitarian relief work, and adventure. Casey currently resides in Jerusalem, Israel.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute to this campaign, that's OK! Please consider these options: 

  • FORWARD TO A FRIEND: Help me promote this campaign by forwarding this to at least 5 people who may be interested in purchasing a book or giving toward the cause of refugees. Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • CONTACT ME: Email me at contendingwithhope@gmail.com to receive monthly updates regarding how we are working to meet various needs among refugees and/or persecuted minorities.
  • GIVE A TAX-DEDUCTIBLE DONATION now or later: If you want to give directly to the cause of work among refugees in the Middle East, please contact me at contendingwithhope@gmail.com and I will send information regarding several reputable non-profit organizations serving in this capacity.
story_txt:
Campaign Summary Hello! I'm Casey Tait, a traveling gal who absolutely loves people, justice, mentoring, good food, studying and teaching the Bible, and making a difference in this world. 
This campaign is all about reviving HOPE. I'm promoting my first book, "WAIT: Contending with Hope." This story is a candid glimpse into my life as a single lady as I learn to trust God through each season and live fully in the tension of hope deferred. This book is a bold stand against apathy, compromise, and discouragement that I believe everyone can relate to, regardless of their season of life. It is a powerful message of hope in a day and age when hope can seem distant or impossible.
I plan to dedicate all proceeds (after publishing/printing expenses) towards work among refugees in the Middle East and persecuted minorities. I currently volunteer in the Middle East with an organization called Derech Avraham that seeks to meet some of the pressing needs in the region as a result of terrorism, civil war and religious persecution. For further information about this organization and what we're doing to help, please see https://middleeastcrossroads.wordpress.com. 
   What I Need & What You Get The fine-print:  I need $6,000 to cover publishing and printing expenses. These costs can be fully covered if I sell just 400 books. 
Even if I don't meet my goal, I'll dedicate the first $2,000 of any funds received towards the cause of refugees and will personally cover any outstanding publishing costs at the end of this campaign. If I exceed my goal and am able to cover the publishing/printing expenses, everything else will go towards the cause of refugees.
All finances dedicated towards refugee work will be allocated based on the recommendations of the leadership team at Derech Avraham and financially accountable to my team of spiritual leaders. PERKS: No bells and whistles ...I'm simply selling books, with the hopes that I can raise awareness about the current refugee crisis and in some small way make a difference as I generate finances to help. You get the satisfaction of knowing you helped too, and hopefully, an entertaining and valuable book to read or to give away.    
The Impact 
Nearly 60,000,000 people worldwide are considered "displaced" due to conflict, terrorism and religious persecution. About 20 million of these numbers are refugees, more than half of which are children. This is a global humanitarian crisis that is spiraling out of control and straining the resources of governments, humanitarian aid organizations and local economies. We cannot ignore the desperate needs of these people.
Civil war in Syria has claimed the lives of nearly ¼ million
people over the past 4 years, and the rise of terror groups worldwide has led
to an 80% increase in displaced people in the past year alone, contributing to
the greatest refugee crisis the since WW2.
There are presently close to 4 million Syrian refugees in
Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan and the surrounding nations. Most of these have lost
homes, businesses, possessions and even family members as they were forced to
flee for their very lives. Many of these people are victims of terrorism and
have suffered in ways that I can never hope to comprehend. These precious
people need basic life necessities that we so easily take for granted: food,
clean water, shelter, clothing, medicine, education and much more. The need is
far too great for humanitarian or government agencies to tackle on their own
and the daily events of world news indicate that this humanitarian crisis will
only increase over the coming years. 
In many ways, the fight for hope for these people seems
overwhelming and it can feel impossible to make any difference at all. I serve alongside a regional team of leaders from throughout the Middle East who also have a desire to make a difference in the current refugee crisis. We are directly working with local contacts in the center of these conflict zones who are daily feeding people at the refugee camps, bringing in supplies, mentoring young leaders and bringing hope in the midst of a dark time.
This campaign is my small drop in the bucket of need, and a way for others to come alongside and support some of the work on the front lines in this crisis. 
   Book Details
This is an incredibly vulnerable book to share. The only reason I'm willing to let other people read this is for the possibility of helping revive hope and encouraging others. 

Book Summary (as seen on back cover): 
Hope is part of the design of humanity. We were innately
created to desire and to be fulfilled. The uncomfortable reality is that hope
often hurts, especially when the journey requires waiting in faith and enduring
untold disappointments or detours. 
Living in the tension of hope deferred requires great
courage. Life presents us all with numerous opportunities to pacify desire with
temporary substitutes or to kill hope and embrace numbness or bitterness. The
wise person will not give up on hope but rather contend for true fulfillment,
no matter how long or arduous the wait. 
Using the backdrop of her own narrative as a single woman
trusting God’s plan, Casey wrestles with the concept of hope deferred in light
of God’s goodness and his promises.
Chapter Titles
Introduction: A Siren
Named Desire
Section 1: The
Dilemma of Desire
     Chapter 1: Hope Deferred
     Chapter 2: Hunger
     Chapter 3: The Question of Free Will  
Section 2: The
Enemies of Hope
     Chapter 4: Great Expectations
     Chapter 5: Disappointment
     Chapter 6: Divine Detours
     Chapter 7: Silence
     Chapter 8: Heart Issues
Section 3: Stewarding
Hope
     Chapter 9: Conversations with God
     Chapter 10: Accountability
     Chapter 11: Health and Balance
     Chapter 12: Seasons
     Chapter 13: Vision
     Chapter 14: Joy is a Choice
Section 4: Anchored
to Hope 
     Chapter 15: Another Silent Saturday
     Chapter 16: The Valley of Achor
     Chapter 17: Eternal Hope
     Chapter 18: Perseverance

More About the Author (as seen on back cover)
Casey has served in full-time ministry for over ten years,
investing in leadership‑training, mentoring, and global missions as well as
teaching internationally. She served on staff at The City Church in Seattle,
WA, and in Ventura, CA, with the Generation Intern Program. She obtained a
master’s degree in Missiology from Regent University in Virginia Beach.
Casey has a heart to train this generation in biblical truth
and practical wisdom and to see young leaders reach their full potential in
Christ. She also has a passion for food and languages, intercultural

story:
1.Who am I and What I Have to Share with You


  • Since a very young age I've been fascinated about the miracles of life. This curiosity led me to study a lot of different fields of knowledge in order to better understand how we came to exist as human beings on this floating ball of water around a star... It's nothing less than wonderful! 
  • After diving in scientific, holistic and esoteric studies and following a path of self awareness and healing, I finally discovered Ayurveda, the Ancient Medicine of India which I've been studying for the past years. 

  •            

  • Click here to know more about my work
  • Click here to access the blog


About the book:

I want to share with you a very special story... 

The Tales of Human Creation

A unique way of understanding the creation of a human being:

  • I'm about to become a mom for the first time! So now more than ever I'm so passionate and exited to write and illustrate this book at the same time that I experience what I knew in theory already.



  • The book will be an illustrated guide of pregnancy that will explain you step by step the development of the baby. I will write it with a metaphorical, fun and fantasy language, but yet scientifically correct. 
  • Here you will find an example.

                         

My goal is to get the best of both worlds to offer you a guide that is magical and scientifically correct  at the same time.

  • This book compiles the knowledge and experience I gathered so far plus the artistic skills that are an intrinsic part of my life. With the extra contribution of experts in different fields that will add value to the whole project.
  • With your contribution I can make this dream come true and share with the world a unique approach on pregnancy to inspire as many people as i can to connect in a deeper level with the miracles of life!
By the way, it's an honor to present to you my tiny giant miracle :)
                        


2. How you can contribute


  • For the total development of this project I need 33,000€

Here's where your money is going:

  • Travel and research expenses
  • Editing
  • Digital scanning and preparation of illustrations
  • Interior book design, layout, finishing touches and extras
  • Marketing (incl. IndieGogo fees)
  • Charity Campaign 
  • Printing

               


  • In December this year, I will travel to India to finish my research and get more interviews with experts to develop the contents of the book.  It will be an estimated 3 months research depending on the state of my pregnancy. Follow my travel here.

All contributions are extremely valuable, to show you my gratitude I will offer a full version of the E-book to everyone who gives a donation. 

Check out my unique perks to know about all my special offers!


3. Help me have an Impact Worldwide


My mission is to share my vision:

 I want to share the E-book version for free with all institutions that I can find and all the ones that request me to do so. Weather they concern pregnancy, parenthood, childcare or education in general.

  • I truly believe that if we have a better understanding about the miracle of life and gain sensibility to the process of bringing a new human being into this planet, we can really make an impact on the way future generations perceive life.

4. Risks & Challenges


The only risk that I have concerns the timing of development of the project.

If you read the info above you know that I'm pregnant and about to embark on a challenging journey to India to finish my research in time before the baby lands on this planet! :) 

Because there are a lot of unpredictable variables, the project might be delayed. But hey, who knows... 

The opposite is also possible! I have the force of creation within me now more than ever. I might get a flash of inspiration and finish the book in record time! 

No matter what happens I can guarantee you that the book will be done and finished with all the love and passion I have to share!

And until then you can follow the process here.


5. Other Ways You Can Help

 I'm so grateful for your time and attention so far, and even if you can't make a donation remember that you can have a massive impact by sharing this project with as many people as you can!

If you cant make a donation remember that there are many other ways to help me!
You can start by sharing the link to this campain using the Indiegogo share tools! You can also share my website  where you will find a blog with information regarding the development of the book and my travel, and my facebook page. 

  • You can also help me built my contact list for my charity campaign! I need to get in touch with institutions, associations or any community group regarding pregnancy, parenting, child care or education in general to make my dream come true of sharing my vision worldwide!
  • Do you have any special insight? Are you an expert in the matter? I truly belief we are in the Era to work in an integrative way instead of exclusive way. If you feel you could have a contribution to this project please don't hesitate to contact me!

Thank you so much for dedicating your time to get to know my mission and dream project!

You can start by sharing the link to this campain using the Indiegogo share tools! You can also share my website  where you will find a blog with information regarding the development of the book and my travel, and my facebook page. 


You can also help me built my contact list for my charity campaign! I need to get in touch with institutions, associations or any community group regarding pregnancy, parenting, child care or education in general to make my dream come true of sharing my vision worldwide!

story:
Short Summary

Hi to everyone.  I am Jules Mitchell, 17 year old Antiguan youth sailor.  I have a dream to get to the 2020 Olympics and race Laser for my country, Antigua.  As part of my quest, I have to compete in local, regional and international regattas, and my next regatta is the KBC Laser Radial Youth World Championships in  Dun Laoghraire, Ireland this July. 

I started sailing at 10 years old in the Laser Radial class and quickly progressed to racing in this particular class in Antigua.   I have  attended 17 sailing regattas in the last 2-3 years; International, Regional and Local events spanning countries as far afield as Martinique, USA, Canada and Guadeloupe and Malaysia having competed in 4 international regattas in the last year.  I am  one of the top youth sailors representing Antigua & Barbuda today and in my bid to make it to the 2020 Olympics, I will have to attend a lot more, which is an expensive undertaking.

I have raised some money and have managed to pay for my registration, Laser charter and damage deposit, but I still have to raise the airfare, pre-regatta boat charter fee, accommodation and food, coach, coach boat and related expenses and the cost of special gear for sailing in cold temperatures, as I am used sailing in 84F temperatures.  I have had a successful year so far and feel confident that will do well in Ireland if I can raise the funds to get there.  I competed in the same event last year in Canada and know the level of competition to expect

I cannot compete at this level internationally without help and support, both financially and otherwise.  Please support my cause by donating and/or sharing this campaign on all of your social media and by email to all of your contacts.  If you know me, you can tell your contacts about me and raise some more support.  Thank you for all your support on previous campaigns and for any and all of your support on this one.  

What We Need & What You Get


Here is the breakdown of funds needed.
Airfare for me and my coach @US$1300 each = US$2600.00
Registration                                                                       US$  345.00
Laser Charter                                                                    US$1020.00
Laser Charter Damage Deposit                                  US$   525.00
Early Charter                                                                     US$  450.00
Centre Board and Rudder Rental                               US$   175.00
Insurance                                                                            US$     45.00
Coach Boat Rental                                                           US$2800.00
Fuel for Coach Boat                                                         US$  300.00
Accommodation for me and my coach                     US$2000.00
Food for me and my coach                                            US$1000.00
Transport from LHR to/from LGW both ways        US$   160.00
Transport to/from Dublin Airport, etc.                     US$    225.00
Titanium top and splash top and gloves                   US$    450.00
                                                                                               ______________
Total                                                                                      US$15240.00
Less already paid                                                             US$   1890.00
                                                                                               ______________
 Total needed                                                                      US$13350.00
If I am unsuccessful in raising the funds needed to get to this regatta, these funds will go towards funding my next planned regatta,  competing in the ISAF Worlds 2016 in New Zealand in December.  Any funds which are raised over my target amount will go towards helping my teammate with his fundraising.

The Impact

This regatta is very important in the campaign to get to the 2020 Olympics because it is a World Championship where the competition is very high cailbre and it is regattas like this that make an Olympic class sailor.  Last year, I took part in the same regatta which was held in Canada, my first competition at this level.  I came 9th in my fleet.  I know I will do better this year after competing in the ISAF Worlds in Malaysia.  I am training hard everyday and working on my strength, endurance, and tactics as it take a lot of work to maintain my physical condition and stamina. I only have one more year at this level of competition.  If my fundraising is successful, and I can compete at the Laser Radial Youth Worlds in Dun Laoghraire, Irleland, I am one step closer to my goal.

Risks & Challenges

No matter how much work I put in to my physical performance, I still have to find a way to fund attending world championships.  Once I have paid for the registration, there is no turning back or I can lose all or some of the money.  Working hard at my training is a good part of the battle to get support.  When I do well, people can see that my hard work pays off and may be more inclined to support me.  I know that I am getting  bigger and stronger all of the time and I am persistent and consistent with my training to be the best that I can be.  With the help of my mother, fundraising is always a priority and we have a raffle, a regatta and other events planned along with this Indiegogo campaign.

We have some lovely perks if you contribute to this campaign.  Contributions of US$25.00 or above will be sent a hand made leather key ring made by Lyris Tracey of Island Mantra, famous for hand painted souvenirs, clothes and jewellry.  Contributions of US$100 and above will be sent a leather bracelet for the men or a leather cuff for women.  See gallery.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Please share this to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. You can do this by email, sharing on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social network.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

I only have one more year at this level of competition.  If my fundraising is successful, and I can compete at the Laser Radial Youth Worlds in Dun Laoghraire, Irleland, I am one step closer to my goal.   Risks & Challenges No matter how much work I put in to my physical performance, I still have to find a way to fund attending world championships.  Once I have paid for the registration, there is no turning back or I can lose all or some of the money.  Working hard at my training is a good part of the battle to get support.  When I do well, people can see that my hard work pays off and may be more inclined to support me.  I know that I am getting  bigger and stronger all of the time and I am persistent and consistent with my training to be the best that I can be.  With the help of my mother, fundraising is always a priority and we have a raffle, a regatta and other events planned along with this Indiegogo campaign.
We have some lovely perks if you contribute to this campaign.  Contributions of US$25.00 or above will be sent a hand made leather key ring made by Lyris Tracey of Island Mantra, famous for hand painted souvenirs, clothes and jewellry.  Contributions of US$100 and above will be sent a leather bracelet for the men or a leather cuff for women.  See gallery.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.
Please share this to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. You can do this by email, sharing on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social network.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Психолог с 30-летнем стажем, частая гостья телевизионных и радио программ, писатель, мастер рейки и мама четырех дочерей Нелли Ксеневич убеждена, что счастье - это вопрос тренировки. Так же, как мы приводим в тонус вялые мышцы, избавляемся от токсинов и лишнего жира, мы можем работать со своим настроением, эмоциями, опытом, который “якорит” нас и мешает двигаться дальше.

В книгах Нелли Ксеневич много юмора, притч, анекдотов и реальных жизненных историй, поэтому читаются они на одном дыхании. Автор дает конкретные техники, используя которые, можно лучше понять себя, повысить самооценку, научиться контролировать тревожность, уменьшить страх одиночества, наладить отношения с друзьями, любимыми и семьей. 

О чем же книга 365?
Возможно, вы, как и автор, верите во взаимодействие энергий и в то, что определенные события и людей в жизни мы притягиваем своими мыслями. 
Но разве можно контролировать мысли? - спросите вы. 
А почему бы и нет? Вы же контролируете то, что едите, чем увлажняете кожу и моете волосы. Ваш внутренний мир тоже достоин внимания! Главное, не путать самосовершенствование с самоедством. 
Свою пятую книгу Нелли называет “книгой-тренингом”, рассчитанную на самостоятельную годичную работу по формированию позитивной картины мира. В течение этого времени вы будете лепить нового себя, отказываться от вредных привычек (обиды, нытье, привязка к прошлому), токсичных отношений, и процесс этот не обещает быть легким. Но, как и с любой физической нагрузкой, втянитесь, полюбите, оцените результат.

Цель:

50% всех вырученных средств пойдет на создание центра по оказанию психологической помощи пожилым людям в Беларуси. Большинство из них доживают, а не проживают "золотой возраст", - в стране не созданы условия для полноценного и интересного досуга пожилых, они либо заняты физическим трудом на даче, либо няньчатся с внуками, а в остальное время сидят дома в одиночестве, страдая от недостатка общения едва ли не больше, чем от болезней. 

Нелли Ксеневич намерена улучшить качество жизни пожилых людей, вовлекая их в новые виды деятельности. К работе центра планируется привлекать волонтеров из числа студентов и старшеклассников, которые могли бы обучать пенсионеров компьютерной грамоте, пользованию скайпом, социальными сетями, мобильными приложениями. Профессиональный стилист будет разбирать гардеробы бабушек и дедушек, и разрабатывать их индивидуальный стиль. Фотографии "до" и "после" можно будет выставлять в галереях, привлекая внимание прессы и общества к пожилым людям - не столько к их проблемам, сколько к их праву и желанию жить "золотые годы" интересно и счастливо. Психологическая помощь будет заключаться как в индивидуальной работе, так и в групповых тренингах, благо у Нелли Ксеневич огромный опыт по части их проведения. 

У Нелли есть конкретный план, опыт, идеи, не хватает только средств. 

Как заказать книгу в электронном варианте: 

1) Внесите вклад на этой странице. 

Мы не указываем конкретную сумму и просим Вас самих определить цену полученным знаниям и техникам, почерпнутым из книг Нелли. Половина этой суммы будет переведено автору, половина пойдет на создание и поддержание работы фонда для помощи пожилым людям в Беларуси.

2) Вышлите запрос на книги nelli.ksenevich@gmail.com. 

В теме письма уточните, какую книгу Вы хотели бы получить - "365", "АЖЗ или Азбука Жизненных Законов", или обе. Будем рады также ответить на Ваши вопросы и рассмотреть Ваши предложения. 

Прочитать начало каждой из книг вы можете по ссылкам ниже:

365 Дней или Мозаика Счастья, Начало книги - ссылка
Азбука Жизненных Законов, Первая Глава - ссылка

story:
Help Publish  Littlest Magpie and the Star 

A picture book for young children

The Magpie Press

Gill Hutchison was a hugely talented children's writer.  Her enormous energy and sense of fun as well as her love of writing for children of all ages meant that she wrote delightful and original stories. She was a key member of the Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators (SCBWI) and had just gained her first class MA in creative writing.

Gill died suddenly before Christmas 2015, just as her writing talent and especially her story text, Littlest Magpie and the Star, was gaining recognition by editors and agents. 

"It's very strong writing, exceedingly well-paced and beautifully atmospheric, with a lovely sense of place" Ben Illis, Ben Illis Literary Agency

We, her writing friends, and Gill were anticipating traditional publishing success for Littlest Magpie and the Star. It is a simple story of friendship and growing up, beautifully told. And we as a group think it deserves to be read and enjoyed by as many children, parents and grandparents as possible.  

Now we are asking you to help us to independently publish Gill's book in her memory. Gill's completed text is currently being illustrated by fellow SCBWI member and published illustrator, Carol Daniels.

Together we can help children to enjoy Gill's storytelling and make her dearest wish to be published, come true.

We have carefully costed this project, and our target sum will cover editing and design, illustration and printing. We aim to sell the book for £5. 

A contribution from any profits will be made to the National Literacy Trust. As a teacher Gill helped many children to learn to read, write and communicate and thus the NLT is the perfect cause for us to support. 

Furthermore, we are establishing our own independent publishing press, called, The Magpie Press, in order to support and enable other children's writers to become published.

What we need and what we would like to offer you

Gill's text is currently being illustrated by Carol. The funding is to take the book through the editing and printing process. To do this, we are seeking a total of £3,000 (GBP), which will fund:

  • Design and Illustration costs:  £1,500 (GBP)
  • Initial print run of 1000 copies in UK: £1,300 (GBP)
  • Establishing  The Magpie Press  £200 (GBP)

Every pound will help us to bring Littlest Magpie and The Star out for Christmas, 2016. We are grateful for all contributions, and are offering the following:

  • £1 or more, our eternal thanks.
  • £7 contribution,  a copy of Littlest Magpie and the Star (to include p and p). 
  • £10 contribution, a LIttlest Magpie poster
  • £15 contribution, a Littlest Magpie t-shirt
                All supporters will be invited to the Book Launch.

What if we don't reach our target?

The book is written;  there is no risk there. So we will press on, using the funds contributed to keep us moving towards publication in time for Christmas. 

We have complete faith in this project, the quality of the story and the artwork. 
We are committed to making a success of this enterprise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You could help by ordering/reserving copies of the book for yourself, family and friends.

You could also share our publicity through your Facebook page on twitter, by email or just by word of mouth. Click here - Littlest Magpie and the Star

Whatever you CAN do will be much appreciated. 

Thank you for supporting Gill's wonderful story, and the rich tradition of children's literature.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! I'm Andrew Pan, an illustrator, writer and photographer from North Carolina. I've been doing freelance creative work for over 8 years now, taking the leap into writing in 2012. I have sense published 3 short stories and have multiple other projects in the works. 

"When Color Came" is a book project 2 years in the making. When I originally wrote and illustrated this story, it was rejected by a few publishers and printers. I've taken their notes and have revised and revived this piece into the beautiful book it is today.

I have spent the past two years enhancing the story and redesigning the illustrations and the result is a captivating journey into a land of color and adventure. The illustrations are all hand drawn and hand painted, each showcasing a brilliant attention to detail. The colors are bright and vivid and the words guide you through a well crafted world of imagination. 

After all this time working on it, I am so happy to finally be releasing this story to those who love adventure. This campaign does double duty in allowing you the fans to pre-order the book and also to donate towards the publication of this book. Indiegogo is a great company for this because it allows me to track and manage my orders and complete them all at the same time. The goal is to have enough people preorder the book that once the campaign is over, I would be able to donate some books to local schools and libraries. This would give my book not only a broader reach but also an opportunity to touch more lives.

What We Need & What You Get

The set goal is $1,000. Although this goal is set as the maximum, it is flexible! The money used if the goal is met goes directly to completing orders that you have placed and also to the publication of this and other works. If the entire goal isn't met, thats ok too! The money that is collected would still go to fulfilling orders and the publication of as many books as I can manage. 

There are many ways to donate, you can choose a popular perk below so you can have your very own copy of "When Color Came" or you can make a perk-less donation! 
(Obviously, we recommend the perks!)

$5- Custom Bookmark and Thank You card!

        This perk is perfect for anyone that doesn't have much to contribute. Any amount is helpful and to show my appreciation, you'll receive a thank you card and a custom "When Color Came" bookmark!


$10- Pre-Order a signed Paperback copy of "When Color Came"!

        This is by far the most popular perk! For just $10 you can preorder a SIGNED Paperback copy of "When Color Came"! This is 40% off the retail price so get it while you can! As more of a thank you, you will also receive a "When Color Came" bookmark!


$15- Pre-Order a signed Hardcover copy of "When Color Came"!

         Also 40% off the in-store price, this hardcover book will stand the test of time and also look great on your shelf! Signed by the author, this perk also comes with a custom bookmark!



$20- Pre-Order a signed Paperback copy + signed Concept Art!

          With this you get your signed paperback copy, the custom bookmark and a signed and numbered Concept Art print! This concept piece was done when I was redesigning the book. This is a campaign exclusive so make sure to take advantage!

$25- Pre- Order a signed Hardcover copy + Concept Art!

          Wanting something a little extra to accompany your hardcover book? This original concept art will go great! Done during the redesign of the book, this concept art will be signed and numbered and is included along with the bookmark!

$40-  Hardcover + Paperback + Concept Art!

          Not sure how to choose from above? Then don't! In this perk you get it all! You get two signed copies of the book, one hardcover, one paper back. The concept art and bookmark are also included! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself not able to contribute, I would still appreciate your help! All you have to do is share this page to your friends, family, coworkers etc. and help me reach as many people as possible!

story:
This is my grandmother working in her parent's bakery, an immigrant business that lasted more than 70 years over three generations. This photo is here because I'm hoping it will tug at your heart. It's also here because when I was seven years old and I told this woman I wanted to open a restaurant when I grew up she said:

"No! Don't do that! People will rob you blind!"

Grandma was a practical sort. Getting on with my life, I pursued other things and I avoided restaurants. But after chance brought me to my first restaurant job, I soon  found it hard to stop. I loved the work. It was like an episode of Cheers (wacky adventures) crossed with a family gathering (the drugs) and a pro sports event (the drunken fights). 15+ years later I still work in restaurants, and I don't plan on stopping.

I'm constructing a website called The Restaurant Junkie that will entertain those who work in restaurants and educate those who frequent them. It will include interviews, pictures, stories, recipes, and more. The point of it is to stay away from food celebrities, and instead focus on the day to day of people who make restaurants work. How many times have you eaten food prepared by Gordon Ramsey? Probably not often. Meanwhile there's a guy out there who made 10 of the last 15 hamburgers you ate and a barista you talk to more than your mother -- yet what do you know about them and what they do for you?

The are two primary goals for this campaign;

  1. Create a website that entertains and educates restaurant workers and consumers on what restaurants are, how they work, and how they can improve.
  2. Work in as many restaurants as possible. The heart of a restaurant is in the people who work in them. Through this project over a period of six months I will work with many dedicated restaurant people, learn from them, and share their stories, skills, and wisdom.

That second thing is the hard part, but let's look at the hard data shall we?


The Facts

Cutting edge cuisine, alcohol, fire, and sharp things all make restaurants exciting. We live in a world where "Celebrity Chef" is a thing. In fact many famous folks are guiding our diets. But the reality is that most of us trust unseen and unknown hands to feed us.

In 2015, for the first time Americans spent more on restaurants than on groceries. But we aren't just eating out more. There are also more of us working in restaurants. The National Restaurant Association (NRA) and the US Department of Labor can fill you in on hard facts, but the former puts it plainly, "Half of all American adults have worked in the restaurant industry."

Not only is this a huge American industry it's also a volatile one. According to an Ohio State University study, "60% [of restaurants] do not make it past the first year, and 80% go under in five years." What's truly interesting is that same study, "indicated that effective management of family life cycle and quality-of-life issues is more important than previously believed in the growth and development of a restaurant."

In other words restaurants are an ever increasing part of the American Economy, and their success is largely determined by the quality of life they provide the people who work in them. This project proposes that we talk directly to these people and take an up close look at how the restaurant industry works.

How This Project Works

The hope is that this will become a long term document that grows with the restaurant business, but this campaign is the seed to get things started.

The driving element of this project is the research, photography, interviews and writing that takes place in 161 days from January to June of 2016. In those 161 days I’m aiming to stage (pronounced "stazhje"; restaurant speak for “intern”) at between 20 - 100 Boston area restaurants. It’s important to note that I’m using this term in reference to all restaurant positions including dishwasher, server, bar, busser, and host. The number is a wide target because much of it will depend on what the restaurant's are willing to go along with in addition to funding.

The Restaurant Junkie is an attempt to cross George Plimpton's Paper Lion with the film Waiting.... Staging has a long tradition in restaurants. It can be a purely educational pursuit, or it can work like a job interview. Some stages last months, others only last one night. In this instance each stage allows conversation with a wide range of restaurant people and see how things work in a very bare bones, direct, and practical manner. Every restaurant is different, and those differences can best be explained and explored by working directly with the people inside them.

At a time when we're talking about "farm to table," terroir, and local food, taking a look at how the people affect and are affected by the food they make seems a natural next step in examining how American's eat.

Why Boston?

Like many U.S. cities, Boston has a complex food history currently undergoing a shift in direction and prominence. New York and L.A. have explosive and expansive food scenes being covered by hundreds of people, and there are many other cities across the U.S. that are trying to define their own local food culture. Since I can’t cover all the amazing work being done across the country with time and budget constraints I needed to find a place where I was, a.) well connected, b.) could work on a budget, and c.) could highlight people, food, and social issues that might be off my radar in an unfamiliar city. It’s also the place I call home and I want to show the world how great the people, restaurants and food in Boston truly are.

Who Are You?

Even though I am a "restaurant junkie," this project isn't really about me. But I'll humor you. Folks call me Jack. I’ve worked in restaurants off and on since 1999. I've washed dishes, served, baked, bartended, bussed, managed and more. I started in restaurants because I needed a job. It became a comfortable lifestyle that eventually allowed me to move and explore other careers that all taught me a lot -- mostly that I missed restaurants.

In addition to my restaurant background in high school I co-founded a small magazine for and by young magicians (aka "pre-pubescent bunny yankers"), I spent a brief stint as a newspaper reporter, I has Writing degree, and I also spent several years as a copywriter and editor of on-line written content for an entertainment company.

How Will The Money Be Used?

Originally I had wanted to cover more than 130 Boston area restaurants in depth, and turn it into a book. While I would love to make that a reality, it would require much more time and money. I did inherit some of Grandma's practical side. Instead of trying to tackle something all at once, the idea here is to start small and grow.

$13,200 may not seem that small, but it's paying for one full time employee to work 1-4 shifts a week in a restaurant (for free) over a period of six months, write the content, organize and coordinate the site all while maintaining another part time job to cover living expenses. It also funds purchases necessary to working in multiple restaurants in multiple rolls. While it won't cover expansive photography, it will cover a few high quality photo essays, and I'm hopping to hire this photographer. The money also pays for expertise when it come to expanding and polishing the small website currently set up at The Restaurant Junkie. Lastly about 18% of the final total raised will also go towards rewards and fees associated with using IndieGoGo.

APPROXIMATE BREAKDOWN:

  • $3,000: Six months of subsidized Rent/Utilities/Living Expenses.
  • $950: Work supplies. Uniforms, knife maintenance, shoes, etc.
  • $1,250: Basic website design, domain, and more.
  • $4,000: Photography. I actually want to spend more here. While it may seem high, it's worth it for quality.
  • $2,000: Food. Divided into two parts, approximately $1,200 is earmarked for eating at restaurants, and $800 is for cooking at home, recipe testing (for the "untitled cookbook" in the rewards section), and food product reviews.
  • $1000: Rewards. Postage, shipping supplies, the goods.
  • $500 - $1000: Approximate Fees. Indiegogo's taste.
If we can reach this goal, great! If we can surpass it, I have a series of stretch goals that would allow for work in more restaurants, hiring additional creative contributors, taking more pictures, and adding more rewards... but let's make some soup before we think about nuts.

Benefits For All
"Restaurants today lie at the heart of 21st-century American life. These employers aren’t headed overseas; for the foreseeable future, millions of Americans will wait tables, cook food, or wash dishes for their livelihoods." - Boston Globe Editorial, 12/29/14

If you eat at restaurants, funding this project will give you a peak behind the curtain and make you smarter about where and how you eat. If you work in restaurants at the very least you'll get a laugh and you may get some insight into your work. If you run a Boston area restaurant this will give you the opportunity to option some free labor. If you're a home cook this project will offer you tips on preping for your next big gathering. And, if you're considering getting involved in restaurants -- even a little -- this project will help you to know if you genuinely are a "restaurant junkie."

People will rob you blind!"Grandma was a practical sort. Getting on with my life, I pursued other things and I avoided restaurants. story:
Hello, folks. My name is Ronnie Smith & I'm a professional graphic artist. For many years, I've done illustration & graphic design for book publishers, ad agencies, software companies, courtroom trial exhibit companies, schools, Boy Scouts of America, Chuck E. Cheese, etc.  You can take a look at some of my work at my website, ronniesmithart.com.

Recently, I decided that it's time for me to take my talents a different direction. Instead of creating artwork for other publishers, I'd publish my own series of children's books that I will both write and illustrate. The series I plan on launching is themed around endearing monster mysteries and it will be targeted to young children, around pre-Kindergarten to 2nd grade.  I intend to produce cute, captivating stories with a rhyming canter which will inspire children to learn to read or increase reading fluency. Although my books will feature monsters, whether real or imagined, they will turn out to be friendly and non-threatening. The first book in the series is 95% complete as of this writing. A good friend of mine, who is a school teacher for the grade levels my books will be targeted to, has seen the nearly completed first book and she's very excited about getting some copies for her students. She feels that my books will be a perfect fit for her reading classes.  Her positive reaction has encouraged me to keep going on this project.
Needless to say, this rewarding endeavor has been very demanding in many ways. I'll need more cash flow to cover overhead expenses associated with the production (including art supplies, computer hardware & sofware), publishing and advertising of my books. 
With your help, this dream will come to fruition.

story:
Haywood James Micaye is a twenty-six year old legend. Those who know him know that he is a genius and one of the top agents working at the Headquarters. Those who know him well know that Haywood is a cruel man with no tolerance towards anyone but himself and a bounty of billions on his head. Only he knows is that he has long since purged himself of humanity and lives to be better than everyone else no matter the cost.  

When a virtual terrorist attack proclaims the existence of a group of people who vow to destroy the human race, Haywood places himself in a dangerous position as he works to stop them. Little does he know that this is only the beginning of a chain reaction that will expose him to not only a weapon unlike anything the world has ever seen before, but also the person who has control over it. 

-(Synopsis from www.ashlynnedoyle.com)

Haywood Micaye is a literary thriller that focuses on Haywood's efforts to stop a terrorist group known as the Leviticus from destroying the human race. It also explores several themes of the human existence like the lines between good and evil and logic versus emotion. Haywood explores these ideas and more on his quest and has to overcome these issues much like we have to overcome them in our everyday lives.

This project is raising money for the self-publication of Haywood Micaye. In its most basic form, Haywood Micaye will be a novel of the same approximate length as Neil Gaiman's The Ocean at the End of the Lane and will be available in paperback and hardcover format.

As of right now, Haywood Micaye is still in its developmental phase and is in need of a professional editor to look it over and give it the polished edge you might be familiar with a commercially published book. Not only that, but the funds raised will also go towards everything everything else involved in publishing a book. The breakdown of costs looks something like this:

 As a young writer myself, it would be a dream come true if I were able to bring this project to life. With your contributions, I believe that that goal can be achieved.


Last year, during the first semester of my sophomore year of high school, fourth hour white days would find me in Mr. Baker’s classroom for Creative Writing.  One of our earlier assignments, and one we returned to frequently that semester, was to use a questionnaire to design a character that we would eventually use in the short story we wrote as our final project.

October 14, 2014, according to my notes, is when I first “met” Haywood Micaye.

Making up his history as I went along was almost like actually sitting down and meeting him in real life: He was twenty-six, American, and had, as he liked to say in his careful manner of speaking, “a rather involved position in the field of espionage”. Haywood forms his beliefs based on the notion that human emotion led to weakness in the human race and that by “disengaging” it by building walls and stifling it that humanity would become stronger. Haywood maintains a strong god complex, although he hasn’t ever really admitted it. He’s verbally abusive to anyone who so much as breathes too close to him, obsessed with the idea that he must be perfect in order to prove his belief, and to top it all off he’s haunted by a childhood that destroyed who he could have been and brought him to this point.

Long story short, I wrote Haywood’s story for the final project. It was a blast to write and ended up being 9,868 words, nineteen pages when single spaced and on size eleven font, and that was my attempt to try to keep it short.

Even after I turned the paper in and got my grade back, Haywood in his fastidious and arrogant way kept pestering me. I had to write the whole story or he would probably never shut up. So I fleshed it out some more, changed the order of the scenes, and essentially wrote an entirely new story, only expecting it to break 15,000 words at most.

Seven months later, it was two o’clock in the afternoon at Starbucks where I had been since seven thirty that morning, and as my oldest brother texted me and told me he was on his way to pick me up I had just typed THE END on a document with 40,000 words titled Haywood Micaye.

And he still wouldn’t shut up.

It occurred to me as I sat there with my Grande Carmel Macchiato that if I wanted any peace of mind, I would have to do something I didn’t think I would be doing for another few years: I had to publish this thing. 

Which is fine and dandy unto itself, except that major publishing houses like Scholastic or HarperCollins receive so many submissions from people that they do not accept unsolicited manuscripts. In plain English, I couldn’t write a letter and shove my behemoth into a manila folder and send it to them myself. I needed a literary agent, who would pitch the book to the publisher and see if they could strike a hit. 

Which led to problem number two: literary agents solicit novels, and to reach novel definition, you are supposed to hit a minimum of 60-70k words, depending on what website you trusted. I was painfully short of this number, and if I were to try to go back through and fluff it up with extra words like a college paper it would create all kind of havoc. You don’t simply drop in 20,000 words into a story for the sheer, unadulterated joy of it. 1,000 words were they don’t belong can make your entire story seem slow and drag: multiply that by twenty and there would be no literary agent alive let alone a publisher stupid enough to accept my book. Besides that, I knew that when I edited it that there were going to be words removed, scenes tightened, and though I was going to go back and add an extra scene towards the beginning, it wouldn’t be enough to break 40k. 

These problems directed me to the world of self-publication, a venue I had hoped to avoid due to the fact that by using it anyone could get anything published, so there was, among the gems, a lot of works that needed more work than what they actually received in order to be compelling stories.

I didn't want Haywood  to be sub-par by any standards, so when I began looking around for ways I could gather funds to avoid that fate, I found my way here.


After I took time away from the story for a bit, I jumped back in and scribbled editing notes all over it in two sittings at the beginning of October. Presently, I am sending my story out to some of my beta readers to get it ready for professional eyes to further help it along.

My goal is simple: I want to make Haywood Micaye the best book I can make it, be it long or be it short. I want to create something I can be proud of. Most of all, though, I want to allow anyone even vaguely interested in my concept to help me along this journey I am embarking. I recently finished Amanda Palmer's The Art of Asking, and it actually inspired me to try my hand at crowdfunding in the first place.

I know that there are people out there beyond my friends and family who would be willing to help, and my call is directed towards you guys to come and help in any way you can, be it spreading the word or going so far as to donate yourselves. I have no doubt in my mind that this project can be successful; I just ask for your support as we trek this path as a community of people who want to see a story thrive.


One of the biggest problems I could see occurring in this project is that of my age. I am seventeen years old and attempting to publish a book. This means I have responsibilities and other activities to juggle while trying to work on this as well. That might delay some of my release dates slightly if I start to get overwhelmed with everything, but if these complications arise I will be open and express them on all of my social platforms. If you are willing to support me despite some things coming to you a little later than expected, I can promise you a quality story and quality rewards to go with it. 

If at any point you want to contact me or have questions about my book as it works through the developmental stages, I will be more than happy to answer them for you!

I appreciate all of your support and thank you tremendously for it! Virtual high five!

-Ashlynne Doyle
