I was painfully short of this number, and if I were to try to go back through and fluff it up with extra words like a college paper it would create all kind of havoc. You don’t simply drop in 20,000 words into a story for the sheer, unadulterated joy of it. 1,000 words were they don’t belong can make your entire story seem slow and drag: multiply that by twenty and there would be no literary agent alive let alone a publisher stupid enough to accept my book. Besides that, I knew that when I edited it that there were going to be words removed, scenes tightened, and though I was going to go back and add an extra scene towards the beginning, it wouldn’t be enough to break 40k. These problems directed me to the world of self-publication, a venue I had hoped to avoid due to the fact that by using it anyone could get anything published, so there was, among the gems, a lot of works that needed more work than what they actually received in order to be compelling stories.I didn't want Haywood  to be sub-par by any standards, so when I began looking around for ways I could gather funds to avoid that fate, I found my way here.After I took time away from the story for a bit, I jumped back in and scribbled editing notes all over it in two sittings at the beginning of October. Presently, I am sending my story out to some of my beta readers to get it ready for professional eyes to further help it along.My goal is simple: I want to make Haywood Micaye the best book I can make it, be it long or be it short. I want to create something I can be proud of. Most of all, though, I want to allow anyone even vaguely interested in my concept to help me along this journey I am embarking. I recently finished Amanda Palmer's The Art of Asking, and it actually inspired me to try my hand at crowdfunding in the first place.I know that there are people out there beyond my friends and family who would be willing to help, and my call is directed towards you guys to come and help in any way you can, be it spreading the word or going so far as to donate yourselves. I have no doubt in my mind that this project can be successful; I just ask for your support as we trek this path as a community of people who want to see a story thrive.One of the biggest problems I could see occurring in this project is that of my age. I am seventeen years old and attempting to publish a book. This means I have responsibilities and other activities to juggle while trying to work on this as well. That might delay some of my release dates slightly if I start to get overwhelmed with everything, but if these complications arise I will be open and express them on all of my social platforms. If you are willing to support me despite some things coming to you a little later than expected, I can promise you a quality story and quality rewards to go with it. If at any point you want to contact me or have questions about my book as it works through the developmental stages, I will be more than happy to answer them for you!I appreciate all of your support and thank you tremendously for it! Virtual high five!-Ashlynne Doyle

story:
Hi ! My name is Robin Lee! I am a Medical Intuitive and Wellness Coach. I help people to feel empowered and support them in healing themselves.  I have over 23 years of experience working with clients.  I listen to how people's choices affect their physical and emotional health, and their bodies. Stress, indecisiveness, and self-doubt can create mental strife, which leads to inflammation, pain, and disharmony in the body. I teach people how to find peace with their lives and decisions. I help people heal lifelong issues. My book. "Listen Up! Your Heart is Speaking!",  is a profound and easy-to-read guide that will teach you how to know the language of your Heart and how to be able to trust in its wisdom.

"Inside each of your hearts sits a vast amount of information. This knowledge can help you live a truly inspired life. Some call this intuition, some inspiration, and some simply awareness. Whatever you may call it, please remember, it is your Heart speaking to you!” - From “Listen Up! Your Heart is Speaking"

The more you feel, the easier it is to hear your Heart communicate, and the more at peace you will be in your life. That which we think, we feel. If you want to live a heart-centered and joy-filled life, my book is for you! I need your help so I can self-publish my book and share it with the world!

This Is a labor of love and your help means the world to me. It is an incredible honor to be able to share my wisdom and experience of the past 23 years with you. 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you for all of your support in advance! 

Here's what people are saying about my work.

"Robin saved my mind. There is no other way to say it. After seeing medical doctors who wanted to treat my anxiety and emotions with medicine, which made me feel even worse, I went into a health food store and was given Robin's card and  told to "just call her". The second I heard Robin's voice my anxiety dropped. She didn't judge me for anything I confided in her. She taught me to connect my mind to my body and understand how they interact. No mainstream doctor ever talked to me about this or taught me about this valuable tool. To have any of her wisdom accessible in book form would be a blessing to this world  Please help Robin get published!" -  Deirdre McKenna

"I had been very sick with a digestive ailment for 23 years. Top medical specialists in New York, Boston, San Francisco, and Baltimore concluded that it was a genetic condition and nothing could be done. I became so debilitated both physically and emotionally that I didn't know who I was anymore. Thanks to Robin's extraordinary gifts, I am healthy and happy today in ways I never imagined I could be. She helped me understand the emotional origins of my illness, unlocking a powerful process that healed my body and ultimately strengthened my family relationships and even my professional life. Let's help Robin get her book published so that others can be healed and empowered as I was." - Deborah Smith

"Robin was one of my key resources in overcoming a serious illness in 2015. No mean feat considering I was in Australia and Robin lives in the US. Having a tumor means being tossed and turned through a bewildering array of information from expert medical advice, Google searches, test results, books and the opinions of friends, family, colleagues and "taxi drivers". Robin helped me enormously by coaching me on how to listen to myself to choose the optimal treatment protocol from my shortlist. Doing nothing was not an option. The result was replacing overwhelm with a peace of mind and confidence that allowed me to simply focus on the treatment.  Robin was a godsend and I can't wait to read her book." - Derek B (Sydney and Los Angeles)

story:
In honour of Canada’s 150th birthday, Bundoran Press Publishing House will publish an anthology of short science fiction next year, entitled 49th Parallels: Alternative Canadian Histories and Futures. Stories will be sought from across Canada and around the world exploring what might have been – or what might yet be. The anthology will be edited by two-time Aurora winning editor, Hayden Trenholm.

“In 1904, Prime Minister Wilfred Laurier said ‘The 20th Century will be the Century of Canada’” said Trenholm, “and while it didn’t quite work out that way, it is easy to imagine how it could have or how the next century still might be. I look forward to seeing how both Canadian and non-Canadian writers explore this question.”

An all original anthology, which, if we meet our goal will pay at least 6 cents (Canadian) a word, 49th Parallels will follow on the heels of our previous four successful anthologies:

Blood and Water (2012) – an anthology of near future resource conflicts, Winner of the Aurora Award

Strange Bedfellows (2014) – an anthology of political science fiction, Aurora Award nominee, and

Second Contacts (2015) – stories set 50 years after First Contact. Winner of the Aurora Award.

Lazarus Risen (2016) -- stories of immortality and the biological singularity

Like Strange Bedfellows, this anthology will be edited by Hayden Trenholm, a four-time novelist and  an Aurora Award winning  short fiction writer and editor. We expect the anthology will be 85000-90000 words of original fiction. Though we expect this anthology may be of greatest interest to Canadian writers, we will be open to submissions to authors from around the world. There is, after all, no greater gift than to see yourself as others see you. Expected publication: October 2017

The Impact

You'll be helping us pay writers to create stories that might otherwise never have been written and how cool is that?

49th Parallels will turn a science fiction lens on Canada's past and its future in the world. The focus will be on scientific and technological changes but we're also keen on seeing how things might have turned out -- or might still turn out -- if economics or politics had taken a different turn. And why stop at Canada's borders? How would this large but sparsely populated nation have developed if the history of America, England, Russia or China had been dramatically different? The best thing about themed anthologies is discovering the magic good writers bring to the theme.

Our Perks

Contributors will get our thanks and recognition in the Acknowledgements as well as e-books, books (lots of books), Bundoran Press souvenirs, writing advice and critiquing from our editors, signed posters of cover art,  

What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

This is a flexible campaign and if we don't make our goal, the book will still appear with all funds raised going to paying writers. But, without our target amount, the pay rate will be lower. Help writers get paid a decent wage! 

Two years ago, we ran a campaign for Second Contacts. We didn't reach our fixed goal (and so none of the money) but we published the anthology anyway. Last year we only made part of our goal but directed all of the funds toward paying writers and Lazarus Risen was born. Because that's what we've been doing at Bundoran Press  for the last nine years -- making good books.

And, if we raise more than our goal?

Stretch Goals

The first $1000 raised beyond our goal will be used to further increase the anthology length beyond 90000 words.

Additional funds will further increase the pay rates UNLESS…

Super Stretch Goal

If we raise another $3600 – that is, $9000 total – we will publish a second anthology – starting at four cents a word and rising from there.

LIBERTY HALL

“This is Liberty Hall. You can spit on the mat and call the cat a bastard.” – A. Bertram Chandler

An anthology of Space Opera where anything goes – as long as the story is entertaining and thought-provoking. Want a story with a white male engineer as the hero? Go right ahead. Prefer gender-bending aliens in a communist space station? Sounds perfect. Left wing, right wing, no wings at all? Love it. Libertarian, authoritarian, democratic or group mind – if you can do it, we might publish it. Provided it’s a great story. Politics in service of a story – we don’t mind. Stories in service to your politics – keep them to yourself. Expected publication: Spring 2018

If we are able to publish a second anthology from this campaign, all those eligible to receive an e-book or print book will get a copy of the second anthology as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. Don't forget, Indiegogo has some simple sharing tools for you to use.

story:
Nightmare Soup is a collection of 30 short horror stories meant to terrify both kids and adults.

Each story is accompanied by a ghastly illustration from the mind of Andy Sciazko... the kind of illustrations that will disturb you in the best way possible. Here's a quick preview...

"Noodles" - A young boy on vacation in a far off country decides to try a local "delicacy." While extremely delicious... this dish isn't what it seems to be.


"Teeth" - Kids can be sensitive sometimes, so when Sarah heard she was being made fun of because of her teeth, she decided to reveal a little secret she had been keeping.


"Full Moon Guests" - Carrie and John are vacationing in the mountains until some unwelcome guests decide to show up. But these "guests" are in for a surprise they didn't count on.


"Blard's Burgers"- The newest burger joint in town has quickly made a name for itself, cooking up the most delicious burgers you could ever eat. But there's a special ingredient they don't want you to know about...


HELP US BRING THESE NIGHTMARES TO LIFE

We wanted to create a horror book that everyone could enjoy, so Nightmare Soup is free of major adult themes and extreme gore... but as you can see from the illustrations, you don't need adult themes and gore to create something truly creepy.

Our illustrator Andy Sciazko has been working in the horror genre ever since he first picked up a pencil, and has a special ability to make even the most normal objects look terrifying. The style and creativity of his images, combined with the storytelling of writer Jake Tri, are truly the stuff nightmares are made of.

We're extremely excited about how this project has progressed, and we can't wait to share the final product with everyone, but we need your help! Support our Indiegogo campaign and in exchange, we'll send you our awesomely horrifying book.

Happy nightmares everyone!

Jake and Andy

Risks and challenges

This project is fairly simple being that it's a book, so in terms of production it's pretty straightforward. Our biggest challenge would be if this explodes in popularity... but that's a challenge we would happily accept. We want to get these books into your hands in the quickest manner possible without getting bogged down in delays, so that's why the reward tiers and this Indiegogo campaign in general are so simplistic. Basically, if you support this campaign, we'll send you our awesome book. It's that easy.

story:
By donating just a small amount, not only you help me achieve my dream and be a part of something big, but you will have the opportunity to discover first hand not just the beauty of our island, but also the beauty that lies within your mind, body and soul. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book will be published in both English and Greek and the first 200 people to donate 30,00 euros will get a free e-book with a signed message by the author. The first 2000 euros will cover the corrections, the translation from the Greek to the English language and the designing of the cover. The remaining of the money will be used for printing 1500 books.

 

Even if you can't donate please share this, using the Indiegogo share tools, so that other people will see it

story:
Kedves Könyvbarátnők és Könyvbarátok!

 

A Womanpress - Phoenix Kiadó célja, hogy megismertessen néhány nagyon érdekes és értékes könyvet az olvasóközönséggel.

Ön is segíthet ebben! Ha támogatja a projektünket, részese lehet egy megvalósult álomnak!

A könyv előállításának és az alkotók honoráriumának költségei összesen 4200,- eurót tesznek ki, ennek egy részének összegyűjtéséhez kérjük a segítségüket.

 

Ki és mi a projekt?

 

Egy szlovákiai magyar írónő sikeres mesekönyvének folytatására kérjük a pénzt. Bolgár Katalin, aki fordítóként, tanárként, regényíróként is ismert, két regény, az Érdekek és érzelmek és a Krinolinba zárva című regény és egy meseköny, a Lili és Boti manói szerzője, és a Boszimesék Újbanyavárról című mesekönyv fordítója, ezúttal mesekönyve második részével jelentkezik Manós vakáció címmel, amelyet már szívrepesve várnak a kis olvasók.

Tilli és Villi manó ezúttal egy olaszországi nyaralásra kíséri el az iskolás Lilit és ovis kisöccsét Botit, és lépten-nyomon rengeteg kalamajkát okoznak.

A könyv különlegessége, hogy ezúttal ipolysági gyerekek illusztrációival jelenik meg, mégpedig annak az iskolának a diákjai alkották rajzokká és képekké a manók kalandjait, akik közül többen az írónő tanítványai is!

Ha támogatja projektünket, karácsonyra a manók kalandjaival szerezhet örömet az Önhöz közel álló kisgyerekeknek. A segítségért cserébe több ajándékkal is készültünk, amiket nagy örömmel postázunk majd Önnek.

 

És hogy mennyi pénzre van szükségünk?

 

3300,- euró az a pénz, amivel hozzásegíthetnek minket a könyv kiadásához. Nem kevés pénz ez, ha azonban sikerül ezt a célösszeget elérnünk, karácsonyra már kézbe vehetjük a nyomdából frissen érkező könyveket. Megajándékozhatjuk vele szeretteinket. Mi már most gondolunk a karácsonyra!

Ha mégsem sikerül, akkor kicsit csüggedten, de folytatjuk eddigi tevékenységünket.

De bízunk abban, hogy sok olyan könyvbarát, könyvbarátnő és irodalomolvasó van, aki támogatja a könyv megjelenését.

 

Mire is költjük majd ezt a pénzt?

 

Szerzői honoráriumra, hogy értékeljük a szerző alkotómunkáját: 700,- €

A grafikai elrendezésre és nyomdai előkészítésre, hogy a szöveg és a képek egymást kiegészítve növeljék az olvasás élményét: 500,- €

Szerkesztői honoráriumra, hogy a szöveg nyelvileg és szerkezetileg is tökéletes legyen: 300,- €

Nyomdaköltségre, hogy végül a szövegből és a képekből összeállított anyag a számítógépből kiváló minőségben a papírra kerüljön: 1800,- €

Bolgár Katalin, aki fordítóként, tanárként, regényíróként is ismert, két regény, az Érdekek és érzelmek és a Krinolinba zárva című regény és egy meseköny, a Lili és Boti manói szerzője, és a Boszimesék Újbanyavárról című mesekönyv fordítója, ezúttal mesekönyve második részével jelentkezik Manós vakáció címmel, amelyet már szívrepesve várnak a kis olvasók.
Tilli és Villi manó ezúttal egy olaszországi nyaralásra kíséri el az iskolás Lilit és ovis kisöccsét Botit, és lépten-nyomon rengeteg kalamajkát okoznak.
A könyv különlegessége, hogy ezúttal ipolysági gyerekek illusztrációival jelenik meg, mégpedig annak az iskolának a diákjai alkották rajzokká és képekké a manók kalandjait, akik közül többen az írónő tanítványai is!
Ha támogatja projektünket, karácsonyra a manók kalandjaival szerezhet örömet az Önhöz közel álló kisgyerekeknek. A segítségért cserébe több ajándékkal is készültünk, amiket nagy örömmel postázunk majd Önnek.
 
És hogy mennyi pénzre van szükségünk?
 
3300,- euró az a pénz, amivel hozzásegíthetnek minket a könyv kiadásához. Nem kevés pénz ez, ha azonban sikerül ezt a célösszeget elérnünk, karácsonyra már kézbe vehetjük a nyomdából frissen érkező könyveket. Megajándékozhatjuk vele szeretteinket. Mi már most gondolunk a karácsonyra!
Ha mégsem sikerül, akkor kicsit csüggedten, de folytatjuk eddigi tevékenységünket.
De bízunk abban, hogy sok olyan könyvbarát, könyvbarátnő és irodalomolvasó van, aki támogatja a könyv megjelenését.
 
Mire is költjük majd ezt a pénzt?
 
Szerzői honoráriumra, hogy értékeljük a szerző alkotómunkáját: 700,- €
A grafikai elrendezésre és nyomdai előkészítésre, hogy a szöveg és a képek egymást kiegészítve növeljék az olvasás élményét: 500,- €
Szerkesztői honoráriumra, hogy a szöveg nyelvileg és szerkezetileg is tökéletes legyen: 300,- €
Nyomdaköltségre, hogy végül a szövegből és a képekből összeállított anyag a számítógépből kiváló minőségben a papírra kerüljön: 1800,- €

story:
Project Summary

 

The Revolution of Dignity wasn't my first revolution in Ukraine. I witnessed the Orange Revolution in 2004/5 also. Ukraine has been my adopted home for 14 years and in that time I have learned to respect and admire much about the country and the people of the country.

 

I understood the reasons why the Revolution of Dignity, originally called EuroMaidan, started. With the Maidan Square being just a short walk away from both my office and my home I found the allure of witnessing history impossible to resist and so I was on Maidan almost every day throughout the 93 days of struggle against the cruel and corrupt Yanukovych regime. I stood there when Maidan was jubilant, and I stood there when Maidan mourned.

 

During this period ordinary men and women, young and old, became heroes. They stood firm in the face of relentless pressure resulting from the dirty tricks of the incumbent regime. As the revolution wore on that regime lost all legitimacy, not only were they illegitimate because of the mass looting of state resources that led to the revolution, but their illegitimacy was compounded throughout the revolution by the abduction, torture, and murder of activists and the tactic to throw hordes of violent thugs on the streets of Kyiv to intimidate protesters. This is only part of the story.

 

 

About The Author

 

Since the end of the revolution I have written close to 50 articles about Ukraine and events affecting Ukraine. My writing has been published in the Kyiv Post, Novya Vremya Magazine, Business Ukraine magazine and by the Washington, D.C. think tank The Atlantic Council.

 

Some of my articles have covered certain elements of the revolution, but with this book I intend to deliver the most complete chronicle of the revolution yet published. This is a story worthy of understanding because these events in Ukraine will help shape the future of the entire post-Soviet space, and for this reason there has been a concerted attempt to discredit the revolution. I intend to set the record straight, and do so in memory of those who gave their lives fighting for justice, freedom, and for the basic human rights the authorities of the time tried to deny them on many occasions throughout this period.

 

Much of the material for this book is already written, during the revolution I collected many photographs and shared many articles explaining events in Ukraine at that time. This book will contain many of them, and tell one of the most important stories of modern times, with my own commentary, in real time as it unfolded.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS CLOSED...BUT THERE IS A NEW ONE! CONTRIBUTE TO THE REVAMPED CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN FOR THE CITY AT https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/90294662/t...

Zac Kaplan is not your average graduate mergers and acquisitions lawyer. He listens to the "Wicked" soundtrack on his way to the bus-stop and reads Henry James on the ride to work, he cries at modern art exhibitions and at the ballet, and can recite more soliloquies from Hamlet than sections of the Companies Act. And he's just been poached by the best law firm in the world and transplanted from the seaside paradise of Sydney to the squalid heart of the corporate machine in London, to work with the most ruthless deal-maker at Saul & Gates.

Zac's big break finds him trapped in a rat-wheel of 18 hour working days churning out contracts under the nose of his draconian supervisor, sleeping in 'rest pods' in the building's basement and drinking Victory Gin that is wheeled out to the middle of the office floor on the regular Friday 'drinks trolley'. But in a moment of desperation, Zac hatches a plot to transform this Orwellian nightmare into an extravaganza worthy of one of his favourite West-end musicals. He learns to imbue fabulousness into the most unlikely of scenes, exploring every nook and cranny of the absurd world of M & A by day, and by night wrecking a trail of mischief across London's iconic urban playgrounds.

Against the historical backdrop of Brexit and a society caving on itself, the unlikely hero's adventures take him through the boardrooms of FTSE-100 companies, the underground parties of London's Elite and the print-room of the least architecturally inspired skyscraper in EC1. He uncovers scandal, corruption and most importantly, the true definition of success in the age of post-neoliberalism.

"The City" is a work that captures the coming of age of the Milennials, conveying the disillusionment of realising the price of achieving your dreams. It is an epic work of fiction and a milieu-defining piece, a snapshot of the angst and ecstasy of a city in flux and a world that still seems to revolve around it. The combination of biting satire and tremendous heart makes "The City" the archetypal twenty-first century urban odyssey.

This excerpt from Sam Bookatz's online 'short-form psychiatric memoir', "UNMEDICATED" (available to read with the rest of Bookatz's non-fiction portfolio at www.sambookatz.com) summarises the real-life events that inspiredThe City:

"After eleven consecutive sleepless nights in the serviced flat in which I had been put up, which itself looked across a narrow City lane directly into the offices of a rival law firm (where at least 20% of the lawyers were working through the nights which I wasn’t, the light from their offices blearing through the cheap blinds on my full-length bedroom windows), I found myself grasping onto my last slim threads of my sanity. After some frantic Googling, I headed towards the reception desk of a De Beauvoir NHS clinic with a week-long waiting list for appointments, begging for someone to write me a script for the medications I knew might have the potential to carry me through one of the most violent psychic storms I had ever experienced. The most solid East-End lass you’ve ever met agreed to see me. She wrote the scripts, and made a space for me as her last patient every Tuesday thereafter at 8.30pm just because "I’m worried about you, love”, letting me pour my heart out for as long as I wanted (which was not very long, because I was too anxious to get back from my work ‘dinner break'). God save the NHS!

But then, after the three darkest months of my life (which, considering the nature of the years that preceded it, I think is really saying something), most of which was spent in the Panopticon-like prison of my shared office, the sun came out on a crisp May morning in London Fields, where the wildflowers were already in bloom, to illuminate the true nature of the events of that bitterly cold March. It became abundantly clear that what that year’s 'breakdown' had signified was that the throbbing intuitive organ buried deep inside of me, which had either been neglected, medically straightjacketed or downright abused for most my life, had suddenly found itself an open stage and an uncovered microphone, and sensing the immense danger that lay ahead and in one final attempt to make itself heard, had yelled with all its might. And because at the time, I hadn’t yet learned to listen to my intuition even when it was speaking at a normal volume, now that it was screaming like a raving lunatic could only make out:

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!??!!!????!!!!!?????!!??!!!!!!>><<>>##@@##$$$&(+[“;/@#$%!!###$%%^&&&^%$%$!!!@@@@:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(:(

▄︻̷̿┻̿═━一    ▄︻̷̿┻̿═━一     

            And because most of my life I had been conditioned to believe that any overly-emotional or seemingly self-sabotaging behaviour I had ever exhibited was attributable to a horrible, incurable mental illness (whether that be homosexuality or ‘bipolar disorder’), I was of course completely freaked out by this sudden, 24/7 unstoppable screaming. I never questioned whether something could actually be wrong outside of my head. As far I was concerned, a lifelong, incurable disease had just ‘flared up’ again. And I took what I thought was the sensible, responsible course of action, which was to not tell anyone, to keep calm, and seek medical attention. I didn’t miss a single day of work despite my ‘utilisation’ continuing to exceed 120% for my first couple of months (just so non-lawyers understand how horrific a figure that is, 120% utilisation means 12 hours of billable work recorded per day, which requires at least 16 hours to actually be spent in the office, every day). I was too scared (and too busy) to tell anyone in Australia about my 'relapse', which fortunately meant that there wasn’t an opportunity for my family to corroborate my self-diagnosis, and panic me further, and tell me how I had to immediately return home to go straight into a psychiatric clinic. Although it was horrendously lonely, just sitting in that office dealing with all of it on my own gave my slow-on-the-uptake 'conscious mind' the time it needed in the corporate trenches (where, though over 100% of my time was required, only about 7% of intellectual capacity was needed for the monkey work I was actually doing) to work out that I hadn’t been ill at all (or at least not before I made myself so) and that my instinctive reaction of revulsion had been entirely rational and justified. It took all that time for my supposedly terrifically clever brain to work out what had taken my intuition only a matter of minutes, and to properly decipher the message that had almost been mistranslated as a command to commit a tragic and irreversible act, a message that actually was instructing the rest of me to:

GET OUT! GET OUT NOW! GET OUT WHILE YOU STILL CAN! GO! GO NOW! DO NOT PASS ‘GO’, DO NOT COLLECT TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS! JUST GET OUT OF HERE! THIS IS NOT A GOOD PLACE! THIS IS AZKABAN! LOOK AT THESE PEOPLE!!! THEY ARE DEATH EATERS!! THIS IS YOUR SOUL SPEAKING AND I DO NOT WANT TO BE EATEN!! What are you doing there on the edge of that bed? What are those – deep breathing exercise? Do you think you’ve become immune to anxiety-triggered insomnia just because you’ve been doing yoga for a year? FUCK YOGA – JUST LISTEN TO ME!!! I KNOW WHAT’S GOING ON HERE, WHEREAS YOU CLEARLY NEVER HAVE AND NEVER WILL! I’ve been trying to keep you away from this place anyway I could for the past five years, but now that you’ve finally gone and stuck your nose right up to the abyss, I’m just going to have to bring out every piece of heavy artillery at my disposal to stop you falling in. I’M NOT GOING TO LET YOU SLEEP! NO SLEEP!! NO WAY, JOSE! You can sleep as much as you want once you are the hell away from this giant corporate incinerator that will swallow you up into its squalid belly and spit you out into another contract laying machine like the rows of suited battery hens rotting in their glass cages just outside your bedroom window! Just go take another look if you need proof. See what I mean? LOOK AT THEM!! Look at that forty year-old hag in a crinkled Marks and Spencer blazer almost collapsing onto her keyboard. Do you know how old she actually is? TWENTY-SEVEN!!! She was probably also a starry-eyed hot shot from somewhere nice and sunny when she arrived at the ‘magic circle’ three years ago. And just look at her now! THAT’S MAGIC FOR YOU!!!! Do you want to be that hag in three years? NO! THE ANSWER IS NO! FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, CHOOSE LIFE! ACTUAL LIFE, NOT TRAINSPOTTING-IRONIC-LIFE! Just pack your things, leave the key under the mat, take the lift down to Ground, tip the nice door-man, get in a cab and L-E-A-V-E!!!!!!

Or something along those lines (wait for the novel for a longer, more eloquent description, without any J.K. Rowling or Danny Boyle allusions – there will only be middle to highbrow literary allusions in the novel). But somehow, even once I had decoded this exceptionally clear, direct message from my gut, I managed to rationalise myself out of listening to it immediately. I made a long list of reasons for staying at the job even though I knew it was making me miserable, the least romantic of which was that I would have owed the firm a whole heap of money from all the strings-attached sweeteners they had offered when they still thought they needed to woe me over from paradise (sweeteners which soon after being greedily gulped down left a too-good-to-be-true, sick-to-my-stomach aftertaste that now makes complete sense). Other reasons for staying included ‘not wanting to be a quitter’, not quite being ready to walk away from such a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity (please God, let it have just been once!!), and desperately not wanting to go back to Australia for reasons that only became clear when I was eventually forced to return. Despite having felt like I was lucky to have got through those three months in London alive, Australia still seemed like an even greater hell and one that I had only just escaped from. So I conjured up an extraordinarily fanciful plan, one borne out of sheer desperation and perhaps fuelled by the close-to-hypomanic state in which I may or may not have been at the time (who will ever know?) The plan was to keep participating in the Hunger Games of the City of London, but to start making everyone else start playing according to my own rules. And I’d do this by reconstructing the remainder of my Training Contract as being a ‘field research mission’ (from which I could walk away at any time) for the revolutionary novel I was going to write at the end, one which was going to be so inspiring and widely read that it was going to turn the sordid, sequestered world of corporate law inside out. I thus reimagined the experience through which I was only an eighth of the way from being an introduction to a lifelong career in which I was inevitably going to be found dead at my desk, to being a thrilling escapade of espionage, and a noble sacrifice of a small chunk of my precious youth for the sake of the betterment of humankind."

story:
Greetings!

My name is Melica Niccole and I would like to tell you about my children's book called Naturals: The Paper People. This book  was created as a tribute for kids and people with natural hair, to showcase that people of different ages and genders can have natural hair. The book is about Zee Baby300 who is 3 years old. Zee Baby300 introduces the audience to her family, friends, and famous people who have natural hair. The images in the book includes: Zee Baby300, her family, Solange, Nina Simone, and more. This book is an important topic to tackle because it allows children to understand their hair and to start questions questions, such as: Why do I have curly hair? Why do I have straight hair? What different things can I do with my hair? What is natural hair?

So I know you are asking yourself, what is my role in the project and where is the funding going? Your contribution will be used to create 200 books on CD, which includes creation of the CDs, packaging, and marketing. Creation and packing will cost about $5-$10 per CD. In regards to marketing, various avenues will be used, such as Ads on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and other marketing methods. Marketing for this project will cost between $200 - $300. Helping to fund Naturals: The Paper People (Children's Book on CD) will allow you to fund a child based project that was created for the sole purpose of creating different techniques for reading. 

What Do You Get For Contributing? 

Below, you will find information on different levels of contribution. 

$50- Listed as a contributor

$100- Listed as a contributor on CD and copy of book on CD

$150- Listed as a contributor on CD, copy of book on CD, and listed on website. 

$200- Listed as a contributor, copy of book on CD, listed on website , featured in ME! Newsletter, and shout out on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

If my goal of $1500 is not reached, the money will go into creating and packaging the product. Marketing will be done on a smaller scale, possibly using free advertising efforts.

Why Is Your Contribution Important?

You contribution is important because you have an opportunity in assisting in distributing an amazing project that can be incorporated in schools, after-school programs, community based programs, and other services catering to children. Let's work together in helping children listen to stories read by other children. 

Risks & Challenges

Potential risks and challenges in obtaining $1500: 

  • Entering the holiday season many families may be on limited incomes due to previously purchased items. I can work on marketing this project as a way to start early shopping for birthdays and the holiday season for 2017. 
  • Getting individuals to buy into your project. I will continuously market items on website and social media networks. I will also use a Children's Book Festival platform that was developed by Hampton Publishing House, LLC and ADC Kid.
  • Not getting all the money needed for the project. In the event that the project raises less than requested, I will look into other avenues to get things done. This includes marketing by using free services and at various book festivals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this information on your social media accounts
  • Talk to your friends and family about this effort
  • Suggest various business or people who may be interested in this campaign.

Let's make this project grand!

 

Melica Niccole
story_txt:
Greetings!
My name is Melica Niccole and I would like to tell you about my children's book called Naturals: The Paper People. This book  was created as a tribute for kids and people with natural hair, to showcase that people of different ages and genders can have natural hair. The book is about Zee Baby300 who is 3 years old. Zee Baby300 introduces the audience to her family, friends, and famous people who have natural hair. The images in the book includes: Zee Baby300, her family, Solange, Nina Simone, and more. This book is an important topic to tackle because it allows children to understand their hair and to start questions questions, such as: Why do I have curly hair? Why do I have straight hair? What different things can I do with my hair? What is natural hair?
So I know you are asking yourself, what is my role in the project and where is the funding going? Your contribution will be used to create 200 books on CD, which includes creation of the CDs, packaging, and marketing. Creation and packing will cost about $5-$10 per CD. In regards to marketing, various avenues will be used, such as Ads on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and other marketing methods. Marketing for this project will cost between $200 - $300. Helping to fund Naturals: The Paper People (Children's Book on CD) will allow you to fund a child based project that was created for the sole purpose of creating different techniques for reading. 

What Do You Get For Contributing? 
Below, you will find information on different levels of contribution. 
$50- Listed as a contributor
$100- Listed as a contributor on CD and copy of book on CD

$200- Listed as a contributor, copy of book on CD, listed on website , featured in ME! Newsletter, and shout out on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.
If my goal of $1500 is not reached, the money will go into creating and packaging the product. Marketing will be done on a smaller scale, possibly using free advertising efforts.

Why Is Your Contribution Important?
You contribution is important because you have an opportunity in assisting in distributing an amazing project that can be incorporated in schools, after-school programs, community based programs, and other services catering to children. story:
What makes our book special?

It empowers children from a vulnerable community

Our twelve storytellers live in Ferentari, a Bucharest neighborhood that is home to one of the city’s most disenfranchised communities. While the children’s daily life may be marred by insecurity and poverty, when they come together, they open up: they are bright, playful, and inquisitive. We genuinely believe that being part of a writing project will enhance their creativity and pride.  

It promotes empathy and cultural sensitivity

Certain stories help us grow stronger and kinder: they are powerful tools of openness and empathy. Understanding and appreciating of children and people from minority groups is sadly not an established aspect of education in Romania at present. We believe that our society would be stronger and richer if this were the case, and our project is a step towards this goal. 

It raises awareness about the representation of diversity in Romania

Our book will be one of the very few illustrated children’s books with both Roma and non-Roma characters ever published worldwide. We hope it will raise awareness about the importance of different narratives in Romania, and that it will be the first book out of many to go this path.

It brings together two of Romania’s best-loved authors

Adina Rosetti and Irina Dobrescu are both celebrated authors of children’s books. They are part of the new wave of Romanian contemporary children’s literature that flourished over the past ten years.

Adina is a beloved author of adults and children’s books alike. She wrote Miss Aftertomorrow and the Game of Time, that was featured in The White Ravens, the Frankfurt International Book Fair in 2015, as one of the most beautiful children's books in the world and Why do witches fly on brooms…and other ten fantastic questions. She won several national literary prizes for her work; she is also a reporter, editor and contributor writer for various publications.

Irina is a celebrated illustrator of children’s books and one of the few female comics artists from Romania. She studied at the National University of Fine Arts in Bucharest until 2003 and co-founded the Illustrators Club in Romania. She illustrated numerous children’s books and she won the Arthur Prize (a prestigious national literary prize) in 2014 for writing and illustrating The Story of a Poker Playing Wolf.

Who are we?

The New Storytellers is the first project of Cu Alte Cuvinte (In Other Words), a Romanian NGO working to promote diversity in children’s literature. At Cu Alte Cuvinte, we believe that authors need to go beyond stereotypes and embody characters that belong to one of Romania’s largest minority groups, the Roma.
Our main partner in this project is the Alternative Education Club at the Policy Center for Roma and Minorities, a non-formal program that currently organizes remedial education and mentoring activities for over 200 children from Ferentari. We also have a partnership with the Global Shapers Bucharest Hub.
You are invited to be a part of our journey to bring their stories to light!

What We Need

We need your help to:

- support the authors to work on this project

Adina and  Irina will spend two months with our storytellers, in a series of twelve workshops. The children will develop stories through creative games, drawings, short video recordings, and writing. The workshops have two purposes: on the one hand, they allow them to collect personal stories that will inform the writing and illustrating process; on the other hand, they will enhance the participants’ creativity and to develop their storytelling skills. 
Furthermore, the authors will meet up with different members of the Ferentari community, to better understand its challenges. 
They will then spend from four to six months to write and illustrate the resulting book. 
To support them during this creative process, we will offer them a grant from the funds we raise.

- organize the logistics of the workshops

We will provide healthy snacks and school supplies to our storytellers.

- print the first 500 copies of the book and send them to local school libraries and NGOs

Here is the breakdown of our expenses:

Goal: 10,500$
30% - Writer grant (workshops, research & writing)
30% - Illustrator grant (workshops, research & illustration)
15% - Publishing
10% - Workshops logistics 
10% - Administration
5% - Indiegogo fee

Click here for a more detailed bugdet. 

What You Get

We have prepared plenty of goodies to remind you of this unique creative journey:

The hardcover book 
Our beautifully illustrated book will be delivered anywhere in the world. If there is interest, we would like to translate it in English and Romani.

A toolkit with fun learning activities inspired by the book
Are you an educator or a parent? You will receive an education kit, with fun activities inspired by our book and designed by our team.

Illustrated bookmarks
Choose an illustration from the book and we will send it to you as two beautiful bookmarks.   

Printed tote bags
Choose an illustration from the book, and we will print it on a tote bag for you.

Donation certificates
You will get a personalized donation certificate, decorated with an illustration of your choice.

Your impact

By supporting The New Storytellers, you will:
- contribute to the creation of one the very few worldwide children’s books that feature Roma and non-Roma characters;
- contribute to the empowerment of Roma kids and the social inclusion of all children;
- contribute to the development of new education tools: our book, as well as our education toolkit, could be used by educators and parents as well;
- help us to make our project grow: its success would allow us (and other) to continue promoting diversity through other books, illustrations, and other media. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family, friends, your colleagues, people who care and can help.

 © Irina Dobrescu

_____________________________________________________________________________

 

Noii Povestitori: proiect de literatură a diversității în România

Ajută-ne să creăm o carte pentru copii cu eroi romi, inspirată de copii de etnie romă.

Prin proiectul Noii Povestitori, un grup de copii de etnie romă dintr-un cartier mărginaș din București va participa la doisprezece ateliere de storytelling ținute de doua autoare indragite din România.  Poveștile lor vor fi sursă de inspirație pentru o carte de ficțiune ilustrată pe care o vom publica și vom dona 500 de exemplare școlilor din comunitățile vulnerabile si diverselor ONG-uri.

De ce este importantă cartea noastra?

Ii ajută pe copiii dintr-o comunitate marginalizată să își dezvolte încrederea în sine

Povestitorii noştri locuiesc în Ferentari, un cartier bucureştean care găzduieşte una dintre cele mai dezavantajate comunităţi ale oraşului. Deşi existenţa lor cotidiană este îngreunată de inegalităţi şi de nesiguranţa zilei de mâine, atunci când se întâlnesc sunt deschiși, cu poftă de joacă şi de cunoaştere. Credem cu tărie că partipând la proiecte de scriere si creativitate, ei își vor putea dezvolta creativitatea și stima de sine.

Promoveaza empatia si acceptarea diferențelor culturale

Uneori poveștile ne ajută să creștem mai puternici și mai generoși, ele fiind instrumente puternice pentru dezvoltarea toleranței și a empatiei față de cei din jur. Integrarea și punerea în valoare a copiilor, și în general a persoanelor din grupurile minoritare etnice, nu face deocamdata parte, din păcate, din prioritățile sistemului de învățământ românesc. Considerăm că societatea noastra ar fi mai puternică și mai bogată daca am merge in direcția aceasta, iar proiectul nostru este un pas înainte către acest obiectiv.

Sensibilizează opinia publică în ceea ce privește reprezentarea diversității în România

Cartea care va rezulta va fi una din puținele cărți pentru copii cu personaje atât rome cât si re-rome, publicată vreodată în lume. Sperăm că prin aceasta carte vom atrage atenția asupra importanței de a reprezenta realități diferite în poveștile din țara noastră, și că va fi una dintre multele carți de acest fel care vor urma.

Aduce impreuna doua indragite autoare

Adina Rosetti si Irina Dobrescu sunt printre cele mai indragite autoare de literatura pentru copii din Romania. Ele fac parte din noul val al literaturii pentru copii care a aparut in Romania in ultimii zece ani.

Adina este o îndrăgită scriitoare de literatură pentru adulți și copii. A scris Domnișoara Poimâine și  joaca de-a Timpul, selectată în catalogul “The White Ravens”, cu cele mai frumoase 200 cărți pentru copii din lume, lansat în cadrul Târgului internațional de carte de la Frankfurt 2015. Cea mai recentă apariție este De ce zboară vrăjitoarele pe cozi de mătură (și alte 10 intrebări fantastice). A câștigat mai multe premii literare naționale și colaborează ca jurnalistă cu numeroase publicații.

Irina este o binecunoscută ilustratoare de cărţi pentru copii şi una dintre rarele artiste de bandă desenată din România. A studiat la Universitatea Naţională de Arte din Bucureşti până în 2003 şi este cofondatoarea Clubului Ilustratorilor din România. A ilustrat numeroase cărţi pentru copii şi a câştigat Premiul Arthur în 2014 pentru Povestea unui lup jucător de poker, pe care a scris-o şi ilustrat-o.

Cine suntem?

Noii Povestitori este primul proiect al asociației Cu Alte Cuvinte, un ONG care își propune să promoveze diversitatea în literatura pentru copii din România. Echipa noastră crede că autorii români trebuie să creeze artă și literatură dincolo de stereotipuri și să aducă în cărțile lor personaje care să-i reprezinte și pe romi, unul dintre cele mai mari grupuri etnice minoritare din România.

Partenerul nostru principal în cadrul acestui proiect este Clubul de Educație Alternativa al Policy Center for Roma and Minorities, un program non-formal care organizează activități de educație remedială și de mentorat pentru peste 200 de copii din Ferentari. Suntem parteneri si cu Global Shapers Bucharest Hub.

Va invităm să ne fiți alături în această călătorie umană și literară care să facă posibilă scrierea unor povești în general nespuse!

De ce avem nevoie

Avem nevoie de ajutorul vostru pentru:
- a susține autorii să lucreze la acest proiect:
Adina si Irina vor petrece două luni cu povestitorii noștri, în cadrul a douăsprezece ateliere de storytelling. Copiii vor crea povești prin jocuri creative, desene, înregistrări scurte și scriere.

Atelierele au două obiective principale: pe de-o parte, le vor permite să se inspire din poveștile copiilor pentru scrierea și ilustrarea cărții; de de altă parte, aceste întâlniri între copii și cele două autoare le va dezvolta creativitatea și aptitudinile de povestitori.
Mai mult decat atât, autorii se vor întâlni cu diverși membri ai comunității din Ferentari pentru a înțelege cât mai bine provocările comunității. 
Vor petrece între patru și sase luni să scrie și să ilustreze cartea inspirată din poveștile copiilor.
Pentru a le susține de-a lungul acestui proces, le vom oferi granturi de creație.

- a organiza atelierele cu copiii din punct de vedere logistic:
Le vom oferi micilor povestitori rechizite și gustări sănătoase.

- pentru a printa primele 500 de exemplare ale cărții și a le distribui gratuit în bibliotecile școlilor din comunitate și în diverse ONG-uri.

Cheltuielile noastre vor fi împărțite în felul următor:
Buget de implementare : 10.500$
30% - grant pentru scriitor (ateliere, documentare și manuscrisul cărții)
30% - grant pentru ilustrator (ateliere, cercetare și ilustrarea cărții)
15% - printul și publicarea a 500 de exemplare
10% - organizarea logistică pentru atelierele cu copiii
10% - muncă administrativă
5% - taxa Indiegogo

Consultă aici un buget mai detaliat.

Ce îți oferim

Am pregătit o mulțime de cadouri pe care le vom dărui celor ce se îmbarcă alături de noi în această călătorie creativă:

Cartea tipărită
Vom trimite cartea ilustrată oriunde în lume. In funcție de interesul manifestat, vom încerca să creăm și versiunea în limba engleză a cărții.

Un ghid pedagogic cu activități  ludice inspirate din carte
Ești părinte sau profesor? Vei primi ghidul nostru pedagogic, cu activități ludice inspirate din cartea noilor povestitori și concepute de echipa noastră.

Semne de carte ilustrate
Semnele de carte vor fi printate cu un desen pe care îl vei alege chiar tu din ilustrațiile cartii.

Sacoșe cu imprimeu
Sacoșele vor fi imprimate cu o ilustrație pe care o vei alege chiar tu din ilustrațiile cartii.

Certificate de donator 
Vei primi un certificat personalizat, decorat cu ilustrația ta preferată.

Impactul donației tale

Donând pentru Noii Povestitori:
-    contribui la crearea uneia dintre puținele cărți pentru copii din lume ce pune în scenă atât personaje rome dar și ne-rome;
-    contribui la crearea unor eroi puternici și pozitivi cu care copiii romi se vor putea identifica și deci indirect la o incluziune sociala mai reușita a acestor copii;
-    contribui la publicarea unui nou instrument pedagogic: cartea noastră, alături de ghidul pedagogic, vor putea fi folosite atât de educatori cât și de părinți;
-    ne ajuți să facem un prim pas greu — o primă carte tipărită înseamnă un precedent fericit pentru proiectul Noii Povestitori și o șansă mai bună în a găsi finanțări pentru volumele urmatoare. Ne ajuți să promovăm diversitatea culturală în cărți, ilustrații și mass-media.

Alte modalități prin care ne poți ajuta


Te rugăm să dai informația mai departe, transmițând campania noastră atât familiei, prietenilor și colegilor tăi dar și celor din jurul tău  care sunt sensibili la cauza noastra și își doresc să ne susțină financiar.

 © Irina Dobrescu

Echipa noastră crede că autorii români trebuie să creeze artă și literatură dincolo de stereotipuri și să aducă în cărțile lor personaje care să-i reprezinte și pe romi, unul dintre cele mai mari grupuri etnice minoritare din România.Partenerul nostru principal în cadrul acestui proiect este Clubul de Educație Alternativa al Policy Center for Roma and Minorities, un program non-formal care organizează activități de educație remedială și de mentorat pentru peste 200 de copii din Ferentari. Suntem parteneri si cu Global Shapers Bucharest Hub.Va invităm să ne fiți alături în această călătorie umană și literară care să facă posibilă scrierea unor povești în general nespuse!De ce avem nevoieAvem nevoie de ajutorul vostru pentru:- a susține autorii să lucreze la acest proiect:Adina si Irina vor petrece două luni cu povestitorii noștri, în cadrul a douăsprezece ateliere de storytelling. Copiii vor crea povești prin jocuri creative, desene, înregistrări scurte și scriere.Atelierele au două obiective principale: pe de-o parte, le vor permite să se inspire din poveștile copiilor pentru scrierea și ilustrarea cărții; de de altă parte, aceste întâlniri între copii și cele două autoare le va dezvolta creativitatea și aptitudinile de povestitori.Mai mult decat atât, autorii se vor întâlni cu diverși membri ai comunității din Ferentari pentru a înțelege cât mai bine provocările comunității. Vor petrece între patru și sase luni să scrie și să ilustreze cartea inspirată din poveștile copiilor.Pentru a le susține de-a lungul acestui proces, le vom oferi granturi de creație.- a organiza atelierele cu copiii din punct de vedere logistic:Le vom oferi micilor povestitori rechizite și gustări sănătoase.- pentru a printa primele 500 de exemplare ale cărții și a le distribui gratuit în bibliotecile școlilor din comunitate și în diverse ONG-uri.Cheltuielile noastre vor fi împărțite în felul următor:Buget de implementare : 10.500$30% - grant pentru scriitor (ateliere, documentare și manuscrisul cărții)30% - grant pentru ilustrator (ateliere, cercetare și ilustrarea cărții)15% - printul și publicarea a 500 de exemplare10% - organizarea logistică pentru atelierele cu copiii10% - muncă administrativă5% - taxa IndiegogoConsultă aici un buget mai detaliat.Ce îți oferimAm pregătit o mulțime de cadouri pe care le vom dărui celor ce se îmbarcă alături de noi în această călătorie creativă:Cartea tipărităVom trimite cartea ilustrată oriunde în lume. In funcție de interesul manifestat, vom încerca să creăm și versiunea în limba engleză a cărții.Un ghid pedagogic cu activități  ludice inspirate din carteEști părinte sau profesor? Vei primi ghidul nostru pedagogic, cu activități ludice inspirate din cartea noilor povestitori și concepute de echipa noastră.Semne de carte ilustrateSemnele de carte vor fi printate cu un desen pe care îl vei alege chiar tu din ilustrațiile cartii.Sacoșe cu imprimeuSacoșele vor fi imprimate cu o ilustrație pe care o vei alege chiar tu din ilustrațiile cartii.Certificate de donator Vei primi un certificat personalizat, decorat cu ilustrația ta preferată.Impactul donației taleDonând pentru Noii Povestitori:-    contribui la crearea uneia dintre puținele cărți pentru copii din lume ce pune în scenă atât personaje rome dar și ne-rome;-    contribui la crearea unor eroi puternici și pozitivi cu care copiii romi se vor putea identifica și deci indirect la o incluziune sociala mai reușita a acestor copii;-    contribui la publicarea unui nou instrument pedagogic: cartea noastră, alături de ghidul pedagogic, vor putea fi folosite atât de educatori cât și de părinți;-    ne ajuți să facem un prim pas greu — o primă carte tipărită înseamnă un precedent fericit pentru proiectul Noii Povestitori și o șansă mai bună în a găsi finanțări pentru volumele urmatoare. Ne ajuți să promovăm diversitatea culturală în cărți, ilustrații și mass-media.Alte modalități prin care ne poți ajutaTe rugăm să dai informația mai departe, transmițând campania noastră atât familiei, prietenilor și colegilor tăi dar și celor din jurul tău  care sunt sensibili la cauza noastra și își doresc să ne susțină financiar. © Irina Dobrescu

story:
Images of America: The San Geronimo Valley

Hello Friends and Neighbors,

Did you know that the first telephone line in California was installed by Alexander Graham Bell himself on the Maillard ranch in Woodacre? That after the Mexican rancho system dissolved, Paul Revere's grandson Joseph Revere owned the land we now live on? The Valley has a rich past, and it is time for it to be documented! Now, with a publishing agreement from Arcadia Publishing, I have the chance to write a local history book that does just that.

A bit about myself. My name is Owen Clapp - I was born in New York City, but moved with my family to Woodacre in 1993. Growing up here was a magical experience, and I've developed a very deep love for, and connection to, this area. My fondest memories are of playing in the creeks and hills of Woodacre and Lagunitas, the playground at West Marin Montessori, the multipurpose room at Lagunitas School. Since high school I've dreamed about creating a book that tells the unique story of the people and events that make the Valley what it is.

In December I moved back to Woodacre after almost eight years in Los Angeles, where I studied music and anthropology at UCLA, and began a career as a professional musician. Those eight years in L.A., and having traveled around the world as a musician, inform my perspective that the Valley is a truly special place. Now that I am back home, this is the perfect moment to dedicate my time and energy to this project that I am so passionate about.

The funds from this campaign are essential, as Arcadia Publishing does not provide any sort of advance or stipend for their authors. Those funds will help me cover the time and expenses that go into the research and writing stages of this book.

A well funded campaign will ensure that this book is of the highest possible quality that it can be!

What We Need & What You Get

More specifically, contributions will go to three areas:

  • Photo rights and scanning fees
  • Research expenses, such as online journal access
  • Videography costs for aerial drone landscape footage and taped interviews

Pledgers will receive discounted copies of the final product, access to an online archive of historic valley photos, and the more perks to be announced!

The Impact

I feel that this project is important for a few reasons:

  • The San Geronimo Valley is the only community within Marin that does not have a commercially available history book.
  • At a moment in time when demographics are changing all over the Bay Area, now seems like the time to document the beauty of our history.
  • Books like Images of America bring communities together; in the Valley I imagine this project could bring us together in new ways.

Risks & Challenges

This project is not without its challenges. I have considered the conflicts that could arise and how to handle them.

    • Challenge: There is so much history and so many aspects to the Valley's past that it will be difficult to neatly encapsulate it in one book!
      • Solution: Information that doesn't make it into the book can become part of the exhibits at an eventual Valley history museum, and can also be documented in video interviews
    • Challenge: This is my first book project, am I up to the task?
      • Solution: I have solid skills in academic research, non-fiction writing, and organizational skills from research work in college.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The more the merrier! I am absolutely open to suggestions, direction, and simply making new connections through this project.

    • If you have any information or would like to be interviewed, please reach out!
    • Share this webpage with friends and neighbors!

    Thank you for your time. I look forward to hearing from you!

    Best,
    Owen Benjamin Clapp

story:
The Purification of Virgins – Priest R.D. Blacklock

This Indiegogo fundraising campaign is for the publication of a 400-page book in both paperback and hardcover formats.

  • Published by Night Words
  • Support the first print-run of The Purification of Virgins – receive a copy of the book
  • Support the independent publishing of this year's most terrifying gothic horror novel. 

The campaign is simple: Support & Receive a copy (or copies) of the book, available in hardback, paperback, and digital formats.

Your support gets a first edition copy of the book

Here is what you get from our Perks, in exchange for your support:

  • First Edition Trade Paperback of the book (Perk 1)
  • First Edition Hardback copy of the book (Perk 2)
  • Digital Download of the e-reader format for Kindle, Nook, + any e-reader (perk 3)
  • All Editions: Hardback, Paperback, Digital eBook (perk 4)

All books & perks will be shipped in mid-September, 2017

Thank you for your interest and for reading! 

  • If you like our project, please help support by sharing on Facebook & Twitter.
  • You can easily share this project with the 'share' buttons at the top right of this page

story:
What is Crux?

Crux is a nonprofit magazine that publishes all voices and focuses on the personal essay as a way to bridge the gaps between the many different lifestyles around the world.

 

Who's Making This Magazine?

Katie McCluer is our Editor in Chief. Crux Magazine is her dream realized. She studied creative writing at University of Montana and is currently working as an activities assistant in a retirement home. Her love of storytelling and traveling will strengthen Crux's commitment to providing space for diverse voices.

 

Jennifer McCluer is our Operations Manager, keeping the i's dotted and the t's crossed. She's an entrepreneur with a love for creating spreadsheets and a well organized inbox. This ensures that Crux functions efficiently as a nonprofit organization. Her favorite literary genres are fantasy, mystery and classic literature.

 

Crux's Mission

At Crux Magazine, we believe in a literature community that gives and takes, which is why we want to help people get their work out to the public. We believe writers and readers from every kind of background should have access to art and literature, and the ability to publish their own work. This approach makes our magazine rich in culture and diversity. 

 

Our Story

When we looked around at the current selection of literary journals, we noticed most of the journals out there are either profoundly academic or fashion-centric. We want to create a literary arts magazine that celebrates all of humanity in its many different forms. The articles in Crux Magazine will feel like a friend telling a story. You do not need to be a professional writer or artist to submit to Crux. We want the full spectrum of experience, and realize not everybody has access to the money or education necessary to become a successful writer or artist. There are so many amazing stories out there just waiting to be told, and we want to find them and share them through Crux.

 

Crux's Impact 

  • ACCESSIBILITY - Crux Magazine will help get literature out of the academic bubble, and into the world! The personal essay is an ideal format to accomplish this mission, as it often tells an individual’s story that unfurls into something much more universal. Often, the price of literary publications make them unobtainable for many individuals. We aim to keep our magazine affordable for everyone.
  • DIVERSITY - Crux Magazine will publish art and literature by people from every walk of life. No matter what age, race, religion, or gender our contributors are, we want to help get their story out into the world!
  • EMPOWERMENT - Often, when funds are cut, liberal arts and arts programs are the first to go, and we don't think it should be that way! Literature and art help people question their biases and interpret the world through a different lens, and in turn, make more informed decisions on many different topics.

 

Challenges We Will Overcome & Where Will The Funds Go?

  • INVEST IN CREATIVITY - Our top priority is to make the money to pay our writers and artists. We feel that art and literature is invaluable and while most literary journals cannot afford to pay for submissions, we would like to demonstrate how important our contributors are to us.
  • VERSATILITY - While printing costs are high, we feel it is important to offer the magazine both in print and online so as not to exclude any potential reader based on the format. Some individuals prefer to hold something physical in their hands, while others like the convenience of reading on their digital devices. Either way, we want our stories to be accessible to everyone!
  • TOGETHER WE SUCCEED - We will print and distribute our first issue at an estimated cost of $5,000. We will then use our not-for-profit status to apply for grant money, and supplement our revenue by selling ads and subscriptions. This process is time intensive, so we're asking for your help to have the extra funds to keep Crux Magazine afloat while we build our foundation and grow. Because Crux Magazine is a nonprofit, all of your contributions will be tax-deductible.

With your help, we can overcome these challenges and we'll demonstrate as a community how important it is to keep literature and art afloat in this world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

We understand not everyone can afford to donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you care about literature and art, please spread the word about Crux Magazine! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or wherever else.

We are always looking for contributors and we are accepting submissions for our second issue August 15th through September 15th.  If you're an artist or a writer or you just want to share your story, send it to info@cruxmagazine.org.

story:
My name is Emma and 6 months ago I suffered a stillbirth and lost my beautiful daughter Ella Rose. Since this deeply upsetting experience I have raised money for the fantastic facilities made available for us at the hospital. I have also embarked on a career in midwifery to help others going through what I have.

Over the 3 months we have raised £200 toward the cost of the production of the book however, we are still in need of a little more to ensure we can produce the first batch of books, cover the illustration costs in full and produce a website for people to be able to purchase the book and keep up with where the funds go and other projects we may do in the future.

About The Project

3 months after having my little girl I found myself getting thinking about my experience and how I could explain to any future children that they had a big sister who we loved but tragically lost. It is so important to me that Ella Rose is remembered and plays a big part in our future children's lives.

I realised to explain this to a young child could cause confusion - and even fear - so I came across the idea of creating a children's book which would gently explain the loss of an expected child and sibling. The book would approach the subject with sensitivity, with words and a narrative a young child would understand. Initially this was going to be a personal project for myself until a friend pointed out that my feelings would be felt by many others also.  I then decided to produce the book to share with the public. I hope this book will support other parents who want to explain to their children the painful loss of a family member through a stillbirth.

There will be two versions of the story, one for a brother and one for a sister with the option to add the sleeping child's name into the narrative.

The book itself will ease a great anxiety for parents and will be a very sensitive and caring way to introduce their child to their sleeping sibling. The illustrated book will be something the child will enjoy picking up and reading and, as they get older, will encourage natural conversations about their sibling.

The story has been written and Claire Williams,  an amazing illustrator and past journalist is on board, all we need now is the funds to produce the book.

Proceeds from the book:

The majority of the funds made from the book will be given to Stillbirth Charities with one being The Willow Room at Princess Royal Hospital.

Contributions

No contribution is too small and if you cant contribute just sharing this across social media will help our project succeed.

Any funds that maybe left over after production of the first batch of books will go into the pot to be spread across stillbirth and infant loss charities across UK, charities to include SANDS, MAMA Academy, The Willow Room at Princess Royal Hospital and more to be decided.

Other ways you can help

You can get involved in this project by sharing it across your social media, writing a blog post or any other way you feel will promote the project.

story:
What We're Doing

Do you feel your faith is under attack? Do you feel like society is shaming you for believing in Christ? And do you not discuss politics because you were told that politics and religion don't mix? If you answered yes to any of these, we've got the perfect project for you to support!

Massey Campos is a preacher who speaks to groups specifically about the role of faith in politics. He addresses the real intent of the pursuit of happiness, the Biblical foundation of the U.S., the Founders' intent, the Gospel influence in society, the media mindset, Christian duty in the civic arena, and finding your calling in all of this. He goes where most pastors won't, and he challenges them--and the people of the Church--to action.

J.D. Winteregg works in a small business, but he's a former teacher who has been through the progressive academic network. He has lived in a socialist country, dealt with progressive policies firsthand, and he has insight as to where the Left wants to move our country away from God. He's also a former Congressional candidate, and he speaks to the inner workings of campaigning and the culture that goes along with DC.

Massey and J.D. have decided to team up to write a book that utilizes their experiences to provide a blueprint for Christian conservatives--and others--to get engaged in the political process the way the Founders intended. Their youth and unique experiences will provide a path to engagement that hasn't yet been considered. They just need some help.

Massey and J.D. will use the money to hire a writer to help them put together a book that addresses two markets: the mainstream, secular market and the church/small group market. It will pay the writer for her work, pay for transcription, pay for her knowledge and expertise in marketing the book, as well as all of her expenses to finish the project quickly. 

What Massey and J.D. have presented publicly has caught fire. They're continually asked to speak on their respective issues, and they believe a book outlining a new path to engagement would elevate Christians to a new level politically that can alter the political landscape in the U.S. Please support these guys as they work to raise the funds! We would like to get this out before the Presidential election.

The Impact

Our book will help to engage people to become active in the political process. Many don't know why or how to get engaged, and we provide the blueprint for them! A higher level of political engagement provides outlets for people to be heard and greater accountability to our elected officials--something we all can agree needs to happen!

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge (other than raising the funds) will be to effectively incorporate faith with the rationale behind engagement.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this project, recruit people to contribute, and pray for us!
story_txt:
What We're Doing
   Do you feel your faith is under attack? Do you feel like society is shaming you for believing in Christ? And do you not discuss politics because you were told that politics and religion don't mix? If you answered yes to any of these, we've got the perfect project for you to support!Massey Campos is a preacher who speaks to groups specifically about the role of faith in politics. He addresses the real intent of the pursuit of happiness, the Biblical foundation of the U.S., the Founders' intent, the Gospel influence in society, the media mindset, Christian duty in the civic arena, and finding your calling in all of this. He goes where most pastors won't, and he challenges them--and the people of the Church--to action.J.D. Winteregg works in a small business, but he's a former teacher who has been through the progressive academic network. He has lived in a socialist country, dealt with progressive policies firsthand, and he has insight as to where the Left wants to move our country away from God. He's also a former Congressional candidate, and he speaks to the inner workings of campaigning and the culture that goes along with DC.Massey and J.D. have decided to team up to write a book that utilizes their experiences to provide a blueprint for Christian conservatives--and others--to get engaged in the political process the way the Founders intended. Their youth and unique experiences will provide a path to engagement that hasn't yet been considered. They just need some help.Massey and J.D. will use the money to hire a writer to help them put together a book that addresses two markets: the mainstream, secular market and the church/small group market. It will pay the writer for her work, pay for transcription, pay for her knowledge and expertise in marketing the book, as well as all of her expenses to finish the project quickly. What Massey and J.D. have presented publicly has caught fire. They're continually asked to speak on their respective issues, and they believe a book outlining a new path to engagement would elevate Christians to a new level politically that can alter the political landscape in the U.S. Please support these guys as they work to raise the funds! We would like to get this out before the Presidential election.  The Impact Our book will help to engage people to become active in the political process. Many don't know why or how to get engaged, and we provide the blueprint for them! A higher level of political engagement provides outlets for people to be heard and greater accountability to our elected officials--something we all can agree needs to happen!
    Risks & Challenges Our greatest challenge (other than raising the funds) will be to effectively incorporate faith with the rationale behind engagement.
    Other Ways You Can Help You can share this project, recruit people to contribute, and pray for us!

story:
"Be The Media"


Your page keeps me informed with easy to understand information 
Greta O'Neill
Informative, well researched information told in straight understandable language.
Mary Brown
I love your no nonsense, straight to the point approach.
Glenn Rankin
Informative no nonsense page with up to date and accurate information.
Janice Scott

The concept of citizen journalism (also known as "public", "participatory", "democratic",[1]"guerrilla"[2] or "street"journalism[3]) is based upon public citizens "playing an active role in the process of collecting, reporting, analyzing, and disseminating news and information."[4] Similarly, Courtney C. Radsch defines citizen journalism "as an alternative and activist form of newsgathering and reporting that functions outside mainstream media institutions, often as a response to shortcomings in the professional journalistic field, that uses similar journalistic practices but is driven by different objectives and ideals and relies on alternative sources of legitimacy than traditional or mainstream journalism."[5]Jay Rosen proposes a simpler definition: "When the people formerly known as the audience employ the press tools they have in their possession to inform one another."[6]


TMR News Scotland will hopefully become an online hub for citizen journalism, allowing a nation to shape its voice.

This is important, as a standalone website has much more credibility, and exposure, than posting to facebook groups or twitter alone, where articles can quickly become lost amongst the distractions on those sites.

I hope you support my ambition to deliver a fair, unbiased and diverse news site for Scotland, one that is untouched by the many various influences that have cobbled our national media here in Scotland.

There is a need for direct reporting and for those with different opinions than we are used to, I aim to deliver a service which will allow ordinary people a chance to highlight what they think, and publish those opinions and stories in such a manner it gives credibility to news that we all deem important.

TMR NEWS SCOTLAND

Thank You.

You can keep upto date on FB https://www.facebook.com/TMR-News-Scotland-355620901239438/

You can subscribe to TMC on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/user?u=2742837&ty=h

And you can watch TMR News Scotland being built here

https://tmrnews.demojoomla.com/
