story:
A little back story...

I started writing Chivalry's Children when I was 19 years old. By the time I was 21, it was self-published through Publish America, now known as America Star Books. Though it was thrilling and magical to see my story on printed pages, available to all, it wasn't a sustainable final product.

At such a young age I had little to no knowledge of how publishing worked, no guidance, and no resources to help me through this process. Thus, my manuscript was published without editorial input and needless to say, it's kind of a mess.

Fast forward over a decade later, I am now better equipped to make Chivalry's Children the novel it deserves to be. I've graduated film school with an emphasis in screenwriting, and I've taken several creative writing courses in addition to my film program requirements. I've written scripts, submitted to contests, and have made myself more familiar with the way things work in both publishing and the entertainment industry.  

The other resource I have now that I didn't have then (at least not to the same extent) is social media. Social Media platforms have grown extensively over the last decade. This provides a crucial way to share projects that might otherwise never have been seen by the public.  

The re-write and redesign have already begun. With Danielle Pajak (my creative partner-in-crime) doing illustrations and design, and a couple of trustworthy proofreaders who have my back, I know we can see Chivalry's Children through to its full potential.  

Will you help make this a reality? 

Thank you, 
Alexis P. Johnson


The Goal...

We've set the goal for $1000 to cover the costs of republishing and reformatting, as well as the graphic design work needed to update the cover and related artwork. I am still under contract with America Star Books, but this new company has been very helpful and supportive of making Chivalry's Children a whole new book with a whole new look!

The basic breakdown of what the funding will cover:

  • The author rewrite package from America Star Books
  • The cover redesign and original artwork (new front cover seen above)
  • The proofreading and editing process
  • Any media coverage and local promotion for the book
  • The INDIEGOGO perks for amazing donors like YOU! 
The goal is to have this rewrite finished and on the publishing deck by the end of the year! 

The Impact

Young adult fiction has been on the rise for years and will keep rising still. Not only churning out tons of new stories and series, but also fueling the film and television world with new adaptive material. This is great as it not only provides fantastic arts and entertainment, but perpetual jobs for so many involved in all the related industries.

My story centers around four young women, and is very much written to encourage women of all ages to be their truest selves and overcome obstacles with unity and friendship. This story is about bringing an entire nation together in collaboration and unity to overcome a great threat. An incredibly timely theme in our current cultural climate. 

To give a quick mental image, Chivalry's Children is a bit like Jane Austen, meets A Knights Tale, meets CWTV's Reign. 


How else can you help?

We know not everyone can contribute financially, but there are other ways you can help.

Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms throughout its 60-day run, especially with those who support independent arts. Social media will be key in our success.

Share the Chivalry's Children campaign and book information with anyone you know who reads YA (young adult) fiction and help get word of the novel out into the world.

THANK YOU!

story:
American Beekeeper - The Book

Some people buy a car new when they hit their midlife crisis.  Instead, I became a beekeeper.   I'm now in my fourth year and it mesmerizes me just as much today as it did when I started.    I started with one hive that first year and that one eventually became 60.   I had aspirations of commercial beekeeping and I was really excited about it.  

Unfortunately, things didn't quite work out.

Cowmageddon (a.k.a. Udder Destruction)

About 18 months ago my 60 beehives (~2.5 million bees) were destroyed by a heard of hungry cows after they had been winterized.  The field where they stood looked like a trailer park after a tornado.  It took two full days, four people, and two trips to the dump to clean up.  Needless to say, it was a rough time both emotionally and financially.   

Fortunately, there were enough undamaged parts that I can put together 10 hives as the top tier perk.  Even though my 60 hives have been reduced to one in my mother's backyard, this book is a way for me to stay involved and contribute in another way.  That's very exciting to me.

Rise of the Beekeepers

During the last couple of years I've come across an amazingly diverse group of wonderful people who share this passion of mine.   I could've never imagined I would connect with people in Canada, France, Sweden, Iran (a lot of Iranians! WOW!), Kuwait, Spain and all parts of the USA.   We come from varying backgrounds, but we share the same passion.  It's an amazing thing!  The inspiration for this book came from seeing their incredible Instagram posts.  A lot of people are doing great things.

So, I thought it would be neat to write a book about the culture of beekeeping in America, starting with the Reverand L.L. Langstroth (widely regarded as the father of modern beekeping) up through today.  There are plenty of great books about how to become a beekeeper, but I'm interested in writing about the people with bees in their blood; their backgrounds, their hives, their honey, their businesses and festivals.   Beekeeping is much more than a hobby - it's a lifestyle.  Beekeepers work tirelessly and selflessly and I want to tell those stories to inspire you.  It'll be part coffee table book, part oral history, part biography, part how-to.

The book will also include practical tips for getting started.  I want to demystify the process, explain the lexicon, and show you just how simple and rewarding it really it is.  There's nothing like cracking open a hive and pulling out frame full of honey that your bees made.  It will contain a directory of all the local honey producers, pollinators and beekeeping clubs and associations I can find.  I believe in supporting our local businesses and buying local honey.

This is so important because our bee colonies are in danger.  Every year colonies are dying at alarming rates.   Bees pollinate about 80% of our insect crops - our vegetables, berries, nuts, beans, fruits, and herbs.  Now more than ever we need new beekeepers.   My primary goal for this book is to inspire YOU to take up this hobby. WE NEED YOU!  You'll be welcomed into our community with open arms and hearts.

I need you.

Without my fellow beekeepers, this book can't exist.  If you're a beekeeper and would like to be a part of this project, please email me at matt_lohrke@yahoo.com.   I would love to hear from you.  I'm interested in writing about all types of beekeepers (city folk, country folk, hipsters, survivalists, everyone!), whether it's a hobby or your business.    I will visit as many of you as possible, but logistics will play a large part of how many people I can actually get to seeing.     

Where's the money go?

The bulk of the $15,000 target goal is for travel over 4-8 weeks, which includes car/hotel rental.   I will bathe in creeks and eat weeds on the side of the road if I have to!  I will make this trip as inexpensive as possible.   The rest will go to rewards outlined on the right, as well as Indiegogo's fees.

10% of all funds raised for this project, as well as 10% of post-campaign book sales, will go directly to a Beginner's Beekeeping Grant.   It's important to me to give back.   I believe we have a duty to do so.  Beekeeping does have its share of start-up costs and this grant will assist those who may not otherwise have the means.


It's a bit scary.

I freely admit this is a huge personal challenge for me.  I'm an extreme introvert by nature and the thought of having to put myself out there is terrifying.   Its taken me about six months since I first had this idea to launch this campaign.   So I'm very grateful for your support and encouragement.  It means the world to me.  Thank you, thank you, thank you.

I know times are tough for many people.  If you're not able to contribute, I completely understand.   I've been in your shoes.   Spreading the word about this campaign is just as valuable as contributions.   Thank you for telling your friends and family.

*Special thanks to Wayne Dahlberg for the pre-Cowmaggedon photos.

story:
Welcome to the Icarus

Canvas Skies: Wings of Freedom has been a work in progress for over a decade now, drawing together a local creative team of writers, editors, and artists from the Twin Cities metropolitan area. Because of the lengthy time spent creating this universe, the story is deeply layered and spans a planned 33 volumes. Set in the US post-Civil War era, both writers are trained historians and educators with a passion for the subject. As such, extensive research has gone into the making of the universe of Canvas Skies: Wings of Freedom so that - while an alternate telling - it is historically accurate. Imagine if airships had risen to the theatre of war, and catapulted a war-torn nation toward its manifest destiny...

What We Already Have Done

  • Volume 1 is already written and inked and ready for production.
  • The website domain is purchased and ready to go.
  • Volume 2 is in the final edit stages and artwork is in production.
  • Volume 3 is written in rough form, and ready to go to editing stages.
  • The entirety of the series is in outline form, waited to be drafted.

What We Need From You

The purpose of this crowdfunding campaign is almost exclusively to generate enough resources to finance our initial publication of Volume 1 and to cover the start up costs already accrued. We plan to start small for our initial edition, as we are self-publishing and trying to reduce costs while still producing a quality publication, and as such, our current goal is $7,000.00 USD, which translates roughly to 350 copies shipped and sold. Essentially: you buy a copy, we ship it to you, you help us jumpstart production of subsequential volumes for the story. Win-win.

Transparency is important to us. Our start-up costs, which we do need help with, include:

  1. The writers, editors, and artists have been working exclusively pro-bono as of yet, holding fast to the belief that the project will be enjoyed and see success. Our writers, editors, and artists all work full-time in addition to working on this project; some work 60+ hours a week, and one of our artists is currently on active duty in the United States Army. This does limits our production speed and ability to focus on quality, and a percentage of the funds generated will go toward compensating the members of the team for their creative efforts and ensuring that future publications are prioritized.
  2. The website is paid for up through three years, currently, but more funding is needed to maintain the website. Our eventual goal is to add a forum to bring together friends and fans alike within a central hub.
  3. Most of our marketing has been guerrilla marketing and word of mouth. However, we were fortunate enough to connect with a professional cinematographer and video editor - also from the local Twin Cities metropolitan area - to create a film-style trailer. The trailer was produced on a volunteer basis, but we did accrue some costs re: costuming and production time.
  4. The cost of warehousing and distribution of our comic novella. Besides the copies that we will be shipping ourselves, our publication distributor will add us to their catalog, which will allow Canvas Skies: Wings of Freedom to be available at brick and mortar and online retailers.

Risks & Challenges

(Note: We have hit our minimum publication goals, so if you order a copy, you get a copy!!)  Risk is low, but we are leaving this bit to remind us what we have overcome!!

We've already overcome most of the hurdles, and there remains one last major hurdle toward publication. Through our publication distributor, the minimum publication run is 100 copies. Which means, we need to pre-sale at least 100 copies of Volume 1 in order to guarantee publication and guarantee that you will receive your copy.

Obviously, there's always a risk that this campaign will not have the success we dream of. If we at least make the minimum, we promise that every person who pledged for a copy of the book will receive their copy.

In the event that we do not even break minimum, we will do our best to ensure that those who pledged still receive their copies. We will redesign our campaign and try again, and if it comes down to it, even if we have to sit there and sell blood plasma, we'll get you your copy.

Other Ways You Can Help

1! Tell your friends about us!

2! Share our campaign on social media! There's a nifty share feature on indiegogo designed to make this streamlined.

3! Visit our website! We will have a portion of Volume 1 available for preview on our website: www.canvasskies.com

story:
Hello, all you awesome people of Internetland!
If you like old school Sword and Sorcery Fantasy I've got something for you!

I'm Robert Van Dusen. I'm an independent Fantasy and Horror writer who has self published several books. I used to love the old Choose Your Own Adventure stories when I was a kid so imagine my surprise when I discovered a website that will let me write CYOA stories of my very own! I've since started working on a few just for fun between other projects and thought it'd be fun to add illustrations to my stories. If you're a fan of the fun, pulpy goodness of the likes of Robert E. Howard's Conan stories I'd suggest you check this out. 
If you're curious you can get an idea of what I'm talking about by checking out the first story here: The Merchant Prince of Sina

The one I'm working on right now is called The Heart of the Dragon, a followup to The Merchant Prince of Sina. I don't want to spoil too much of the plot of the previous story because I'd really like you to click the link above and give it a play through before you plunk down your hard earned money. However that one won't have any art so come back for the sequel!

After the events of The Merchant Prince of Sina,  Sarah Walker decides to sail south for Aronim and spend a little time in a small coastal tourist village. While seeing the sights and enjoying the sunshine she asks one of the locals about an imposing looking tower nearby. Curious about the strange cult that built it and the rumors swirling around it, Sarah can't help but get a closer look. Also, if they're as bad as they say, it isn't like anyone would really mind if she found anything worth taking...

 With your help, O awesome people of Internetland, I'll be able to pay the face wreckingly talented Jay Hernandez to do the pencils for the art. Here, take a look at his DeviantArt Gallery right here. Once the pencils arrive in my email inbox I'll ink and color the illustrations myself. I plan on having everything ready and the link emailed out to the backers by Christmas.

I hope you'll help me do something amazing. 
It'd be my honor to entertain you. Thanks.

story:
CHAPTER 1

A DEADLY PROBLEM YOU CAN’T SEE, AND MAY NOT KNOW ABOUT

 

The problem is that our food has been changed, it has become toxic, and we are getting sick and mentally impaired.   

The problem is that the chemical companies genetically engineered food crops such as soy, sugar, corn, cottonseed oil and canola to resist toxic pesticides so that they could sell more chemicals.

The problem is that these chemical companies, their sister companies which make pharmaceuticals, and big food and oil companies are controlling our media, government and policy makers.

Our food, tap water, breast milk, cotton sanitary products, beer, wine, and even vaccines are proving to be contaminated with chemicals linked to various diseases, cancer, infertility and mental illnesses which are skyrocketing in America and around the world.

1 out of 2 males and 1 out of 3 females are expected to get cancer in America today, 1 out of 5 have a mental illness, 1 out of 10 has liver disease...and we allow a carcinogen/neurotoxin/liver disease causing chemicals to be sprayed on our food??!!!

 

 CHAPTER 2

A MAJOR PART OF THE SOLUTION – PUTTING MOMS VOICES ON THE  MAAP

 In the process of publishing my own book, UNSTOPPABLE  -- Transforming Sickness and Struggle into Triumph, Empowerment and a Celebration of Community, I realized how difficult it can be. I learned that most publishing houses try to control the language, play it "safe," and keep valuable information from the public to protect themselves. This was upsetting. I could not tolerate having my book censored and not be able to be authentic and honest. I was also shocked by the low royalties authors received from a publishing house and how high the upfront costs are to self-publish a book, the line editing, copy editing, design and book cover...it can easily cost over $6000 for a book with no photos.

Then, with Facebook changing their algorithms and fewer and fewer people opening their emails, even people with 500 - 1000 friends on social media are likely to only sell perhaps 100 books...so re-cooping my investment was a major concern. I was sure other authors were experiencing the same frustrations. Perhaps many don't even start writing a book, even though they have valuable information and experiences to share, because the publishing process can seem so daunting.

Then I met a great editor who previously ran a publishing house, very successfully, and is committed to working only with authentic, honest people who have information that will make a difference in the world. We worked so well together that we decided our moms and supporters should also be able to have this kind of support.

So, I am announcing that we are launching Moms Across America Publishing, a division of our nonprofit, so we can support moms and truth-tellers to get honest information to the world with a knowledgeable team. As a nonprofit that values our supporters, we are committed to giving our authors a much larger percentage of royalties as well -- 2 - 3 times more! With our own platform, which currently reaches 1.5 million a month, and our partnerships, we can bring important information to the public without the censoring, challenges and corporate profit-driven business model of the publishing industry.

If you support the work of Moms Across America or if you have never heard of us before, we invite you to support the launch of our publishing house and the launch of our first book: UNSTOPPABLE -- Transforming Sickness and Struggle into Triumph, Empowerment and a Celebration of Community.

If you are tired of seeing information censored, or the spreading of dishonest information, if you love a family member who is sick, if you are fed up with our current food or political system, or if you want to just support new authors share their voice, we welcome your support.

Our country is in a health crisis. Our families, towns and cities are struggling. It is time for us to take action to bring knowledge and power to our citizens.  It is time to amplify the voice of the mom and truth-tellers who stand for health and freedom.  It is time for community leaders to become global game changers. We can do this. Together. One mom, one child, one dad, one family at a time. Moms Across America Publishing...From our House to Yours.

 

You have important research, experiences and solutions to share!

Someone whose only objective is to help by providing unbiased information based on experience.  An expert without a hidden agenda.  That’s the definition of a Mom’s Across America Publishing (MAAP) author.  

The American food industry is broken.  It has been bought by companies concerned only with profit and government agencies concerned only with following their agendas and keeping their secrets.  It is up to us – you and me – to share our experiences with each other as we learn what is necessary to keep our families safe.  

Over the last five years Moms Across America has created an online community reaching hundreds of millions worldwide.  These are people who come together on social media, in chatrooms and in person to share information and experiences with the goal of keeping all our loved ones safe and ultimately transforming the food supply.  Now we are seeking to take our online activism to a new level by publishing books. Books that will take us beyond a 280-character tweet and allow us to hear each other’s stories, learn from each other’s struggles and successes, and make deeper inroads into reaching the masses still unaware of what is actually on their dinner plate.  We want to amplify the voice of the mom and truth tellers who have experiences that will make a difference to improve our world.

 

CHAPTER 3

Testimonials

When mothers and caregivers are empowered with honest information, however, we do see triumphs over health issues and empowered communities.

“I went GMO free and after about a month, my Fibromyalgia symptoms went away.”  ~ Belinda

“Yay! for non-GMO diets and organic options! 64 pounds gone! Obesity that I am no longer living with!” ~ Amberle M.

“I had chronic digestive issues, but they soon went away when I switched to an organic whole foods diet. My daughter was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis but keeps it in check with a healthy diet.” ~ Cindy B.

 

CHAPTER 4

OUR FIRST BOOK….

Our first book, UNSTOPPABLE Transforming Sickness and Struggle into Triumph, Empowerment and a Celebration of Community kicks off our publishing house with a bang.

“When you know better you do better.  Information can save lives.”  So says Zen Honeycutt, founder of Moms Across America, the non-profit whose motto is “Empowered Moms, Healthy Kids.”  Thousands of Moms Across America members, who together reach millions of people worldwide, agree.  

UNSTOPPABLE is the story of a mother who learns about the current state of our world food supply and how it affects your dinner table and the health of everyone you love.  In it Zen walks you through her realization of the chemicals we all feed our loved ones, their origin and effects according to top-notch scientists from around the world, and why none of this is necessary according to farmers who not only want to feed the world but nourish it and protect the environment at the same time.  Moms come forward to talk about the chronic and life-threatening health issues of their children, themselves and other family members that were greatly improved once they took matters into their own hands and acted on the truth.  Scientists back up the moms with independent studies and unbiased peer-reviewed papers. Respected journalists, experts, and other activists share their stories of corporate greed and government corruption, all at the expense of our health.  And Zen shows you step by step how to change things for your own family, and the world.

If you have a loved one that is sick, your family is struggling health issues, and you do not trust our current system to provide you the information you need, know that there is hope, you are not alone, and there are steps you can take to be empowered to create the health and freedom you desire.

The foreword for UNSTOPPABLE was written by Jill C. Carnahan, MD, ABFM, ABHM, a functional medicine expert, conventional farmers daughter and breast cancer and Crohn’s disease survivor.

“As a functional medicine doctor, I’ve seen firsthand the increase in chronic conditions in this country. Allergies, autism, autoimmune disease, cancer, obesity and diabetes are undeniably on the rise. So much of what’s causing this phenomenon is the sheer number of chemicals we are exposed to on a daily basis. In fact, I see environmental toxicity as the elephant in the room – the number one burden contributing to chronic disease.  Only through leveraging the accessibility of information can we fight against the onslaught of chemicals that are making us sick – and this is exactly what Zen Honeycutt’s book, UNSTOPPABLE, does."  ~ Dr. Jill

 

SOME UNSTOPPABLE  FEEDBACK:

"Inspiring, poignant, educational, courageous...UNSTOPPABLE is a must read for anyone who is invested in the sustainability of the global food supply, as well as the health of future generations. Zen Honeycutt takes us on a journey of sickness and struggle to health and community empowerment. UNSTOPPABLE captures the undaunted reality that small ripples of change can truly change the tide of the health landscape." ~ Tami Canal, Founder of March Against Monsanto

 

“UNSTOPPABLE is arguably the best book available today on the topic of toxic foods and their effects on human health.  It is written in highly accessible prose, and it unfolds with a story line of Zen's own journey of personal awakening. Entertaining, absorbing, and even gripping at times, it is the kind of book that you can't put down. Despite the ominous message she delivers, she maintains a sense of optimism throughout, and a belief that the American citizenry can solve the problem through grass roots bottom-up strategies in local communities across the country. Zen is fond of quoting Lily Tomlin who said, "Somebody ought to do something about that. Wait a minute, I am somebody!"  Zen is truly an embodiment of that message. We are all "somebody," and Zen's book will inspire anybody who reads it to find a way that their special talents can contribute to helping to solve this enormous crisis that our country currently faces.  If we don't all pitch in and do our part, the future of this country is in jeopardy.” ~ Dr. Stephanie Seneff, MIT

 

“UNSTOPPABLE  is Zen's immensely informative manifesto, movingly sharing her passage from desperate mother to determined activist, boldly calling out some of the worst culprits behind America's growing health crisis, and passionately making a timely and encouraging call to action. For anyone concerned about the health of our families and future generations, it's our manifesto, too.” ~ Saifon Plewtong, “The Healing Chef”, owner of True Seasons Organic Kitchen- Voted one of OC's Top Ten Restaurants by Orange Coast Magazine and CBS twice, founder of JesusHarvest.Life, co-founder of The Free Pantry

 

CHAPTER 5

COMMUNITY

Who are We?

A National Coalition of Unstoppable Moms

Empowered Moms, Healthy Kids

Moms Across America is a 501c3 nonprofit started 5 years ago. We reach over 1.5 million a month on Facebook and hundreds of millions around the world each year through local grassroots activism, articles, reports, testing for toxins, campaigns, petitions, radio, news stories, and more. Our moms are passionate! They are moms whose children got sick and they took action to get them better...and then they shared what they learned with their local communities and are making a huge difference around the world.

 

CHAPTER 6

WHY CROWD FUNDING?  WHY NOW?  WHY YOU?

MAA was built around the wisdom of the crowd.  When Zen needed help with the myriad of health issues of her sons, and her doctors couldn’t help, she turned to the internet and found the support and information she was looking for.  She found moms who had triumphed over experiences similar to hers.  She found health professionals, both mainstream and alternative, who saw things differently from their colleagues and offered guidance.  She found journalists and politicians, farmers and scientists, people from all walks of life, from around the world, ready to help.  As MAA has grown, it has done so with the support of that international online community.  Publishing the research, experiences, and solutions of our supporters and courageous authors will fulfill our mission to create healthy communities and expand health and freedom around the world.  

And we are eager to offer our love and appreciation back to you, our supporter.

Check out the great perks below, and thanks to our supporters for making this happen!

 

OUR THANKS TO YOU  

$5 – Thank you! Virtual Hugs!

$10 -- Copy of the e-book.

$15 - Audio book download.

$25 -  Featured Perk -- Paperback copy of the book UNSTOPPABLE.

$35 – 2 paperback copies of UNSTOPPABLE. Share the Empowerment. Get a copy of the book, donate a copy of the book to your library.

$150 -- Two copies of the paperback book UNSTOPPABLE. + Healthy Garden Gift Set: Baker Creek - seed set (limit 45)

$300 -- Community Empowerment - 15 paperback copies of UNSTOPPABLE to gift to your team, family or libraries.

$1,000 – 10 copies of the book UNSTOPPABLE. Empowerment Coaching or Discussion. One hour skype with Zen for you or your group.   

 

Goal

To Raise $20,000 for upfront publishing expenses, with a Pay-it-Forward Publishing model...a portion of the proceeds from the sale of our first book will go towards the costs of publishing our second, and so on and so on. A portion of proceeds will also go toward Moms Across America programs, which include expanding our outreach, empowering moms and supporters to have healthy kids and communities across the country and around the world.

Your investment in MAAP will reap you and our communities the return of improved health and empowerment for generations to come!

 

CHAPTER 7

GRATITUDE

It’s difficult to put into words how grateful MAA is for the support of our members in launching MAAP.  Thank you.  And to those of you just finding out about MAA and our mission, we appreciate your time and attention to this problem we all share, and we thank you for becoming part of the solution.  MAAP will do everything we can to bring you information that will empower you and your family.  There is no donation that is too small, but if you are unable to donate, please share our information, this campaign, and the MAA website with your family and friends. Let’s make it possible for us all to get and stay healthy.  Let’s transform our food supply…together.

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

 1.  When will perks ship?

 Allow 6 weeks for delivery from the end of Indiegogo. Most items will arrive within 2 weeks.

2.  How will perks ship?

They will be shipped via U.S.P.S. from our warehouse in Colorado or directly from the US printer.

3.  Can I substitute items on my perk?

We ask that no substitutions are requested unless the request is for an audio book in lieu of a paperback book.

4.  What if I would rather not have my perk and have you give it to someone else?

If you wish to decline your perk, please decline during the donation process. We will not re-route and ship your perk to another address other than the one provided with the donation.

5.  Can I donate from outside the US mainland?

Yes, but please note that additional shipping costs will be requested if needed.

 

Additional questions? 

Contact:

Moms Across America Publishing

24000 Alicia Parkway #17-234

Mission Viejo CA 92691

Contact: info@ momsacrossamerica.org

Thank you for supporting health and freedom in the world!

Let’s make it possible for us all to get and stay healthy.  Let’s transform our food supply…together.
 
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
 1.  When will perks ship?
 Allow 6 weeks for delivery from the end of Indiegogo. Most items will arrive within 2 weeks.
2.  How will perks ship?
They will be shipped via U.S.P.S. from our warehouse in Colorado or directly from the US printer.
3.  Can I substitute items on my perk?
We ask that no substitutions are requested unless the request is for an audio book in lieu of a paperback book.
4.  What if I would rather not have my perk and have you give it to someone else?
If you wish to decline your perk, please decline during the donation process. We will not re-route and ship your perk to another address other than the one provided with the donation.
5.  Can I donate from outside the US mainland?
Yes, but please note that additional shipping costs will be requested if needed.
 
Additional questions?  
Contact:
Moms Across America Publishing
24000 Alicia Parkway #17-234
Mission Viejo CA 92691
Contact: info@ momsacrossamerica.org
Thank you for supporting health and freedom in the world!

story:
VOICES is a quarterly literary magazine, featuring the very best in speculative fiction from around the world. Its mission is to promote the work of writers from traditionally marginalised backgrounds.

This includes, but is not limited to, female writers, writers of colour, disabled writers, LGBTQ+ writers, writers from minority religious groups, and foreign writers having their work translated into English.

There is a huge, untapped vein of writing talent out there, and we want to get it, and share it with the world. Our definition of speculative fiction is broad and all-encompassing. Just as we will be showcasing a diverse group of writers, so we want a magazine where genre distinctions are broken down and cast aside.

Each issue will contain over 80,000 words of new fiction. It is a celebration of diversity in the field, and an opportunity for fans of all aspects of speculative fiction to read some of  the most exciting new fiction in the field.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £12000 from this campaign.

Half of that is to cover the cost of our writers, our cover artist and our editors, all of whom we will pay at professional rates.

The other half covers the cost of producing the first issue - printing and delivery.

We want to avoid using a Print on Demand service, so that we can keep control of the quality and the distribution ourselves.

However, we are realists: should we not reach our target, our first responsibility will be to pay the writers and the artists for their work. Once that is done, we can find another avenue for printing and delivery - selling advertising space in the magazine, for instance, once we're able to confirm the final line-up.

The Impact

Try this trick at home, if you like: ask a friend who reads a bit, but isn't a deeply-ingrained member of SpecFic fandom, to name a science fiction writer, a fantasy writer and a horror writer. Tell them not to think too long about it.

We don't know you, or your friend, but we're prepared to bet that he named a straight, cisgender, white guy. We're guessing some combination of Asimov, Bradbury, Tolkien, Pratchett, King and Koontz popped up in the list.

There's nothing wrong with any of those writers, and there's nothing wrong with straight, cisgender, white guys in general. But, these kinds of results are telling. Speculative fiction is all about seeing different worlds through different eyes, and yet the cornerstones of the industry, the ones that leap instantly to the tongue, are all looking out the same kinds of eyes.

VOICES looks to challenge that. We want to read a Muslim take on high fantasy, or a Hispanic take on space opera. We want to read a transgender take on cyberpunk, or a gay take on the ghost story. We want to read a Hindu version of the superhero story, or a Japanese take on the werewolf myth, translated from the original Japanese.

There are so many voices on the fringes of speculative fiction. So many stories begging to be told. So many stories that need to be told. We want to give them a home.

Risks & Challenges

Producing the magazine is the least difficult part of the process. I'm an editor with over five years experience in the business, and I have friends in the publishing world who have already offered their time and expertise to this project in its early days.

We will be collating and editing the content: the stories we're going to source from all over the world. The composition of the magazine we will give to the experts, which is where some of the production money will be going, to get a magazine that looks and feels professional.

Likewise, the printing and the posting will be done in bulk, by a company that does this for a living. I've already spoken to the guys who run the printing and dispatch firm, and we've discussed exactly what they need from us.

All we need now is the money to fund it, and the readers to make it worthwhile.

That's where you come in...

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everybody is able to contribute financially to a project like this, and that's fine.

We ask you, please, to spread the word as far as you can. Like our Facebook page and our Twitter account. Share this page on your own feeds. Blog about us. Vlog about us. Mention us to your friends. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Visit us at http://www.voicesmag.co.uk and cheer us on.

Make some noise!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I am Savania. I am passionate about social justice, equality, inclusion, and last but most importantly - the environment.  I have always had a passion for writing and creative art. And I have now chosen to use these tools to promote and advance issues I care most about. 

This campaign is to raise money to publish the first book in what I hope to be a long-running series about a panda who cares about the issue I (and hopefully you) care about: inclusion, justice, and the environment.  Perry is a unique panda who embraces his uniqueness and difference. He is a loving and caring panda who cares deeply for the environment. But he is also a child and thus fun. 

We all have children and nieces and nephews and cousins who are unique in their own way. And if you are reading this, I hope you care for our planet and the legacy you are leaving for those children, for the future generations. 

This book project is about channeling that passion for social justice, equality, and the environment and imparting it to children. This is deeply important to me, as well as the education of children. If you share with me any one of those passion, your contributions, no matter the size,  to make this project a reality will be a meaningful piece you'll be adding to your legacy, a way for you to contribute not only to art but to something that means more and goes beyond art and beyond you and me. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are not looking for money to change the world. We just need enough to enable us to dedicate our time and effort to finish, market, and release the book in the coming 3-5 months, depends on what happens with the ongoing pandemic.  Creating and publishing a book for global distribution is not easy, so here is the breakdown of the things we'd want to do and cost

  • My illustrator is the talented Shiela Alejandro from the Philippines. Life has not been easy in the Philippines. Shiela need about 2 months to work on and finish all the illustrations (including marketing/promotional material) - £5 000
  • I need to dedicate a month to finalise the book and get it to an experienced editor - £5 000
  • We need to run a significant advertising campaign - £20 000 - £30 000
  • Printing and distribution (initial batch) - £10 000

And this what you get, depending on what you are able to contribute and the perk you choose. 

  • Have your name listed as one of the co-authors of the book (and/or other productions - television etc that may be based on the book). 
  • A special edition of the book including dedicated acknowledgment of your contribution and a page dedicating the book to children (or grownups) of your choice. 
  • Opportunity to be named as co-creator of the entire book series 

Whatever you can contribute, you will be rewarded and thanked indefinitely. 

 

The Impact of your contribution

Without your contribution,  millions of children the world over will be denied the opportunity to enjoy the story and know and learn from this this beloved character.  Please don't let that happen. Invite all your friends and neighbours to contribute and join the movement. 

 

Risks & Challenges

If we are unable to reach our goal. we will still find a way to publish the book even though that will risk having limited distribution and success. But we will still be able to deliver all the promised perks regardless of whether we reach our target or not. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are looking for all the help you can provide. We are happy to receive any help including but not limited to the following:

  • Free social media promotion. If you have or know someone who has many followers, please help us to promote the book
  • Illustrator - if you are an illustrator, please help us with this and future books
  • Marketing. If you own or run a marketing company or department and are able to lend us resources for campaigns and promotions for the book, we would be grateful for such help
  • Proof reading 
  • Copy editing/writing
  • Publishing 

Thank you so much for taking time to read through. 

I am very excited about this project. Please help me make it a success.

Free social media promotion. If you have or know someone who has many followers, please help us to promote the book
Illustrator - if you are an illustrator, please help us with this and future books
Marketing. If you own or run a marketing company or department and are able to lend us resources for campaigns and promotions for the book, we would be grateful for such help
Proof reading 
Copy editing/writing
Publishing 

Thank you so much for taking time to read through. I am very excited about this project. Please help me make it a success.

story:
Story Of My Book

Sustainability has great potential for improving your lifestyle and contributing to solutions of our most significant issues including climate change, resource use and social equity.  I embarked on this book journey to present this topic clearly so you can apply updated approaches and perspectives.  The idea for this book grew as I prepared college courses, training classes and public presentations over the years.  It crystalized and became more urgent when my Mother asked me to recommend a sustainability book which she could give as a Christmas present to her granddaughter.  I could list many specialized professional books which would be of limited interest.  I could also suggest some “classics” which are great historical references but not necessarily timely.  That is why this book is urgently needed!  Preparing and writing this manuscript confirms for me how significant this subject is for all of us, throughout our lives.  So I share my perspective, adventures, and updated information to help guide your sustainability journey.

 

The Impact

This book project addresses the most important issues of our time with an approach that improves your lifestyle as well as contributing to larger solutions.  I share over 40 years of both personal and professional experience in all major areas of sustainability covered including food, water, home and mobility.  This is what you can build on for your sustainability adventures and lifelong journey.

 

The Book

The goal of this book is to make sustainability clear and accessible to a broad range of readers, from young adult to senior.  There are three major sections: 

Section 1. Personal Approach:  I begin with a strong conceptual foundation and personal approach which the reader can use to create a more sustainable lifestyle.  Following this introduction, we focus on the personal level in two chapters on spirituality (Chapter 2), and the goals and aspirations that drive all of us (Chapter 3).  These are subjects that are not even mentioned in much sustainability literature, perhaps because they can be so deeply personal.  That is precisely why these topics are addressed here.  They are profoundly important to reaching sustainability goals since there are long held assumptions and practices that need to be updated.  Sustainability concepts and practices are ideally suited for this.  Chapter 3 presents a new American (and Global) Dream that is informed by the sustainability perspective.  The outdated American Dream focused on material wants and needs.  The sustainable American Dream is abundant spiritually and socially as well as materially.   

Section 2.  Daily Basics:  We begin here with the power of the individual as a consumer in Chapter 4.  Wise and informed consumer decisions fully leverage that power, and this can create the demand for more and better sustainable products.  With clean renewable energy sources and recycling, we can evolve from a focus on less consumption to offsetting the more wasteful and polluting alternatives.  There are two keys for our survival and material well-being:  food (Chapter 5) and water (Chapter 6).  For food, much has already been written about nutrition and growing healthy food.  Thus this book focuses also on how you can best access healthy food that also supports the local economy and natural resources.  This includes regional farm to fork efforts and various ways to buy locally, as well as growing at least some of your own food.  Water is an increasingly precious resource, especially in arid regions.  Thus individual needs and consumption patterns are reviewed to point the way toward improvements.

Section 3. Modern Life:  We then move on to key technological developments for two of the most significant expenses in our lives:  housing and transportation.  Both can increasingly be powered affordably and reliably by renewable energy sources including solar and wind.  I have found that many consumers need to understand the energy units and terminology for these energy sources and uses, especially kWh.  Thus Chapter 7 is a primer for consumer electricity use and needs.  Then energy uses for both homes (Chapter 8) and mobility (Chapter 9) are discussed, with an emphasis on recent improvements including solar and plug-in electric vehicles. 

The final chapter concludes with a summary and integration of the above.  You can use this to set lifestyle priorities and connect with the larger community and bioregion.

 

About The Author

Over 40 years of sustainability experience with consumers, students, projects and programs contribute to this book.  With this diverse background I combine a deep real world understanding of the consumer and the need to communicate clearly with academic rigor based on solid facts and a scientific process.  My sustainability projects began in the 1970s.  The first formally recognized as such following the 1987 Brundtland Commission was with the Graduate School of Design at Harvard University starting in the late 1980s.  This grew into projects and programs with international organizations including United Nations (UNESCO, UNEP, UNDP) and World Bank, and the United States including State Department, AID, USDA and NSF.  I also worked in the private sector since the late 1990s, mainly in the areas of automotive sales, business development and training.  Since 2010 I have focused on providing the best possible resources (including vehicles, incentives, trained staff) for electric vehicle customers.  This lead to the 2016 California Governor’s Environmental and Economic Leadership Award (GEELA) for promoting the sale and adoption of zero emission vehicles.  I have published about 50 peer-reviewed articles and book chapters.  I have taught classes (undergraduate and graduate) for up to 400 students, and workplace training has been for groups of up to 30-40.  Invited public presentations have ranged from local to national and international.  My educational background includes BS at College of William and Mary, MS at University of Michigan and PhD at University of California.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Four thousand dollars are needed for the two main tasks that will take the manuscript from over half to fully completed.  The first is to make figures and text files compatible with the Kindle eBook platform for both the eBook and paperback versions.  I have identified professionals which can be hired with this half of the funds.  The second is to complete writing and editing for the manuscript.  Half the funds raised will support an assistant and me for the time needed for this task.  Together, all the above will produce the quality product this project deserves.  The perks are designed to allow you to support this project as you prefer at three major levels  First, you can provide feedback as the manuscript is completed with the $49 Preview Package.  Second, you can simply contribute for the eBook($12) or paperback($20 B&W or $35 Color).  Finally, you can contribute at least $300-$1000 for an interactive presentation customized for your group (final costs depend on number of people, length of interactive presentation, and location).  

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer.  This includes mailing the book to you. I have reduced this risk by building into the campaign the estimated shipping costs of copies to you within each order tier.

The risk of delivering the copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with Amazon to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the eBook and/or printed versions to you. We will keep all backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. Thus you will know when the copies you ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean that you can't help:

Please share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share this book campaign with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for your interest, support, and love!

Heath J. Carney

story:
Welcome to the Farima Indiegogo campaign!

As some of you may know, my name is Brian Lewis and I am the author of the upcoming novel Farima. Before I talk about my book, allow me to share some information about myself. I'm 32 years old and I live in North Carolina. I was raised in a close and very tight-knit family and since I was young, I was always a dreamer. I played video games, read books, even spent some time as an actor because I've always enjoyed worldbuilding. We enjoy science fiction and fantasy because of the momentary escape it provides. So I would imagine I was in the worlds built by other creators

Farima represents my opportunity to give to other readers what so many other creators have given to me. A beautiful world to escape to and get lost in. Farima is an afro-futurist science fiction novel set in the year 2082 in the fictional nation of New Manden. It takes place in the real world, though this is a much different future than the world that we live in today. Farima suggests that the future doesn't have to be bleak and dystopian. It suggests that the future can be abundant, free and progressive with the basic necessities for survival provided as a right.

However, all that glitters isn't gold. Many dangerous people lurk in the shadows seeking to destroy what New Manden represents.

I began writing this book a couple of years ago. After several stops and restarts, it's finally complete. However, I need your help. The purpose of this campaign is to help me launch my book because I am self-publishing. There's a lot that goes into getting a book written, released, and shared so that your labor wasn't all for nothing.

With your support, you are helping to kickstart what will become a massive, multi-book world. A world of androids, immersive augmented reality, blockchain, quantum technology, and more.

The wonderful thing is since the object of this campaign (Farima) is already complete, you don't have to worry about the book not being finished. The novel will be released, it's just now a question of how successful it'll be. That is why I need your help.

CHAPTER LIST

Chapter 1: Mind and Body
Chapter 2: Project Maximus
Chapter 3: Project Farima
Chapter 4: Change of Plans
Chapter 5: The Man With No Nation
Chapter 6: The Arrival
Chapter 7: Secrets Among Friends
Chapter 8: The Principle of Struggle
Chapter 9: The Treaty Writ in Blood
Chapter 10: Masterstroke of Deception
Chapter 11: Making of a Patsy
Chapter 12: False Accusations
Chapter 13: Birthed In Chaos
Chapter 14: The Battle of Charlotte
Chapter 15: Chasing a Traitor
Chapter 16: False Hope
Chapter 17: Ghost of the Past
Chapter 18: The Truth
Chapter 19: Reunion
Chapter 20: Battle Arena
Chapter 21: Shadows of History
Chapter 22: The Farima
Chapter 23: Our Guardian Comes Home

Synopsis

The Founder of a nation hides a destructive secret,

From a collective of scientists building disruptive technology,

while an enemy from the past hides in plain sight as he plots to destroy them all.

 

Dr. Natia Greenheart has built the most advanced team of scientists in all of New Manden. They've built many things, but nothing as disruptive as Homo Maximus. When complete, this breakthrough will offer effective immortality - for free.

A series of unfortunate attacks prevent this from happening. Natia and her team are then taken to a private man-made island to finish the work.

Yet when they get there, Natia soon realizes that the island holds many secrets that could cost her and her team their lives. Natia will have to overcome sabotage, deception and the threat of death to not only complete the project but save a young nation from destruction.

 

 

For this campaign, I'd like to be able to raise at least $2,000. Ideally, I'd like to be able to 4x that at least, but $2,000 would be enough for me to do a few basic things and cover the cost of the book cover. Your funds will primarily go to 2 things:

  1. Offset Book Cover Costs
  2. Post-Release Marketing

A cover artist has been chosen and he is working on the cover now. That will be revealed after the end of the campaign. 

Since I'm self-publishing, in order for the book to be successful I will need strong word-of-mouth and a healthy marketing budget. This will be used for various media packages of which the skies the limit almost. Marketing is vast, so I can put the resources anywhere. I will focus on various forms of digital marketing.

  • With a $5 contribution, you can support the project and secure a preorder copy of Farima that will be given to you in eBook format.
  • Now that the novel is complete, I need Beta Readers to be the first to read it to provide feedback. Become a beta reader with a contribution of at least $15 and you will be the very first to read it.
  • The Featured perk is called 'The Advocate' and is the contribution level ideal for you if you'd like a signed paperback.
  • For those who want to really make an impact, I'm doing something unique. In one of my next 2 books, I will create a character for you. This character will have a role to play in a future novel. My future novels will run 300+ pages, so there will be room to introduce everyone.

.

 

Farima isn't just an afrofuturistic story, but also a solarpunk story. Solarpunk is not a sci-fi genre most have heard of, unlike Steampunk and Cyberpunk. Solarpunk suggests that the future doesn't have to be bleak or post-apocalyptic. While there is a lot of suspense and conflict in the book, it exists in a world that says we've solved many of the problems that hold us back today.

By funding Farima, you are making an impact and pushing a subgenre forward that could use the boost.

No Risks

There are next to no risks involved in funding this campaign. The book is complete and edited. The only things I await are the book cover and illustrations. So you're not funding a project that might happen. No, Farima will be released. This campaign is to raise awareness, give away free books to supporters, and secure post-release financing to make sure as many people know about Farima as possible.

Still not interested? No problem. Perhaps you have friends or family who you know will be interested? Take 1 second to click the share buttons above and share it on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
Institute for Christian Socialism (ICS)  

The Institute for Christian Socialism activates and equips US Christians and churches for the work of education, resistance, and constructive transformation. Our mission is to support US churches, their members, and institutions in confronting the world’s captivity to capitalism and in claiming, embodying, and promoting the radical socialism of the Christian faith and life. In time, we will be seeking financial support for each of the interrelated initiatives of ICS, including Radical Convivia, the Solidarities Project, a Fellows program, and more. For now, we are prioritizing The Bias Magazine.     

Help us launch The Bias Magazine

The Bias is the inaugural project of the Institute for Christian Socialism and the premier voice of the Left in American Christianity. Cutting across the routine conventions of the Church and religious academy, we are the distinctive radical and ecumenical voice on politics, culture, economy, and environment. Your funding supports the production and labor costs for print and digital editions of The Bias. The print edition publishes twice a year, with digital content appearing regularly every week. 

We need to fundraise $35,000 to sustain and build the work we've begun. Can you and your household consider a gift to help us grow in the new year?

Why The Bias? Why Now?

The Bias is designed to respond to the absence in the religious publishing landscape of a distinctive leftwing and socialist voice. The Bias will give voice to the conviction that the Christian Church and its theology cannot be accurately understood in our time apart from its material conditions. The absence of any significant representation of the political Left within the Church, academy, or religious and theological media only exacerbates these conditions. The Bias will speak to the intersection of church life and Left politics, better represent the church within the politics of the Left, and help nurture new social formations, within the church and society at large

Readers of First Things, Sojourners, and Christianity Today will find a unique voice and perspective presented in our pages, and will stand as a Christian iteration of publications like Jacobin, Catalyst, Dissent, and New Left Review, while remaining distinct enough in its format from these other programs to offer consistent brand and market differentiation.

What can I expect to find in The Bias?

The Bias will begin as a digital publication. We have begun planning to grow into a print magazine while continuing to generate quality digital content. The Bias will explore issues of politics, culture, economy, and environment from an ecumenical and radical perspective. Each published issue will present a guiding theme. For example, one issue may focus on “Race,” “The Left and Religion,” “Climate Change,” or “Labor.” While each of these themes is responsive to contemporary news cycles, the editorial voice and presentation will approach them in an “evergreen” fashion, so that every issue will be fresh and relevant for many months after initial release. This same relevance will also be sustained by the regular content posted to the magazine’s website every week.

The magazine format will allow for the publication of a number of notable voices from across the fields of contemporary theology, ethics, textual study, and religious history. Every piece published will emphasize fine writing and original, unconventional analysis of the intersection of Christianity with contemporary social, political, and cultural life. The reader can expect certain types of regular commentary, but both the print and online formats will allow for a great deal of flexibility in terms of themes, topics, and outlook. Cultural commentary, film and music criticism, and human-interest pieces will also be regular features of magazine.

The production cycle for our print magazine will be seasonal, with new writing appearing each week online. Essays and commentary will be curated and solicited by editors overseeing topics such as:

  • Politics
  • Economics
  • Environment
  • Anti-racist and feminist movements and theory
  • The Religious Right
  • Political theology
  • History of Christian socialism
  • Film, art, and literature

What does my donation help with?

In order to make The Bias a reality, we need your support to:

  • Purchase technology and website tools to support the digital presence of The Bias
  • Compensate writers and editors for their work
  • Expand our artistic capacities by compensating radical artists

For this funding cycle, we need to fundraise $35,000 to sustain our initial launch. Costs of production forThe Bias are currently budgeted at $150,000 per year. If you would like to make a large gift and/or would like to explore partnership as a publisher, seminary, denominational organization, or religiously-focused philanthropy, we welcome the opportunity. Please email us at contact@christiansocialism.com.

The Impact

Your contribution now makes a difference. You are helping us to establish a firm foundation forThe Bias and to develop additional material manifestations of the vision of God’s new creation: a society marked by the interdependent health of our common earthly home, the shared enjoyment of our common wealth, and the just participation of all in our common social and political life together.   

The Bias is just the start. Our Solidarity Projects and Convivia are emerging even now. The vision has its time. It will not delay.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Every gift counts from $5 to $50 to $500.

If you can't donate today, it doesn't mean you can't help in other ways.

  • Get the word out about our fundraising campaign by sharing with your networks
  • Help connect us with organizers, ministers, theologians, and other workers at the intersection of Christianity and left politics
  • If you are interested in working with ICS, The Bias, and especially if you'd like to write for us, please send an email with "Contributor" in the subject line to contact@christiansocialism.com

In Solidarity!

story:
From September through February I heard about the importance of saving Indian Country Today. So many people across Indian Country had the same idea: What if … What if we all contribute? What if we step up to make certain Indian Country has solid, accurate, fair reporting? What’s it worth to save a voice, a national media platform for Indian concerns? 

Yes. Yes. And a lot — or a few tax deductible dollars if we do it together.

We are building the new Indian Country Today on the public media model. We will have some advertising but most of our resources will come from members and non-profits. We need you.

We thought we would start this process with some fun. We are launching a membership drive and an auction. The membership drive will solicit help from our “members” as $100 Founding Members, $500 Sustaining Members, and $1,000 for Premier Members.  Unlike public media we don’t have nifty gifts as a thank you. No t-shirts. No coffee mugs. Just a better news report. We want to use the money to build our news operation, a multimedia report about what’s going on across Indian Country. We’ll stretch your dollars by partnering with other organizations (and amplify our reporting by letting others repurpose our editorial content).  We will serve.

To get us started we are hosting an auction: Who ever bids the most will be designated Founding Member 001. We will honor them in ICT and thank them across social media. (And if your bid is not the most … we are still happy to accept your donation.) To place your bid email general@indiancountrytoday.com. 

If you can’t afford $100 send us what you can. This is important and we don’t want to leave anyone out. (As we get going we plan on a monthly membership plan that will cost only $10 a month … something to think about.)

Indian Country Today is going to be a new kind of journalism (just wait until you see the platform we are building) and we can use your help to get us launched. Thank you so much.

Mark Trahant, editor, Indian Country Today

story:
Chicago, as you know, is the mecca of innovative theatre and it is very unfortunate that there isn't a publication that celebrates it—which is why I am keen on creating this publication. This is a time of change for Chicago. In the past, Chicago theatre has been known to break the norm, and even more so now. Theatre companies are tackling inspiring subject material, and theatre folx are holding people accountable for their actions like never before. 

These past two years have been a trying time for many artists, but Chicago theatre has not succumbed to the struggle. We have fought and we have persevered and because of this, the theatre community has made many strides to improve its inclusion, diversity, and art activism spirit.

The biannual magazine will include information, opinion pieces, reviews, and a reflection of the past six months of Chicago theatre: the who and the what, game-changing theatre productions, art activists, appropriate representation, etc.

In simple terms, 'Chicago Theatre Now' seeks to start a conversation and enlighten the community on why Chicago has some of the best theatre in the world. It seeks to gather knowledge from various practices: actors, scenic designers, costume designers, directors, fight choreographers, producers, writers, lighting designers sound designers, marketing and outreach representatives, stage managers, etc. 

So please, please if you feel that this is something Chicago theatre needs right now, donate. Any amount helps. Any and all donations will be attributed towards the inception of this zine! 

Thank you so much for your support and generosity!

story:
To all those who want a better USA, world, and environment, this book could be the stepping stone to get there.

We live our lives and sometimes wonder, why things are the way they are. Taxes [personal, state, city, property, internet] increase, work becomes longer and more difficult, liberties are unknowingly taken, etc. And we are conditioned to go with the flow.

This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.

We post our happy pictures on social media and leave our children a world more precarious, glossed over by these images and let the corruption continue that makes their world more difficult than need be.

This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.

We watch, post and read about events like a presidential speech, Congress, white collar corruption, or 911 truths, have a rally and nothing changes. We let the corruption continue to strip our rights, liberties, and purpose in life, away.

This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.

We post and read about one political side or the other, and let the corruption continue to 23 trillion dollars of debt, 45 million living wage jobs lost because of both sides and they all say they want the best for us. We are given the choice of two sociopaths to vote for and accept this corruption.

This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.

Or the billions of dollars of corruption of the mega-corporations, non-profits, and appointed positions and the corruption continues to grow, and we feel hopeless to end it.

This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.

This is why this book is so important.

Once published, this book could be the stepping stone to a better USA and world.

Let me know what you need from me, to be part of this mission.

The mission to make the USA and the world a better place.

My mission to make known these solutions, with your contributions.

Sincerely,

Christopher W. Spada

This is why this book needs to be published.We post and read about one political side or the other, and let the corruption continue to 23 trillion dollars of debt, 45 million living wage jobs lost because of both sides and they all say they want the best for us. We are given the choice of two sociopaths to vote for and accept this corruption.This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.Or the billions of dollars of corruption of the mega-corporations, non-profits, and appointed positions and the corruption continues to grow, and we feel hopeless to end it.This book holds the solutions. This is why this book needs to be published.This is why this book is so important.Once published, this book could be the stepping stone to a better USA and world.Let me know what you need from me, to be part of this mission.The mission to make the USA and the world a better place.My mission to make known these solutions, with your contributions.Sincerely,Christopher W. Spada

story:
The curse of The Handsome Twist

king of love, sorrow his name         

  Gruesome his legacy fame

Tonight he shall bath in unholy dreams 

His heart will be trialed two decades of screams

Pats will ponder he's cute and he's handsome

It'll cost him his art with a deep lonely ransom

In grief he shall moan living all of his days

His soul to be claimed his most special day

When the sun comes to rise evil gains full power 

Every step that is taken shall pass an hour

The wind will blow and the earth will crack

All the grass will wither as it's surface turns black

From Hell shall ascend lust gluttony and pride

For his soul istheir temple and  his body their bride

With greed sloth and envy they shall crush all his bones

For they thrive of misery and painful moans

Wrath will come forward and strip him from Sight

As his voice will depart screaming in fright

The birth given mother will take back his silent soul

And the sins will come forward to swallow him whole

Joy shall weep and  love shall mourn 

For their king has died and evil born

He shall roam the earth a flesh eating beast

Blood to be his wine and his victims his feast

Cursed by the first royal subject of Hell at childhood, The King of love is destined to live a life of nothing but degradation, shame and tribulation in the occurrence of events such as victimization, poverty, prostitution, rape ,the loss of his most dearests to then fleeing from the palms of death ! He is then stripped from his vision, voice and soul which take human form aiding to comprehend the true meaning of love, only then he meets his soulmate but hopefully in time to save the world from plunging into eternal darkness and he becoming

the most malign being time has ever witnessed.......
