story:
Thank you for the support over the 3 years, this marks as our 3rd and final successful fundraiser! We appreciate the belief, effort and standing by us - through the growth. This marls as our final fundraiser in 3 years!

What is IDEA, WHAT DOES IT DO AND HOW FAR CAN IDEA GO INTO CHANGING THE LIVES OF WOMEN AND THE LGBT COMMUNITY?

IDEA was founded to raise awareness within African Communities on the need to support the rights of young feminists and the LGBTQ community especially trans, bi women and lesbians. We started with Kenya, we are now in East, West and Southern Africa! We decided at the end of 2018 to:

  1. Have writers and activists all over Africa hence we opened up calls for submissions to be continental!
  2. Have department heads on a regional level and on certain much-needed topics and we have gotten heads for 3 regions (East, West, Southern) and different column editors for similar topics in different regions!
  3. To have a sustainable model that would create employment, help us build the physical Hub we have been aiming for and support other African led initiatives. (our financial projection aims at catering for the needs mentioned)

OUR PLAN?

  1. Monthly subscriptions (we tested the concept with Kenyan Feminists and it proved to be a success but we decided to have more content and more platforms before implementing the model)
  2. Partnerships with women and LGBT led businesses  (we already have a few ready to jump on board)

Each year we have been asking for two hundred dollars ($200) but this year to actually hope to have a hand up rather than the annual handout, hence we are looking to raise $3000. 

We are asking for help raising $3000 for the following:

  1. Paying for annual hosting. We are growing and we need to have better hosting options to accommodate our content. Our hosting, domain and custom themes since 2015 used to cost us around $100 but with growing content inclusive of videos and an online community we need to purchase the following:

    - Annual Hosting costs - $220 with a 63% off discount annually. Without the discount, the cost would be $563 (the package is 36 months all paid hosting at Bluehost and estimates roughly the same with most hosting companies)

    - Custom Themes $168

    - Graphics and stock images - these will cost us about $1.67 a piece (stock images) and we need about 48 annually hence a total of $80.16 annually. We have a graphic designer's proposal to charge us $300 annually to make us 180 posters in 2019.

    - Website maintenance: $100 (we have a web designer that has cut off over 90% of the fee charged to maintain the site year round.)

  2. Buying a camera and sound (for our interviews with women and members of the LGBTQ community) on social, economic and political matters that influence diversity, equality, and Inclusion. Our aim here is to be a driving force for change by giving women and the LGBTQ community the voice needed to start a revolution. $580 for a camera and $100 for sound. When we started out, we would borrow cameras to attend and support events and when we couldn't anymore the program died out. We need to start a fierce web series that creates a platform to have discussions such a more inclusive and informed version of this one.
  3. We need a piece of podcast equipment for daily podcast shows centred around campaigning for Equality, Inclusion, and Diversity. The podcast studio we have spotted will cost us $530 and the package entails: 

    - A professional podcasting, music production, and digital home recording equipment

    - Full recording  "out of the box" studio including FireWire interface, mixer, microphone, headphones, professional music software and more

    - Professional 8-input 2-bus mixer with premium mic preamps and 3-band EQs

    - Table microphone stand, microphone windscreen and cable, four 1/4" jack cables and two FireWire cables

    - Powerful DAW software 

  4. Buy a laptop that will be used for video editing, editing content sent to us and also use it for operations. $500
  5. We will finally start our monthly comic series. We are being charged $50 a month for 2 comics, 4 issues, and satire based posters on reverse gender roles. One of our founders will pay for $200. we need $400. Total $600-200.

We need a total of $3206 but our founder will cover $206 on top of what we need help with raising.

    IDEA OVERVIEW

    IDEA has been using the creative and online space to advocate for diversity, inclusion and Equality for young women and members of the LGBTQ community. Kenya, like most African nations, tends to culturally and socially exclude women and members of the LGBTQ community in the participation of community policies and activities. 

    IDEA AFRICA emphasizes on the need for African activism on three fronts: issues activism takes on with a focus on women and the LGBTQ community, the African communities approaching those issues and the ways they choose to tackle them factoring in the deeply embedded oppressive cultural norms that instigate injustices and oppression.

    Women are seen as an inferior gender and their voices silenced whereas, members of the LGBTQ community especially trans (with examples of people coming out and being shunned evident)- they are seen to defy and insult the African culture. Sexual rights and identities are a mere concept in most nations in Africa. Women have a huge gap to fill. Our goal as IDEA is to make sure that there is a voice, and a stern loud one when it comes to respecting and enforcing the rights of women and the LGBTQ community through online advocacy and partnerships. 

    This can only be done by normalizing what is seen as a divorce of the culture and pinpointing the shareholders of change.  A lot of oppression on women and members of the LGBTQ community is instigated by norms that are derived from moral high grounds crafted either by culture or politics for the benefit of the majority beneficiaries. 

    To push for more resource centres, policies, initiatives we need to have a bigger voice. We need to have more people join us. To create impact we need allies, we need support. To be different, impactful and ready to be change makers we need you!

    Kenyans, have a huge online presence and a love for the creative space, hence provides us with the platform to create awareness and acceptance. We would love to have more women, men included in decision-making processes politically which often links back to the social and economic growth of women, especially young women without the stigmatization that comes with stereotyping, successful confident young women. We would also love to have the nation and continent at large create a positive atmosphere for young members of the LGBTQ community to outright participate in and voice for their needs and rights. 

    The magazine has already had various writers and collaborators come forth to talk about issues at hand when it comes to diversity and inclusion of women and members of the LGBTQ community. 
    We have been mentors and guest speakers in Universities such as Mount Kenya University and Moi University in Kenya, we have been panellists in women forums such as women in tech, had partnerships with YouTube shows such as Zero Chills TV to freely talk about the LGBTQ community, are having ongoing recruitment from the creative space on our various projects such as JiEducate (focus on constitution and possible implementations for inclusiveness), Maverick woman (helps young women and girls follow the lead of local heroes) and JiCode Program that uses training to give women an option to having a voice.

    We have actively involved organizations on the 16 days of activism against SGBV toolkit. We already received a draft of the proposed sexual harassment policy and we are hoping to also urge orgs in Kenya and Africa to adopt them. We just started our campaigns to ask organizations to at least have activities that advocate for the CM policy implementation and are providing them with activity guides.

    IDEA AFRICA has been running as a magazine (3rd year now). Since we are focusing on online activism before we start holding matches and forums; we want to grow from being just a magazine to having a podcast station that will eventually be a radio station, and also have web series on YouTube and Facebook videos to reach out to more Africans. We have proved in 3 years that online activism is the future and it instigates physical protests, signatures, activities, and partnerships.

    Help us pay for our annual hosting and domain, our magazine theme and the necessary plugins for our online magazine. Help us start a docuseries (create weekly videos interviewing women and members of the LGBTQ community) centred around giving women and members of the LGBTQ community a voice. Help us create and launch our podcast show centred on reaching out to survivors, activists, and maverick women in African communities. 

    HOW YOUR SUPPORT REACHES MILLIONS

    1. IDEA has been running since 2015. In the last 3 years, we have not achieved the maximum potential that we set out to. Our mandate was to reach out to millions all over Africa by 2018, becoming a major force of change. Regardless: In the last 3 years, we have succeeded with your annual help of around $200 involved over 5 countries by getting content and readers from the nations. These nations entail South Africa, Kenya, Uganda, Burundi and recently - Ghana and Nigeria. We have also had women from Europe submit their publications on Africa and the practices published. We are hoping to finally get to all African nations.
    2. We have run campaigns in the past and we have always raised about $180-220. Our last campaign which just ended on 22/12/2018 and we raised $5. Lack of resources is a huge hindrance in being change makers. But it has not stopped us. Having your support means creating unimaginable possibilities for change. 

    IDEA AFRICA run by young activists (20-27) takes a different approach to activism, in general, let alone feminism because AFRICA is deep-rooted in so much patriarchal culture, we are basically brought up in it and African feminism needs a different approach to smash these oppressive norms. In our platform; we have activists, feminists, allies to feminism and we also have readers (who generally visit the site for research purposes on what the movement is about).

    To date, we have diverse writers. Both women, women, and men in the LGBTQIA community and men. We have doctors, psychologists, lawyers, social workers and activists that voluntarily send content to us.

    IDEA'S MILESTONES

    • We have had women and members of the LGBTQIA community come to us for info on where to get help and given that we have experts writing for us (volunteers), we send them to the right people. We are hoping this becomes a norm and we can form partnerships with organizations and experts where we link our audience with the necessary professionals directly through our platforms especially on matters of mental health, medical help and legal procedures in the case of GBV.
    • We now have writers from over 6 African countries. We hope it to be more than 20 by end of the year or much more!
    • We have up to 25k reads in certain articles and that's a sign we are reaching people and hopefully sparking discussions. 
    • We have been nominated for the following:
    1. Pivot East Africa (an incubator for hubs in Africa making a change using tech) - we were semi-finalists
    2. We have successfully reached the final stage of FRIDA, but unfortunately did not secure the top 5 voted position to receive funding
    3. We have been nominated for BAKE (Bloggers Association of Kenya) under the girl's and women empowerment category, we, unfortunately, did not win the award category.
    4. We are partners with several universities and organizations in Kenya. We have been invited to women in Tech forum as speakers and Mount Kenya University as well

    We have also been able to form partnerships with 2 to 3 organizations that assist women and members of the LGBTQIA community.

    WHY THE SLOW GROWTH?

    We are founders and a team of under 26-year-olds. Initially, the magazine was run by one person, Ella; for almost 2 years and everything would be out of pocket in addition to the around $400 we have raised in 3 years. 

    HERE IS THE LINK FOR THE MAGAZINE

      We are growing, we are making a difference. We need to keep it going, keep it steady. We need you for the change to actualize.

        The Risks & Challenges IDEA faces

        The following have slowed us down rapidly:

        • The age factor: IDEA's founders are all 26 and below hence a lot of our ideologies are pushed off, as we are growing at a significantly low pace due to lack of resources
        • Despite this challenge, we have never been shunned away from actualizing what we set our hearts to. 

        We are hoping that this campaign is the beginning of enforcing the fierce fire burning within us to make a change. Each pledge from $5 gives you access to our 2019 content sent via email each month. Ps# we will also appreciate cameras, laptops and anything useful for writing, podcast and video creation be it new or old. 

        Meet the Founders, some of our writers and founding staff.

        Stella (Ella), Founder.

        Loise, Founder.

        Shisia, Founder.

        Jackie, Founder

        Nancy, Vivian , Buibwa , (Writers)

        Dr Saringi, writer.

        Cherrie, Communications Manager.

        Nick, web developer.

        OUR FOUNDING WRITER & WRITER OF 2018

         

        Meet Beryl, written for us since 2016. Feminist. Advocates for the rights of women and LGBTQIA community. 

        We have around 16 writers. We hope to have hundreds by 2019. 

        With your support we hope to have the magazine grow, the podcast set, the videos recorded and have staff all over Africa. We also hope to do much more!

        KINDLY SHARE THE CAMPAIGN. DONATE. 

        PS#

        The video below was done in 2017 (it was a partnership between IDEA and Zero Chills TV) and it opened up our eyes on the need for Inclusion while holding discussions that focus on the rights of women and members of the LGBT community.

        After the video was released, we had members of the LGBT community reach out to our founder Ella on the need to actually have the platform to address much needed conversations and the DIRE need to provide a safe space for women and members of the LGBTQ community to have that voice.
         
        Our hub was called Lalona during that time but after this video came out; we changed our name to be more inclusive and restructured the hub's long term goal to having an inclusive resource center that advocates for the rights of women and LGBT community.

story:
Blessings Everyone! My name is Lakshmi, and I am an artist, singer/songwriter, dancer and garden enthusiast. I have worked with children of all ages for over 15 years teaching movement, music and dance. While working with kids, I noticed a big need for children to reconnect with nature and build a relationship with Mother Earth.

Realizing I cannot reach every child physically, I wrote and illustrated a children’s book to encapsulate the joy of growing up, and playing outside in the garden.

It’s called “Love Grows Love: Starlight Seeds of Creation,” and it’s all about the journey of a seed.

With your support, the book can get printed, packaged with seeds and out into the hands of children!

The first round of books will each come with a packet of heirloom seeds donated by the wonderful Baker Creek Seed company!

Please check them out at https://www.rareseeds.com .  They are a wonderful company, and do amazing work with saving a vast variety of heirloom and rare seeds.  Their catalog was the inspiration for the cover of “Love Grows Love” and holding their donation of seeds has been the fuel to complete this mission, and get the books with seeds to the children!

 

About “Love Grows Love”

 

Coming from the stars, to the darkness inside the Earth, to the Light of the Sun, Tiny Seed keeps growing with all it’s might. As Tiny Seed grows it changes into a Little Sprout, transforms into a Young Sapling and graduates to become a Mighty Oak Tree. Throughout the journey, Mother Earth holds and guides Tiny Seed, sharing her wisdom along the way. The book is intended to inspire children to cultivate a relationship with Mother Earth and find the magic of Nature; all beginning with a single, Tiny Seed.

 

 

It has been a journey in itself creating the book as I started out with a publisher and after receiving a blurry first copy of the book, I started doing more research and looking into other options. I realized it would be better to go the route of self-publishing. I found a great local printer here in Oregon and I am excited to be at the final steps towards printing! I just need a little help to cross the finish line!

 

14,000 will cover my final expenses for printing 2,000 books, registering my publishing company, setting up accounts on Ingram (a backend source for bookstores like Barnes and Noble etc.), covering Indiegogo and credit card fees, and paying my angel friend who has helped re-edit the digital files for the local printer.

By pre-ordering the book here on Indiegogo, you are helping me reach my goal and I am so grateful!

 

The story was inspired by being outside in the garden and getting to watch things grow, and receiving deep healing and satisfaction. The amount of love you give reflects back to you in the beauty of your garden. I put my heart into this book and prayers into all the illustrations for more children to experience the joy of gardening and live in harmony with Mother Earth.

 

I shared the first author copy version from the publisher with some classrooms of 3 to 5 year olds, and the authentic joy the children expressed for the book, its pictures and message made it all worthwhile, and their genuine excitement about seeds and learning about how things grow is priceless.

 

The world needs more love and healing. The children are our future and deserve a chance to thrive. Together let’s sew the seeds of love into all the hearts that need it and get “Love Grows Love” to as many children as possible!

Please check out the sweet perks available with Art from the book on Prints, Puzzles, and Thank You Cards! As well as, one of a kind Original Artwork!

Thank you for your support!

Many Blessings,

Lakshmi
story_txt:
Blessings Everyone! My name is Lakshmi, and I am an artist, singer/songwriter, dancer and garden enthusiast. I have worked with children of all ages for over 15 years teaching movement, music and dance. While working with kids, I noticed a big need for children to reconnect with nature and build a relationship with Mother Earth.
Realizing I cannot reach every child physically, I wrote and illustrated a children’s book to encapsulate the joy of growing up, and playing outside in the garden.
It’s called “Love Grows Love: Starlight Seeds of Creation,” and it’s all about the journey of a seed.
With your support, the book can get printed, packaged with seeds and out into the hands of children!

The first round of books will each come with a packet of heirloom seeds donated by the wonderful Baker Creek Seed company!
Please check them out at https://www.rareseeds.com .  They are a wonderful company, and do amazing work with saving a vast variety of heirloom and rare seeds.  Their catalog was the inspiration for the cover of “Love Grows Love” and holding their donation of seeds has been the fuel to complete this mission, and get the books with seeds to the children!

 
About “Love Grows Love”
 
Coming from the stars, to the darkness inside the Earth, to the Light of the Sun, Tiny Seed keeps growing with all it’s might. As Tiny Seed grows it changes into a Little Sprout, transforms into a Young Sapling and graduates to become a Mighty Oak Tree. Throughout the journey, Mother Earth holds and guides Tiny Seed, sharing her wisdom along the way. The book is intended to inspire children to cultivate a relationship with Mother Earth and find the magic of Nature; all beginning with a single, Tiny Seed.

I just need a little help to cross the finish line!
 
14,000 will cover my final expenses for printing 2,000 books, registering my publishing company, setting up accounts on Ingram (a backend source for bookstores like Barnes and Noble etc.), covering Indiegogo and credit card fees, and paying my angel friend who has helped re-edit the digital files for the local printer.
By pre-ordering the book here on Indiegogo, you are helping me reach my goal and I am so grateful!

 
The story was inspired by being outside in the garden and getting to watch things grow, and receiving deep healing and satisfaction. The amount of love you give reflects back to you in the beauty of your garden. I put my heart into this book and prayers into all the illustrations for more children to experience the joy of gardening and live in harmony with Mother Earth.
 
I shared the first author copy version from the publisher with some classrooms of 3 to 5 year olds, and the authentic joy the children expressed for the book, its pictures and message made it all worthwhile, and their genuine excitement about seeds and learning about how things grow is priceless.
 
The world needs more love and healing. The children are our future and deserve a chance to thrive. Together let’s sew the seeds of love into all the hearts that need it and get “Love Grows Love” to as many children as possible!
Please check out the sweet perks available with Art from the book on Prints, Puzzles, and Thank You Cards! As well as, one of a kind Original Artwork!
Thank you for your support!
Many Blessings,
Lakshmi

story:
Who I am:

Passion is defined as "an intense desire or enthusiasm for something". Today I am inviting you on my personal journey and my lifelong passion for writing. I am asking kind donors such as yourselves to kindly pledge to my fundraiser. I am fundraising to help me complete my second novel in my series called Ismark. Having already completed the first novel I am excited to continue the saga and to present to all of you bibliophiles the next installment in this adventure series. 

My name is JH Lillevik. My passion for the written word started many years ago. I have been blessed to work as a screenwriter and as a writing consultant. My first writing credit was a few years back on a feature film called The House directed by the famed Reinert Kiil. I now regularly work as a screenwriting consultant for the Norwegian film industry.

The Story:

The Golden Bond is a continuation of the story Eirick, a young slave from the land of Ismark. The story follows his adventures in strange and foreign lands. I have spent many years developing the world, characters, and many other exciting creatures that Eirick encounters on his coming of age journey. This is a story for our time even though it takes place in a different time and place where dwarves and merfolk roam and live. The message is uplifting and explores a man's journey as he starts at the bottom of a system and struggles to rise to the top. The story also explores the idea of being chosen to something and having a destiny. Everyone has their own destiny and this story closely follows Eiricks journey.

As mentioned, this is the second installment in the series. The first novel was very well received and has garnered great ratings on both Goodreads and Amazon. I encourage to grab yourself a copy of "The Marked Boy", sit back, and embark on the journey as well.

The Needs and the Perks:

Today I am raising $5000 to pay for an editor, printing 200+ hardcover copies, cover design, and to allow me to take some time off to complete this novel. The funds and time off allow me to focus solely on this project and to give it the best storyline possible that will not disappoint.
$10 donation gets you a digital copy of both The Golden Bond and The Marked Boy

$40 gets you a hardcover copy of either The Golden Bond or The Marked Boy.

$80 will get you hardcover copies of both books in the series.

$100 and you will receive signed copies of both books and an Ismark coffee cup to enjoy while you go on the adventure.

Risk and Challenges

As mentioned above I do work as a screenwriter in the industry and at this point cannot dedicate 100% of my time to bringing you the next installment. If I do not receive full funding it will take me longer to complete, I will complete this given the opportunity and time to do so. This is my passion, I truly love writing and presenting to kind people like you entertaining stories that will last ages. Because I have such a great love for writing and this saga I never experience writer's block which is often a hindrance for many amateur and experienced novelists.

How you can help:

Pledge today and share my story with everyone you know who is also passionate about books and reading. Tweet and share on Facebook, even private message to your friends and family. Together we can bring this incredible story to life. If you kindly make a donation today please feel free to contact me and I would be more than happy to talk with you and share my ideas. Thank you so much!

Also, visit my blog at jhlillevik.com and spread things I have written there. Everything you do to spread the message is of great help to me. So thank you in advance and I hope you will enjoy taking this journey with me and Eirick.

Sample chapter:
https://jhlillevik.com/2018/08/21/the-golden-bo...

story:
HELLO

My name is John Frederick. I am someone who at one time had a miserable life — many health issues, depression, addiction, financial difficulties, bankruptcy, homelessness and general discouragement. I was fairly hopeless; I didn’t think that that life was ever going to work for me.
 

Then starting in 1990, things began to change. Circumstances drove me to desparation and I began to learn spiritual principles that brought me up and out of the pits of despair into a life beyond my wildest dreams. Out of this journey, I have developed a 12-week course that is soon to be a self-published book:

Prosperity Now! A 12-Week Journey to the Life of Your Dreams

Using my own life’s story, from homeless, hopeless and addicted, to an amazing life of purpose and abundance, the Prosperity Now! course will show people how they can transform their life too. Using ancient and modern, practical spiritual principles — ones that anyone can develop and practice — people can move beyond their current circumstances— no matter how dire — and begin to see the possiblities and realize their dreams!

 

MY CAMPAIGN 

This Indegogo campaign will help me defray the costs of publishing the course as a self-study book. I want to help as many people as possible, but I can only take on a limited number of  individual students and groups. I want to publish the course as a book to get it out into the world.

Especially Now! in 2020, people need help, need answers, need hope. By contributing to Prosperity Now! you will be helping me to shine this light into the darkness, giving people the practical means they need to lift themselves out of poverty, dispair and helplessness.

In the current world crisis, this book is needed more than ever. I hope millions will use it to see past appearances, to the truth of their own greatness, and begin the journey to fulfill their deepest heart’s desires.

You can be a part of this effort to help people transform their lives, and thus help transform the world!
 

TESTIMONIAL 

John A. Frederick’s new book, Prosperity Now! A 12-Week Journey to the Life of Your Dreams, is a tour-de-force of practical, spiritual, and financial advice on how to achieve the life you’ve always wanted. Drawing upon [many spiritual paths, including] the Twelve Steps of Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), Frederick walks readers through a twelve-week course that teaches them not only how to find prosperity, but how to eliminate all the things blocking them from achieving it.
— Tyler Tichlaar, PhD., award-winning author of Narrow Lives and The Best Place


CAMPAIGN BUDGET and GOALS

So far, I have spent about $6,300 to ready the course as a self-published book.  I am looking for investors to support my work, and recoup some of my investment so I can use those funds to distribute the book widely, to schools, churches, support groups and others who could benefit from this knowledge.

I DO NOT charge a fee to Prosperity Now! students and groups for my courses. Everything is on the basis of “Tithing” which is the most powerful spiritual concept I use in my own life, to change my thinking and my circumstances. Tithing is the spiritual concept that recognizes that it is the Universe (or God if you prefer) that supplies our good. We are merely giving back a small portion of what we have been blessed with, to gain even more abundance. A tithe is 10 percent.

So, in this way, someone who has nothing (literally) pays nothing (literally). Ten percent of zero is — zero! I do not charge a fee because I do not see this as a profit-making venture, but rather a vehicle to spread joy and abundance to people who need it.

My budget is as follows:

Editing, layout and book cover: $4,215

Website design, domain name, email, $1,840

Misc. $545

TOTAL $6,600

For investors/donors to my Indegogo campaign, I will offer autographed copies of my book, once it is available.

At higher donation levels, I will offer Zoom counselling sessions, from a 1.5 hour session all the way up to a full 12-week full-blown Prosperity Now! course for 8-10 people!

If I do not reach my entire goal, the funds I do receive will go toward making the course/book available to people all over the world who need a path out of poverty to success. If the goal is exceeded, there are plans to have the course translated into other languages!

 

The Impact

I fully believe that the secrets to abundance and prosperity are not secret at all. They are just ways of seeing that are usually 180 degrees opposite of how people are taught to see things. 
By helping people see in a new way, I believe that these ideas will help make individual lives better, thus their families will improve, thus their neighborhood and community will be inspired and change, and then their nationand the whole world.

It is not the world that needs changing so much as how we see it, for when we “see it right” it changes before our very eyes! 
 

I have helped 2 dozen people individually and in small groups, and the impact has been measurable. It is the right time to cast a wider net and help more people be free, to grow and have better, richer, fuller lives!

Perhaps some people will be put off by the emphasis on the Christian Bible. Others perhaps by my mention of Taoism, or A Course in Miracles, or 12-Step programs. Perhaps they will look unfavorably on my emphasis on tithing and money as a vehicle to open up consciousnesses. Perhaps they will cynically view this as just another “scam” to get rich by taking people’s money.

I cannot be affected by those energies, except to quote Herbert Spencer, “There is a principle...which cannot fail to keep [people] in everlasting ignorance — that principle is contempt prior to investigation.”

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, because YOU CAN! Here’s how:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and circulate widely!
  • Sign up to take Prosperity Now! with me. I do not charge a fee for students!! Your only cost is to purchase the book. Prosperity Now! is a tithe-based program. As you prosper, you tithe and everyone around you prospers too. It’s all explained in Chapter 1.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

Kind Writers is an ambition brought together by our founder, Sophia Apodaca, a poet, writer, and kind human who wants to spread kindness. We are dedicated to bringing the acts of kindness from our artists to the forefront.

Our team includes an eclectic group of artists that work to make a positive difference in our world. In addition to being writers, many on our team are also educators, tutors, and volunteers.

Our Steps to Publication

Our goal is spreading kindness within and outside our community of artists. We accept submissions from all over the world to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to be represented.

We work hard to review submissions, create goals to spread our message, and get involved with our community. This will not be an easy journey. Our first publication is quickly coming together and we need your help to make it as successful as possible.

Join Us

We ask for your support in funding the first Kind Writers publication. Your contribution will aid our journey of spreading kindness through diverse works of art and literature. With your help we will be able to fund the costs of initial publication, Submittable membership, rewards for our writing contests, and future publications. Lend your support now and become an advocate for spreading kindness in a world that desperately needs it!

Donation Perks

$5 – Kind Writers Bookmarks (3)

$15 – Print Issue with Electronic Issue (Both are included exclusively only for this promotion ONLY)

$25 – KW Set with Postcards (includes items above)

$45 – KW Set with Written Feedback (includes items above)

            *2000 words of prose or 3 poems

$60 – KW Set with Zoom Workshop OR Personalized Poem/Letter (5-8 lines) (includes items above)

$100 – KW Set with Zoom Workshop AND Personalized Poem/Letter (5-8 lines) (includes items above w/o $60 perk)

            *Further details of perks are included in their descriptions.

Become Part of our Community

We understand that these are difficult times. If you are looking for a non-monetary way to support our journey, please follow us on our social platforms. Help spread kindness today!

Instagram: @Kind_Writers

Twitter: @KindWriters

Facebook: @KindWriters

story:
Michael Chapel is not just another vanity book project, it is a rescue mission! Michael Harold Chapel is a decorated veteran and former Gwinnett County (Georgia) police officer, wrongfully convicted for the 1993 murder of Emogene Thompson of Sugar Hill.  

 

At the 1995 trial, which ran opposite of the OJ Simpson trial on Court TV, crucial evidence was manipulated, lost, destroyed, and otherwise suppressed and Chapel was denied a fair trial.  The District Attorney in the case spent the next twenty-five years opposing proper DNA testing, and stood in the way of a fair appeals process.

 

On April 15, 2021, on the 28th anniversary of the murder, the newly elected District Attorney announced the formation of the Convictions Integrity Unit to look into past wrongful convictions and for the first time in nearly three decades, the Chapel family has hope that truth and justice will finally prevail.

 

We launched the Michael Chapel is Innocent Facebook Group and a Kickstarter project in April, 2021.  The Facebook Group has grown to nearly 500 active members and we were fortunate to achieve 113% of our Kickstarter goal. 

 

Indiegogo funds will be used to publish the book, multi-media pitch documentation and video, and other projects concerning this case, in an effort to make known the tragic and infuriating true story of a man, a family, and an entire community denied justice for nearly three decades.

 

Let the truth prevail though the heavens fall.

story:
Rising from Ashes

I am writing novels under the name Matthew Bellwether, and had recently completed my debut novel, the first in a trilogy called The Aethernet Chronicles, when tragedy struck: we got news that the Glass Fire in Napa Valley had burned 30-40 acres and was located about 5 miles away from us.

Within days, the fire had grown to thousands of acres, then police came knocking on the door in the middle of the night and we were forced to evacuate. Within a few short hours, the flames had reached my house and surrounded it. From our temporary relocation, I helplessly watched firefighters on the news literally battling flames at my doorstep.

Our property was damaged, but still standing; we were one of the lucky ones. Many were not.

Serendipity & Gratitude

I was working on the manuscript for the second book in my trilogy when this disaster struck. Meanwhile, I had submitted my book to various literary agents and publishers, but I started getting little hints from the universe that maybe I needed to do something different:

  • The Glass Fire appeared one day after I had just finished a chapter titled "Rising from Ashes"
  • While evacuated, I was walking down a sidewalk and saw some random graffiti. The spray-painted message said "Hello World" -- this is the title of the very first chapter of my debut novel, Alpha: Apparitions!

It made me feel like I needed to do something in return for the universe, something to show thanks for the mercy I had been given. So I decided to publish the novel immediately on Amazon via Kindle Direct Publishing, and decided to offer the book in exchange for donations 

The Goal: Help Less Fortunate Victims

I have chosen a few specific charitable causes to donate to, and I know people can donate directly, but sometimes it feels good to "get a little something" in return for the money you sacrifice. That's where my book comes in. With damage to my house and my wife going on four years of unemployment now (she had found employment earlier this year, only to lose it again to the pandemic), I don't have extra funds to donate to these worthy causes, but what I can offer is any proceeds my book could garner, and you can help me do that by purchasing the book or donating to these charitable organizations:

  • The California Fire Foundation, which provides assistance to firefighters, the families of fallen firefighters, and communities impacted by fire.
  • UndocuFund, providing assistance and support to undocumented workers of Sonoma County and their families. Many of these laborers are counted amongst the "essential workers" that have kept our economy afloat, and they have already been greatly impacted by the pandemic... and now by the fires, too. 
  • The Do Better Initiative, a charitable initiative by Amanda Betsold, whose house (right next to ours) burned to ashes in the fire. Her mission has been to climb the Seven Summits (the highest peaks of each continent), each time raising money for a different charitable cause. This mission was already disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic, but losing her house has caused even further setback. Donating will help her achieve her goal of reaching the final summits to raise money for The National Park Foundation and The Joyful Heart Foundation for victims of sexual assault, domestic abuse, and childhood trauma. 

What You Get

The e-book version of Alpha: Apparitions (The Aethernet Chronicles, Book 1) is currently available for preorder and will be released on Halloween (October 31) By contributing to this campaign, you get:

  • A free copy of my book in Kindle eBook format (note: You do not need a Kindle device to read this eBook. It can be viewed on any phone, tablet, laptop, or computer via the Kindle reader app or on the web)
  • A choice of charitable organization to support.
  • A good feeling from knowing that you helped others in need (via the charitable organizations listed above)

What I Get

My first novel is already written, and the others will eventually be written, too. So what do I get out of it?

  • Faith in humanity.
  • Knowing that people care.
  • A feeling that I could somehow help, when I have felt so helpless during the fires.
  • A way to repay a great debt that I feel I have to those who saved my home.
  • Motivation and support to write my second and third novels in the trilogy!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not interested in reading my novel, I encourage you to help in any way you can:

  • Donate directly to one of the above causes.
  • Share this campaign. Spread the word, especially to anybody who might like my story!

Synopsis

Alpha: Apparitions is a supernatural cyberpunk thriller for young adults and the first book in The Aethernet Chronicles trilogy, taking place in a not-too-distant future, a “utopian” society in which science, technology, and progress reign supreme. There are Trad holdouts, but art, religion, mythology, and even history have been relegated to the realm of Esoteric knowledge, and much of it has been scrubbed from the Net by the Ministry of Information. Churches have been repurposed as community wifi beacons. Kids attend schools to specialize in biotechnology, robotics, rapid fabrication, and other high-tech fields.

Fifteen-year-old Alexandra Novak is an introverted girl who is abruptly uprooted from her comfortable life in Santa Fe and forced to move in with her Aunt Maddie in Seatac, Washington when her parents die in a tragic work mishap. Enrolled at NuVo High, she quickly begins to show prowess with the modern STEM-based world into which she has been thrust. Until, one day, things begin to go haywire. When a mysterious message appears on her vidgogs, followed by an explosive malfunction in her SoftDev class, she is plunged into even greater dangers. Alongside her one friend, the athletic-but-awkward Peter Figaretti (Fig), she narrowly escapes smart-taxis careening out of control, a mysterious figure who has stalked her all the way from New Mexico, and the ghost of her father during a bizarre virtual reality simulation. With her life going as haywire as the world around her, Alex is left curious, searching, and trying to survive the aftermath of the question: what actually happened to Jared and Lenasha Novak, and why is A.F.T.E.R. trying so hard to cover it up?
story_txt:
Rising from Ashes
I am writing novels under the name Matthew Bellwether, and had recently completed my debut novel, the first in a trilogy called The Aethernet Chronicles, when tragedy struck: we got news that the Glass Fire in Napa Valley had burned 30-40 acres and was located about 5 miles away from us.
Within days, the fire had grown to thousands of acres, then police came knocking on the door in the middle of the night and we were forced to evacuate. Within a few short hours, the flames had reached my house and surrounded it. From our temporary relocation, I helplessly watched firefighters on the news literally battling flames at my doorstep.
Our property was damaged, but still standing; we were one of the lucky ones. Many were not.

Serendipity & Gratitude
I was working on the manuscript for the second book in my trilogy when this disaster struck. Meanwhile, I had submitted my book to various literary agents and publishers, but I started getting little hints from the universe that maybe I needed to do something different:

The Glass Fire appeared one day after I had just finished a chapter titled "Rising from Ashes"
While evacuated, I was walking down a sidewalk and saw some random graffiti. The spray-painted message said "Hello World" -- this is the title of the very first chapter of my debut novel, Alpha: Apparitions!

It made me feel like I needed to do something in return for the universe, something to show thanks for the mercy I had been given. So I decided to publish the novel immediately on Amazon via Kindle Direct Publishing, and decided to offer the book in exchange for donations 

The Goal: Help Less Fortunate Victims
I have chosen a few specific charitable causes to donate to, and I know people can donate directly, but sometimes it feels good to "get a little something" in return for the money you sacrifice. That's where my book comes in. With damage to my house and my wife going on four years of unemployment now (she had found employment earlier this year, only to lose it again to the pandemic), I don't have extra funds to donate to these worthy causes, but what I can offer is any proceeds my book could garner, and you can help me do that by purchasing the book or donating to these charitable organizations:


The California Fire Foundation, which provides assistance to firefighters, the families of fallen firefighters, and communities impacted by fire.

UndocuFund, providing assistance and support to undocumented workers of Sonoma County and their families. Many of these laborers are counted amongst the "essential workers" that have kept our economy afloat, and they have already been greatly impacted by the pandemic... and now by the fires, too. 

The Do Better Initiative, a charitable initiative by Amanda Betsold, whose house (right next to ours) burned to ashes in the fire. Her mission has been to climb the Seven Summits (the highest peaks of each continent), each time raising money for a different charitable cause. This mission was already disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic, but losing her house has caused even further setback. Donating will help her achieve her goal of reaching the final summits to raise money for The National Park Foundation and The Joyful Heart Foundation for victims of sexual assault, domestic abuse, and childhood trauma. 


What You Get
The e-book version of Alpha: Apparitions (The Aethernet Chronicles, Book 1) is currently available for preorder and will be released on Halloween (October 31) By contributing to this campaign, you get:

A free copy of my book in Kindle eBook format (note: You do not need a Kindle device to read this eBook. It can be viewed on any phone, tablet, laptop, or computer via the Kindle reader app or on the web)
A choice of charitable organization to support.
A good feeling from knowing that you helped others in need (via the charitable organizations listed above)

What I Get
My first novel is already written, and the others will eventually be written, too. So what do I get out of it?

Faith in humanity.
Knowing that people care.
A feeling that I could somehow help, when I have felt so helpless during the fires.
A way to repay a great debt that I feel I have to those who saved my home.
Motivation and support to write my second and third novels in the trilogy!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not interested in reading my novel, I encourage you to help in any way you can:

Donate directly to one of the above causes.
Share this campaign. Spread the word, especially to anybody who might like my story!

story:
Once upon a time...

there was an awkward little kid who didn't understand why he fantasized about traveling back in time. Why he gave his Transformers middle names like Optimus Otis Prime. Why he convinced his friends he didn't cry and why that was such a bald-faced lie.  

What he didn't know at the time was that this little kiddo was a Cancer sun sign. 

And... end rhyming sequence.

I always wondered how my childhood may have been different if I understood more about my Cancer sun sign at the age of seven instead of twenty-seven?

Astrology is a tool I wish so badly I had when I was a kid struggling to love all parts of myself. It’s for this reason that I created the first of its kind astrology-based children's book adventure series. "The Little Crab Finds a Friend!" is a fully colored, rhyming picture book series for ages (4-9) that follows a lost little crab on his journey home through an astrological land. 

This book series (and astrology as a teaching tool) is an invitation for kids to fully embrace who they are. Embrace all that makes them unique and then embrace those same differences in the people they meet.

A little about The Little Crab...

This character represents... 

A little about The Little Crab...

This character represents... 

Okay. So I guess the Little Crab himself wants to take over this part of the intro. 

(Little Crab) 

"Since my beginning, since my start, I have LOVED my dear Mom with all my heart!

 

We live in a slightly moldy, sunken submarine home.

 

My Mom schools me every day... And I mean that in a good way!

If you're curious about my favorite class...

Yes, of course, It's baking class!!!!!! 

Wondering about my friends???  Well, interesting thing is, I don't technically have them..."

(Little Crab makes his exit) 

In book one, the Little Crab is thrust into a journey that takes him far away from his home, from all he has ever has known. To find his way back, he will need the help of twelve unique friends each one representing one of the twelve zodiac signs. From the brave Aries Ewe, to the inquisitive Gemini Twin Squirrels, to the Secretive Scorpion, each character teaches the little crab valuable life lessons,  such as what defines bravery, the power of our words, and how to form a healthy, trusting friendship.

Just like the Little Crab cannot make it home without the twelve zodiac signs, this book would not be possible without team TLC.

 

Our illustrator, Angelica Gau, has brought to life each zodiac sign through her vibrant characterization, and astrological contributor Dominique Jaramillo helps parents understand their child's astrology through a parenting guide which will be in the back of each book.

What We Need & What You Get

We will be publishing through Ingram Spark. Your contribution will help us release Volume One in both print and digital formats.

Our goal is to publish a fully colored picture book that introduces the Little Crab, his journey and the parenting guide for Cancer sun signs.  Our goal is to use this initial publication to introduce the series to as many people as possible and secure a publisher that will publish the entire series. 

To date, I have a detailed story outline of the entire twelve-book series and completed manuscripts for the first three books (zodiac signs Aries-Gemini) which are awaiting illustration. 

Your contribution will help cover the initial publishing costs (including shipping, publishing and promotional costs) and allow us to begin illustrations on the next three volumes. 

Needs Breakdown

- Purchase IBSNs (International Book Serial Numbers)

- Cover Copyright expenses.

- Cover Ingram Spark setup costs to publish.

- Purchase 100-500 print books from Ingram Spark to be sold directly by us

- Hire an editor to proof-read the final edition.

- Pay our amazing illustrator Angelica Gau to start working on the Aries Edition so it can be released by Aries season 2020.

- Pay our amazing Astrological Contributor Dominique Jaramillo for the parenting guide she creates for each book's zodiac sign. 

- Shipping costs form Ingram Spark

- Purchase promotional materials such as a banner and tent for Famer’s Market and other vending adventures. 

- Cost to buy 100 paperback and hard copies to sell at Farmer’s markets and hand out to promotions. 

- Host a book launch party by mid-December

What you get!!!

To show how much we value each of your investments; we will be offering donor perks ranging from astrology readings from myself and our contributor Dominique Jaramillo, to T-shirts from Dominique’s cosmically inspired clothing line Nurturing Astrology.

Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

By sharing this link (using the Indiegogo sharing tools) you will be doing a great service in spreading this book's message of inclusivity, unity, and self-acceptance! Also, the Little Crab promises to bake you some Seaweed crusted French Toast... once we figure out the whole shipping logistics:)

story:
Overview

Let your children explore the world of marvelous embroidery, colorful textiles, sweet melons, unique architecture and scientific achievements of Central Asia! All through a very unique children's book about Central Asia! Good for ages 3 to 12. English and Russian versions  available. You can pre-order the book and support my effort to publish it.

I just ended a successful Kickstarter campaign for this book, which you can find HERE.  I am now accepting funds from those who still want to preorder before we go into printing. ALL SPONSORS WILL BE LISTED IN THE BOOK if you pledge before OCTOBER 31, 2021.

To make a customized order, or if you prefer to make a contribution without ordering a book, please contact me directly at barzuworld@gmail.com.

At this stage of the campaign, when you order two or more books,  I am not requesting that you select language version. I will contact you by e-mail at the end of the campaign to clarify whether you prefer English or Russian, or a combination. You may also include into your order a coloring book and my previous book "Orange and Blue: The World of Barzu" through "ADD ON" option.

 

  • ART + engaging reading + ethnographic information 
  • Two separate language versions: Russian and English
  • Hardcover and good quality paper.
  • The size of the book will be 12x11 inches/31x28cm (Kids love huge books!).
  • Large font for easy reading.
  • 25 beautiful illustrations (double-page spread) by a professional artist + some drawing from the author. 
  • 88 - 96 pages (I will know the exact number of pages after the book design is ready for printing).
  • The accessible language, detailed illustrations, and engaging stories bring readers as young as three years into a world of fairy tales, while older readers and their parents can dig deeper into the region through the Ethnographic Notes, which offers the historical context for the story and detailed descriptions of places and customs. Additional activities let kids learn through hands-on activities and questions for discussion. The text is complemented by large, colorful illustrations filled with cultural details, which provide visual reference and convey the visual beauty of the region to the readers. This structure allows an individual to discover Central Asia gradually, through different types of learning: visual, auditory, and kinesthetic.
  • This is the second book in a series.  "Orange and Blue: The World of Barzu" was the first book. It is available on Indiegogo . You can also order it as part of your Double, Triple, Four, Six books pack.
  •        
  • Social, art, textiles and cultural studies.
  • Family reading time;
  • A gift (kids love big books);
  • Reading at daycare. Some daycares allow parents to come and read books or organize activities as a way to celebrate their child's birthday. This book is a perfect choice for that!
  • Demonstration at the school's International Day;
  • School project on Central Asia;
  • Elementary and middle school libraries;
  • Homeschool studies;
  • Reading in English or Russian for bilingual families.

Children 3 - 12 years old. My goal has been to make this book interesting and understandable not only for children of all ages, but also for their parents. Thus, the book is divided into several parts: the story itself, which includes history and fable; folkloric narrative on how people really live; and an educational section at the end of the story for parents to discuss with their children.

 A long time ago, in a place where great roads crossed, stood the City of Blue Domes, with its narrow, winding streets and intricate mosaics decorating its high towers. The ruler of that city was the powerful Emir Bahriddin, the wisest of the wise and first among the just.

One spring morning, Emir Bahriddin was reclining among his pillows in his Room of Thought. Ancient books in leather covers lined the shelves, maps of stars and land caravan routes hung on the walls. The room's large carved windows looked out onto a green, ever-blooming garden with cooling fountains.

he emir liked to come to this room to ponder on life’s problems or think through an affair of State.  Here, with the song of birds drifting in from the garden, he could concentrate, search for answers in his books, and consult with learned elders.

This time, Emir Bahriddin had a most difficult task to solve. Spring had finally come – the time for sowing in the fields – but after two years with poor harvests, the people had no seed to sow.  The ruler did not yet know how he would feed his subjects this year. It was in the midst of these sad thoughts that his wife found him. 

I have been working on this project for two years. In 2019, I travelled to the region for the research in the field, essential to the final product. I spoke to art experts, and craftspeople; visited crafts workshops and museums; took pictures, recorded video, and made sketches. All of this research was used directly in the story and illustrations, and in the Ethnographic Notes and activity sections of the book.

In 2019, my book project “Introducing Central Asia through Children’s Literature” received Honorable Mention in the Public Outreach Award from Central Eurasian Studies Society.

Marina Abrams – Author of book series, The World of Barzu; project director and founder of “Barzu World.” I was born and raised in Kazakhstan, lived in Tajikistan and Russia, and traveled extensively around the Eurasian region. I am an international policy professional with twenty years of experience in multi-disciplinary projects. I hold a B.A. in Translation-Interpretation from the Abylaikhan Kazakh State University of International Relations and World Languages and an M.A. in International Policy Studies from the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey, where I studied on a Graduate Muskie Merit Scholarship. I have two children. More information on my website:  https://marinaabrams.com/ 

Gulya Gromova- Djumagari –  illustrator, was born and raised in Uzbekistan, where she graduated from Republican Art College of P.P. Benkov and then studied at the Tashkent Theatre and Art Institute. She is a member of the International Federation of Artists (IFA) and the Union of Artists of Uzbekistan. Since 2007, Gulya lives and works in Almaty, Kazakhstan. More information on her website:  http://gromova.info/biography.html 

Joshua Abrams – translator from Russian into English. My husband, a wonderful father to my children, and a talented writer. Joshua studied Russian in St Petersburg, was a Peace Corps Volunteer in Kazakhstan, and has lived and worked in most of the countries of the former Soviet Union. He’s a graduate of Bard College (BA) and Indiana University (MPA/MA) and has also published his own articles and stories.

 

Natalia Kuzmina – editor of the original text in Russian. Natalia is a graduate of the Philology Department at Novosibirsk State University, Russia. From 1993 to 1996 Natalia and I studied together in the Philology Group at Specialized High School #134 in Almaty, Kazakhstan. And now, 20 years later we are happy to work together in this project. Most important, Natalia is a mother of four wonderful boys.

OVERVIEW

I’m writing the biography of Hugh ‘Jumbo’ Edwards, oarsman, Olympian, RAF pilot, and renowned rowing coach. Jumbo was the grandfather of my wife Melissa, and over the past few years I have been working my way through the family archives uncovering a life that was far less than ordinary. With your help and support ‘Water’s Gleaming Gold’ will bring this story to life through publication of the hardback. I will be writing the book, designing the layout and employing an experienced editor to assist me in this task and publishing the book under the Lapwing Publishing imprint. The text will be accompanied by over 20 illustrations that have not been seen before and reflecting Jumbo's exploits at Henley, the Los Angeles Olympics, his wartime career in Coastal Command, and as an innovative rowing coach.

“With the death of Group Captain HRA 'Jumbo' Edwards, rowing loses one of its most colourful and famous personalities. He will be remembered as not only one of the greatest oarsman of all time, but also as a famous coach, innovator and raconteur. His race record could only be described as phenomenal. British rowing owes more to Jumbo Edwards than any other person in the sport as far as attention to the science of boat moving is concerned.”

The Times, Obituary, December 1972

 

“As an 8-year-old after seeing the Henley race against the Germans in 1931, I knew we should win the Second World War and that Jumbo Edwards would play a part”.

Sir Charles Wheeler, Journalist and Broadcaster

 

THE STORY

In the Boat Race of 1926, at the age of 19, Hugh ‘Jumbo’ Edwards rowed for Oxford alongside his brother. Edwards collapsed when the Dark Blues held a slight lead and Cambridge went on to win. From this nadir, Edwards defied doctor’s orders and the British press on a mission to prove everyone wrong, and rise to the heights of success in the 1932 Los Angeles Olympics by winning two rowing gold medals on the same day. 

In 1943 his rowing ability saved his life. After protecting a convoy and attacking German U-Boats, Edwards ditched his damaged Liberator in the Atlantic Ocean. The only survivor of the air crew, and suffering from life-threatening injuries, he managed to row his dinghy overnight towards land and was picked up by a British minesweeper. 

After many wartime exploits and decorations, Group Captain Edwards retired from the RAF in 1946 and soon developed a reputation as an innovative rowing coach. Jumbo coached Oxford between 1949 and 1972, winning five boat races and surviving an infamous rebellion. In 1960 he coached the British rowing team at the Rome Olympic Games. 

‘Water’s Gleaming Gold’ is the tale of a unique man on an extraordinary journey – from the humiliation of the Boat Race to the ultimate glory of twice winning gold at the Olympics. From establishing himself as a well-known air racing pilot in the 1930s to rising to the rank of Wing Commander in the RAF and battling U-Boats in the Atlantic Ocean.

 

PUBLISHED ARTICLES

I am a contributor to Hear the Boat Sing, a website dedicated to rowing, and these are links to a selection of articles on Jumbo:

90 Years Ago, a HRR Triple Win for Jumbo Edwards. 

Jumbo Edwards: Oarsman, Coach and RAF Pilot

 

THE PODCAST

Listen to me talking to Dan Snow (Historian and Broadcaster) about the life of Jumbo Edwards and my research into the book. Listen at 20 mins onwards.

Dan Snow's History Hit: Britain's Forgotten Olympic Heroes

 

THE BUDGET

All the funds contributed to this campaign will go towards the writing, editing, printing, publication, marketing and book launch for ‘Water’s Gleaming Gold’. 

 

What happens if I get more than I ask for?

Additional funds will help towards allowing the family to digitise the extensive Jumbo Edwards archive (letters, diaries, rowing reports, coaching strategies, photographs, flying logbooks) and make this available to the public, museums and rowing organisations. 

 

TIMELINE

The research for the book is now complete and the writing process will commence at the end of Summer 2021. The book will be ready for editing in early 2022 with a scheduled publication date of June 2022.

 

STAY IN TOUCH

Learn more about the project and get updates on Twitter (@gmbjamieson) and my website, lapwingpublishing.com.

 

FAQ

Please do not hesitate to contact me with any queries.

 

Thank you for your interest.
